reviews.review: Views back to the city. This gen spot only 1/2 an hour on the ferry from Sydney is a must see on any tourists agenda, and is somewhere where we often travel to for a day out as locals, and especially when someone comes to town.

Super views towards North head. Just a short ride from Circular Quay but a world away from the city crowds. Lots of good walks. Signal Station and
Lighthouse. Home to famous fish and chips though wrong time of day so did not try them.
Beautiful quiet spot. 20 min ferry ride to get to Watsons Bay and for a meal at Doyles. Wonderful view of the bay and the sunset.

Pleasant Walking. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. A great chance to take in the sights of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the water. On arrival it's clear Doyle's has the immediate monopoly on dining, with a wharf cafe (incl. takeaway options if you want to picnic in the park across the road) and then both mid and high class cafe/restaurants almost exclusively serving seafood. The walk up to Gap Bluff is comfortable and certainly the 360-degree views are well with any effort. A couple more cafes near the bluff looked good, but closed on Monday - which was a shame for us. Buses back to city via scenic suburbs are easy to catch, else jump straight back on the ferry.

Watson's Bay--A nice picnic place. I had visited this place recently in Oct 16 and observed that this can be recognised as a nice picnic spot near sydney. I reached there by ferry from circular quey. Onetime, this island was actually fishermen village. Some lonely beaches along the national park and a light house is situated there. Water sports like snorkeling and Scuba diving on cove beach can also be enjoyed there. I would strongly recommend this island to visit.

Wonderful cliff walk. Well worth the drive out to Watson's Bay . The bus is easy and inexpensive. Views of Bondi beach on the way and a pretty village location when you arrive with nice restaurants for a meal. The walk has breath taking views and is well worth the climb.
Some great cliffs to take a walk. This was a nice visit as there are some great views of cliffs and some options to have a drink by the water.

Disappointing. We went to watsons bay hotel for a hens night 15 October Set 2 course menu $60 per headWe did not get the drinks package as we preferred to buy drinks on night or run a bar tabUpon arriving found our table to be downstairs squashed in behind DJ...very loud!!No glassware on table, was informed as we didn't have a drink package ..no wine glasses were suppliedAlso upon arriving at venue went to bar to order carafes of cocktails but was told to come back in an hour as bar was busyNot a great start!!Entree arrived at table...artsian salami and cheese but no cheese was on plates!!However mains were very niceOur waitress who looked after us on night was amazing, she saved the night from being a complete failToilets appalling...no soap in dispensers, blocked toilet and vomit on stairs which was never cleaned up
fascinating nature. ıt is recomended to go on a sunny day otherwise not much to do. have a drink or meal at a restaurant on the seaside just looking at the bay.

Too busy!!!. Watson's Bay is a bit overated in my opinion. There's mainly only two venues, the Hotel and Doyle's on the Beach. The Hotel is always packed to the rafters and Doyle's whilst good, is bloody expensive. My recommendation is to get fish and chips from Doyle's outlet on the wharf!

Seaside Charm. The ferry ride to and from Watson's Bay offers some wonderful views of Sydney. We enjoyed a lovely walk on the path along the cliff high above the ocean. Watson's Bay is a nice place for a day at the beach and a nice lunch or dinner spot.
WONDERFUL. Took the ferry and had lunch. I had trout,which turned out to be one of the best meals I had the entire time I was in Sydney
Australia. If you wish to experience Sydney - this is it - Parking is poor - so take public transport and enjoy.

I stayed at the hotel there.. it was an interesting experience. I found the hotel okay. Breakfast was nice as part of the accommodation cost. Doyes next door, famous fish restaurant had a collection of rubbish the next morning at 8am and this guy and his wife were throwing bottles one by one out of a sulo into the truck for 2 hrs. We had just arrived after a long flight and were woken to this. Never again would I stay there!

Must visit!. The beautiful part of Sydney and Australia is its astonishing nature. Watson's Bay is offering the amazing experience of Sydney's coast and is definitely a must-visit. Even though it is possible to go there via other transportation, we got there by car. Take your time to enjoy the beautiful view that Watson's Bay has to offer, and bring some food with you as you will enjoy a nice lunch near the water.

Perfect small resort. The best thing was getting here. Three separate cheap ferry rides and all the sights on the way. Then a lovely lunch followed by a good walk to the lighthouse and fabulous views and finally tea. Allvery refined and perfect for a day out!

Lunch time visit. Great place to stop for lunch but be prepared for the mass of people that also like this beautiful Bay, Little beach for children to play on and you can walk up the hill and get the bus to Bondi Beach just 20 mins away approx.

Comfortable Ferry ride to a Breathtaking view. We took the Sydney Ferry to Watson Bay by coincidence. We did not thought that we would see such amazing view. Remember to take a walk by the beach, go to the Park and climb up to The Gap. Spectacular view. Not to mention to grab the Delicious Fish and Chips at the jetty.

A fantastic surprise. We had never been to Watson's Bay before, and caught the ferry from Circular Quay, and were blown away by how beautiful a spot this location is - the view across the harbour, the ample parkland in which to sit and look at it, and the access to fabulous walks within 300-400 m makes this a must-see destination if you're in Sydney. We weren't there long, and rain was threatening, but we'll be back again one day to have a longer look. The ferry ride is pretty good too.

Worthwhile ferry trip. Great fun to go there, especially on one of the smaller, faster ferries. Lovely park with a great playground for kids. You HAVE to walk up the hill to look at the view on the other side of the peninsula as it's breathtaking.

Idyllic escape from the city. The ferry across to Watson's Bay was a magical (and cost effective) way to get a full perspective of the sheer size and magnificence of Sydney Harbour. Ferry was a supercat, so it only took 13 minutes from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay Wharf, with lovely views of Neutral, Double and Rose Bays on the way.Once at the bay, we braved the cold day for a quick paddle, then walked up to the Gap (just a few minutes stroll from the wharf). The view from here was amazing, all the way out to North Heads and south towards Bondi, and east across the Tasman sea. There are a number of walks leaving from here that explored the headland and are well signed.Back at the Wharf we queued with heaps of other tourists for our takeaway fish & chips from Doyles. The food was good, but we may have been better to eat up at the restaurant on the promenade, as the wharf shop was incredibly busy. We then bussed from Watson's Bay back to the CBD...enjoying interesting views of the palatial Vaucluse and Rose Bay homes on the way. A lovely day out.
Worth a visit. Well worth a visit nice location with views of the City - try coastal walk to the lighthouse - would recommend

Perfect for lunch.. We caught the ferry from Darking Harbour and enjoyed takeaway fish and chips sitting in the beautiful park, looking at the amazing view of Sydney. As we got off the ferry a dolphin swam past us. Following lunch we walked to the cliffs which were about 4 mins behind us for amazing ocean views. Is a great thing to do on a beautiful sunny day. Plenty of indoor eating options if the park is not your thing. Doyle's looked gorgeous.

Not to be missed 3! Day trip on Sydney Harbour. 10.30am ferry to Watsons Bay. Gentle sloping walk to South Head through 150 year old renovated cottages,,beach, Australian coastal scrub to the gun emplacements. Wonderful perspective of Sydney Harbour- 1 hour return. Follow this with long lunch at Doyle's On the Beach, entree each, share a whiting main and indulge with a chocolate brûlée each to finish. $100/ head. Wine list excellent . Need to book and ask for table on the beach. Ferry return. Oh yes great day. For those who cannot afford the restaurant there is the Doyle's fish and chippery on the wharf for about a fifth the price.

anytime activity. Waton's bay is situated at a quiet corner from where you can watch all the on-goings in the harbor, the big ships and the little boats coming in and out and can just sit there doing nothing

Soooo relaxing!!. Watsons Bay, including the ferry ride to get there, is very relaxing. The views are spectaculair, on one side you have the chance to watch the ocean, the other side you see Sydney in the far distance. If you have time make sure you walk the loop to the Lighthouse.

Watson's Bay is Wonderful. Took the ferry here on our way to catch a bus to Bondi Beach and it is just such a lovely and picturesque area. Well worth a visit on its own. Lovely shops and restaurants nearby as well.

lovely view. Beautiful view from Watson bay and lovely taking the ferry from the harbour. Not a lot there apart from some very nice seafood restaurants, nice place to go sit and relax and take in the view.

Amazing Cliff Views. Travelled by ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's bay - well worth the trip. Check Ferries for the most direct/express trip. Amazinng Cliff views - stick to walking tracks, check out historic bunkers. Enjoyable easy walk around the headland and further up from the ferry terminal. Visit the Fish and Chip shop on the ferry terminal and sit and eat in the Park (watch the sea gulls they are cheeky and like to steal your food when they are given the opportunity).

Nice area, good local restaurants. Watson's Bay has some great fish and chip places. It juts out at the mouth of Sydney Harbour and is a beautiful, semi-upscale area. There are a lot of bays and inlets all around the harbour and beaches. This is one of the better ones and worth a stop either by car or ferry.

Lunch at Dunbar House. 18 Months back we had lunch at Dunbar House in the park overlooking the harbour , There many other places to eat by the beach at Watsons Bay the Hotel or on the pier or the Famous Doyles which is upmarket as is Dunbar House.
Doyles. Stunning food in a stunning location at Doyles fish restaurant, one of many highlights to our trip to Sydney

Laid back area. Another good way to see Sydney from the harbour. Watson bay nice spot with excellent fish & chippy at ferry wharf, had a good feed off fish& squid rings & chips. Easy walk to south head of harbour entrance and short walk to eastern coast walk to Bond. Spotted some whales.
Beautiful area. Had a great time hiking around this area. Entertaining nude beach.. A couple of cool lighthouses and an awesome view of the ocean!!
Sydney Break. Beautiful Watson's Bay, an easy ride by ferry from Circular Quay. A nice lunch at one of the restaurant to compliment the ferry ride.
What a view!. Great spot you can take ferry from circular quay. Stopped for amazing seafood lunch @ Doyle's then walked up to the gap. A Sydney visit must!

Calm oasis close to the city. This was a lovely ferry trip (there is an express) and it was so refreshing after the hustle and bustle of Sydney. Just nice to get away for a few hours or even a day or two..

Nice spot to relax for an hour. You can get walk up food at Doyles and sit in the park and enjoy a nice day. It is becoming a bit commercial these days but is a fun stop if you are doing a ferry ride.

It is a walk in the park. The Watson's Bay walk is a walk in the park, very easy and relaxing. But it is of historical significant when you get to the light house, where it control the ins and out of ship into the Sydney Harbour.. The Lady bay is also interesting as a nudist bay, it is a bit small and non-exclusive. When you finish the Watson's Bay walk, you can finish at the Gap, where you can see the magnificent view of the Harbour and the ocean. The ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay is very pleasant, and the bus ride back to Town Hall is also very interesting with different views through Rose Bay and Double Bay.

Beautiful place. We attended a family wedding at Watsons Bay. A lovely venue, a place to while away a Sunday morning walk and have lunch, just watch the world go by. Super food selection, easy to get to quick and easy access to Circular Quay.

Great views. If secluded beach and great views is what you are looking for Watson Bay is your thing. If you are at Watson bay, a walk up to the Light House is a must. Walk is tedious, and a bit long, but worth taking. Enroute is the Lady Bay Beach - a nude beach, which is not as exciting as it sounds. Just remember the last public ferry leaves Watson bay at around 4:30 after that there are private ferries, which is a bit expensive. So plan your trip early and return early.

A Relaxing Trip. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson Bay while visiting Sydney. The ferry was comfortable and a relaxing way to travel. It took about 20 minutes before we arrived at Watson Bay. We walked up the hill and around the coast line looking down the cliffs at the sea. We then went back and bought at Doyle's Fish and Chip shop fresh fish and chips and sat on the terraces around the bay eating them. You need to like seagulls because they were all there waiting for your scraps. A lovely way to spend part of a day when visiting Sydney. It gives you a different view looking back at the city.

Relaxing spot 15 mins from circular quay. Beautiful little Bay on a sunny day. I recommend a ferry from circular quay, you can have an upmarket lunch or casual fish and chips in the park by the water. Short walk to the gap or around south Head for great Ocean views. You can walk further south along the coast then hop on a bus to Bondi Junction to catch the train back to the city. I went midweek and there were plenty of tourists around but not crowded, I imagine it gets much busier on weekends. Also would not be nearly as pleasant on a cold or rainy day.

Watson's Bay. A wonderful part of Sydney out on the South Head,take the ferry from Circular Quay.A short walk across to Gap Bluff offers views of the South Pacific Ocean.There is Doyles where you can a coffee,snacks or a beer.

Lovely walks and great views. Caught the ferry to Watson's Bay and then enjoyed lunch at the Hotel right near the terminal. We then walked up to the Gap and did some of the coastal walk which offers magnificent views of the city.

Eastern Suburbs Devotee. Views are stunning.Learn about potential Russian and American invasions and the true Attack by Japanese midget submarines.See the old gun turrets.Watch the Sydney harbour sailing then head to Doyle's or the Watson Bay pub for lunch.Then back to the city by ferry.......Potstanding
Lovely day trip. Take a ferry ride from Circular Quay and hop off at Watson's Bay for fish n chips on the beach or something a little more fancy. Nice clean sand and sparkling water.

Wish we could have stayed longer. We were restricted by a tight timetable so were only able to spend a short while in this delightful seaside village. We were able to explore the park, shops and visit The Gap for some amazing views. Would love to come back on a fine day for a more relaxing beach picnic.

a bay with a view. First time I went was at least 12 years ago when you could sit on the beach at look out towards the magnificent view of Sydney in all its sun bathed glory. Eat your delicious fish at Doyle's and NOT be bombarded with the sound of music. Each time I returned (some six times)the view was as magnificent as ever the fish of choice as delicious as ever but a new place was added for the young uppie yuppies who always need music to drink by. Such a shame -now problem finding a parking place at any given time of the day. It is still a beaut bay and a pretty walk around but really some things should remain the same and Doyle's is so worth a visit.

Walk with views to die for. After visiting Bondi Beach, make sure you continue on to Watsons Bay. Park by the lighthouse and follow the coastal track for views over to the city and out to the ocean. End up at the pub for a beer with a great view over the bay

Recommended. A local friend suggested we check out Watson's Bay on our recent trip to Sydney. We took the ferry service over, and enjoyed a day walking the trails and learning the history. We especially enjoyed seeing the lighthouse keeper cottages and the lighthouse itself. We were told we'd "just missed" some whale activity when we arrived, and we didn't see any while we were there. But I'd imagine that with a pair of binoculars, you could spend hours up there watching (an older gentleman that we met up there doing just that told me the secret was to "watch where the whale watching boats go." Ha! Delightful. We took ferry service back (which was much busier than ferry service in), but still very easy.

BEAUTIFUL. Don't waste time going to Manly go to beautiful Watson bay instead. A tiny picturesque bay with a lovely beach & beautiful walk. The views of the harbour are just as good as on the Manly ferry & this place is far prettier & way less touristy

Pretty town and great fish & chips. We took the ferry from the Taronga Zoo to Watson's Bay where we enjoyed a fabulous lunch of fish & chips at Doyle's on the Wharf and then walked through the park and up the hill to look for whales in the ocean. We didn't see any whales, but there was a great path with views of the cliffs and ocean and lots of birds.

Whether you want to have 5 star fish n chips or similar on the beach from the wharf, .... you cant go wrong with any choice, the food at all venues is spectacular it just depends on your budget. But good to work up an appetite first and walk along The Gap headland. its magical,and then catch a ferry back into the City - cheap, and seriously spectacular trip not just for the tourists, I do it as often as I can and it sure lifts the spirits :)

Make sure you walk on the foreshore to Camp Cove Beach and back. Great location, great pub to visit. I have always got a seat at the venues nearby. Great walk in the old area where the fisherman cottage from the whaling era of bygone years. Ferry service is good however the bus service is direct into City or Uber at $25 to CBD

Great little package here.. Great little place being more or less on the end of either a ferry trip or a bus line. Catch the 380 bus service from Bondi Beach or the ferry from Circular Quay. Both trips give you great views. Watson Bay offers great food and drink choices as well as a start point for different walks on the South Head. From the bus stop or ferry terminal, a short walk to the Gap gives you views over the Harbour to the west and out to sea in the east. You can then follow the walking tracks to South Head taking in more stunning views but if you are like me, you can return to the restaurants and bars at Watson Bay for a cool one and some food.Keep an eye on the ferry times and remember that if you are travelling on the Opal card, its only the Sydney ferries you can use. Two important things to note. Their time table and touch on machines are at the beginning of the jetty. You have to touch on before going onto the jetty to catch the ferry. You cannot "touch on" on the ferry itself. I saw so many people running back down jetty having been told that by the crew member on the ferry. Second thing is that there are lots of other ferry services calling at the jetty and these services have a myriad of timetable posters near the boarding gates. But the Opal card is not accepted on these services so you must refer to the Sydney Ferry timetable near the touch on machines.Bit long to explain, but a good couple of tips for this lovely little place which shouldn't be missed, even if you only have a day in town.

Family visits. My family and I love going to Watsons Bay on the Ferry from Circular Quay any time of the year.The scenery is always amazing, a walk along the promenade is calming and the kids love the park. We all also love the pub for a good lunch of fish and chips and a cool drink.

Nice Bay to hang around. Great view from Watons's Bay back to the City. Walk up to the Gap and admire the ocean and crashing waves. Watch the sunset from the top of the Gap. Great restaurant (the Doyle) for fish, though drinks are slightly expensive.

Views to the city . Watsons Bay is a great spot to get views back to Sydney. The park provides a great spot to sit and enjoy the views. The ferry ride to Watsons Bay compliments the views with great views of the harbourside houses and apartments on the journey out and back. I would recommend this place to anyone.
Beautiful views!!. There are many trails that offer breathe taking views. The best seafood restaurant in Sydney (Doyle's) is here. I loved it!!

A must see location when you are in Sydney. This was the second time I visited Watson's Bay and I highly recommend it as a side trip if you are visiting Sydney. It is easy to get to from the Sydney Ferry.Watson Bay has spectacular 360 degree views of Sydney Harbour, the Sydney skyline and Cliffs and the Tasmanian Sea.Last time we just went to the top of Gap Bluff to look around. This time we hiked along the Cliff Walk in both directions, both towards Horny Lighthouse and towards Macquarie Lighthouse. The trails have some steep spots but are not outrageously difficult. You just need to be on decent shape to handle the entire cliff tops hike, which is about 5 miles total.If you have a half a day to kill this is great place to visit.

One of my favourite places in Sydney. Watsons Bay is one of my favourite places in Sydney. Accessible by boat, car or bus, its a definite must visit! Some great bars and restaurants, to grab something to eat, my personal favourite is Doyles restaurant for amazing views and views,

Such a pretty bay. Such a pretty bay, we stopped off on the Hop On Hop Off Ferry we got with Taronga Zoo entry. We had gone for fish and chips at Doyles and sat looking out as the sun set on a cool July tea time- beautiful. The gulls were rather friendly!
Lovely Spot. Went by bus to this terminus of Watsons bay and spent a lovely few hours there, lovely views of Sydney in the distance
Great For Lunch. The ferry from circular que is beautiful and a great way to get a sense of the city. Then go for a walk and join the local crowds at the restaurant and bar by the ferry.

Quaint and laid back. Accidental stop off as part of the hop on and off ferry on way back from manly beach. No beach to talk of, but some lovely cafes an d bars to sit in and watch the boats/world go by. Stayed couple of hours due to ferry time but if I went back would plan to spend longer here, fab seafood place right on the dock

worth the trip. Watson's Bay has a variety of eateries including the well-known Doyle's fish restaurants where you can have delectable fish meals for varying prices depending on the site you choose. We like to go out on the bus and return to the city by ferry, the best of both worlds.

Cool pub.. Someone told us to chill out at this pub. It was right on the beach with views up the harbour. Nice boat ride from the city. Go over to the gap for an ocean side view. Good beer and good lunch meal too.
Good without being great. There's a beach at Watson's Bay, but it's not a surf beach; it's possible to walk out to see a lighthouse on the cliffs of Sydney Harbour, which is nice. All quite pretty.

A nice ferry ride. We went to Watson's Bay as we were told it was famous for its fresh fish restaurants. We took the ferry from Sydney which was very enjoyable. We went there just before sunset. We walked to the famous light house which was worth it as you can see out to sea and the cliffs are amazing. The town itself was cute but the fish was over priced and not worth it.

Great place for walks and harbour views. This compact suburb is well worth a visit for either high tea, coffee or a fish & chips meal. Explore on foot including the famous Gap Bluff, Watsons Bay Beach (alongside the world famous Doyle's Restaurant) and Gibsons Beach Reserve alongside the Pilot Station. The Watsons Bay hotel is also a great venue for people watching, a beverage or two and reasonable meal options.
What a great venue. Had the privilege to attend a wedding at this place. Everything was so nice and beautiful!The view makes it just perfect!

Submarine net caught Japanese sub. During World War II, Watson's Bay was closely involved in the submarine netting across the entry to Port Jackson, that is, Sydney Harbour. During the Attack on Sydney Harbour in May 1942, a Japanese miniature submarine was caught in the net and the crew destroyed the sub, along with themselves. Two subs got through the net, causing chaos in Sydney. Watson's Bay is peaceful today, just the place for a quiet Sunday afternoon..

Not what we expected. Very dirty.. We made the trip from beautiful shellharbour to have lunch at Doyles. Well let's just say we should have stayed home. The bay was atrocious. Dirty with an endless amount of rubbish and broken glass on the banks. The locals rude and thinking they are better than everyone else. Especially the man whose home was right on the bay and trying to get his dog in his yard. Rude as they come. If this is what having money is about well then u can have it. u wanna see pristine beaches then visit the north or south coast of nsw. We welcome everyone. Rich or poor. Ad for Doyles...well its over priced and over rated especially when its right on a dirty bay. The food was average and nothing to brag about. Surf and turf had lumpy mash and hardly a "giant" prawn on the steak. Just small green prawns on top. I didn't expect frozen chips at 5 star restaurant. Very average at best.

Great place. Love this bay because not only you can walk around but you also can go to the gap and walk to the top of the gap. The view is amazing and great. I had a good time here with my family. Recommended to visit in Winter as well.

Thumbs up. . Get the ferry over from circular quay. Beautiful food at Doyle's and a great gelato shop near the park. We will definitely stop by again next time we are in town. Very glad we were taken there.

Watson's Bay. Very beautiful and peaceful place to visit and just chill out if you want to, or you can walk along the cliff edge, on the great walking trail. Great place for photos, the sea from one side and great harbour views from the other. Good Cafes on the waters edge.

an iconic sydney view. I think this place is very special - the great views of the harbour, lazy Sunday afternoons at the Watson's Bay hotel, walking around to the magic Camp Cove with its even better view of the Sydney skyline. It doesnt get any better than this.....

best place to see on sunrise. Best place to see sunrise and striking waves of ocean on the rocks - The gap!!See up to the horizon, Sydney beauty on the other side...!!Lighthouse on the time of dawn is the best here and near to city.

a typical place full of local but also tourist. a great combination of local and tourist.not much to do in waitron’s bay simply take a bus or the ferry from the city.of course the ferry will take via some of the prestigious eastern suburb like post point double bay…you will find a great pub and the famous Doyle seafood and also a boutique hotel with great reviews,not a bad place to eat lots of seafood and have a great drink.

Spectacular! . Great view, excellent place to walk around and have a great sea food lunch looking at the ocean, the lighthouse is interesting. You can take the ferry from the opera location and visit this place. Try it if you have time

Great views, lovely area. Watson's bay is a lovely area to visit, with a lovely view back over the city.
You can catch the ferry from the city centre, which is a nice trip.
Definitely worth a visit when in Sydney.
Fabulous Fish and Chips. Fabulous Fish and Chips at Watson's Bay. We also took a lovely coastal walk to the heads, fantastic views.

Beautiful, sleepy town with stunning views. Not a lot to do in the area -- a few shops and restaurants that were cute. But you get the nice bay view of downtown Sydney coupled with stunning views of the ocean off of the cliffs. Go up to the part and do the nature hike around the cliff edges. The water was pretty rough and the crashing waves were fun to watch. Really glad we stopped off there from the hop-on-hop-off ferry on a whim. It was a great detour on our way back to the city from Manly.

Amazing. I've been now multiple times at Watsons Bay and still i am amazed by that place. Leaving the ferry at Watsons Bay wharf and heading uphill through this beautiful park, just crossing Military Road and some steps - and suddenly i stand on the cliffs and look at the Pacific Ocean. Don't miss Gap Bluff and the walk along the cliffs. Either left hand side, first up and than down, to the lighthouse or right hand up to Old Southern Head Rd. In case you get hungry just return to the crossing of Military Rd and try Nautical. A greek restaurant with good prices, nice service and good food. Water is included in the price of the food.

A must visit for locals and tourists. Watson's Bay is an icon of Sydney with the great views, great food, and friendly people. Easy and cheap to catch a Ferry from Circular Quay to get there and take the opportunity to enjoy fresh seafood at a number of restaurants.

Do not miss Watsons bay best views of Sydney skyline. Best views of Sydney you will find in Watsons bay, walk up to the gap road and climb the stairs to the trail that lies there. From here you have magnificent views of the whole bay with Sydney skyscrapers on the back ground. Watch out for the Cockatoos that live here, you can hear them when you arrive. Definitely recommended to visit when in Sydney.

Spectacular views of Sydney. Take the ferry to Watsons Bay and walk across the road to the Ocean side for an amazing view. The walk to the lighthouse is beautiful. End with a drink at the Beach Club at sunset before taking the ferry back to Sydney.

Must do. Sydney is not just about Opera House and Harbour Bridge. A must do is to take a ferry ride to Watsons Bay. Most recommended is to take it an hour before Sunset. On arrival climb up to the look out point. You will be pleasantly rewarded with a fantastic view of the Ocean from the cliff on one side and the Sydney CBD skyline together with the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. The last ferry leaves Watsons Bay at 1645. Do not worry about it as you can catch many buses back to town either via Bondi beach or Kings Cross. Really worth doing it...
Nice view of the beach. Nice view on the beach. Suggest to have lunch by the side of the beach and enjoy the view. It worths the short ferry trip from circular quay.

Great trip. I loved Sydney and all around the junction area great food and drink bondi is a must see I loved it there I found the people very friendly Watson,s bay hotel is fab food brilliant try the sea food platter its to die for went up to Melbourne for the granprix loved it there great trip

Wonderful day trip. A 20 minutes ferry ride from Sydney Harbour, you will find the most attrative and picture perfect place, you can fine dine, hike/walk or enjoy the historical site of this place, there is always something special to do. It only took me three visits from USA to Oz to find this remarkable place; that Its what I thought it was important to share. Make sure you put this in the list of things to do when you visit Sydney!
Lovely bay. This is another beautiful bay. Most of these bays are safe for swimming and have shark proof pools and netting. Always check this out be fore swimming.

Always beautiful in a sunny day . Lovely place to go for a short walk. Start from breakfast or lunch close to the harbor, get an ice cream after it. Walk along the path. Enjoy the view. Go up to the light house, lay down in the green grass and enjoy the sun. It's always good to go on a sunny day. It will make you feel fresh!

It was very cool, Watson Bay was an experience I wll not forget. The restaurants were open on the beach.. The night air while sitting either on the ferry or restaurant was very relaxing and enjoyable and cool.

Nice for a Ferry ride and lunch. We took the Ferry form the Quay and it was a beautiful ride past the Opera House and then into Watson's Bay. Had lunch, got to pet Sean a 11 week old pet sheep and walked on the beach. Just a wonderful trip but didn't get out to the lighthouse.

A great place at the end of a fun ferry ride.. Watsons Bay is a beautiful little bay that seems a fair way from busy Sydney. It is a 30 minute ferry ride...great fun...and then a good feed of fish and chips at the iconic shop on the wharf. We loved it...small and easy to do in half a day or less.

Watson Bay Stroll. We were lucky enough to get a great sunny day. We stopped at Rose Bay (bit boring) but Watson had a walk we could do with great views. Some great cafes, park, and wharf. Great place for a cruisy sunny day.

Peaceful and nice picnic area, great fish and chips!. We visited the place at least 3 times as w e enjoy the peaceful and pleasant park and ferry ride to Watsons Bay. After a nice lunch at Doyles, take a stroll up the steps toward the Gap, a popular local attraction. The views is amazing, you get the ocean vie as well the city skyline during a clear day. A must for most visitors to Sydney, you can have picnic and enjoy 2-3 hour stay there to chill out.

A nice afternoon (day) trip. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay on Sunday, and did the walk around South Head and up to the lighthouse. Bought some sensational beer battered fish and some chips at the Watsons Bay Hotel for lunch and ate them in the park opposite, then caught the ferry back to Circular Quay.It's an easy walk up to the lighthouse and back, with quite a lot of history in the way of old gun emplacements and the old Lighthouse masters cottage, right on the heads. Overall, a very pleasant walk, with some spectacular views, particularly on a nice day and the fish and chips at the end of the walk topped it off nicely.
Pretty view. Really nice place with a view on the city of Sydney and the see in the other side. If you have an opportunity to try the sea food there i highly recommend you to.
Beautiful place to visit. Great place to visit on a day that's cool and without rain. Recommend Doyles to have lunch or dinner - seafood type of meals
Stunning views. My partner took me here because Id never been here before but its definitly worth the visit of you want to get good photographs of the city skyline and the beach which is up a hill

Great view from Watson's Bay. The view from Watson's Bay is breathtaking. The clean beach, beautiful sea and nice blue sky. It was a short 15min walk from the wharf and the walk towards the lighthouse is very enjoyable. If you have some time, you can sit on one of the rocks and enjoy the cooling seabreeze - very therapeutic. I took a nice ferry ride from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. The journey was approximately 30min and one can use Opal Card for the travel. Do note that if you take the ferry on Sunday, the price is 50% of the usual.

A great ferry ride to great harbour views. After a short and pleasant ferry ride from Circular Quay you arrive at Watsons Bay. Apart from some of the best fish and chips on the ferry wharf you get to have some of the best views of the harbour. Very relaxing way to spend a few hours with family and friends.
nice bay for winter. a nice park is a plus in this kind of winter traveling. the sun was shining but the wind can be quite chilling. Not so many people were there, we had a nice walk on the cliff.

The View from Watson's Bay, Sydney. This place is perfect for a sunset walk with a clear view to the skyline of Sydney. I took the picture in December 2014. I recommend to take the ferry from Circular Quay.

Breathtaking views. I visited this place in March 2016, it was one of the many beautiful attractions in Sydney. It had stunning views, ice places to eat and relax or grab a cup of coffee. The views from the top overlooking the cliff by the ocean were very stunning. I throughly enjoyed this place.
Great views of Sydney . Great place. Found whilst having a drive around Sydney and the surrounding areas/countryside. Exploring the sights and sounds of NSW.

Aussie Harbourside Living. Grew up in the area so a little biased. Watson's Bay is just inside the harbour around from south head. Originally was a fishing village but now is one of the most expensive area's of real estate in Sydney. Watson's Bay and nearby Vaucluse are situated on a peninsula with ocean on one side and harbour on other. Public transport from city is either via the 325 bus from circular quay or a public ferry. Both scenic options. Spend a day and make certain you walk to the "GAP" a popular ocean cliff face often unfortunately used for suicide, stroll along harbour side to Camp Cove and enjoy a swim or venture further along toward south head to Lady Jane beach where nude bathing is permitted. Doyle's famous seafood restaurants are located on the Watson's Bay public ferry wharf or on the beach. The boutique Watson's Bay hotel also has a great beer garden for a leisurely lunch with spectacular views of the harbour. Enjoy one of my favourite places in the world.

Fish and chips. You can get a ferry from circular quay over to watsons bay but remember the last ferry is 3pm. The best fish and chips are available I a restaurant to the left as you get off the ferry you get a lovely view of the city skyline too
Most amazing place. Liked very much and nature is there only feeling like this ,walk lovers or joggers must visit there visit gap and nude by walk whole day enjoyed very Much.
Nice ferry ride for lunch. Take a ferry or water taxi and go have lunch here. Nice places to eat and relax and people watch. Love Doyles for lunch!
A real beauty. Take the ferry and visit this beautiful place for a couple of hours. Charming and relaxing with grate views.

Gaze back at the city along the beautiful Sydney Harbour.. Catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay then enjoy fish and chips at Watsons Bay Hotel or many of the restaurants that face the harbour. A short walk to "The Gap"gives you a view looking over the ocean.

We drove to Watsons Bay and had a lovely walk around the Bay to the Kiosk at Camp Cove!. When you take a walk around Watsons Bay there are a few fish restaurants but we loved the little kiosk on Camp Cove where you can buy a great coffee, drink and a great sandwich most days when its warm.
Best fish and chip in australia at watsons Bay restaurant. Best fish and ship in Australia at Watsons Bay restaurant you can sit inside( in winter and the cooler months) or outside on a sunny day

Great views over good food. Whenever I'm in Sydney, or have friends heading to Sydney, I recommend a ferry ride from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. The ferry ride itself is beautiful with great views of the harbour and river from the boat. Watson's Bay is just stunning. We sat at the jetty area and had fish and chips and other seafood at Doyle's on the Wharf. The food was really good and fresh, and top that off with the stunning view, it makes a great afternoon. After lunch, take a short stroll up the hill towards The Gap as you digest your food. And walk off more calories by walking even further up the gap path towards the lookout for some amazing scenery of the ocean and the cliffs. It'll make the short walk worthwhile!

Great Bay to visit. 10 mins from circular bay on the ferry. We walked up to the gap which was straight ahead through a small park area, we turned left & walked past the beautiful little fisher ens cottages up to the point, it is not disability friendly as there are steps to negotiate & going up to the lighthouse is a steady slope up, but well worth the views of the heads. We then came down & went to Doyle's on the wharf for fish & chips which are served in boxes & very nice.

Busy place. It is rather a long way to go by bus or car, not much there except busy restaurants and bars, purchase some fish and chips and eat in the park.. You can go and return by ferry which is a nice ride and well worth it on a hot day.
The Best Fish and chips with an amazing view. This is the place to go in Sydney if you want to sit on the beach and have fish and chips, it is so scenic and a lovely way to spend an afternoon.

Beautiful Seaside Town!. We took ferry from Circular Quay to Watson Bay and the journey was really enjoyable and very scenic. We walk along the Gap Bluff Top Rd overlooking the vast ocean which is famous for whales and dolphins lookout and unfortunately we aren't in luck today.There are a few seafood restaurants along the pier which is famous for its fish and chips. It's very relaxing to walk around the park and enjoyed the quaint atmosphere here..

Fish and chips to secret beach. We went to Watson's Bay for the famous fish and chips...like everyone does when they visit Sydney. Not worth the fish and chip but definitely worth a walk! Some really great houses on some really narrow streets.On our walk we found a very quiet beach with only a handful of locals swimming. Great find!! can't remember where it is though. If it's summer and your heading this way, pack your swimmers. Worth the walk and the best swim with the view of the city.From memory, once off the ferry, turn left at the end of the wharf and walk along the water front then right up the stairs the try and keep walking left until you reach a very small park, walk through the park and there's a beach at the end.

Beautiful and could willingly waste my time in it. "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feelings as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." - Albert Einstein

Watsons Bay to South Head Walk. Watson's Bay is a really cute little town just opposite the Sydney CBD. The homes are very picturesque and give the Bay a quaint feel. We did the walk from Watson's Bay to South Head (the lighthouse) which was a lovely easy and very scenic route. There are a number of small beaches along the way as well as some great picnic spots. A word to the wise - Watson's Bay is pretty, and it knows it. Expect the prices of the restaurants and food vendors to reflect this

Lovely visit. We took the return ferry over from circular quay cost $12 for 2. There is a Restaurant on the pier that do fish n chips for $13, there is also a mainly seafood takeaway on the pier and there is also a pub and a few other places to eat at close to the water. We went up the hill and ate at the bandstand nearly the toilets. We also walked further up the path and crossed the road and did the walk along the ocean looking towards the heads of Botany Bay.Great day then we took the boat back.Recommend this place for a sunny day trip.

Fun for kids & Peace for solo goers. Peace is out here. The lookout on the opposite side has the best view in Sydney in my opinion. The grass grounds on the bay side are a good picnic spot for families and the bay area is the shortest beach I have seen. Good for kids to practice swimming (that's what I saw kids doing there). For me it was really peaceful, no hullaho of a beach with a similar beauty!

Great place for a scenic lunch. A friend living in Sydney took me here for something a little different outside of the city. It didn't disappoint. The restaurant was great and the view to match.Have recommended it to other since and they too have enjoyed it.

Nice day out. Lots of picnic spots on the grass or near the bay. Great restaurants, cafes and take away food options available. Watson's Bay lookout really is something to see. A great day our for all.

Iconic Fish and Chips don't disappoint. Taking the ferry to Watson's Bay from Circular Quay is such a great value! Even if you didn't get off, you'd have a stunning view of the bridge, the Opera House and how the residences climb up the hillsides. But if you DO get off, be sure to grab the fish and chips from the iconic Doyle's that has been there since the 1940's...either from the full service restaurant with a view of the harbor, or for a less expensive option, the smaller version on the actual ferry dock. And whatever you do, take the time to climb the hill through Gap Park to view the sheer cliff walls that front the Tasman Sea. What a surprise!
Peaceful place with good food. Take a ferry to Watsons Bay to view the wonderful sealife and enjoy the quite ambience of the place whilst you enjoy a good feed. Great seafood.

No interest . Shops are for most of them cash only.
The area has nothing that will glitter or be magnificent.
The beach was dirty and without interest.
You can really avoid that
Great place for breakfast. This was a beautiful seafront spot to sit and have breakfast. There were many water activities happening making it an interesting place.

Lunch at Watsons Bay Hotel. Had a late lunch here. Pretty good food. Only a small lot of people but the day was bleak so that probably was the reason for this. Lovely view looking back at the city. The hotel is not listed on Trip advisor, maybe because it has recently been refurbished. We usually go to Doyles next door but thought we would try this out. Glad we did.

Beautiful day out. Went to Watsons Bay and were lucky to go on a beautiful day - the area is simply stunning and the views of the centre of Sydney across the bay, the relaxing water lapping at the beach and the laid back life of the locals, shouldn't be missed - but good luck finding a parking spot on a sunny day!

One of the best places in Sydney to watch the sunset. I'm going to post a few pic's. I think they can speak for itself.Take a ferry from Circular Quay. Have a fish and chips at the restaurant just after the Ferry (Fisherman Wharf) and walk to the Laing's Point (check the google maps). Take a sit at the rocks and enjoy such a great view.

Great location great food - Iconic Sydney destination. Watsons Bay is one of my all time favourite Sydney Locations. The trick is, to get their early if driving as parking is quite hard to come by. I recommend the Watsons Bay Hotel for meals. Take a walk across to the lighthouse where their are sweeping views of South Head and a visit to the GAP. Recommended Highly to Sydney siders and vistors

Excellent fish and chips. Went to Watsons Bay on the ferry. Lovely place, had a good walk around the area. Wonderful fish and chips for lunch on the wharfe, which I had at a table overlooking the bay. Dont miss this trip.
My favorite place in Sydney. This really ended up being my favorite place in Sydney. Such a great view and the drive up from city center was really nice too.
Great ferry ride to beautiful Watson's Bay. We travelled by ferry to Watson's Bay and enjoyed fish and chips overlooking the water. Such a beautiful place.
Average beach, Poor Fish and Chips at Beach cafe. We decided to take a ferry across the bay to Watson's Bay. Beach was average and the meal which we had at Beach cafe was poor for the price charged.

A great excursion by ferry. We had a leisurely trip out to Watson's Bay by ferry and explored the choice of lunch at Doyle's or the Watson Bay Hotel. We plumped for the Watson Bay Hotel, and weren't disappointed.

Watson's Bay. Ferry trips a must to Watson's Bay.Food can be expensive or reasonable depending on where you dine.The take away has very reasonable food, and you can go inside their restaurant and dine, right on the water, so why pay extra??.The atmosphere is what you make it.There is at least 3 great dining choices within 2 minutes walk.Doyles, Pub, or the cafe on the wharf.
Just Great!!. U have an incredible view from Sydney!!Great for a morning walk, near the water!!Very peaceful, i loved it!!

Beautiful part of Sydney. Took a ferry to get here and it's just beautiful, wish I came earlier in the day! There are some dining options on the beach and a trail for hiking as well as a nude beach if you're into that stuff!

Perfection. Watson's Bay is pure bliss. It's a short ferry ride from circular quay and it's so worth it. Usually I would recommend the fish and chips, but my most recent trip saw the downing of an old fashioned milkshake and sandwich from a quaint little milk bar off the main drag. The Gap is breathtaking. We saw divers and a seal off the rocks, then clear blue all the way of the coast line. There's a pristine nudist Beach a bit around the corner and the views of Sydney city are far enough for you to lose yourself for a moment. An excellent recess from reality.

Beautiful place, easy to navigate. I got a ferry (port 4) from Sydney Harbour to Watsons Bay. There's an easy to follow map at the port at Watson's Bay and I followed it to the lighthouse. The walk itself is beautiful and there were not many people around. The lighthouse it cute with some excellent views of Sydney in the distance on the route to it from the ferry. Buses back into Bondi - beach and junction are easily accessible. There's also a nice green in the middle by the bus stops to enjoy gelato/coffee before leaving.

A nice ferry ride and family getaway for the day. Arrived on the ferry to a glut of jellyfish floating in the pier area! Watson's bay on one side, ocean side on the other, with a nice promenade between them (although we missed it going from the bay to the ocean side, ask directions!!!) The bay side full of families and young'un's enjoying the calm waters. ocean side was weekend crowded, with surfers and lots of bikinied women and not hard to look at Aussie men :) On the Ocean side, had a so so meal at a Tex mex restaurant but had a fantastic view of the ocean beach while eating in the shaded balcony, lovely!

A Relaxing place to spend the day.. Take a ferry to Watson Bay and enjoy the cruise. Have fish and chips for lunch from Doyle's at the wharf. Bring along a mat, place it on the grass, read a good book or just relax. Nearby is the Gap where you can see beautiful rock formations and cliffs and watch the strong sea waves crashing against the rocks. If using the ferry, you need to leave around 4 to 5 pm as there is no night ferry. However, there is a bus service from and to Bondi junction where you can then catch a train. Watson bay is also one of my favourite places and I particularly enjoy the fish and chips from Doyle's.
Fantastic views. Great walk around South Head with fantastic views of Sydney. Very enjoyable day. Get the ferry from Circular Quay. Then get a bus to Bondi Beach and do the walk to Coogee.

Amazing fishing spot!. I have been there in the last three month several time to fishing.
Every time was better then the last one!!!!
The spot close green point but more near the main beach is incredible....... Rocky and sand bottom sea perfect for sardi bait and big fish.
AHHHMAZING. The view, beach and water is just AHHHMAZING! Best place to go in the summer time for some cheeky wine, cheese and crackers!
One of the best scenic places in Sydney. This is worth a visit with its breathtaking views. Especially on the way you get to see different scenic places which have breathtaking views.
Harbour View. Lunch by the water, then up the hill to the gap for a walk along the coast. Easy accessible via ferry or bus.
Relaxing lunch. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay, walk up the Gap & then have lunch on the beach, at the pub or at Doyles. A great afternoon
watson's bay. Watson's bay is a beautiful place, and I'll recommend you to do the coastal walk to bondi beach to see beautiful landscapes

Wow!. This place is gorgeous! we had the fish and chips and went for a wander up to the lookout, you can go further but we had limited time so just did the 5min walk. Beautiful building housing restaurants, just a lovely spot
Take the ferry. After seeing the opera house we got the ferry to here for lunch. Like a little fishing village with a great pub on the beach.
Picturesque and quiet retreat. Well worth a stop off the ferry. We walked along the front and then had tea and cakes at Dunbar House - lovely.

Nice afternoon trip. We took the ferry over around noon. Had lunch at Doyle's where we did takeout and then ate in the park. Then took a walk around the coast line and into the town a bit. Very pretty setting and worth the time to see.

Fish and chips. Easy to get to by Ferry and to sit in Doyle's and eat fresh fish and chips with a view of the sea who could ask for anything else. Then a walk to view the ocean and rocks. Wow a must do.
D
S

AMAZING VIEW. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson Bay. The ferry ride was pleasant with great views of the harbor and took about 20 minutes.From the Watson Bay jetty, it is a short 100 metres walk to the Gap. The view from the Gap is amazing especially with the sea waves splashing against the rocks. We went on a weekday and it was quiet and virtually empty.Plenty of opportunities for good pictures without the weekend crowd.We took a bus back to Circular Quay from Watson Bay.The public transport system in Sydney is very efficient and convenient.

ELEMENTARY MY DEAR WATSON. Got to Circular Quay, a bit wet behind the ears and wasn't too sure where to go for the day. So the boat for Watsons Bay was about leave so we thought let's take a punt with our water based oyster cards!Our trip was back in January, which explains why it was extremely busy. First stop was Rose Bay, followed by Watsons. When we got off, couldn't help but notice Doyles, but it was ram jam packed. So we followed it round the corner and bought some delicious fish and chips at the side of Watsons Bay Boutique Hotel. Again it was so busy to eat in the seating area, so we just crossed the road into the park and indulged whilst watching the world go by.So then we walk through the heart of the park, up the steps and turned left towards the view point. The Gap look out is the best part of this trip, watching hard waves crash into the landscape time after time does not get as boring as you think. Maybe, just maybe it was possible that we viewed the Tasman Sea at its finest...

Amazing views and quiet beaches during the week. The ferry from Circular Quay gets you there quickly as you will need some time to enjoy the walks in the area and lovely beaches. The Federation Cliff walk takes you by some dismantled historic armaments to the Gap, the entrance to the Sydney harbour. There are a few restaurants and ice cream stops in town, but it is more residential than commercial, which is nice to see at times. Bring a lunch and make it a day excursion.
A real gem. A nice quiet little place away from the hustle and bustle of Sydney, Watson's bay was indeed an amazing place!
Fish and chips and ferry. This is also gets busy but there's a nice fish and chips place near the wharf. It's also covered with Opal and will take you to Circular Quay.

A Wonderful Day trip. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay mainly to eat at Doyle's but we really enjoyed the leisurely time in the littleton. Hike up to the look out at the back of the bay for a magnificent view of the the Tasmin Sea where you feel like you are at the end of the world.

Stunning views, beautiful location. There are some quaint restaurants and cafes here and the walk along the cliff edge gives you great views of the harbour and the rugged landscape of the area.Nice place to stop off for a short visit.

Beautiful. Take the ferry across the harbour of drive along the scenic roads past the lighthouse to this lovely beach. Great place to paddle in the water or just chill out. There are a few nice places to grab ice-cream, fish and chips or a drink but I'd say take a picnic and enjoy the view!
TAKE A FERRY. This is a great way to see Sydney Harbour by taking the public ferry to Watsons Bay Have a drink and fish and chips at the hotel and get the ferry back to Circular Quay

Nice views!. Watson's bay is great for a scenic drive. I have been here a few times for a drive and it is always gorgeous. Come for a night drive and park your car in a quiet neighborhood to enjoy the pretty lights.

Gorgeous bay, recommend Doyle's for Lunch to enjoy views and a nice lunch. Such a beautiful bay with nearby views to see the Eastern most part of Australia. Really nice way to spend an afternoon in Sydney.

Gorgeous bay. Went for a bus ride on the first bus that came by and it happened to be going to Watson's Bay. Yes, this is how I like to explore cities lol. Was a lovely bus ride, and when we arrived it was raining, however the beauty and bustle of the place took my breath away! A gorgeous park runs down to the bay, with lots of seating, and space for the kiddies to run around. Even though we were not hungry, we grabbed soem of Doyle's famous fishnchips and sat under a tree and devoured them. Delicious. Took the ferry back to Circular Quay, again a lovely ride. Will definitely go back on my next visit and spend more time there.

Beach to cliffs, great views and vibes. Caught the ferry to Watson's Bay. Wasn't sure what to expect but was delighted to find a beautiful park and stunning views of the coastline via a short walk from the ferry terminal. Absolutely stunning views from The Gap park and pathways. After a stroll we went to Watson's Bay Boutique Hotel for a few beers. Refreshing and beach vibe at the hotel bar, great for couples, families and groups alike. Highly recommend Watson's Bay Boutique hotel for their service, and cool views!

Picturesque bay for a family day trip. Watson's Bay is a short ferry ride from Circular Quay with a lovely small beach for children to paddle or swim in. Takeaway fish and chips from Doyle's was a treat under the giant Moreton Bay Fig trees. A quieter pace away from Sydney for a day visit.

A beautiful secluded part of Sydney. OK, so you will need to get here by ferry from Circular Quay or it is a 20 minute drive from the CBD, it is well worth a visit if you have time on your visit to Sydney. It is not something you would do on your first 3 days in Sydney but if you have the time on an extended visit, travel here to experience it's beauty. Get of the ferry, turn right and get some fish and chips at Doyle's and then sit on the adjacent beach for a while enjoying the view. After lunch, do a short walk to Camp Cove Beach (10 mins) and sit on the beach enjoying the sun until sunset. Possibly take a walk around the 'point' and 'Gap' as well, it is good.
Nice walk. This is very nice area, I did the walk along the shore with beautiful views, romantic rocks and great weather.

Awesome Bay!. We took the walk out to the end of Watson's Bay. It was pretty awesome to be at the end of the cliffs and look out into the open water and into the bay! I don't know the exact history, but Watson's Bay use to be a main fighting position. There was old bunker and weapon ruins. Pretty awesome to explore around!
Beautiful bay. We stopped here and had a delicious ice-cream and walked a little way along the coastal path. Beautiful and stunning bay - well worth a visit

Magnif, Sunris and Sunset. Though I could not grasp the exact pleasantness of the Sunset on my camera as I was testing with some filters in my camera, the bay is beautiful with good view of ocean and the city in the backdrop. The gloomy city in the Sunset is really amazing. If you are around Sydney City do not hesitate to go there for a second. Jut ride the ferry and leave Circular Quay and experience the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House from a spot never before on the way.
Yummo !. Ye, it is just fish and chips and reasonably expensive, but a visit here and a look at The Gap is a must for a visit to Sydney !

Watsons Bay Hotel. Great location right on the beach at Watsons Bay. Outdoor eating area split level with some of the dining area under cover and the rest under umbrellas and trees with lovely views over Sydney Harbour.
Last but not least , as this Hotel is part of the Doyles group it has great seafood dishes on the menu.
closest ferry and bus to Lady Bay nudist beach. Sydney has four nudist beaches and the closest one to a ferry is Watson's Bay which is a ten minute walk to Lady Bay nudist beach.

Fantastic Romantic Place for the Visitor. I live in Sydney and this is one of my favourite places where I take my wife for a take away seafood lunch with a nice bottle of Chardonnay in the park adjoining the beach overlooking the harbour. There is plenty of options in adjoining restaurants if having lunch on a rug with someone you love is not your thing. We have been married for 26 years and it still is as enjoyable as the first time we went there. The place is easy to get to by ferry from Circular Quay (Driving and alcohol does not mix well) and the Doyle's on the Wharf provides plenty of seafood options with a nice bar included for any alcoholic beverage.
Stunning. Such a gorgeous place to visit, beautiful walk out to the south head and lighthouse. Fish and chips from Doyles looking out across the harbour, the view is perfect!

A bay not worth the time. The smallest and poorest bay in Sydney. The place has a big tourists restaurant right at the landing, and a park. The best part was walking up the hill to see the gap. The scenery is beautiful here and you can see the opening to the harbor.
Lovely. Unfortunately it was raining when we went but still very beautiful. We had lunch at Doyle's wharfside.
Nice place. A very serene and calm place away from the semantics of the CBD. Good place to clear your thoughts or maybe just sit and admire the view.

Great perspective of the harbour and coast. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay and back for a Saturday outing in the autumn sun and it was great. The ferry ride offers great views of the harbour and a stop off at Rose Bay. The walking paths around Watson's Bay and the Gap are great and very accessible. Great views, well worth it!

Great location , lots to do. Watson's Bay is well known to Sydney residents as one of the "places to go", particular in the Summer. Food at the Restaurant is first class and "knocking down"a few beers in the Pub is also recommended. Great views and close to popolar beaches, Watson's Bay is a fun place

Serene escape from sightseeing. . After a few days of sightseeing which included a lot of walking we decided that a day of relaxation was required. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay which was a very quick and scenic journey giving us awesome views of Sydney. We had planned to get the bus from Watson's Bay to Bondi Beach where we intended to spend the day but we liked Watson's Bay so much that after a couple of hours watching the waves and sitting in the wind on Bondi we got the bus straight back there. We had a stroll around Watson's Bay, light and superb lunch in Doyle's on the beach watching the boats and ferries and then took the short walk along the front to a lovely, sheltered beach which we had almost to ourselves. We spent the afternoon there swimming, sunbathing, reading and watching boats and birds then , as the sun was setting, we walked back to the bar on the jetty which was buzzing and had a drink or two before boarding the ferry back to Sydney, viewing the city from the water once again but this time at dusk. Beautiful! We found Watson's Bay to be attractive, charming, easily walkable, serene and restful and would recommend a visit there if, like us, you need a calming break from tourism!

Small but beautiful. One of my favourite places to visit. A small little beach but still plenty going on around you. A two minute walk takes you to beautiful Dunbar house where you can enjoy an afternoon tea and watch the world go by.
Great views. I took the first ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay around 10 am, had a lovely breakfast at a nearby restaurant and took the ferry back. Wonderful!

Great food, great atmosphere. Well, what can i say?? I have been to Watson's Bay many times. There's so much history there. You can arrive by bus, car, or ferry. For food, there is the famous seafood restaurant, Doyles, the takeaway seafood restaurant Doyles at the ferry wharf, a hotel/pub, and another restaurant further down. Each have great service and food. The restaurants are quite expensively priced, and the pub, and takeaway are reasonably priced. All very nice food. The beach is right out the front of the two restaurants and the pub, so while the adults are eating and chatting, the kids can have a paddle in the water, and still be seen. The beach is quite protected, so there are very few waves, except when a ferry comes in!After you eat, you can take a walk along the path in front of the beach. The view is gorgeous. There's a great park for the kids to play in and for the adults to rest a while!Its Really a lovely place to come for a day trip!

Great beach and lunch spot. It is a short, easy ferry ride to Watson's Bay. Once you are there, there is a beautiful walk with several lookouts and a great beach. It wasn't busy at all when we were there and there were several restaurants to grab a drink or have lunch. Great little day trip!
Beautiful. We heard that the place was famous for fish-n-chips and they were right. The surprise was the nearby hiking trails and scenery. Lots of history abound.

Lunch in the sun. Make this a must visit place to visit - head out on the ferry service it takes 30 mins. Restaurants were heaving although seats available as people came and left regularly. Food was satisfactory, great atmosphere with great views.

Beautiful - a must see!. When asking people who had travelled to Sydney before/people who currently live there what is a must see, watsons bay never cropped up in conversation. Almost by accident we found watsons bay. We jumped on the first bus and rode it to the end of the route. The beaches here are beautiful and were very empty when we were there. There are a handful of lovely beachside restaurants including a famous seafood restaurant on the pier (the king prawn salad was delicious).An absolute must see - there are unique views of the city from a distance. Although we didn't stay there I imagine it would be the perfect place to stay on a visit to Sydney, especially for a family.Wish we had discovered earlier in on visit rather than the last day!!
not in the middle of the city but zoo beautiful. to go there you need to take the ferry or the buses but the view is really beautiful. Its good because are not too many tourists

excellent view, community life. I went there twice. On the bus from the city center to Watson's Bay, try not to sleep and look out the left side of the window, there is excellent view along the way. It's a non-touristy spot, quiet, lovely view, and a very cosy community life.

Nice half day. Watson’s Bay was on our list of places to visit during our Sydney trip. No disappointment, it was worth to spend half a day in this place, full of people (weekend), with nice restaurants and excellent view of Sydney skylines with Harbour Bridge over the water.Don’t forget to reach nicely organized walking path along the rocky coast to see the place where Parramatta River reaches Tasman Sea.
Great Monday afternoon. Caught ferry accross to have a few drinks and blown away by secenery and views Meals were great and not expensive and staff very friendly

Wonderful place. Went on ferry to Watsons Bay and really enjoyed the prettiness of the place. Had lunch at the Watsons Bay Boutique Hotel. Lovely outlook and good food , and pricing. Would go back again

More than just a beach side fish & chip restaurant. We originally visited Watsons Bay to check out the famous Doyles Fish & Chip Restaurant at lunchtime. When we got off the ferry we realised that there was a lot more to this place than just the fish & chips. We wandered along the path to the left of the jetty and the take way or eat in restaurant. Here there are numerous little tenders upside down waiting to be used to carry the owners out to the yachts in the bay. It was a Thursday therefore very quite. We could have sat there for hours but we had not yet had lunch. We tried the (catch of the day fish which was hake) and chips.The service was excellent despit it being almost 3 pm (the end of the lunchtime period). The staff were pleasant & friendly. the fish was a little dry (Hake often is when encased in batter) but overall well worth the cost. We had intended to walk along the other side of the bay where ther are most homes but we were mindfull of the ferry timings which end between 4 & 5 pm.

Great trip, views and food. If you don't have time for the Manley ferry trip, try the ferry to Watson's Bay. It's only a 10 min trip, costs very little and the scenery of the harbour and houses is amazing. Then when you get there, there is a ripper pub right on the foreshore with great food and drinks at bar prices. The view looking back at the Harbour Bridge is great. The place is really humming on a sunny Sunday. Love it and will return, again and again!

Just a great place to walk around and enjoy in warm weather. Had caught the bus down from Bond as planned on going to Doyle's and after hopping off the bus just kept walking around. The weather in October was perfect and the area so calm, what started as a short walk ended with over an hour just spent enjoying the band, water and view. I had no idea how it all fitted together but seeing Sydney off in the distance over the soothing water helped place it all
Beautiful. You can see a beautiful landscape and enjoy the beach at Watson's Bay. If you are visiting Sydney the 1st time it's a good option.

Exploring Sydney harbour. Hopped on a boat in Sydney and went out to Watson Bay. 2 infants in tow. Fairly easy getting on and off the boat and around Watson Bay. Beautiful day to enjoy the view and a quick bite at Doyles. Would absolutely go again

Where the locals go. Watson's Bay is a great place to go to enjoy seeing Sydney harbour as well as being able to look out towards the sea. Perfect for sight seeing and photos. Great for naval history. You can buy take away fish and chips and eat in the park or on the sand. Or pack your own picnic lunch. You can catch the bus from Bondi Junction or you can take the ferry from Circular Quay. I recommend you come by one mode of transport and leave by the other so you cna experience both views of the harbour and the ocean.

Good way to spend an afternoon. On the recommendation of a friend we took a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. It was an excellent way to see Sydney from the water and to get outside of Sydney. Once at Watson's Bay we walked up to Hornby Lighthouse. Beautiful views of the bay and Sydney off in the distance. Back down at the pier you can get something to eat or enjoy the park while you wait for the next ferry back to Sydney. A nice relaxing way to enjoy your time in Sydney.

beautiful day perfect memory. take the Sydney Ferry or drive there by the Old Southhead Road, you can absorb the tranquility and beauty of the Sydney Harbour.Enjoy your fish and chips at the restaurant by the beach, at the wharf, or the pub/restaurant. You can even have a picnic by the beach, buy a box of take away and sit under a 200+ years old fig tree at the beach and fight off the invading sea gulls.There are toilet and washroom facilities, ideal for family picnic.If you are adventurous, climb up to the heads and SEE the vertical drop cliff (I didn't say jump!!, there had been too many "accidents")
Very Average. This spot is quite tricky to get to, its rather narrow and there are a lot of boats and no waves of course. They even do dive courses for some reason.

Lets be real. I actually live in Watsons Bay area, and I get to see this magnificent landscape of the Sydney every day. The place offers many parks, restaurants and entertainment for any type of leisure. However, I have to add that if you are planning to visit the place on a sunny day, definitely come here with a ferry because traffic can get crazy.

Lighthouse Walk. Definitely take the easy walk from the harbor to the lighthouse and back to town for some food at one of the harbor restaurants with views of the bay. You can visit Watson's Bay and Manly Harbor in the same day unless you want a full day at one beach.

Evening at Watson's bay. We enjoyed a lovely walk up to the gap and returned to enjoy the mandatory fish meal (reasonably priced) at Doyle's famous fish and chips establishment. The lawn areas and trees provided a fairytale setting and we were refreshed after a busy day

Not a big deal. The bay itself is very very small, not a big deal, there is a very small park and a cliff(should I tell you its a highly famous suicide spot?) a restaurant there is over price and food very low quality, hard to get there too, low frequency bus and ferry

For older travellers . I was told I must get the boat from Sydney Harbour to Watsons Bay while in Syndey. To be honest, I wish I hadn't.Unlike at Manly, there is very little to do when you get there. It's a fishing village and while there are some good restaurants to lunch at, there is little else. There is a pleasant green near the harbour.I can see this would be very popular with older travellers, but within an hour we were done and ready to get back on the ferry.You get great views from the waterside restaurants and there are some nice cafes. The last boat back is not long after 4pm, otherwise it is an extended bus ride.In summary - pleasant but sleepy, good for older travellers, otherwise don't go unless you're in Sydney for an extended period.
Fish 'n' Chips. A lazy lunch with fish and chips from Doyle's. A walk round the park and back on the ferry to Circular Quay. An afternoon well spent.

Glorious views, deliciously yum fish 'n' chips!. I could rave all day about Watson's Bay, conveniently accessible by ferry ride from Circular Quay. Bush walks, nudist beaches, dining experiences, and a photographer's paradise! Boating brilliance for the nautically inclined, especially on December 26th for the start of the world famous Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race. Watson's Bay is a slice of seaside heaven!

travelled by ferry. Met my cousins and they said have you been to Watson Bay? Nope , so off we went on the ferry, good way to travel, we went past the Opera House, the Naval base, Rose Bay and onwards to Watson Bay, there Dunbar House front the bay, a beautiful house now set out as restaurant but I believe weddings and naming days may be had there, we had morning tea, then went for a walk to The Gap, the top of the cliff that looks out to sea opposite Manly, so I guess from high up there would be a great place to watch the cruise liners go through the Heads, after walking back down the hill we were a bit peckish so decided on lunch at Doyles Fish and Chippery, we went to the self service area, they have benches on the beach and under the shade for your use, very reasonable take away, where as the main Doyles restaurant was behind us, not sure how much more you would pay for eating in there, caught the fast ferry back to Circular Quay ready for a walk to Opera house. Brilliant trip.
Lovely. Get a boat from circular quay for lovely boat trip to Watsons Bay. Have lunch on the quay then get the bus onto Bondi

Sleepy little corner of Sydney Harbour. We travelled on the Hop on Hop off cruise to Watson's Bay for lunch. The Bay is quiet and very picturesque. It's relaxing to wander around the waterfront and walk up to the lookout for a view of the Pacific Ocean.

Watsons Bay. If you catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay, you not only experience the delights of Sydney Harbour with its harbour beaches but you also have a view of many of the waterfront properties along the way. Fish and chips at Watsons Bay washed down with cold wine, water or beer is a summer delight.

Pleasant, crowded summer weekends, over rated. Showing a niece around Sydney so caught the ferry from Manly thinking of lunch at Watsons Bay. It was packed - everything! Looking at available menus I couldn't see anything to justify the cost, so quickly moved on to Bondi.

Great Views back to Sydney. However you get there, Watsons Bay offers some great beachside views back to the Sydney CBD across the Harbour.You are also spoilt for choice for dining options, several of which are either right on the beach/water of looking straight out onto it.You can get a ferry from Circular Quay and the hop-on-hop-off ferries also stop here. If the water is not for you I am sure that you can also catch the bus to Watson's Bay. Great views in a loverly beach side location.

A Jewel in a Sea of Beauty. Watson's Bay has so much to offer! Two Doyle's' Restaurants, a great pub (with sensational accommodation), safe swimming, parkland, the Gap, views to die for and picnic areas.
Beutiful spot on the harbor. A great spot to visit and view the harbor - close to the CBD, yet still apart of nature. Also has a few nice spots for lunch and a cool drink.

Simple but lovely. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay, using out Opal Cards and were not disappointed. There are some nice bars and restaurants and a lovely coffee shop. A rather quaint atmosphere. We walked to the top of the point and enjoyed the view of the entrance/exit to the Pacific Ocean. There was a P&O cruise ship leaving Sydney and we enjoyed watching the Harbour Pilot hopping off the cruise ship onto the pilot boat. Although the final ferry left at 4pm, there was a good bus service back to Sydney (using out Opal Cards). A lovey afternoon in Watson's Bay.

Memorable lunch. When I was visiting Australia I meet with two of my business clients at a restaurant in Watsons Bay. Food was very good, staff was very nice, and the view of the city was magnificent! It was so quiet and nice, and it appeared we had the whole city on the palm of out hands.

Wonderful Watson's Bay!. Cannot fail to impress all seafood lovers - both the take away Doyles on the Pier and the famous Doyles on the Beach - the spacious park with enormous old trees the small beaches all impress. Do be aware weekends the queues to get back on the Ferry are long. The food is exceptional and the setting is a plus to be savored - it is a "must" to experience eating over there. Cannot fail to impress the most fastidious customers. The Ferry ride is very pleasant and you pass the Opera House and the Bridge and so many other icons and stop briefly at Rose Bay and observe the sea Planes well worth doing.

Have lunch there.. Catch the ferry from Sydney and go to pub on the corner as you get off the ferry . Spend the day there . Best food and the view id to die for . Get there early as most people do not leave after lunch , and it will be hard to get a table . We always get there around 10.30am.

Fish & chips on the wharf. We took some overseas visitors for a fish and chip lunch and were luck to find a car park. This place is superb. We were there about 1.30pm so may have missed the main crowd having lunch there and the wait was only a few minutes. The fish and chips were reasonable in price and delicious.
