We also were luck to find a table actually on the wharf so the atmosphere was superb. The whole meal and stroll looking at the many boats etc around there was interesting and safe etc.

Well worth a look. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay and you will be able to enjoy some lovely beaches and splendid sea front walks. The famous Doyle's Fish and Chips shop is just next to the ferry pier and there is a viewing area overlooking the bay for people to eat their take away food. Just around the corner is a sheltered sunny beach with gorgeous sand and warm water to swim in. Give it a try.

Nice place to visit. A wonderful place to visit. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay to see this beautiful bay.. Also go to " The GAP". It's a very nice cliff but they say some people commit suicide here. There are good restaurants too serving seafoods. Nice for lunch

Watson's Bay. A wonderful place to see. It's better to take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay to see excellent sceneries. Don't miss " The GAP". It's a very nice cliff but they say some people commit suicide here. There is also a place for nudist. There are good restaurants too serving seafoods.

Delightful Doyles in Watson's Bay. Wonderful day trip to Watson's Bay, nice easy coastal walk with fab views back to the CBD - just 30 minute ferry ride to get there and well worth the trip. The added bonus being Doyles right on the front of the bay, best fish and chips ever in the most gorgeous of settings. Dont miss this, we enjoyed more than Manley.

ferry trip and walk. A short ferry trip from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay and then a walk through the park to the Gap and then an easy walk along to the signal house and lighthouse.(Next time must remeber to bring hat, got burnt pretty bad). A lovey day out.

Lazy afternoon by the sea. So easy to reach from the city, and yet it has such a relaxed vibe that is perfect for a lazy weekend afternoon. There are plenty of restaurants nearby, although it seems Doyle's seafood restaurant is a firm favourite!

Skinny dipping at Lady Bay. The Watson's Bay is 11 km (7miles) from the Sydney CBD. The.area has a number of stand-out features, among the best-known secrets being Lady Bay, a legal nudist beach. Camp Cove is another well-known beach in the area. The Watson's Bay area also takes in The Gap, a sadly notorious cliff where several people take their own lives every year. Watson's Bay is a pleasant spot, I've visited The Gap several times, though not Lady Bay.

A nice place to visit and have lunch. We were in Sydney for 3 days. On our last day, we took the ferry to Watson Bay after making a lunch reservation at Doyles. I think we took the 10:00 (10:10?) out of Circular Quay. It's about a 1/2 hour trip and well worth the AU$12.40 return if you did nothing more than go and return. Nice views of the Sydney skyline. We got off the ferry and cut through the park up to The Gap. You can walk along the cliff paths either to the left or right. We went right until the path ended and then walked back towards the ferry. We happened upon a great restaurant, Dunbar House, where we stopped and had a well deserved drink on the veranda. We were able to have drinks without reservations because we promised to vacate our table by 12:15 when people with reservations were coming in. By then it was time to head to Doyles for our 12:30 reservation. Had a fabulous meal along the water's edge and then took the ferry back to Sydney.

Ferry trip and a feed. Great viws from the ferry and a delightful place to visit. Cheap but good meals or spend up on a very good meal. Walk to Lady Jane Beach (30 mins), look over the Gap (10 minutes) or take a 30 minute walk along the cliffs to Bondi and then catch a bus back to the city.

A must place to visit. We took a ferry from Circular quay to Watsons Bay. An old fishing village with a great beach and views. Walks along the top of the village were good with stunning views. Have lunch at Doyle's on the Beach. A superb fish restaurant. We booked and had an outside table overlooking the beach and saw a pelican wondering along the beach. Not to be missed

Beautiful Watsons Bay. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. Then walk around the bay's which are just beautiful. A good walking track with wheelchair access. The little homes are original and quaint. Love it.

Only for the locals. If you are looking for a nice beach - you have come to the wrong place. Polluted. Difficult to access. Parking is difficult. The locals seem snooty. Try Manly instead. Some nice shady old trees though.
Lunch at Doyles Watson Bay. We hadn't booked for the main Doyles so had lunch on the harbour front. It was brilliant, would love to go back to the restaurant

Show off the harbour to visitors!. We took three visitors from the US by ferry and had a great few hours. The ferry trip is one of the best parts of the trip and you have stunning views of the harbour. You pass the opera house, the Royal Botanical Gardens, Garden Island, Rose Bay and lots of great little islands on the way.We took a maxi taxi around to Camp Cove another great little spot away from the crowds. At the Gap, we had great views almost to New Zealand and then back down to the Watson's Bay Hotel that is a happening place and finally dinner at Doyle's on the Beach. This was the only disappointment with very poor service.Great place to visit at any time of the day
Beautiful location for a picnic. Spent a lovely day by catching a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay to sit in the sunshine, have lunch at Doyles and watch the world go by.

my favorite place for a day out. Take a sydney ferry to watsons bay and view the entrance to sydney harbour from south head, have lunch at doyles on the beach or the local pub or jetty. If you have time catch a bus down to bondi beach for dinner, only a few k.

You have arrived ….. The park you can enjoy sitting in with a picnic..swim in the ocean lounge on the beach eat at Doyles Restaurant, the local Pub or take away fish and chips from Doyles or just have an ice-cream. the family, kids, oldies everyone will enjoy a day at Watsons Bay I love it there...
Great escape from the crowds. Caught the local bus there and back enjoyed nice lunch and walk up to the lookout and the lovely views
A nice destination on the ferry. This makes a great destination for a ferry trip. Some good restaurants for lunch, an enclosed swimming area without big waves and a nice stroll round
Lovely day out. Enjoyed the day walking around the coast to the lighthouse. Had fish and chips at Doyles. Great views on the walk.
Little village.. Catch the harbour ferry out here and have lunch at the pub on the beach. A nice place to relax with a beer.

Some lovely walking around this Bay. We had a very enjoyable ramble along the coast from this bay. There are some lovely views in both direction from the ferry. We'd been recommended to go there for Doyle's fish and chips though were slightly underwhelmed by those.

Great place to stop off on the cruise to have lunch. We took the cruise out of the harbour with Captain Cook, stopped off on the way at many places, you could hop on and off as many times as you like. Watsons bay is a smart little bay with a lovely little beach and a handful of restaurants where you can have lunch or dinner. Most enjoyable, with fabulous views of the harbour towards the Sydney Harbour bridge. Must do this one!

Nice Place for family outing. Good place to spend with family and friends. The fish & chips is really good. As it's a bit hot for our liking didn't really spend too much time this visit. We visited this place in a cooler season, it was great place to relax and walk around.

Don't Go On Sunday. Come to that don't go anywhere in Sydney on Sunday......Very busy place, but surely not as busy as Manly Beach because at least here you can get on the ferry without waiting for two hours.Very pleasant parkland behind the beach. The beach is not big but you can easily find places to sit if you want.Several places to eat, I recommend the place right by where you come off the ferry from Circular Quay, a nice bit of barra with chips and not overpriced.Do it of the Manly Ferry is way to busy on a Sunday.

Lovely afternoon out plus lunch!. With so much water and harbour views, we booked a cruise (hop on/hop off) and stopped at Watson's Bay for lunch. We had great weather - it was it bit crowded, and you pay for the view, but still very worth it. If you are a planner, book a table so you can get a table right at the water's edge.
Great Palce to visit. Walked around the place, total walk took about 2 hours at a slow place, saw lots of interesting sights. Very nice way to spend a day. Beaches are very clean.

Beautiful Spot. When in Sydney this is a must visit place. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and enjoy the views of this beautiful harbor,when at Watson's Bay have freshly cooked fish and chips and enjoy the view from the park while you eat your lunch . After you have eaten take a walk up the pathway and enjoy the the views of the ocean from The Gap, a beautiful lookout.

Best Scenery. Really enjoyed exploring the bays and coves of the harbour. Old battlements from the war and quiet little bush walks in the vegetated areas with cute little restaurants strategically placed to appertise the walkers.

A special place for fresh fish restaurants. Whether you are a couple or in a family group ; you can enjoy great food here with the emphasis on Fresh fish and especially shell fish.. it is a great place to visit with lively bars and good wine and fun!

Great place for families & friends. We had family from overseas visit recently so we took them on the ferry to Watsons Bay for lunch & a look around. We decided to do it easy so we had takeaway from Doyles on the Wharf & purchased a few beers & a nice bottle of wine at reasonable prices from the bar. It was a very hot day so we chose to sit inside & enjoy the open windows & fans. The food was great & the view of the water was so relaxing.
Ferry crossing for lunch.. Took the ferry across for lunch and found every restaurant very busy but the location, food and atmosphere were great. A charming place to spends few hours.

Great place to visit. Visited Watsons Bay with Canadian friends on a Wednesday and realised it is quiet and peaceful and midweek a terrific time to slow newcomers the sights of SydneyTook them up to The Gap and explained some of its history. Everything at Watsons Bay is well maintained and clean. Good work by local council.Ate our fish and chips looking over the harbour and stopped at Dover Heights on the way to Bondi to look over the harbour

A Special Bay with a Special View and Presence. We went to see this on our last day in Sydney. We only wish we would've found it sooner. We could've spent the day relaxing in the clear water. We enjoyed the area so much.
Watson bay views. Watson bays on clear day provide stunning views of Sydney from afar,had Doyles lunch on the beach with some seagull spectators ,catch ferry from circular quay
Breakfast on the bay. Had a lovely breakfast at Watsons bay. Perfect weather and great company. Very hip down by the Vaucluse Yacht club.

South Head gr8888888. Very special destination for solo traveller, couples, families. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay. Hop off at Watson's Bay. Morning tea followed by walk to the Gap (Parkland and beautiful ocean views), then continue north past nudist beach towards the South Head lighthouse. Great harbour & ocean views. Return for lunch at Doyle's and other restaurants, gelato and late afternoon drinks before returning by ferry to Sydney CBD for dinner.

Loved Watson's Bay. We spent 2 days in Watson's Bay midweek. There is a nice walk to a local lighthouse and a nice beach, but not much else to do. We stayed at the Watson's Bay Hotel, and sampled food at the Beach Club there, along with fish and chips in the park from Doyle's On The Wharf and had a nice sunset dinner at Doyle's On The Beach. I imagine weekends here are much faster paced and lively than midweek!

Take the ferry to a beautiful spot.. From Circular Quay, Watson's Bay is only 20 minutes or so away, but you will wish the trip was longer as the harbor is so beautiful. Once you land, walk through the park and climb the wide stairs to see the amazing view of the waves crashing on the tall sea cliffs.
Top Spot Sydney. A breath of fresh air stunning place we went for swim had fish and chips then fished up at the pub for a couple of drinks caught a ferry back to city

Great Stop for Fish 'n Chips. Face it, anywhere you go in or around the Sydney Harbour, especially on a ferry, is fabulous! We followed the to-do list & had fish 'n chips at the dockside Doyle's. The food was good & the people, boat, & beach watching was terrific! We never left the dock, so I can't comment on the area shops at this stop. I think stopping at these Bays are more about the journey. So many boats & water toys all over the bay. Note to file, however -- we went to Manly a Bay first. There is not a public ferry between Manly & Watsons. We had to pay separately for that ferry, & then rode the public ferry from Watson's to Sydney Harbour via Rose Bay. If I get back here, I'm going to ride in one of those sea planes!
A look out to enjoy. Last time I was there it was way too open and this was the reason why too many suicides took place over here but this time this area is well secured.
Pleasant boat ride from Circular Quay. Visited this place with friends to eat Doyle's famous fish and chips.Walked around the neighborhood afterwards.
Special day out. What a delightful place great photo opportunities great swimming pretty beaches delicious fish and chips nice park
Wonderful to visit. in my case I visited Watson's bay via the ferry and it was a great place to see and some the houses really great and expensive
Beautiful spot. Fabulous place to go to. Doyles Restaurant is a must for a casual lunch, fish and chips in the park next door or a great coffee.

Not to be missed! . I love watsons bay! It's good for bush walking. The scenery is very beautiful and it's near the city to boot! It's a great place for couples, friends and families alike. I highly recommend.
A lovely spot on the harbour. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay. It is a gorgeous spot. Pack a picnic and sit in the park. Relax and enjoy the quite atmosphere.
Doyle's !. A lovely ride on one of the ferrys and fish a chips at the of the trip what else do you need on a beautiful sunny day!

Chilled and relaxed stay. We were visiting our son in Sydney and the booked us in here for our last night as a gift. The location is fantastic on the beach and so relaxed. The rooms are beautifully decorated in a boutique simple style. We met friends and had a lovely dinner on the terrace. breakfast the next morning was continental style but with loads of choice and great fresh coffee. I wish our stay could have been longer! A great hotel in a great location.

A pleasant surprise and another rude surprise !. Went there by ''mistake",unintentional trip from Circular Quay - but wow ! what a gem - such a beautiful place which is so far yet so near to the Sydney CBD (just a 20minutes ferry). We walked about the island, the tracks, the trails...and sat at the point where Governor Arthurt Philip landed in 1788...watch the sails, the boats, the seagull..and a cliff fisherman doing his stuff !! So so beautiful.Having said that, there was a naked man showing off his stuff obliviously at the nude beach , The Lady Bay, at a very 'strategic' point ..:-)...it is not so great for young kids though.Went to Doyle's restaurant for lunch at 230pm...ordered seafood platter that costs $162....somehow contaminated due to the hot wather - we all had a bad stomach upset after. Luckily there is toilet nearby at Circular Quay (on the return trip) and spent 1 hour clearing all up our tummy there ! Written to Doyle, not even a single response so far. They really ought to be more careful with thaw material indeed!!!

Beautiful. Take the early morning Ferry.Beautiful beach on the other side of the harbour giving great views over Sydney.If you want to try the famous fish and chips on the Quay make sure you are early as the waiting time can build up at peak times

Nice spot!. Watsons Bay is a harbourside, eastern suburb of Sydney and it is a little further out from the city center but worth a visit. I would recommend stopping by the Watsons Bay Boutique Hotel great place!

A trip to Watson's Bay by Ferry.. A short ferry ride from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay is a exciting way on a sunny to visit the area. Have lunch, or just a drink at one of the many restaurants, walk to the Gap, or just walk around the back streets of this very old, interesting suburb.

Fabulous. Get a ferry from Circular Quay, get off the ferry at Watsons Bay, have a beautiful lunch at The Pub which is handy to the wharf or at Doyle's restaurant, or even get a takeaway meal from Doyle's and sit in the park Nd watch the beautiful views
great small beach. Like the fewer crowds here but a nice beach town. So more accessible, but fewer restaurants and sites with the smaller area. Nice marina.
The houses are wonderful. The value of walking from Watson's Bay to South Head is to see the houses. I guess East Sydney is where rich cluster

A 'must-do' for visitors to Sydney. Watson's Bay is a short ferry ride from Circular Quay and a terrific journey to take even if you are a Sydney-siders. It's a great example of an inner-city beach and lifestyle. Take a tip from me and when you get off the ferry don't turn left and follow all the tourists. Turn right and walk down past the small yacht club. Then you'll find the absolute best sea pool in Sydney with gun-barrel views down Sydney Harbour and the bridge. A total 'locals secret'. After a swim walk back down the beach for some fish and chips.
Hide away gem. Short ferry ride from Circular Quay. A serene sport to stop have lunch and a drink at Watsons Bay Beach Hotel - great service. Great location
Don't miss. A great place to relax and spent a nice time walking! Nice hike to lighthouse! Great places to dine!

What a great place. Arrived on the bus from the city, returned via the ferry, fab to have both options.
We thought Watsons Bay just stunning, we didn't see it all as we had a lunch reservations at Doyle's but the beaches are gorgeous, it's all very clean and views over to the city amazing.
valentine. went by ferry from daring harbour to Watson's bay had dinner at the famous doyles very lovely area peaceful

Great walks and so beautiful. Short journey from Circular Quays by Fast Cat ferry (17 mins) very scenic. Some lovely beaches, great walks, not too taxing, fabulous fish restaurant close to ferry landing BUT watch out for clouds - tremendous thunder storm whilst we were there. Handy to be near the restaurant then!!

Beautiful Watson's Bay.. I walked around Watson's Bay and onto the Headland. It was a very pleasant walk and the highlights would be the "Heads" and lighthouse. If you love rocks, you pass some huge rocks and lovely beaches. The Watson's Bay pub is a fantastic place to meet friends and enjoy live music, food and wine.

Great views towards Sydney Harbour Bridge. 11 km away from Sydney it's a beautiful harbour with some restaurants and coffee shops and a hotel. Part of the South Head peninsula, it gives wonderful views towards the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Beautiful beaches and among them Lady Bay, a legal nude beach. There are a lot of heritage houses in this region.

Impress any visitor to Sydney. Take them on ferry to Watsons Bay. Take a walk around the old seaman cottages and the renovated houses. The gap has great views back to the city. The entrance to Sydney harbour can be walked to . Finish off with Fish and Chips at the Hotel or Doyles Fish Cafe. What to spend a bit more "Doyles on the Beach."Overseas visitors especially will be excited.

Pleasant place, easily accessed. Watson's Bay is a short (20 minute) and pleasant ferry ride from Circular Quay and is well worth a visit.The ferry ride itself is very pleasant with views of part of Sydney's amazing waterfront. The ferry was busy but efficient and clean.The Bay itself is very beautiful. You arrive to an expanse of greenery fronted by a sandy beach which is clean and good for swimming. The close location to the city centre is indicative of Sydney's claim to fame. I have rarely traveled such a short distance form a large metropolis to arrive at such peaceful tranquility.Doyle's fish and chip shop near the ferry pier sells very good food, although it isn't cheap. I do worry a bit about the large amount of packaging which is probably not recycled. This is also true of the delicious flat white coffees sold all over Sydney in plastic cups. I wish the Aussies were a little more environmentally conscious.Watson's Bay is popular with local Sydney folk and it can get busy. We did have quite a long wait in the hot sun for our return boat but we had a lovely day out.I
Really incredible place to visit for food at sunset.. Despite a tropical storm raging at the time we took the ferry, we had booked a table at Doyles, we had a really lovely evening.
Beautiful bay. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay. Beautiful bay and safe beach for children. Various restaurants for all price ranges and a lovely park

A place not to miss. Family lunch (five couples) for my wife's birthday. Ferried from Circular Quay then two minute walk to Doyle's Restaurant on the beach. If the seafood was any fresher it would be swimming on your plate. Cooked fantastically - the wines were a little expensive but acceptable when you consider the venue outlook straight down the harbour towards the city. Sunny day cool, breeze off the water, good food - what more could you wish for.

Relaxing not exciting. A great place to have fish and chips in the park overlooking the water. Its a great vantage point to see the labour. This place would be better if it was more readily accessible. Parking is a huge problem.

Loved it. We went there after visiting famous beach and I must admit it was much more beautufl. The view was fantastic when we climbed the rocks and were able to see the sea from two side. We had lunch - sea food from fast food small restaurant where ferry stops and it was great!

Relaxing moment and lovely scene. Best wayto Watson Bay is to take train to Wynyard, then walk tp Circular Quay and catch the ferry. Watson Bay has great view to the ocean, nice park, relaxing beach and beautiful iconic lighthouse.

Spectacular Watsons Bay well worth the visit.. Having visited Watson's Bay several times previously, enjoying stopping off for fish and chips, and walking the length of the bay, my husband and I decided to do something different this time. We walked up to the cliffs through the park where a fabulous view of Sydney city can be seen. We continued south until we came to the huge Dunbar anchor where fiifty years ago my photo was taken sitting in the same anchor. We kept walking south until we reached the highest point, with spectacular ocean and cliff views the entire way. Then on the way back we walked downhill through a delightful rainforest, which I had never seen before. When back to the main road, we had a light lunch sitting outside at a small cafe across the road from the bus stops, then decided on the spur of the moment to catch one of the buses back to the city instead of going by boat. We would highly recommend the cliff walk at Watson's Bay- if one is more ambitious, the walk goes up a steeper way to the north side.

Must go when in Sydney. We took the bus here from Bondi and were so pleased that we did. We got there mid to late afternoon and found that the little beach was a delight. The park down to the jetty makes a nice walk and the ‘town’ whilst small is pleasant enough. We took the opportunity to walk up to the Gap Bluff where the views were spectacular both along the cliffs and towards the city skyline. A lovely cocktail as the sun started to go down ended a perfect day. Definitely a ‘must do’.By sharing your experiences, you're helping travellers make better choices and plan their dream trips. Thank you!

What a setting. Watson Bay is an idilic setting for a casual afternoon or evening out. The choice of meals is extensive and a big emphasis on everything fishy. We enjoyed an fabulous evening meal just watching the sun go down over the water and the boats. ah yes.

The fish and chips match the view. Probably the best lunch trip for fish and chips in the world. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and go to Doyle's for the fish and chips. Have them with some of their wonderful Chablis (the wine list is wonderful) and take in the view. The ferry ride back will be good for the digestion.

Nice day outing for locals and tourists. Travelled by ferry from Manly on the Captain Cook ferry - a quick trip across with great views. The ferries to and from are packed as are all the places that are recommended in Watsons Bay. Of course we had Doyle's Fish and Chips for lunch (the queue is very long) and sat in the park. Some of the party took a walk up to the lighthouse while others just stayed at the beach. It was a lovely outing with the family and will be taking more visitors to Sydney.

great location for a sunday stroll. lovely area to spend an afternoon - arrived by ferry - the best way!
suitable for all - good for walking.
Cute bay. Small bay, lots of bars and restaurants around. We stayed a couple of hours but there wasn't lots to do other than sunbathe.

Stunning day trip. We went to watson's bay on a glorious morning. It was a beautiful drive down. Or you can catch the ferry at circular quay. Once you're there you can head to the baths for a swim or walk over to The Gap and start a stunning short walk. Next up was fish and chips at the Doyle's takeaway on the beach. Great thing to do on a nice day in Sydney

What a great day out. We travelled to Watson's Bay on New Years Day 2016 on the ferry. This is such a peaceful place and we had a great time here. A walk around camp cove, the headland and the reserve are a must and we are assured the fish and chips here are the best in NSW.

Great Vibe, great views. just what you would expect from a well established hotel. Broken up into various areas to eat and drink - all areas have a great Vibe. Friendly staff, great place to go with a bunch of friends or just 2 of you. The sights are a plenty.
fab view of the city. watsons bay has a lovely view of the city but the best acclaim is the fish and chips at the restaurant almost on the beach they are fantastic !!

Highly recommended. The view back to the city from 'The Gap', 5 minutes walk from the ferry, is wonderful.The walk out to South Head (circa 2km) is highly recommended too. If you have 3 hours to spare and energy you can walk all the way to Bondi Beach from here, which is excellent.Doyle's restaurant for 'eat in' or 'take out' and eat in the park by the ferry, is world famous (even if the chips can be bettered in many places).The ferry trip out to Watson's Bay is lovelly and this visit is one of our highlights of every Sydney visit.

Excellent weather and seafood at Doyles. The Coranas were excellent as well !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. Excellent weather and seafood at Doyles. The Coranas were excellent as well !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!great Seacat ride over the Harbour as well.
Recommended by my son.. Took the ferry over to Watson's Bay. Walked around the bay to the lighthouse. Quite a walk in the heat. Not sure about Lady Beach though.

very disappointed. I know I may upset a few people here but as a couple we really didn't get the hype. For young families yes as the water is very safe and it has a small little beach but other than that we didn't enjoy and left on the next ferry. We walked to the lighthouse and through the town and this did not take long at all.
Beautiful . Take a ferry ride from Sydney Harbour..about 20 mins to Watson Bay. Take the headland walk for the views. Lovely beach and restaurants... We ate in Dunbar House...excellent.

The spectacular gap views . Taking the ferry to Watsons bay from circular quay is a relaxing boat ride where you enjoy the stops along the way Watsons bay is the last stop. You can have a relaxing lunch at Doyle's fish restaurant famous for his fish or do take away and have a picnic or bring your own lunch near the beach at the ferry wharf or up in the grassy hills which has great children's park viewing the beach area of the bay. After lunch you can take a walk to the gap park by walking straight up the hill past the park & across the road walk the trail along the Watsons bay cliff. The views along the coast are spectacular you can stay there all day watching the cliff top views. There are benches for resting along the way take cold water with you as it is a good walking exercise going up and down cliffs and stairs.

Great views and slightly isolated, so perfect.. Have fish and chips and either stare at the pacific OR back at Port Jackson. This is a great and relatively isolated part of the Sydney City, but lovely and relaxing.

A pretty bay to visit!. The ferry from Circular Quay provides a scenic ride to Watson;s Bay. As it was a hot day, we decided to swim in the newly renovated swimming baths, just a short walk from the ferrry terminal. The baths are enclosed, with pontoons built out over the deeper water, allowing swimmers to jump in, swim laps or just enjoy the water. For those who prefer to wade into the water, there is access to do so, with comfortable seats to sit on and trees providing shade. There are a number of restaurants and cafes. There are a number of other beaches that can also be accessed.

Perfect. We had a wonderful day at Watson's Bay. Large shady trees by the water to sit under and the water is clean and calm. Toilets nearby, coffee, fish and chips and other restaurants are handy too.

The quintessional weekend abode for lovers of any persuasion. Light carry bag in tow we alighted from the Circular Quay ferry at Watson's Bay and hiked the 50 meters to the abode called Boutique. There is a zing to the word boutique, isn't there?Any closer to the water and you'd be wet. Our view is of a beaming couple delighted like kids looking out to the city and glorious harbour Those kids are us, as we hoist the best cocktails saluting each other. The food's decent too with soft shell crab sliders a delight.We didn't stay in the opulent Grand Harbour Suit, complete with marble bathtub, eschewing instead for a Standard Room, perfect for two with a perfectly normal, white enamelled bath . A perfect weekend spot like this you'd be stumped to find.

Beautiful place with nice attractions. Watson bay is very beautiful with nice attractions nearby. This can be easily reached by a ferry from manly or circular quay or by bus.It has many places to eat.The robertson park has a nice view of the city with the bridge and also the Gap park. Few kms away is the hornsby light house. A good and relaxing place to pass time for few hours.
Waterfront dining on the beach.. Can't beat Doyle's at Watson's Bay for relaxed beachside dining. Freshest of seafood, gorgeous environment.

Great distant city view . A short, two stop ferry ride from the city docks. Unless you like loud music & crowded (really crowded) noisy (really noisy) restaurants, avoid going on a beautiful sunny Sunday (and probably Saturday) summer day...tourists and locals are at equal numbers (whew & a lot of both). Don't know for certain but the weekdays have to be better - go then.

Doyles on the wharf..... Ive done the Doyles Restaurant a number of times but if you want a qick no frills great seafood meal you cant beat the Doyles wharf set up. Buy your takeaway and sit out in the covered area with a Fishermans Lager. Take the ferry from Circular Quay $6-$7 to Watsons Bay. Stroll around up on the boardwalks over spaectacular cliffs to build up an appette. Time your lunch early to beat the crowd its popular! And worth it!

Land's End? Well, almost!. Had not been there for some years, and surprised to find that things have improved so dramatically.... While Doyles on the Wharf (sic) is still at the jetty, but refined to a dramatic degree, no more just 'fish-n'chips', the other Watson's Bay pub has got things done to almost fine dining! Fantastic experience! One also noticed that there was on bold display an advertising and phone number from Lifeline (the volunteer group for counselling) - right at the entrance to the Gap, where it is known the ones who believed having reached the end of the road would often take the leap.

Stunning location. We went to Watsons bay to watch the Sydney to Hobart Yacht race, and we weren't disappointed. Its a beautiful little bay with a real community feel...we loved it, nice little coffee shops and friendly people!

Noisy pub!. We decided to take the ferry to Watsons Bay as it was a gloriously sunny afternoon and we wanted fish and chips by the water. When we arrived it was really very busy, which wasn't really a problem however the loud music emanating from the pub really did put a dampener on the outing. At just under $20 the take away fish and chips was what I consider, expensive. We didn't stay long and don't really think it's worth the visit!

An easy ferry trip. If you don't want to take a formal cruise but want to spend some time on the Harbour, a ferry ride is a great way to do this. Opal cards are easy to buy and the staff at Circular Quay are very helpful. Watson's Bay is a short ferry ride from Circular Quay and the trip gives excellent views of the harbour, the Bridge and the Opera House. Once at Watson's Bay there are a number of things to do including dining, walking around the houses and a longer walk to The Gap with views of the ocean. Highly recommended.
Chill. Great vibe sit on the beech and view the amazing Sydney skyline the paradise bar and restaurant is very good great atmosphere great food and drinks very friendly staff
Summer delight. We travelled to Watson's Bay with friends and enjoyed a nice albeit a bit over priced lunch at pub.The walk over to Camp Cove was delightful .
Beautiful View. Very beautiful view of dark blue sea with high tides on the rocks and giving spectacular view. Beach and park on other side is also a nice picnic spot for families.

Ferry to Watson's Bay. A beautiful scenic view of Sydney & surrounds from the water. The Beach Club offers great meals at reasonable prices, with Doyle's usually fully booked. The best Crab Pasta dish I've had in Sydney(go figure... Jamie's Italian didn't measure up). Just get there by 11:30am, to ensure a good table & fast service. Very impressed! Also fabulous fish & chips. A real treat! Stunning walk up the hill along the coastline.
Park, beach, restaurants. On a warm, sunny day, this is a beautiful place to be and to relax with family, friends or going solo. Peaceful and well organised.

I loved it even if it was a cloudy day. This is a really good place to walk. The view are scenic and I loved the roughness. I sat down by the light tower and just enjoyed the wind and the view over the bay.

wonderful views. The views are worth the trip. Best to use public transport as parking is at a premium.
Restaurants were crowded and quite pricey, even the takeaways. Small beach was nice. Smells of boat fuel.
Memory Lane. 2003 after my sons wedding we had excellent meal here. Replay was just as good...very busy and could not find a table in Doyles restaurant but still had great fish n chips on the jetty

Amazing pics!. If you to the Coogee to Bondi coastal walk, then take the bus up to Watson's Bay. The views are amazing to say the least. Some of the best pics I have from my entire trip. You can take the ferry back to CQ or elsewhere.
Nice eateries along the bay. There are many choices of eateries along the bay, all their views are fantastic. The things to do here are limited though, there are mostly walking trails...
Beautiful views. Walked up to the Gap. Nice view. Had lunch at Doyle's which was also very nice but be sure to book as it is very busy. Nice relaxing way to spend an afternoon.

Lovely to visit by ferry. Watson bay is a must for all water bay lovers . Accessible by ferry and bus . Could have swim the park is also lovely many lovely eating shops especially fish and chips shops

A great day out. The hotel (pub) is a landmark. Great place to meet up and have a beer, etc. close to good seafood restaurants Watsons Bay is a fun day out if the weather is fine. Also I would suggest , if you do not mind the expense, you book a ride on a seaplane at nearby Rose Bay which will give you a great view of the Sydney region , particularly the beaches and national parks located around the numerous bays

Some of the best views of this trip!. We were on the hop-on hop-off boat tour and got off at Watson's Bay. The wharf opened into a nice large park and there were shops and cafes around. We opted to walk over to the Gap, the most beautiful thing we saw there.

Doyle's was amazing.. Christmas lunch here for my family as husband was away working over Christmas. Very memorable experience. Awesome location, food, wine. Only bother was the waiter, not once topped up our wine - that would have been a nice touch!

Wats Up!. Lovely Bay where you can take many great walks to the top of the cliff and see a great view of Sydney with the bridge in the distance, Easy to get to by bus from George street and takes about 30 mins. also use Uber which is also a great value way to travel around.

Delightful . Quiet beach safe for children with a few boats bobbing in the water.
Had dinner in Doyles watching the sunset... Perfect escape from hedonistic Sydney
Great Alternative to Bondi and Coogee. Accessible by ferry, Watson's Bay is a great alternative to Coogee and Bondi. Doyle's Fish and Chips provide excellent grub.

Best views of the city?. Apart from visiting the Long established Doyle's here, the views back to the city are stunning.Also take time to go to the ocean side of the Bay where the cliff walk and views across the sea are equally rewarding.If you don't fancy Doyle's, there is the excellent Watsons Bay Boutique Hotel.Or just stay on the ferry and enjoy the ride and the views.

Very Relaxing!. Catch a 15 minute ferry from Circular Quay, or the bus from the city or Bondi Junction or take the car and you won't be disappointed.Take a walk up to The Gap and continue up to South Head lighthouse is recommended. If you prefer to have a more relaxing time, then grap some fish and chips at Doyles and sit in park and enjoy the views. It can get very busy during the summer so beware of the queues for take away.

Watson's a delight!. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay to avoid the queue to Darling Harbour and so glad we opted for this last minute choice! 16mins after you depart the Quay, we arrived at the picturesque Watson's Bay. What is the one thing you must do in Watson's Bay? Grab a bit to eat from Doyle's of course! Dine in or takeaway both options, along with the Watson's Bay Hotel which serves fantastic food. You can't go wrong with the battered fish & chips or their famous Watson's burger. We grabbed takeaway and headed across the road to the park full of families. There is an enclosed park for the kids, toilet facilities, alternate buses back to the city via the eastern suburbs and a little beach to dip the feet in. Great relaxing afternoon had by all.

Beautiful beach and great views from the South Head walkway. We did the walkway from The Gap to South Head. Highly recommended on a clear day as the views are amazing. As its peak time, the crowds were out in full force and the famous fish & chip eating places had long queues of around 45 minutes. We'll go back in the winter-time!

Something for everyone. Catch a bus or a ferry to Watson's Bay for an excellent taste of Sydney. The ferry option gives a bonus trip on the Harbour, sometimes via Rose Bay. Once at Watson's Bay, you can walk around Green Point, Camp Cove and right around South Head. The views are spectacular, and during winter months can sometimes include the sight of whales breaching. Enjoy the panels that explain some of the local history and natural features.It can be very crowded on weekends and public holidays, but you should still be able to find a spot to sit and picnic if you don't want to eat at the many different restaurants and cafes in the area.You can swim at Watson's Bay and Camp Cove, and there are possibilities to hire watercraft and take paddle-boarding lessons.

Lovely beach. I really like the beach, very clean and bright. You can walk around the beach very easy. This beach could access to the beach by public transportation or you can grab the ferry at the wharf. There are many selections of the food providing, restaurant, beach club etc.

Stunning Views & Beautiful Surroundings. Beautiful 20 min ride from Circular Quay. When you arrive, you have your pick of 3 fab eateries in the form of Doyles (takeway and the great On the Beach restaurant), and the Watsons Bay Hotel.There's also a great swimming area and chill out spot, with some beautiful walks.

The gap is a must see. Made a perfect day trip starting at catching a ferry Watson's bay found it very average and was not impressed with the fish n chips( I'm from Melbourne and never enjoyed any fish n chips from nsw as they don't have flake) so after this we weren't very impressed with Watson's bay until we walked to the bus stop to catch a bus to Bondi and just so happens to catch our eye at the gap.. We end up staying an entire 2 hours more due to this attraction and enjoyed it so much as you were one minute seeing nature's best and then you could also look up and see the beautiful Sydney in the background. The gap ended up being well worth the trip and we also loved the bus trip to Bondi and spending the rest of the day in Bondi.. I would recommend this trip!

watsons bay. Preferred this place to Manly. found it very pleasant with small beach, which is fun to paddle in while waiting for the ferry. Nice park nearby and plenty of places to eat. Loved it although it was only a stopping off point!

Exhilarating view! Must do in Sydney. People talk a lot about how wonderful the harbours, beaches, and iconic buildings in Sydney, but this is my favorite spot in Sydney and I am glad that we visited! Be sure to walk the cliff trail (sorry I don't remember its exact name). Worth a visit!

Lovely part of Sydney. Watson's Bay is easily reached by ferry from Circular Quay. The ferry will take about twenty minutes and the coastal route will take you past some of the other lovely bays around Sydney. Watson's bay has a fine sandy beach with bars and restaurants lining the front. These establishments serve excellent food and it seems to be a hang out for some of the Sydney 'smart set'. If you need to walk off a lunch, or some liquid refreshment, there is a path that will lead you up and around the next bay to the lighthouse. Here you will have a smashing view of the mouth of the harbour and out to the sea. The walk can be managed by anyone with even modest fitness/mobility.

Just OK. The well-known fish and chip is just OK. You can get much better seafood somewhere else. There are two fish and chip restaurants. The one farther away from the shore is more expensive but the view is not hood. The one next to the beach is cheaper and the view is better. There are some good places to take picture of sea platforms. It seems they are man-made but indeed are natural.

Beautiful cliffs!. The ferry ride from Darling Harbor to Watson's Bay is an experience in and of itself. You get to see the Sydney Opera House from almost every angle! The fish and chips at Watson's Bay is exceptional and plentiful. You need cash; they don't take credit cards. As you walk up the hill, you get some of the most beautiful cliff views you will ever see!

hidden but not hiding. nice place to catch a different view of Sydney from its ,most East side. Easy access by public transport which I suggest as most of the time there is no way to find free parking. Famous Doyles fish and chips or the first Doyles Restaurant dominate the location. 300m walk to the another Sydney famous visitors place - The Gap!!!

THE BEST OF SYDNEY. Any trip to Sydney should have a ferry ride to beautiful Watson's Bay as the top of the bucket-list. Spending a gentle afternoon watching the harbour from the deservedly famous Watson's Bay pub, slurping a cold bottle of wine, is as close as anyone will get to paradise in this region...and the seafood is legendary!!The first place we head to in Sydney and the last place we want to leave! And the hotel accommodation is great if you request a harbour view and the breakfast is excellent...a great place to stay if you want to get away from the madness of Sydney CBD for a few hours or a couple of days.

Peaceful beach and park walk. A lovely place to spend a lazy afternoon walking along the beach and cliffs. Stopover at Doyles for some seafood and continue walking to Gap Park for endless view of the sea.

Beautiful Watsons Bay Sydney. Watsons Bay is a very beautiful place to visit. You can get a ferry from The Circular Quay to get there.I have been there 4 times and always enjoyed my visit.Beautiful beach ! You get beautiful harbour views from the Wharf.Walk to The Gap and enjoy wonderful harbour views.There are restaurants to eat,but if you are there for a picnicwith packed lunch,there is a bigPark.If you are visiting Sydney,It is a must visit place.

Great Place to Visit. If you are a local Sydney sider or from overseas or just visiting from out of town, Watson Bay is a great place to visit.We came across on the ferry from Circular Quay and then walked up through the pretty Robinson Park to The Gap. This is a great place to take photos and then continue walking up around the cliff walk. The weather was great and the views stunning.We had lunch at the Watson Bay Hotel which was really nice sitting at a table overlooking the harbour. The food was great and the lunch time special of fish and chips was only $15.

Great Half Day for Harbour experience, lunch and cliff walk. Highly recommend taking the Watson's Bay ferry from Circular Quay to get a great harbour experience.Excellent seafood at the various Doyle's restaurants: I find the hotel overpriced but up to you. I recommend the "take-away" on the ferry dock. Order and collect food then take to restaurant part on dock with Harbour views to sit and order a drink at the bar. Also a small beach there to swim or larger ones a short walk away.Walk up hill through park to cliff top walk for great views back to the city over the harbour and of the Harbour entrance.

Fish and chip town. When you get the ferry from circular key it's a lovely trip when you get there it's a Mecca for fish and chips .There is Doyle's were the ferry docks were you can buy take away or if you want to push the boat out there is Doyle's fish Resturant it's not cheap but it is a very good and it has lots of choice .It is advisable to book on the weekends is very popular and it is very very good.

Fast Ferry to Watson's Bay. A large group of us caught the late afternoon ferry to a party at Watson's Bay. This a a perfect way to start the evening and enjoy the views of Sydney Harbour. Choose a place that is out of the way of splashing waves for a more enjoyable ride. Pulling into Watsons Bay with the sun setting behind is a real treat. The bay is full of a wide variety of people relaxing and soaking up the atmosphere.

Get a ferry ride to visit. Watson's Bay is a great place to visit to see the 'other' side of Sydney. So easy to visit by getting a Sydney Ferry from Circular Quay. When you arrive there are so many delicious options to enjoy fresh seafood.
Always a treat!. We go to Watson's for a nice lunch or dinner, or even just a stroll along the beach. Its always a treat for us to just spend a little bit of time together there.
Not a bad place for a day trip. It has a beach to have a bath and you can walk up and visit the high cliffts. There are some bars and shops.

Perfect spot to watch sunset. I came here from Bondi Beach, however, there was no direct bus on the day I came. Do check the bus services. There are plenty of vantage points to look out and take photos towards the ocean and the Sydney city centre. The sunset here is also wonderful. You can take a ferry here but do check the schedule as it does not run till late.
Memory Lane. I spent most of my childhood here now its accessible by Ferry and buses , parking is difficult! Loved the birds especially the cockatoos in the wild!

great view of the city and access to the ocean. nice boatride. nicely set up village with iconic restaurants (doyles etc.), although overpriced for the quality.nice walk up to the cliffs over the ocean.probably the best view of the city, similar to new york from staten island, vancouver from the island or melbourne from williamstown.a worthwhile day out.

A great days outing... Ferries or buses service Watsons Bay, so leave the car at home.There is a great little fish shop close to the ferry stop, food is good and the view is great. There is a park to relax in, or take the Gap Walk, it is worth the effort.. Don't forget the camera, the scenery is fantastic..

Lovely escape from City Life. This little treasure tucked away in Sydney Harbour just minutes by ferry from Circular Quay offers a variety of eateries on different budgets plus the opportunity to do some swimming from the beach.

Fun, busy and stylish. This place is always busy even when it is not hot. Has something for everyone. You can eat at the stylish restaurants or picnic in the park. the Hotel has been done up and is now much trebdier. I notice lots of weddings are having receptions here too. Reall though it is a lovely spot to catch a ferry to. Relax and enjoy the wonderful view of the city and just enjoy the ambience

Perfect setting. There is a fabulous snorkelling beach, which seems very safe. There are great places to eat and plenty to do. One word of warning - don't swim next to the pier. The sea is full of stingrays and a hospital stay is not enjoyable...

Great to revisit. We were spending a few days in Sydney prior to taking a cruise, so were keen to go back to Doyles in Watsons Bay. The trip over from Circular Quay was terrific stopping in at othe scenic bays on the way. After our delicious lunch at the restaurant we stopped in at the pub and viewed the interesting historic photos on display in the bars. Just a walk along the seafront was relaxing whilst enjoying the million dollar vies back to the city. Lovely place to visit over and over again.

Nice part of Sydney. Had lunch (fish & chips) at Doyles on the wharf. Food was very good although a little expensive. On the beach front you have Doyles on the wharf, Doyles Restaurant, and the Watson's Bay Hotel. Up on the hill behind Watsons Bay you have the ocean side & the gap which offers fantastic views of the Pacific Ocean, and in the other direction, views of the Sydney skyline.
this place is a dream. place is priceless. it's uptown area of sydney. i just think i live there. i always went there. and recently went there. just fresh.

Truly Beautiful. This is the beach I prefer. It begins with a great ferry ride from Sydney Harbour, give great photo opportunities and ends up in a calm seaside town, at the back of which is a sensational beach.
Wow wow wow. What can i say but the view is more than spectacular, the walk is wonderful with wonderful views from both sides
lovely!. Love this relaxing area - calm little beach where you can have amazing seafood lunch/dinner! Pairking can some times be a challenge.

Just relax and take in the view. You can't miss the Watson's Bay Hotel to kick back and relax... Or Doyles if you want something a little more upmarket. It's a great spot and a must to visit,and revisit.
Wonderful. You will love it. A must!!! Great views from the park. Walk around, try the fish and chips our grab a sandwich and enjoy the views.

Great ride. Ferry to Watson's Bay is fun...can be hot and lines can pile up in hot sun for return trip. Never fear. There is a city bus almost at the Gap for a ride back to Sydney via Bondi Beach! TheGap has great views for photographers.

Harbor Town. After our Coogee Beach to Bondi walk, we took a bus to Watson's Bay. It looked like a nice little town to spend the day. We had some fish n chips and took the ferry back to Circular Quay.

Surprise at Watson Bay. Arrived at Watson Bay by bus. Walked up high side and found path along cliff top overlooking ocean. Lovely views, even back over Harbour to 'The Bridge' and Opera House. Found original anchor on display from first English sailing ship. Walked down towards harbour beach over lawns to ferry terminal and had a coffee whilst waiting for ferry to take us back to Circular Quay. Very pretty area and clean.

Amazing!!. Takes a while to drive or bus out to Watson's Bay. A water taxi is a brilliant luxury. Once you get there, you will find a great pub, beautiful food and a lovely beach to walk along and dream of what life would be like if you lived in one of the waterfront homes.
If you go for one day to Sydney, you MUST go there with the ferry. Beautiful trip by ferry. Once there walk to the lighthouse, a 20 minute walk to the gate of the Sydney Bay
A cool place to be on a very hot day!. I visited here when the temperature in Sydney spiked to 43 degrees on day. It is primarily a beach area with some nice walks in the area
Highlight of our trip. We took the ferry over, saw the Opera House and Bridge from thewater, then went on to Doyle's Restaurant, fantastic seafood.

Paradise in disguise. A short ferry trip away from the Sydney harbour is this small yet bustling place for a day trip. Nice beach with ample restaurants for a drink and a bite make this a great picnic spot. Family vacations are quite popular and there is easy access from the Sydney harbour to this place. There was a cedar festival during my visit which added to the life and energy at this place.

A lovely part of Sydney Harbour. A great place to visit, whether you are stepping off a ferry from Circular Quay, a water taxi ....can be expensive....or you have driven here.Take a picnic or enjoy the food at one of the restaurants located here, including the famousDoyles hotel or Restaurant or Doyles on the wharf. The beach here is only small , you can swim here, but I would not go here just to swim as boats often come in here to access the restaurants.boats often
Love this spot. It's quite a drive from the city but you can take a ferry and it's lovely to wander around the foreshore and have food and drinks.

Lunch on the bay. Just a great place to spend the day away from the hustle of downtown sydney. Jump on a ferry from circular quay and then relax and enjoy decent food and chilled out views from the bay. Some nice strolls too

TAke a ferry here!!. A love the ferry trip over and when you land there are a few eating options available though a little pricey. Then a walk past some beaches and past a nudist beach there is a walking trail to a light house and excellent views of Sydney, worth going too!!
Excellent views. Come here at sunset on a weekday when it's not too busy and sit at the pub/bar right on the water. Spectacular views of the city skyline and yachts. Very relaxing place to visit.
Great views. Great place to go for a Sunday, enjoy some fish and chips, a sun bake and a few drinks. Beautiful suburb of Sydney.

A nice quiet place to visit if you have extra time. I suggest visiting Watson's Bay after you visit Manly and Bondi. It is much lower key, quiet, not much to do other than walk, sit and have wine and watch the boats. If you walk a few blocks, you can get to look over open ocean or the opening into the harbour. There are a few shops not worth visiting. There is a small paved path of "bush". Bring fly spray. Watch your food, the sea gulls are vicious and fast
One of Sydney's nicest spots. A wonderful place. Great views, wonderful food and just the place to relax and enjoy the wonderful views back to Sydney.
Beautiful little secret. Felt like a secret discovery but its a tourist spot! Beautiful small beach . Clean and safe.Lovely little fishing village. Loved it here

Great Day Out. Watson's Bay, Sydney Harbour, makes a great spot for a relaxing day by the water. We rode on ferry. from Circular Quay and enjoyed the views. At Watson's Bay we walked up to the Gap for some photographs of the coastline before lunch at the famous Doyle's Restaurant. Some of the activities available include paddle boarding and safe swimming area.

Lovely. Catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. Lovely little town, grab a bite to eat, relax on the beaches or sit in the park and watch the world go by! Great place to wander around beautiful coastal views.

Another fabulous day out. We took the catarmaran ferry to Watson's Bay and then did the walk through Shark Bay to Rose Bay. The views of the city were stunning. I would love to be there on New Years Eve as to see the fireworks from there would be amazing. The beaches were stunning. I would do this walk again and again.

Nature treat. Took the ferry, quay 4 from Circular Quay, and returned on the 380 bus to see Bondi Beach. Great fish and chips, lovely walk to the left to see the North and South cliff Heads which make the entrance to Sydney Harbour. Some good bird life, clean beaches, beautiful houses and gardens. Generally peaceful and nice to maintain that peace ourselves. Hope the Save Watson Bay campaign is successful, surely Sydney has enough lively places, let's keep the peaceful ones peaceful.
Save Watsons Bay. Beautiful&cozy beach. Development project is underway so nobody is sure of future... Really recommend trail course and gap park toward Tasman sea.

quite peaceful scenic. Went to watsons bay with my family early morning and must say very quite isolated beautful place. Just opposite the wharf , there is a kids playarea in the park and my 3 yr old made the most of it.............. my and wife sat near the harbour and were admiring a very small quite scenic place .....must say its not commercialized and thats what is keeping its prestige intact......must do for all tourists and good tranposrt mode is sydney ferries.....

tooo gud, God's creation & nature resting place. Its awesome place, quite, peaceful.Amazing view, if u r photographer, a great place to take pics with all zoom features of your camera. We went there by ferry from circular quay, its 30 minutes ferry & view from ferry is worth capturing.Fish @ watson bay is worth trying.We spent 5 hours at the place.Took coastal walk , climbed up the cliff & went to the national park.

Great location & even better food. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay & arrive at Watson's Bay for a great seafood lunch whether it's at the arrival wharf or at the hotel close by. You can BYO or buy onsite but the view is sensational.
Absolutely amazing! . I went to Watson's Bay for a school excursion and it was a really fun day! The food is a little bit expensive so its much cheaper if you bring your own food from home!!
Very scenic. A must do is Doyles fish and chips on the wharf. The walk to The Gap is a must do also. Beautiful area.

Great day out. We arrived by bus and did the small coastal walk, admiring the views, the fish n chips provided a nice lunch, but we did need cash for payment , a little inconvenient and only one wine with lunch. We ferried home , a great inclusion on our long weekend in Sydney .

beautiful bay to escapr the city. A lovely ferry trip from Circular Quay. Walk up the hill through the park, cross the road, up the steps and the views are amazing over the Pacific. Walk left fro views of the Heads.

Beautiful city views at sunset. The best place to take in sunset over the city with jaw dropping views and perfect photo opportunities! A historic seafood (fish and fries) is located here and a nice picnic area to relax and take in the view. Walk up the top for an elevated lookout (cross the road and turn left along a newly updated path) Highly recommend this place to visit in Sydney!

Other than the park, not much to see or do. Almost no businesses near the beach. Very small town a few blocks away with few shops. The national park looked quite nice, but we hadn't enough time to explore it. We thought that other beaches (Manly, Bondi, Coogee) were better.

A nice beach to spend the day. One of the happening place in Sydney where you can spend the day doing some beach activities or just laze around or grab a drink or a coffee in one of the cafe or bar..you can enjoy more if you are in a group

a journey but worth it!. Took public transportation from downtown and after a few bus transfers and a lot of walking, the view made everything worth it. Be sure to walk to the top viewing area for great views!

Great Starting Point. We love Watson's bay. You can get there easily by bus of ferry. The eating there is somewhat touristy and I don't recommend it, but this is a great place to start a walk, whether a short one up to the lighthouse at the Gap or a long one all the way to Bondi. We never tire of the cliffs, the view and the ocean.
Not much to do here. What you see from the ferry is about all there is to do here. Two restaurants on the beach and a walk to the lighthouse .

Must visit by ferry. Everything about this trip is beautiful. The harbour going by ferry. The walk along the beach and through the streets. The walk up to the lighthouse and the view of where Sydney harbour meets the Tasman sea.
The best fish and chips!. Didn't see this in daytime, as we went across for fish and chips at Doyles. do it - the food is excellent!

A great palce to have a stroll and a very special meal. A walk around the headland is beautiful with great views and some history showing the defences set up during the 2nd world war to defend against attack from the Japanese
breathtaking view. one of the most amazing views one can have. take a ferry from Sydney harbour and its the 3rd or 4th destination.

Watson Bay. We went across the harbour to Watson Bay by ferry - lots to see on the way with plenty of sailing boats.
There are a number of cafes and resturants.

Gorgeous cliffs!. Beautiful cliffs, almost like The Great Ocean Road in Melbourne , but a smaller scale. Intersting fact about it was a chosen place for suicidal persons! Too beautiful to be depressed!

Stunning city views. Eating @ Doyle's is a must (restaurant or Pier cafe options)Beautiful park with stunning views from the top of the hill. Caught the bus from Bondi & then ferry back to Circular Quay

Cider Festival. Somebody gave Watsons Bay a 1? Well, no, not Watsons Bay itself but the Cider Festival that's run here in October.Just came back from it and it's a shocker. $25 each if you pay in advance on line or $35 if you roll up on the day. For that you get a card with the names of around a dozen companies and it gets you a 50ml cup of each cider from each stall. That's an amount I would expect if I was sampling wine, not cider.If you're lucky, they may have a couple of varieties and if you're lucky you may get to sample more than one. Otherwise what you paid will get you between one and two schooners worth of cider. We were there about midday and it was relatively easy to have a sample. But within an hour, the crowds were such that it was close to a 10 minute wait for your small helping.After trying about 7 or 8 of the companies who were there, the wait became intolerable and we left. There was then a queue of people about 50m long waiting to get their cards. Little did they know how long they'd have to wait for a drink.He's some tips to whoever is running it. Offer tokens so that you can try a cider you like more than once. Get the crowds away from the stalls as soon as they've had their sample. Spread the stalls out so that there's some room between them. Make it compulsory that each stall has enough staff to serve the cider. There were 5 of us who went (and we went last year as well). There's five who won't be going next year. And I'd bet that none of those queuing to get in will be back either.
Lovely day trip. Cute little bay and excellent food at Watson's Bay Hotel! Highly recommended for a day trip from Sydney
What a view from Sydney. Just incredible view of Sydney. You can do both, Watson's Bay and Bondi beach. So you do have wonderful views from Sydney and from the ocean

Went here in February, and again this October; it never grows old.. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay and back. I suggest you do the slow ferry to Manly Beach before you do this faster ferry to Watsons Bay, or you'll be spoiled for speed:) There are scheduled stops at Garden island, Darling Point, Double Bay & Rose Bay. Taking the bus from Bondi Junction isn't half as fun as the ferry to Watsons Bay. Walking from Watsons Bay wharf, a few cuckatoos peck around the park on your way to The Gap. The fresh water drinking station is at the park's entrance, and the public restrooms are midway to your left by the shelter. It's a 10-minute walk uphill but The Gap provides magnificent views of the crashing waters. For a nature lover on a gorgeous day, it's stunning.

Beautiful little nook at the end of the city. This was a beautiful little bay at the end of the city. We traveled here by bus after a trip to Bondi and then took the ferry from Watson's Bay back to Circular Quay (where the Opera House is) which I would definitely recommend. There is a restaurant there to eat at as well at the Bay.
Lovely little beach - great fish and chips! . Lovely little beach with great views of Sydney in the distance. Also had a fish & chip shop with great views and tasty chips.

A lovely quiet excursion. Easily accessible from the Sydney Ferry system and some of the best seafood you will ever eat! We were enjoying a day on the water riding the ferries and got off to spend some time on Watson Island. There is a lovely little community library and plenty of beachside restaurants to enjoy a cuppa and watch the wave come in.

Great Ferry Ride and There’s Doyles. Take the Sydney transit ferry from Circular Quay using your Opal Card (of course). The ferry ride alone is worth the trip, great photos of the Bridge and Opera House from the ferry. Upon arrival look at the map at the end of the pier and follow the directions for a short walk to the Light House, around the point and past a nude beach (if that’s your thing). There is some sort of a military installation at the top of the point but it’s still a very scenic walk and a great way to work up an appetite for seafood at Doyles.

Yeah no. I am struggling because I wanted to put a higher rating despite the lows at that location. Yes, it is nice, very nice....views. Either going up the hill to see the endless ocean and the cliffs or when you come back to the ferry where you can catch a beautiful skyline of the city. Apart from that, it is really 50/50. It has a big park without a lot of facilities. To buy some snacks or drinks/water, you do not have many stalls available. Restaurant are nice, well damn expensive and they do not provide the view. And as always, which is getting on my nerves in Oz, the so called Beach club is NOT on the beach and is a place for packing people. Take the ferry from Circular Quay, the promenade is awesome and you can check out other places to go after.

Glorious views and great food. A relaxing and lovely day. Allow enough time to walk through the trails of South Head and catch views of the Ocean and Harbour. And, when you've had enough, excellent food (we ate at Doyle's) and lively scene.

Among the best in Sydney. It was a typo earlier when the rating showed only 1 star. In fact, this has been my most favourable beach in Sydney, above Bondi which has the coastal walk to champion the already very beautiful beach that is so famous in the world. Watson's Bay is a gem. Being more quiet than Bondi, many will love it more as its always peaceful mood is very appealing.

The wonderful self tour you can enjoy with your family on a ferry to Watsons Bay - Picnic and harbour paradise!!. Take your picnic rug, a nice little tablecloth and a picnic basket full of delicious goodies and a nice bottle of wine to enjoy overlooking the most beautiful harbour in the world. Go to the ferry terminus at Circular Quay and to the quay from where the Watsons Bay ferry leaves. Buy your family return tickets to enable you to enjoy what I call a "self tour" i.e. a tour which you organise for yourself and your family and you do not have to include a middle man to enjoy it. Enjoy the fabulous views along the harbour until you get to Watsons Bay. Alight from the ferry and find a spot. No table free, no matter, you have your picnic rug!!! You have a bonus situation where you can add to your fabulous spread by buying fresh seafood from the canteen on the wharf. Watch your children as they frolic in the lovely beach with no big waves but just sparkling water!!At around 4pm catch the ferry back to Circular Quay and head on home with a tired but happy family!!!

Amazing view. We were lucky enough to visits when it was possible to see several whales. However it would have been worth the visit to see the rock formation at the gap. There are a couple of short walks available. It is possible to go by ferry from circular quay or by bus from Bondi.
A unique part of Sydney.. Go by ferry from Circular Quay travelling across the harbour to Watsons Bay. Have lunch at one ot the seafood restaurants. A must for any traveller to Sydney.
Great view!. An old friend took us there for lunch. Great view of the city center. You'll get a feel of what a Sydney neighborhood where the locals live.

Doyles. Doyle's seafood restaurant is a must. The position is fabulous - and so is the food. If you get a day travel ticket you can go by ferry and catch the bus back to the city, seeing all the beautiful houses of the Eastern Suburbs.

Relaxed and family one day visit!. Just a small ride in your car or 15 mins ferry from Circular Quay will take you to this picnic spot. Do not expect to enjoy kind of beach feel, there is no water playing thing here. However, there are amazing walk ways just parallel to the cliff facing the endless ocean. The cliff view was really best in my life; photographers’ paradise. Nice bar to drink bear by the bay. Nice large green park just beside bay with children play yard. Overall a very good family destination within the city.
Endless beauty.. Great spot to visit all year around. Great view from South Head overlooking North Head and parts of Manly. I would love to go back soon.

Manly Beach > Watson Bay. Well, if you have been to Manly beach, I suggest that you skip Watson Bay if your schedule is tight. What I like about Watson Bay:1. Hike to the lighthouse: you get wonderful views of Manly Beach. It is also a short hike 2. Watson Bay hotel fish and chips. Light and crispy. Hope to try Doyle the next time.3. Satisfy my curiosity of a nude beach. But, because of the cold weather, there is only 1 guy who looks like santa tanning nude at the beach. Not a nice scene but interesting. Why average then?1. The gap is not as scenic as compared to the coastal view at Congee Beach to Bondi Beach. It is of smaller scale2. 20mins bus ride from Bondi. Too long a distance to walk to Watson.3. Ferry ends service before evening during winter.

Cannot be miss this place. Arriving this area when we going to have late lunch at Doyles on the beach. Watson bay got a hill (?) where you can walk to the top of the hill. and can see the wave crash to the rocks.

Not too crowd and very nice beachside. it's really nice place in Sydney. I've been to Coogee and Bondi. Watson's Bay is my top one landscape about beachside in Sydney. I went there every month. You can swim, lie on the beach, read a book under the tree, take a photo, also have dinner or lunch here. Of course there are lots of Bar nearby. The best time to visit is day time. Transports ferry are available every day but after 6pm. Not too far from the city. Have a day there and enjoy your sunshine!
Die hard romantics. This is definitely one for the romantics, with Doyles famous fish restaurant on shoreline love will be in the air. Wonderful place.
great view. We had a lovely walk there. the view is fantastic and it is really calm. We took the ferry and could relax

Beautiful Ocean View. It was a beautiful place, being able to look out into the distant ocean and also marvel at the magnificent rocks and lovely place. A good place also to view the Sydney city centre in the distance. Suggest to go in the evenings on a clear day where the water appears to be sparkling and it is a great sight to take pictures. I may even say that this place is more beautiful than Manly Beach; at least, this place is not as crowded as the more popular seaside areas.
So pretty!. We popped out here via ferry and enjoyed Doyle's fish' n' chips on the beachfront. It was such a pretty spot-spectacular view back to the city.
Nice place. I took a bus from CBD and stopped at Watson's Bay. Nice view and good for a walk. You can get good gelato as well.
Hop on a ferry. Catch a ferry and Head to Watson's Bay have fish and chips at the wharf or a meal at the pub and don't forget to get your feet wet

Great lunch location.. Travelling by ferry to Watson's Bay is a prelude to a very scenic location followed by a fantastic lunch at Doyle's Restaurant.
Should not be missed!
perfect. Always nice at Watson's Bay. The crowds are less and the walk to attractions are interesting. Doyle's is worth lunch

What Wat. Watsons bay is one of the most scenic places in Sydney. Take a walk around the bar area which is a peninsula which on one sides faces the city and the other side out to sea.
Definitely a photographers paradise.

Doyles Fish Cafe... Visited Doyles some time ago for lunch...found prices over inflated for what you get....no better than the fish take out next door only difference is the price....if money is no object for you then feel free... Was so disappointed as I was looking forward to reliving my easy Sunday lunches in this idyllic setting from the 70's but alas the food let the dream down....
Doyles Fishermans Wharf. The short 20 mins ferry ride is worth it if you have time to spare. Dine in at Doyles for the fish and chips at $13.80.

Wonderful views. Take one of the ferries to this spot and choose a restaurant to enjoy. There are long distance views of Sydney from many locations. It isn't cheap but a relaxing place to spend an afternoon.

Watsons Wonderful. Wonderful spot to enjoy good seafood at reasonable price, collect from local kiosk and find a spot on the beach (benches available) to munch on lunch, feed the gulls, or take in the sun

Doyles Fish Cafe. Watsons Bay is idyllic,& easily accessible via the Ferry from Darling Harbor. A nice leisurely cruise. Watsons Bay is famous for 'Doyles's' fish restaurant, which features sit down or takeaway meals. Doyle's has been there forever & features great fresh fish cooked to your preference/taste.
Watson's Bay. Watson's Bay beach was very small, but there was a good walk from there to the end of the cove, with various quaint beaches along the way, including Lady Bay Beach

Get to by ferry, leave by bus. A great round trip if you're exploring Sydney for the first time (or indulging yourself as I was). Take the ferry from Circular Quay and hop off at Watson's Bay. Treat yourself to an over-priced lunch or a drink in the iconic surroundings of the Watson's Bay pub. Once you've done that, grab a bus back to the city and gawk at all the houses and money-laden places on the way. A great way to spend a few hours.

worth a quick stop to have fish n chips. this beach has amazing view with line of yachts on the sea. there are several cafe that serve fresh seafood for lunch and dinner. you can explore this area by crossing the road to sydney harbour national park for a breathtaking view of the sea and the unique formation of the cliffs. there is also a park called robertson park nearby to setup a picnic with your loved one. from here you can view sydney city (the tower and skyscrapers).
Amazing views. The local eateries were very expensive but the food which is mostly seafood based is fresh.The outlook is quite spectacular

Take the ferry and have a terrific lunch or a wonderful gelati. I went on the ferry on a beautiful winter day and met family members who have three young daughters aged 2- 6 years old at the open garden of the hotel opposite the wharf for a relaxed and casual lunch followed by play on the beach and among tree roots a short walk to a superb gelati shop and of course lots of fun. There is a playground but it was not of interest to the girls. I know if some of the young boys in the family had been there it would have been one of the exciting aspects of the day. Some families bought take away fish and chips and not doubt some went more up market to dine at Doyles. There was a massive queue for the return ferry so I took the bus on a long meander back to the city. Highly recommended.

The GAP at Watson's Bay Day trip.. Recently visited "The GAP" watson's bay in sydney. One can catch the Watson's Bay wharf from the circular Quay wharf terminal. It about 20min in ferry to reach watson's bay Gap.It one of the most scenic place in sydney, as you can get the Sydney city view from the opposite end at watson's bay. The Gap is an ocean cliff on the South Head peninsula in eastern Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. The area, which faces the Tasman Sea, is located in the eastern suburb of Watsons Bay.In 1857 the sailing ship Dunbar carrying 63 passengers and 59 crew struck the rocky cliff at the foot of The Gap.The Dunbar's anchor was recovered more than fifty years later and placed on the cliffs at Watsons Bay with a memorial tablet.The place has exhilirating views of sydney and has a nice cliff walk to enjoy. Good family fun with children.
Iconic Beach in Sydney. Watsons Bay is a harbourside, eastern suburb of Sydney, in the state of New South Wales, Australia. Watsons Bay is located 11 km north-east of the Sydney CBD.

nice place for sunset. Amazing place for sunset. The view is stunning during the day and in the evening. The walk to the Honrby lighthouse is nice and you have good views towards Manly and North Head. Camp Cove is a nice little beach for a swim.

Beautiful views, walks and then finish at Doyles for lunch.. Watsons Bay is a beautiful place where you can excellent views and walks. I did just that, and then by chance walked into Doyle's Restaurant and enjoyed a lovely sea food platter.
Well worth a fish and chips meal by the sea. Lots of seafood restaurants at varies prices, lovely beach with clear water and a wonderful view point.

Surprising views. We took the ferry from Sydney Harbor to Watson's Bay for sunset, not realizing we were on the last ferry! It ended up be a blessing in disguise as we made our way to the bus stop and discovered a beautiful lookout point just behind the stop. We took the stairs to the very top and wow, what a view!
Afternoon drinks in Watsons Bay. I love this place!!! Beautiful bay and great hotel/bar on the bay. Definitely worth going on a sunny Saturday afternoon for drinks

Sunday afternoon trip to relax and walk for a bit. A nice walk around the bay gives you a beautiful view of the Sydney skyline. Walking a bit further you find steep cliffs and more bays where you also have the possibility to go for a swim or just enjoy the sea.
