Gorgeous afternoon. went here at the end of our 2 year stay in sydney. Wonderful walks up to the lighthouse and a nice late lunch of fish and chips on the wharf. Be warned tat if you want to take your own car you may have to wait a lifetime for a parking space.

A great place to visit on a sunny day. You can catch an enjoyable ferry ride from Circular Quay Sydney to Watson's Bay. The hotel at Watsons Bay is very popular on the weekends, lovely fish and chips. Just a short walk will take you to The Gap where there are fine views of the ocean. A good place to watch the Sydney to Hobart Yacht race. If you visit by car you can then head off to Bondi Beach and all the southern beaches which are close to the city of Sydney.

Hidden gem not all the masses of holiday makers think about. Untouched location specially Doyles and ancient fig trees , bit of a drive from Bondi enough to keep the insane masses away,but still always busy , soon find a free park though . Take away fish and chips has gone up in last few years, but still nice and casual , local hotel has good views , ferry on hand to city

Good option for entertaining visitors to Sydney. I was surprised by how easy it was to find free, all day parking near the wharf. This was a great spot to check out some views and then take an interstate visitor across to the city by ferry. If the weather is good this is an ideal, inexpensive way to entertain out of town visitors.

Great half day trip.. Great place for a morning or afternoon! Catch the ferry across from Circular Quay, the are some nice coastal walks. I would recommend Doyle's for fish and chips, and trying stand up paddle boarding.
Lunch. About a $50 taxi ride on a busy Saturday lunch time but it was worth it. The views are spectacular, and we enjoyed lunch in the sunshine at the famous Doyle's seafood restaurant.
Watson's Bay. I will never forget the two pelicans that acted as though the wanted to come home with us. Beautiful place! Want to go back.
Stunning Beach. What a delightful part of the Sydney area, lovely restaurants to eat at and a beautiful view and just 30 mins in the ferry from the CBD of Sydney
Beautiful view coming in from ferry. Stopped here for lunch off the ferry. Lunch was good and prices were reasonable. Beautiful view coming in from the ferry.
Amazing. Great place, close to the city, easy to get there (by ferry from circular Quay). Amazing view of the cliffs. Great to spend a morning or afternoon with free cost.

Nice to visit in the late afternoon.. You can drive here, arrive by bus or take a nice Ferry ride across the harbour from Circular Quay. The famous Gap on Sydney's South Head is one of the most famous attractions at Watson's Bay. The Gap has a viewing area that offers stunning views and opportunities to take nice photos. Take the scenic walk and follow the path and see the Hornby Lighthouse. After exploring the area relax at Doyle's or one of the other establishments near the water and enjoy some seafood with a beer or wine.

Great for dates. Relaxing weekend, we drove to Watson's Bay on a sunny beautiful day, did a short hike to the ligthouse and emjoy the crashing waves, perfect for relaxation and just to unwind. Couple of good restaurants there too, perfect for dates.

Lovely Scenic Walk. Took a sudden decision to get the ferry from Central Quay to Watson's Bay and I was glad I did. It has a lovely little beach with some nice restaurants but mostly I enjoyed the scenic walk. I decided to get a bus back to the city for a change of scene and was in awe of all the beautiful houses, each one more stunning than the next. Lucky people living there!

Fish & chips. This is the place to go for a quick escape from the city to a beautiful small beach that seems to be hours away. Take the walk to South Point to see the lighthouse and don't forget the Fish&chips at Doyles!

Must See. Watson's Bay is a uniquely beautiful part of Eastern Sydney. Delicious cafes' and Fish and Chips shops. Go for a little stroll around the corner and discover the hidden beach with a great harbour view as the main beach is not good for swimming.

Visit the Multi millionaire area !. Watson Bay is one of my flavour spot ! It take 20 minutes to drive car from city . I normally drove my car to King 's Cross and then to Double Bay for coffee . And then drive through Rose Bay and then go through Watson Bay . After I arrived the Watson Bay , I normally to go to the seafood restaurant there for lunch or dinner . There are few seafood restaurant . They cater very good food. The fish is very fresh ! Many tourist are visit there daily . I enjoyed the environment there ! This area is very high class area . Most of the Multi Millionaire are living there ! Some of the housing are so nice to be mention !
Love it here. A beautiful place with stunning views of Sydney city centre. It is a place of tranquility within the city. We loved walking along the shore and having chips from Doyles.
Great place for visitors to Sydney. The views and food at the Watson's Bay Hotel are fantastic. A great place to take a visitor to Sydney.
Nice suburb.. Nice place for lunch. Catch the ferry from the city only takes 40 minutes - nice parks, walk up to the gap and enjoy a fish lunch. Nice atmosphere like a fishing village.

Beautiful spot - easily reached by ferry. We travelled via Sydney Ferries from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay on a magical late winter's day with sunshine and clear blue skies. Many other people had the same idea and so it was quite busy at the point of disembarkation. The venerable Doyle's was bustling, and we were unable to get a table for food or drinks at any of the eateries so we settled for a walk up to the Gap lookout and then around the longer walk back to the return ferry. It is a beautiful spot, with wonderful views of the city (including the bridge) from the lookout. Lovely parks and a large childrens' playground too if you need a family day out.
Overcrowded. Watkins Bay has lost its soul :( used to frequent the pub here years ago when there was grass to sit on. Now the pub is all concrete and very over crowded as is the whole bay.

Beautiful and peaceful. If you get the opportunity do visit Watson's Bay, a contrast to the hustle and bustle of central Sydney with beautiful views and a calm and peaceful atmosphere a place not to miss.
Doyle's is still there!. Fish and chips at Doyle's. Walk they the town and see the old heritage homes. See the very low key marker to James Cook.

Watson's Bay and Doyle's meant for each other.. Took the boat to Watson's Bay for a fish and chips lunch at Doyle's on the Beach. It doesn't get any better than this. Beautiful bay and view of Sydney. Do it !

beautiful view. i got there by bus. it's very convenient because you can go from one point to another and take another bus to the train station. Watson's Bay located at the edge of the sea shore, and i saw the whole view of the ocean. it was very beautiful and definitely worth the visit.

BEAUTIFUL AREA. Well thought out place, with its majestic ocean views, nature's walk, beautiful houses, scrumptious restaurants and outdoor/ sports facilities, all in one place? that equates to a thumbs up place well worth a visit!

Most Beautiful view, but not more.. For tourists and first time comers to the city, it highly recommended, it is one of the only places in town where you can see the harbour and the ocean. The restaurant is really good in terms of vibes and quality of food. But there isn't much to do other than scenery.

Stop off at Doyles for fish and chips. We caught the boat from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. Fast boat great views. We called in at Dolyles for fish and chips. Highly recommended. Good fair price. Doyles is situated at the end of the pier.

Bay Watch. Watsons Bay is a Sydney landmark and the ferry ride from Circular Quay gives you a brief look at all the bays and waterfront that is the home to the rich and famous. On arrival at the bay there are a few dining options but the experience is a little pricey and doesn't offer real value for money. take a stroll along the waterfront and then through the park up to the Gap return to the city or circular key via bus and get off for lunch or an Ice Cream and walk along the famous Bondi Beach. the round trip is regularly serviced by ferry and bus and is a great dway to see some of our prestigious harbor and beaches.

Tranquil seaside neighborhood with nice restaurants by the sea.. We had four days in Sydney. On the third day, we got a Taronga zoo and hop on and off ferry combo. Watson's bay was then place we visited after zoo. This is a very nice place to have lunch or walk around for an hour. No shops or downtown, just a nice beach, a park and restaurants by the sea.

Worth the ferry ride - amazing views.... Stunning! Go on a sunny day and walk around to see some of the gorgeous homes there including Dunbar House on the park when you arrive at the Bay by ferry. Doyles fish and chips on the jetty is nothing special but a great place to sit to take in the amazing views around you. Worth a ferry ride to go and see this beautiful part of Sydney.
Shouldn't miss. If you don't know what to do with your Sunday, come down to Watson Bay. You can plan your own barbeque's here, or try Fish and Chips at Doyle's or just enjoy a cliff walk.

Nice area with a great view. Took the bus from Circular Quay to Bondi and then onto Watson's Bay. There were some good walks with fantastic views. Doyle's is the place to eat here if you love your seafood. Then catch the ferry back to Circular Quay for a great round trip.

Watson's Bay is like heaven on earth. easy reach by ferry. Turquoise blue water with seagull, pelicans, dophines...A park right by the beach .Excellent place for family with small kids to spend a afternoon.On the other side face the Ocean can do whale watching.

Food, drink and seagulls.. Get some fish and chips and head down to the waters edge. Watch a boat race on the harbour and get friendly with the seagulls. There is a fine pub for a drink or meal. Sydney's most famous suicide spot is a stroll away- the infamous 'The Gap' is worth a visit too.

Its more about the journey, but still.... Jump on a ferry out to Watsons Bay, grab some take away Fish & Chips and enjoy them in the park or on the beach, your choice. The journey to Watsons Bay is the where the real joy is, but the serenity of Watsons Bay beach is nice, just more often than not too crowded.

beautiful spot, but dont go on a weekend!. So different i. The week and at the weekend. tranquil place with great Sydney views and you can get there by ferry from the city. But on the weekend youll be sharing it with hyndreds of visitors and a big queue for the ferry back to Sydney. Great restaurants and a nice park for the kids to kick a ball aroud, not to mention lovely little beach. All in all a must visit, but pick your time!

Beautiful location and a must see!. I went to Watson's Bay with a group of friends and we have spend the entire day there. It's only a short ferry ride away from Circular Quay. The beaches are amazing, there is a nice park and there are some short but beautiful walks to do. If you walk up to the lookout point, you have the most amazing view on Sydney. I am definitely coming back!

Lazy afternoons. Great chill out place. Whether its parking yourself at one of the restaurants/ bars, or simply relaxing with a picnic on the lawn. Loads of place for the kids to run. Great for a lazy afternoon.

A delightful day in Sydney. I have a personal attachment to Watsons Bay. My ancestors had a dairy farm there in the late 1800s. Nonetheless I feel I can give an unbiased review of its delights. Firstly, it is very popular on weekends and school holidays, so avoid peak periods if you don't like crowds. I also recommend public transport, parking is limited and scarce. A ferry from Circular Quay is a delightful adventure on it own and you can return by ferry (or bus, via Bondi Beach if you have time or a more direct route if you don't). Watsons Bay provides much for everyone.Takeaway "Fish and Chips" at Doyle's is good value for money and you can sit in Robertson Park and enjoy harbour views while you eat. There are a couple of upmarket eateries, including the original Doyle's, the Hotel and cafes in "The Village" on Military Road. The famous and notorious "Gap" is worth a look and if you are reasonably fit and up to a couple of hours walking, follow the road to delightful Camp Cove beach (coffee shop and toilets) and the walk to South Head and see the delightful Hornby Light, gun emplacements (relics of man's warlike nature), the light house keepers house and SPECTACULAR views of Sydney Harbour, Manly and the Heads. You may return to your bed exhausted, but utterly sated from the visual and culinary delights. Take water and a sun hat/cream.Slip, slop, slap, is great advice in Australia. Slip on a shirt, Slop on the 30+ sunscreen, Slap on a hat, Seek shade or shelter, Slide on some sunnies and sip to stay hydrated.

Beautiful spot on Sydney harbour. An iconic bay/beach areas, if you have some spare time and the weather is great, spend the day here, lazing around take a picnic basket and your sweetheart and it will be a great day to remember, if warm enough go for a refreshing swim and a refreshing beer or wine and watch the sunset!

Beautiful. Have been many times, and it's beautiful in summer and winter (as long as it's dry!) There's a park where you can relax, and you can either choose to eat at Doyles or go cheaper with fish and chips...lots of options and a great day out if you take the ferry from Circular Quay.
Simply a beautiful place. A beautiful part of the world and worth the look and wonder. Take a walk along the entire beach and take in the magnificent views of the city.
Great Fish and Chips.. Travelled over by Ferry and enjoyed the walk around the Bay. The highlight of the trip was having Fish and Chips at the wharf.

Must see in Sydney. Watson's Bay is a terrific area to explore. The walk along the cliffs is spectacular and there are great places to stop for a meal or drink. Also easy to get to Bondi by bus but the best way to get to Watson's Bay is via the ferry.

A Beautiful Neighbor Near Bondi Beach. When you are in Bondi Beach, many people don't know a beautiful place call Watsons Bay which is just a few bus stops away. Take bus 380 go further north. Alight at bus terminal and there is the paradise. You can see Sydney CBD from a distance. The national parks there provides magnificent scenery and views of beautiful cliff and wave.

NICE. After Fish & Chips @ Doyles headed up on to South Heads and walked the coastal path very nice and well worth getting off the Bay Area in front of the ferry. Get up to The Gap amazing scenery. Missed the whales playing between the Heads which a friend had seen hours earlier so will need to get back for another watch

Delicious Food. Catching a ferry to Watson's Bay is a must when in Sydney. It is a beautiful beach with several eateries which are all popular and busy. We had brunch at Watson's Beach Club and the food was superb. I had fish and chips which was absolutely delicious and a very generous size. My daughter and my husband both had burgers which they reported to be excellent.

the wharf and Doyle's. easy to get to by ferry from circular quay, don't forget Doyle's on the Wharf (take away ) food and sit on the wharf, or Doyle's on the Beach excellent fine dining and great seafood
nice hidden spot. walk around the bay, great views of the harbour and the open ocean. diving there is good too if you have a chance!

Great views of the Pacific. We took a ferry to Watson's Bay to eat fish and chips at Doyle's and then walk up through the park to enjoy the Pacific coast line. The fish and chips were disappointing (busy and expensive - but tasty all the same) but the walk and the ferry made the trip well worthwhile. The views over the cliffs are superb.

Beautiful Bay. Great ferry trip over to Watson's Bay then drove round to Bondi Beach onto Rose Bay.
Beautiful area for day trip looking around area. Great for families and couples. Worth a trip over for sure 😀

Nice but over-rated. Nice beach and surrounding areas and everyone told us we should eat at Doyle's and have their fish and chips.We might have done this but as one arrives on the ferry, one is hit by the smell of fish, hot oil and grease! There are two Doyle's - one by the ferry quay and the other on the beach, and they're crowded, noisy and hardly welcoming!
Nice part of Sydney. You can access it by Ferry of Taxi. The most famous restaurant is on this beach "Doyles"... it is also home for a couple of Pelicans
Cute little town. Great little part of sydney, there's a trail walk that is awesome and easy even for children. Easily accessible by ferry.

Watson bay the gap , and the surrounding areas. Have been here many times by either ferry , very popular on weekends to eAt or swim on the foreshore, can return to sydney by bus travelling through the eastern suburbs of sydney , you can stop and Rose Bay have lunch or leave at Edgecliffe station to use the train and visit Bondi junction , this is quite a affordable way to see some lovely scenery and use public transport

Lunch at Doyles. Pleasant fishing village Doyles restaurant worth afternoon visit nice food and wine. Very popular iconic location. We attempted to walk from bondi to watson via cliff walk but were unable to find walking path and had limited time.
Beautiful. Great ferry ride from city centre. Eateries, lookout, beach and park to sit and relax or have a picnic
Beautiful views of the Harbour. No noise pollution, very serene. Not particularly touristy so you have room to breathe. Would recommend a visit to families and couples.
have to try the fish and chips!. for a couple of quid, the trip over from circular quay was well worth it. Watson's bay is lovely and the reputation for great fish and chips is well deserved!!

Take a half day trip out from Circular Quay by Ferry. Enjoy a short trip across the Harbour to Watson's Bay to enjoy fish and chips and or enjoy a drink in the pub. Nice park for kids to run around in or to have a picnic.

Love it here.. A quiet retreat from the busy city centre. A ferry ride away....so relaxing! Fine dining to take-aways with the 2 Doyles establishments, plus Dunbar House which is LOVELY...especially if you can book a table on the verandah.....$20 for Devonshire Tea. All a short walk from ferry wharf.

Sydney harbour on a shoestring. Another great low cost activity in Sydney. Catch the bus 234 or 235 from the City, takes you through Kings Cross, along the Harbour to Watson's Bay. Look out at the Pacific Ocean from the gap and then walk back down to the harbour foreshore and either have a luxury meal at one of the restaurants, a pub meal at the famous Watson's Bay pub or just have some fish and chips on the beach or in the park as you look back down the magnificent Sydney Harbour. Maybe catch a ferry back.
Day trip. Great day out from the ferry from Circular Quay lovely walk along the cliffs and views over the Ocean. Finished with great fish and chips at Doyle's before heading back to the city.

a nice activity from sydney. one of our favourite day activities in sydney is to catch the ferry to watson's bay from circular quay - climb up to the top of the heads and check out the view, then grab something to eat from Doyle's.

Watson's Bay, Fish and chips and the Gap Park -Great combo!. Watson's Bay is also famous for home of Sydney's famous fish and chips, Doyle's restaurant and The Gap Park. You can take a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and have fish and chips then take a walk to the Gap Park then see sunset in the bay. doyle's has a take away shop near the pier so you won't miss it. Having it on the grass overlooking beautiful sydney harbour bridge and opera house in distance will be an unforgettable experience while you are in sydney.

Watsons Bay Sydney. Well worth a visit. But be prepared to pay above average pricing, for meals and drinks at either the Watsons Bay Hotel, or nearby eating places. Best way to get there and back as a tourist, is by ferry from Circular Quay. Then it is up to you as to where you want to eat, as you have the choice of up-market at Doyle's Restaurant on the beach (quite expensive, but facilitated accordingly, the Watsons Bay Hotel (which is a bit of a bun-fight) or Doyle's on the pier, which is very much a takeaway arrangement, and is most definitely a bun-fight to get served, on a bright and sunny day.

A lovely way to spend the day......... This is a must visit, where the Australian Continent finishes and the Pacific Ocean takes over all the way to the USA. Be prepared to drive around and around to find that parking spot, it could take a while so think ferry from Circular Quay or the bus. The ferry is obviously more scenic and direct also a lot quicker. Once there, scale the cliffs for spectacular views, ocean and city skyline. Stop at the Watsons Bay Hotel and enjoy a drink and a meal or visit Doyles fish restaurant ( bookings recommended ). Alternatively take a stroll through the narrow streets of Watsons Bay and enjoy the lovely architecture, both modern and historic. A lovely beach on the Sydney Harbour side is a mecca for divers or simply plonk yourself on the beach and eat your fish and chips and watch the flotilla of yachts and boats go past. Very Sydney !

Fish and Chips. Caught the ferry to Watson's Bay. You can travel on all Sydney Ferries on Sundays for $2.50 but go early as it gets crowded. Great views of the Opera House and Bridge. Watson bay is famous for it's fish and chips. Doyles restaurant is expensive but the take away Doyles cafe is excellent and you can sit in the cafe or park. Order your food before mid-day to beat the crowds. Great coastal walks for everyone safe for kids.

Surprise at the Heads!. After a blowy but very swift ferry ride arrived at Watsons Bay expecting only Fish and Chips but had a surprising walk to South Head and views to the North. New walkway very well constructed for those with knees- had no problem at all with the steps and views incredible ! Finished off with take away Doyle's eaten in their restaurant on the beach with a couple more red wines waiting for the ferry- a very pleasant outing!

Nice spot to visit. Watson's Bay if never been before is a nice day out.There is a hotel where one can have nice lunch and drink overlooking the bay. There is quite a few cafe's nothing spectacular, Also a few fish and chip places. Or one can sit on green and have a relaxing day.Beware parking is shocking so be prepared for a walk.
A great day out not far from Sydney.... Lovely place to hangout and a lovely park where kids can play...The Fish & Chips from Doyle's a must have..
Whale watching. lovely relaxing place for a stroll. Bring some binoculars for whale watching. Food/drink a bit too expensive though.
nice sunset. The bay is very nice, the sunset over sydney is awesome. the restaurant just next to the beach is too nhammy :)
Must see!. What a destination!! Came here by ferry and loved every minute of it. Such a relaxing place and just has an awesome vibe.. We will be back!!

A must!!!!!. Fantastic area. We went here via a ferry from Circular Quay. Such a great way to go. There is easy walking around the bay and up to South Head and the Gap. This is a must when in Sydney. Also great views back to the city. There is a park at the ferry terminal which is great to sit in while eating fish and chips
Disappointed. the food available was disappointing, ours were served lukewarm and it seemed to take a long time to clear and clean the tables, despite it being very busy.

A bay with a great view of the CBD. Watson's Bay has some great restaurants near it's wharf such as Doyles Wharf Café and Dunham House (see my review). It's hard to believe the bay is only 25 kms from Sydney CBD as it is very quiet/serene and picturesque. It is also the perfect location for some great city and panoramic pics.You will however need to take a ferry to get here (Watson's Bay ferry).

Nice views of the city - and loved Gap Park. We came here on a Sunday after going to Manly when we were maximizing the flat $2.50 Opal rate. We visited Gap Park (just up the hill) which was our favorite part of Watson's Bay. Gap Park gave a great view of the city and it had a great path along the coast which we wish we had more time to hike.We stayed here for sunset and then got some Doyles to go for the ferry ride back (one order was more than plenty for two people). We got some great pictures on this brief excursion!

Lovely, unexpected coastal views. We travelled to Watson's Bay by ferry for dinner one evening and were pleasantly surprised to find a paved walk with stunning views of ocean and sandstone cliffs. A quiet little gem.

A Little Something for Families & a Little Something for Gays. Beautiful area to walk, hike a bit along the rocks, lay in the sun and cool off in the water. There's the main beach, which is good for families. If you're gay (or just don't like tan lines) and enjoy nude beaches, keep walking farther down the trail toward the lighthouse. It's a nice place to meet up and have some fun.
food with a view. we have had several trips to watson's bay. we have eaten at doyles on the pier and at the hotel bistro. both are relaxed with good food and a great view.
Simply Stunning Harbour Views. One of the most beautiful places in the world. We walk and often kayak from Watson's Bay to Camp Cove.

Pretty views of the city. just 20 minutes away by Ferry, and you reach a mini haven. Walk upto the gap and enjoy the cliff views. Also turn around and enjoy the city sky line. Love taking friends and family to Watson's bay. perfect getaway.
Great Place to spend an evening. We had cocktails and a delicious dinner with a beautiful view of the harbor. A perfect setting as the sun was going down.
Watson's. Watson's bay is a nice place and can be reached by a ferry from almost whole of Sydney. There are regular ferries to and from Watson Bay

Great Views across the Tasman Sea/Pacific Ocean. Always make a point of going to Watson's Bay every trip to Sydney as I enjoy having lunch at Doyle's and spending the next few hours walking off the meal on the numerous walking trails that overlook the Tasman Sea/Pacific Ocean. There are buses that cost approximately AUD2.5 from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay that takes about 30 minutes
some steep paths ahead. caught the ferry from the kings cross an it was a nice ride to watsons bay an then we went 4 a long walk along some tracks an some of the pathes were fairly steep to walk up

Good for an hour or so. I came to Watson's Bay after hearing some rave reviews. It was really windy the day I went there and there was not much to see/do at all so I was a little disappointed. It is a nice spot to stop off for an hour but I wouldn't really want to spend much more time than this there.

Restful and Views. One of my favorite places in Sydney, just a short ferry ride and you are there to have a grand lunch on the small beach, then up the hill to some dynamic views of the ocean, waves and rock formations. Been to Australia many times, and this is always on my itinerary. Just a pleasant day, and a nice boat ride too.

Doyles fish & chips is a must!. You can get to Watsons Bay easily by the regular 380 bus via Bondi Beach you can catch at Liverpool Street near Museum Station or by ferry from the Harbour ferry quay. I did bus out and ferry back to vary the journey. Watsons is famous for Doyles fish and chips. Go for the takeaway at AU$13.80 rather than the a la carte restaurant that charges AU$42. Line up and get your fish and chips and then you can eat on the green or better still sit down and eat your lunch in Doyles behind where you queued. You can order a drink at the bar. The a la carte Doyles is about 40 yards away. You get a generous portion of fish and chips, a segment of lemon and a sachet of plum sauce. Soft drinks AU$3.20...do try Kirks Ginger Beer!

Drive or Ferry... both worth every second of it. Watson's bay is almost surrounded by water.... once at watson's bay you feel so relaxed. I recommend not only going to the park there and fish and chips shop but go all the way up to Gap Bluff. Go for a stroll around and enjoy the hidden treasures of Sydney around Watson's Bay. You can also walk around the coast and get to Hornby Lighthouse... great views from there.Famous Dunbar House is located at Watson's Bay along with Doyles on the Beach and a lot more to see.....

Take a water taxi over to Doyle's. This is one of the oldest suburbs of Sydney and you can take the water taxi over to one of the oldest seafood restaurants in Sydney. On the beach. You can see back to downtown Sydney so the view is great. The restaurant gets overwhelmed on holidays so give those days a miss.

Up to the Heads, breathtakingly spectacular, back dowm to the beack and into Dunbar House for coffee and snack.. Worth will taking the tourist bus and getting off at the Watson Bay stop, let's you see Bondi Beach, Kings Cross and other sites.

Trip to new views. On the recommendation of a good friend it was suggested to visit Watson's Bay. Wow I am pleased I made the journey - the ferry ride was great, the bay and the sights were easy to navigate and lunch at Doyle's fabulous. The weather was great to top off a fabulous day.
A must do for the view!. Enjoyable walk along the coast with a breathtaking view of Sydney city! Getting to the tip of South Head and you're facing the open ocean....

Watsons Bay Hotel. Went to the Hotel for lunch and caught the ferry. Very beautiful coastal day trip. We walked to the Quay and caught a ferry. The trip took 30 mins and right at the wharf was the hotel. Had seafood lunch and enjoyed the atmosphere. Would visit again.

A beautiful way to spend a few hours.. Watsons Bay is a must do when in Sydney. Whether you have lunch at the hotel or fish and chips looking over the harbour, it really is a lovely way to spend a few hours. We visited on a fine Sunday afternoon in June and understadibly it was very crowded. Summertime l would definately recommend booking if you want a sitdown meal. We had a delicious reasonably priced, take away seafood basket from the kiosk on the pier. Finding a seat overlooking the beach we thought this really is a little slice of heaven. Ferries come and go to Circular quay frequently.

Wonderful views & walks. Ic took the ferry to Watson's Bay today. The ferry was running late but it is a fast catarmaran so soon made the time up. Great views on the way too and from the Bay of the opera house, the bridge and the naval docksVery queit at Watson's Bay but in the summer months I would think it is swamped. A lovely walk uphill through a park to Dunbar Bay. Turning right it's a 5 minute walk to Jacobs Ladder and another stunning view.I didn't have enough time to go the whole distance. I wish I had. Lunch (fish & chips) at Doyle's overlooking the small yacht basin and a ferry ride back ended a glorious trip

Surrounded by views. The gateway to Sydney Harbour. While Capt. Cook discovered Australia, he missed by a few kilometers the best harbour in the world. Walk along the cliff tops and admire the view of the ocean on one side and then turn and take in the skyline of Sydney. Doyle's seafood cafe and restaurant serve a smashing meal.

Cheap day trip - $2.50 only!. The cheapest way to get there is by public transport on Sunday since the daily cap for the opal card is $2.50. Just get to circular quay and catch a ferry to Watson's Bay. It is a very scenic ride with fantastic views.There isn't much choice for food there but the fish and chips are decent.Sunset is also beautiful. This is definitely a worthwhile day trip/half day trip!

Lovely walkways and views. Nice views down harbour and walkways opposite the bay to view Sydney Heads and Tasman Sea. Buy some fish and chips from one of the local shops for lunch and enjoy them while sitting on the beach. Lots of parking in the area.

Day trip. Great place to visit, lovely views of the harbour. Best way to get there is by ferry, you get a wonderful view of the harbour bridge, the opera house and the coast line to Watson's Bay. Good fish 'n chips but very pricy.

Nice little township. We took one of the harbour tours out to Watsons bay. Its a great way to get around and see all of the harbour and not just Manly. Its a lovely little place with a couple of nice cafe's and a great walk along the cliff top. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Sydney for a few days.

Watson's: the ferry ride alone is worth the trip.. Watson's Bay is a delightful, scenic ferry ride from circular quay. There is the famous Doyle's restaurant and its equally good take away and bar. There are walks from here or take the bus across the headland to Bondi.
Great Fish and Chips. Always a interesting ferry ride to get there and choice of places to eat , and a good walk towards South Head

Go to Watsons Bay if in Sydney. you wont be dissappointed as long as the weather is good.. I love going here by ferry. We have fish and chips at the cheaper Doyles, walk up to the Gap, go around to the streets and follow the path to South Head. There is a lot to choose from. I would suggest public transport as parking is a nightmare most days.
Beautiful place, lighthouse . Took wedding photo here near the lighthouse, a quite little hidden beach with a lots birds. Very popular wedding photo venue.

Amazing!. I always hunt for places with great atmosphere to photograph and watch sunset. This place always have families taking a walk and/or walking their dogs. People are lovely there and it is very easy to get there and head back to the city by the bus.
Lovely Bay. Easy walk from the pier to The Gap. Great views on the cliff walks. Visit Doyles Take-away Fish and chips on the wharf were good. Buses available to Bondi.

Fish & Chips in paradise. Watsons Bay is such a special place
Just a few miles outside Sydney but it feels like a million miles away
Fish & chips here is a must
Must see Watsons Bay. Well worth the trip out to Watsons Bay. Historical features, gorgeous views and the most wonderful trip through the winding British-like streets.
Walk Around Watson's Bay. A Beautiful and easy walk was great views. Suitable for kids and most levels of fitness. Easy to get to via the ferry.

Fantastic views of Sydney. Stopped at Watson's Bay to enjoy views of Sydney. Were able to look out along the coastline and see the beautiful ocean and surrounding bushland as we walked along the path which is easily accessed from the road.

Sunday Lunch at Doyles Watsons Bay. Sitting in Port Jackson just as you enter Sydney Harbour is the fantastic Watson Bay.This is a favourite Lunch Spot, it feels most decadent during the week as you look back at the working city!Doyles Seafood covers every budget from takeaway to sitting on the beach (my fav). It's a family treat, but also a lovely couple lunch escape.A walk around to Camp Cove is a must if you have the time.Catch a Ferry or water taxi from Cirular Quay so you can enjoy a long leisurely lunch with a bottle of wine, aaahhhh must make a booking.

Look back down the Harbour. Watson's Bay offers a park for picnics, access to harbour beaches, access to the Gap, dining options ranging from Fine Food to Take Out Fish and Chips. From this vantage point you can view this harbour city of Sydney as those first Europeans sailed into it. Access is by road or water. Offers great photo opportunities as well as lots of ways to relax. You will need a hat, sunglasses and your camera.

Ferry Ride to Watsons Bay. Catch ferry from Circular Quay, good view from ferry. Numerous restaurants located in the area. Good park for kids to play. Fish and chips at Doyles on the wharf at $13.80. Generous portion, three fair sized pieces of fish. Do it...

Hidden world. Wonderful location, quiet and peaceful with good eateries nearby, The whole area is clean and tidy and has a very safe feel about it.For older people with pension cards you can catch a bus from Bondi Beach to Watsons Bay and then catch the fast ferry back to Circular Quay, all for $2.50.You can eat at the wharf and watch the world go by while keeping an eye on the ferry's arrival.There are other attractions at this venue including The Gap Lookout and nice beaches.The main point about Watsons Bay is that it is quiet and peaceful yet in sight of Sydney.

Relax in a different part of Sydney. Pick your day. Parking can be hard on wekend. Great park to relax in and enjoy fish and chips from cafe. The pub has good food and great atmosphere. There are also restaurants for those wishing to spend more. Nice to play tourist in Sydney

Wonderful view. Take the ferry to Watson's bay and walk the south heads to the light house. Explore the old cobble roads and where the cannons use to be to protect the Harbor. Take some water and comfortable walking shoes. If the weather is nice there are a few beaches on the way to enjoy also.

You've Had Your Chips!. The boat ride to Watson's By is a delight, as is the place itself. I'm just not sure that the fish and chips the place has a reputation for really are worth the money. In fact, they were probably the most expensive I have ever had anywhere in the world!Don't let that put you off, though - just eat before you go.

Watsons Bay past its best.. A let down for something so bragged about but having said that, if you have no expectations it is a lovely ferry ride to get there with a few good walks around. The fish feed is overpriced but OK and it is always jam packed on the weekend.
A great ambassador for Sydney. Watson's Bay is steeped in history and offers access to some of the best views and walks that Sydney has to offer.
The view and seafood restaurant. Watson's Bay not only gives you a panoramic view of the skyline of Sydney it also has some of the better seafood restaurant.

Scenic walk, finishing at the pub. Lovely walk to the gap with great views over the harbour and back to the bridge.South Head road was closed but worth the detour to Camp Cove, circling back and finishing at the Watson's Bay Hotel with great harbour views.

Beautiful views and great food choices. This is a relaxed and beautiful part of Sydney. It offers terrific Harbour views, swimming if you feel like it, and some delicious food and drink options. A must-see for visitors.

Gorgeous area. Loved this area. So relaxed and nice. There's a big park, lots of lovely areas to sit and fantastic views of the city in the background. There's a nice little cafe near where the ferry goes from.
The Face of Sydney. This is the place you remember Sydney with the coathanger and city skyline in the distant and the harbour in the forground

A little overcrowded but nice view. Went to double bay before heading over to Watson's Bay. Found a random unknown beach at double bay which was really beautiful and therefore set a little highly expectation for Waston's Bay since it's well spoken of.The path to watson's bay with surrounded by trees and grasses and it's beautiful. Perfect spot for picnic. Went further in and found a few restaurants selling fish and chips. The beach has a some rubbishes laying all around. The food served was alright. A little bland if not for the sauce provided. However, the fish and calamari were really fresh and good. Had gelato after meal and the flavours were rich and unique. That's my favourite part of the trip. Worth a trip but if your schedule is tight, can consider giving it a miss, unless you're heading to The Bluff Gap (at the back of Watsons' Bay) which has breathtaking views.

Lovely area with lots to explore. Watson's Bay area is an excellent one for families, couples, groups of friends or even solo. There's a few lovely little beaches, parks and breathtaking view of the city. The famous Doyle's restaurant, Dunbar House and Watson's Bay Hotel are all consistently great places.

Plenty of dining options. We caught the hop on hop off ferry to Watson's Bay. We had fish and chips for lunch from the take away section of Doyles. We ate at the tables and chairs provided but there is a nice park where you can eat. The fish and chips are fairly expensive but decent sized serves and very tasty. There is also a Doyles restaurant if you want fine dining. We walked through the park to The Gap which has great views out over the ocean. A very pleasant place for lunch.

Yummy food and am. Doyles Restaurant is one of the best around the globe of my travels, and the fresh crayfish a must. Pricey but worth every cent.Take a ferry from circular quay to make the experience unique and take in the stunning views of Sydney Harbour & The Opera House not the way. Ticked off my bucket list.

Wow! Watson's Bay. Ferry ride was comfortable and fast.Very clean and well presented at the dock.Easy access to our lunch destination ,Doyles restaurant .Good pathways to view the ocean ,on the opposite side of the Bay.
perefect location. magnificent food service , bread love it , seafood , tops , views are amazing , lunch is my favorite , time
unique watsons bay. Unique bay with lots of character ,very relaxing.,has genteel feel of yesteryear..Doyles restaurant good...bonus as well going back to city centre on ferry

Relaxing!. It was cooling with nice wind blowing in a hot summer day. Spectacular to see the water splashing against the colorful rock formations of the cliffs. Sat on the beach to relax and unwind. There are nice cafes for you to grab some food.
Posh little pocket of Sydney . A quaint little posh suburb of Sydney. If you are visiting I suggest you grab some food at Doyles on the beach, and have a look at the gap.

Day trip to Watsons Bay. Watsons Bay is superb to visit either by Ferry or by Bus. If travelling by Ferry give yourself enough time to enjoy the ride there, walk around the area, go to the cliff facings over the ocean and harbour, and return by Ferry to Circular Quay (if originating htere). The Ferry service is busy in the weekends and you may not get on your ride first up, sometimes there is a queque to get on the boat. Services do cease early in the afternoon so depending on the time of year you visit, you will need to be aware of the last Ferry service out of Watsons Bay. There are a number of eateries there to choose from, Doyles restaurant and take away are both good choices. You can sit in the park and enjoy the harbour views, or go for a stroll along the beach. The area is certainly worth while on a fine sunny day. This will not disappoint you.

One more way to love Sydney. The great thing about Watson's Bay is that it lets you appreciate the city from a very cool distance. Watson's Bay feels posh and doesn't have the hassle of the city. Go to the beach or relax sipping a cocktail from one of the bars.

Good Expedition from Circular Quay to Watson Bay. You can take a Speed Boat from Circular Quay to Watson Bay, one experience you don't wanna miss when in Sydney, it is all about coastal views, Good Scenic spot, You can take a walk from the Watson Bay ferry terminal walking through the roads to a hidden family beach and the climbing up for one of the few nude beaches (Lady Bay) in Sydney. though it is most of the time just few regular nude males, you can cross the spot go a litter higher for a old light house, take some food and drinks good spot to eat and then make your trip back

Beautiful spot. Beautiful place for lunch or just have a drink, with the benefit of the view to the city. You can take the ferry from Circular Quay or drive. I personally prefer the ferry because on the way you can see the beautiful harbour.
a great view down the harbour. a different perspective on Sydney harbour where you can also swim & dine on seafood from cheap takeaway all the way through to finwe dining

Watsons Bay great to live in but not much for tourists. I have grown up here, it is a beautiful part of the world to live in but if I was a tourist I would probably expect more. In summer the beaches are packed, there is limited food available, the pub is a heaving mass of young cool people and the park is so busy its hard to find somewhere to sit. I think the best thing for tourists here is to walk along the harbour and ocean, it is breathtaking and sometimes if you are lucky enough you will spot a whale or two. An amazing suburb to live in but not that exciting for tourists.
Great spot for a fish and chip meal. Just a short ferry ride from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay then take the walk out to South Head - the entrance to our beautiful harbour

Want to go back time and time again!. We went on the ferry which was a great experience as the views on the way were beautiful. Lovely walks and the best fish and chips ever once there. It stays on our to do list as we just want to go back over and over again!

A great place to visit during your Sydney visit.. One of the nicest parts of Sydney is Watson's Bay. The bay itself is very peaceful and serene, plus you can take a water ferry from downtown. Additionally while you here you can visit one of the prettiest spots in Sydney at Gap Bluff and take advantage of the photo op. Aftert your done, you can eat just yards away from Gap Bluff at Doyles, one of the bets restaurants in all of Sydney in my opinion.

take your picnic and spend the day. it's nearly always full on the weekends, but go during the week with a picnic blanket and some picnic food-pop into the pub for a drink after and enjoy watching the sun go down over the harbour. There are a lot of little spots around if you look hard enough.

Sunny Day on The South Side. Beautiful sunny afternoon spent lazing around Watsons Bay, whats not to like. Sand, water, food, wine and a brilliant location. A must if you haven't been before, and worth doing again if it has been a while since you were there.
Iconic. What an iconic location, just a short ferry ride from the City. It's fantastic looking back down the harbour while eat a sumptuous seafood lunch with good friends.

A trendy little trip. We caught the ferry over to Watson's Bay from the city and enjoyed a stroll along the water, a drink at the trendy hotel and some fish and chips on the pier. Although we went on a grey old day, Watson's Bay provided enough colour in itself that it wasn't a problem. Definitely a fun little day trip out of the city and one i would certainly do again!
Better to go in good weather. I visited there in a rainy winter weekday. The cliff is spectacular but better to view in a sunny day and so that u can have a walk in the Gap Park.

Holiday Girl went to Sydney. From Watson's Bay you can catch the Ferry to the city. Lovely walks around the are. Glorious views. Unfortunately the day we arrived it was raining, however we can't control the weather but we can always use an umbrella
Lunch with a view. Perfect for relaxing, enjoying the view and a nice seafood lunch, plenty of parkland for the kids to run around or a strol along the shorelin .
Great fish and chips. Make sure you incude a ferry ride to Watson's Bay and visit the Doyles pub for some outstanding fish and chips. Spend the afternoon lazing in the park or listening to music
Picturesque!. Very peaceful and quiet with a lovely walk around by a lighthouse too. Great fish and chip bar on the sea front, but a fancier cafe if you want to splash out.

A bay with view. Apparently this is the last bay before you hit the south head. It is a nice bay at the base of the national park and the views back to the city are extraordinary. I assume at night they would be spectacular. We only came during the day and it seemed like a nice place to take the kids or bring some friends for a picnic. It gives you a different view of Sydney. Worth a visit if you have the time.
Nice winter walk. Great atmosphere. Good restaurants and a lovely ferry ride worth the trip. Take the normal ferry. No need for a tour. Make sure you have a camera
Pretty but busy. Always very crowded on weekends but good Ferry access and wonderful harbour scenery. Restaurants and bars abound. Easy access to harbour beaches and South Head.

LOve Watson's Bay. Visited Watson's Bay on our trip to Sydney and really enjoyed firstly the ferry boat out with lovely views of the harbour bridge, Opera House and the Sydney skyline. We arrived at the bay and decided to eat at the Doyle's but at the take away and sat outside by the bar. The fish and chips were excellent and clearly had been prepared as we waited, lovely Aussie beer and beautiful sunshine - what more to you need. Except, it was ANZAC day and the NSW Police pipe band were playing - for a Scotsman that was awesome. Walked up and viewed the harbour entrance and the ocean - amazing. Well worth the trip.

Nice little sea side cove.. My advice, catch a ferry from Circular quay to Watsons Bay, got off, have a look around, plenty to see, The Gap, Little Beach, have lunch or dinner at Doyles Seafood Restaurant or Doyles on the pier (Their prawn rolls are great) walk along the beach, on a sunny day there is nothing better, very quite and lovely place to be.

Relaxed vibe lots to explore. Great walk around the Cliffs and National Parks. Terrific harbour views with great panoramas for photographers. Visit the Gap cliff top walk and read the history of ship wrecks and heroism. I spent an afternoon photographing the different architectural styles from old terraces, restored fisherman's cottages and great harbourside mansions. Interesting for the history buff and a great place for a picnic. If that's not your style the Watsons Bay Hotel and other eateries provide great options. Can be very busy on the weekend and parking is limited. Easy bus or ferry transport from the City.

super fish and chips. Important that we arrived just before the lunchtime rush, which allowed us to order and have a drink. Food is quick and timed correctly for a nice afternoon's lunch. careful, this place can get packed out on weekends
best fish & chips in the world?. Take a harbour trip to Watsons Bay for probably the best fish & chips in the world or even better eat at Doyles restaurant who also run the 'chippy' on the wharf.

picturesque view of the Sydney skyline. We took a ferry from Circular Quay brings you to Watson's Bay to have a view of the Sydney skyline from the water. The next day, we took a bus city tour and stopped on a hill above Watson Bay for the same view from higher in altitude.The view from Watson Bay is very picturesque. Watson Bay itself is a little bay where a few house are scattered on the hills . Its owners seem to enjoy a quiet life and beautiful views.

One of the best things to do in Sydney. Got the ferry here from Circular Quay - such a beautiful journey - and then did the walk from the lighthouse at Watson's Bay all the way down to Bondi. It took about 3 hours and was so so beautiful! Most of the time there's a pathway but at the end you have to cut out onto the road or go around houses but it's not difficult to figure out.

Picturesque little bay. A short ferry ride from Circular Quay brings you to Watson's Bay where you can enjoy fish and chips at the famous Doyles restaurant or you can do what we did and walk to Vaucluse House museum and have lunch at the 1910's style tea rooms. Make sure you get a free guided tour through the house which we found very informative and interesting. Ask directions from a local as it can be tricky to find on foot.Well worth a visit!
Quick stop. We took Ferry from here to circular Quay. Managed to be waiting when the sun was setting amazing view. The noise of the birds singing and the sunset made it an amazing experience

Lovely way to spend the day. Taking a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay is a pleasant experience. We were fortunate the weather was on our side. Sydney is blessed with gorgeous views from almost any angle. We went for a lovely stroll to the lighthouse, had a light lunch at the cafe and ferried it back to Circular Quay. A magical day

A ferry ride to Watson's Bay. Do yourself a favour and take a ferry ride to Watson's Bay and go to Doyles for a feed of fish and chips. Then walk up to the Gap and look at the 360 degree views which are magnificent. Then take a bus ride back to the City via Bondi Beach. A few hours of bliss that you will not regret.

Lovely Beach. Lovely beach here. Supposed to be best fish and chip s in Sydney found here.
Good bus service from Sydney, we planned to take the ferry back but unfortunately they seem to stop really early. Luckily busses run all the time.
Nice selection of bars on the sea front. Large park. And small selection of shops

Good half-day outing. It's a good way to spend the afternoon, whether it's snacking on seafood, having a picnic in the park, or enjoying the view from the lookouts. It's a nice and peaceful getaway from the busyness of CBD.
Visiting with family. The best time is Sumer time work around or take weather plane for tour nice place e very one can anjoit kids adults
Good cheap eats. Best place for local seafood at the takeaway on the pier, better than hotel prices and you cn sif down to enjoy it behind to shop.
top seafood. place to visit to go to Sydney's premier fish restaurant. The company has now also taken over the adjacent pub which is cheaper and has a takeaway shop on the pier.

Peaceful. Its pretty peaceful and its different from a few other beaches in Sydney. Its a nice and quiet place but I won't consider it as fantastic. Theres a nice and small church near there, which I think is more interesting.

An oasis in the middle of a big city!. From the time you get on the ferry to the time you get off it's a great day at the south head. The journey is great as you take in the Eastern suburbs mansions on route and then on arrival the best fish and chips or fresh oyster at Doyles restaurant eating seaside alfresco style. Then cruise the afternoon away in the Watsons Bay Beach Club at the Palace Hotel with a cocktail listening to the cool summer sounds of top class audio selections from the in-set.

Watson's bay: great for a day. Take a ferry or bus (ferry) from Circular Quay to Watson 's Bay wharf, arriving in time to have lunch and an ale at the pub or take a picnic. Good playground for the kiddies and picking there, or better yet on the grassy, shady hill aboVe Camp Cove is brilliant. Bring your swimmers- it's a great little beach, and the walk up to the lighthouse offers brilliant views and photo oops. Easy walking. Check a local map or ask anyone how to wind past the charming cottages to get there, or follow signs to the Naval Base and bear left after the parking lot (which fills up very quickly on weekends). Toilets available. Just beautiful in any weather, any season, and just off the whole "Rocks track." Families, couples etc.
Worth the trip. Watson's Bay has stunning views of the city and easy walks.The pub is iconic and the restaurant providing wonderful sea food.Sit back and enjoy and feel the tension leave the body.
Offers a great view!. A great place for a picnic or a drink in the bayside pub. Easy to get to from the city by ferry, and offers a great view over nthe harbour to the city!

lovely time with friends. The views are amazing it is really worth a visit while in Sydney. We took a lot of pictures that turned out great. We had lunched at a popular fish and chips shops which we enjoyed so much.
Take the time, got to the Gap. The Gap is just 10minutes up the hill and once there you can go left or right. Great scenery and very pleasant walk.

Peaceful, small beach & grass area for relaxing. The bay itself is pretty quiet, although getting off the ferry from Circular Quay there were a lot of tour groups departing, most of which seemed to head to Doyle's which can also be pretty crowded.Otherwise the grass area and beach area is pretty quiet, and I suppose it would be nice to swim in when the warmer months arrive.I can imagine the area would get pretty busy in summer when it's warmer.
Last Hurrah. Before our flight back to Manila, my cousin and her husband took us to Watsons Bay. I would've kicked myself if we didn't do this. It was a perfect ending to our holiday.
Pretty. We had some time to kill before flying out and were sent here by hotel staff. Fun dog park and walking trails, nice to look at the sailboats. very pretty

Fun Stop on a Circuit Tour from Bronte to Bondi to Watson's Bay to Circular Quay. A really fun circuit tour in Sydney that is inexpensive and healthy is the Bondi Beach-Watson's Bay-Circular Quay circuit. From downtown you can either take the #378 bus to Bronte Beach from the Central Station, or take the metro to Bondi Junction and catch the bus there. The end of the line is at the south end of Bronte Beach, at the beginning of the Bronte to Bondi Beach Walk, a 6 km formal finished exercise trail along the beaches and cliffs that is easy and fun for any reasonably healthy person. From Bondi Beach, you can catch the #380 bus to Camp Cove on Watson's Bay. There you can stop for ice cream and lunch at Doyle's Restaurant on the wharf. The ferries leave from the wharf back to Circular Quay giving you a first class tour of the harbor, the Opera House and the the bay on the way, and all for the price of a normal daily transit pass. Of course, it is best to do this on a day with nice weather. Don't forget to take you camera. One caveat is that the last ferry from Watson's Bay leaves fairly early around 5 PM, so if you stay late there for dinner, you have to take the bus back to the city...
A meander around Watsons Bay and South Heads. A great way to spend a day. Walked around South Heads and explored along Watsons Bay. Finished up with Fish and Chips at the Watsons Bay Hotel.

Great dining at Doyles on Watsons Bay. Such a lovely seafood restaurant - Doyles at Watsons Bay. Take the water taxi from Circular Quay (better on a Saturday night as the Friday night ferries are limited). A quick ride over to a wonderful fresh seafood restaurant. We had the hot and cold platter for two - was DEVINE !!!

A breath of fresh air. Small seaside type place a 30 minute fast ferry ride from Circular Quay. Has a village feel. Nice walks up to look-out with good views and also along beach past Doyles Fish Restaurant to the Lighthouse. A breath of fresh air away from the hustle and bustle of the CBD.

Beautiful spot. We got the ferry over and had a drink, the weather was rotten but seeing the city disappear and reappear from the fog was stunning in its own way. If it was good weather can imagine it's even more beautiful.

Interesting place to explore. Watson's Bay is an interesting location to explore offering a variety of activities from the historic buildings, beach and swimming, cafes, cliffs and walks.
Views across to the city.
Leave the car at home as parking is difficult.

Beautiful views, walk to Gap Park. This is a gorgeous stop while taking the ferry. We went from the central quay to Manly, and then continued to Watson's Bay before ending our day at Bondi Beach. It is well worth stopping for an hour or two to take in the magnificent views.
Bay View. A must go to watch beautiful bay watch and sea view. Fantastic view of Sydney water front and beach houses!

Fish and chips supreme. Take public ferry from Circular Quay, 15 minutes to Watsons Bay $2.50 for Oz.pensioners for all day ferry, bus and trains.ticket. On the Jetty you have Doyles Jetty Restraunt which serves up dine in and take away Fish,chips and salads for a very reasonable price. Leave time to stroll around the bay and explore the rugged coast line before catching the ferry back to Sydney.

Convenient break from the busy city. A short ferry ride, which gives you great views of both the harbour bridge and the opera house, takes you to this interesting haven away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A short walk gives you gives you views of the original cottages and the sheltered harbour around to looking at the open ocean from the cliffs. Plenty of time for refreshments before you head back.

Watson Bay day trip. Watson Bay is great for day trip and relax, walk around the area Take a ferry, drive, taxi or busLook at the cliff’s, sandy beachYou are the ocean one side and inner harbour the otherLunch at the hotel or restaurants sit and look up the harbour to Sydney centre relax with a drink and sea food lunch or dinnerFood and view is great, what is the rest of the population doing, who cares as you have found your spot to enjoy yourself and friendsSydney population are spoilt for place to go in Sydney. This is just one of them to explore yourself.

So Sydney. I grew up in Bondi and we went here every weekend.I don't go as often now but it is still a special place.You can go to the hotel, Doyles on the Beach or simply wander around.Every visitor to Sydney should come here.

Vaucluse House. We didn't have time to explore Watson's Bay (next trip..) but walked to Vaucluse House (which has personal history with my husband's family)..anyway, a wonderful piece of Sydney history is tucked away here, and the lunch at the outdoor Café/restaurant well worth it. The House itself needs a bit of time to really explore and appreciate it's worth.

A must visit. Try and travel by ferry if you can, if not the bus is pretty good too. Doyles at Watson Bay is the place to eat but expensive seafood, grab something an a cafe or the takeaway place on the wharf.Adjacent Camp Cove is a great safe harbour beach. Awesome walk out to the heads , just avert your eyes when you pass Lady Jane as its a nudist beach
Walking. Nice area for walking, jogging, looking from and at the cliffs.Small Lady Jane beach for naturist sunbathing. Very good seafood place on the Wharf. Also family beach at Green Point.

Great walks. Get the fast ferry to Watson's Bay. Have a seafood lunch right on the beach and take in the views. Then take the signed walkway up to the lighthouse at the entrance to the harbour and look back at the views towards the city. Breath taking.

My favourite place in Sydney, Watsons bay. Watsons bay is an old fishing village, with quaint historic houses, beautiful walks, old gum trees, a view of the harbour and a real holiday feel to it. Seagulls fighting for your fish and chips and a fabulous harbour pool to swim in, jump off the jetty. It's also minutes from Camp Cove a treasure of a beach.

Great views of the City from the Bay. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Doyles on the Beach at Watsons Bay. Lovely open space and a beautiful old Moreton Bay fig tree. Nice takeaway cafe on the wharf.

Lunch at Watson's Bay. I organised for a small group of OS visitors to take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay, where I had reserved a table at the Beach Restaurant for lunch. The day was cloudy, but still spectacular views back to the bridge and the city. The food was superb, the location spectacular, the staff excellent and altogether it was a wonderful experience for all my friends from Bali, UK and Adelaide..
Amazing to watch the ocean. View from the top is so amazing and you can just indulge watching the waves making pattern with rocks on shore!!!

Where Sydney Harbor meets the Pacific Ocean. Take the ferry or bus out to Watson's Bay to Sydney Harbour National Park. Walk the coastline trail for spectacular views or the harbour and the Pacific Ocean.There are a few restaurants. We splurged on lunch at historic Doyle's on the Beach. It was excellend.

Perfect for tourists to get a sense of the harbour, great views and Sydney life. Catching a ferry to Watsons Bay is a perfect introduction to Sydney living. Sun sparkling in Sydney Harbour, the homes of the rich and famous, with pleasure crafts, ferries and cruiseships passing by, you will feel you are living a glamorous life.Watsons Bay Hotel on the outside deck upstairs is the picture postcard view of the city skyline to enjoy over oysters and seafood. You can also get take away fish and chips near the wharf and sit under the trees, tourists head to Doyle's but it is overpriced and very touristy, so I cannot recommend it.Take off your shoes and walk along the beach, feel the sand under your toes.There is a good walk to the Hornwby lighthouse then back along he area known as The Gap. Sadly this is a suicide spot on the top of dramatic cliffs.You can get a return ferry trip, but I would recommend catching a bus back to the city as it meanders past other greqt views of the harbour and gives you a real insight into the mix of Sydney suburbs. You can also get off at Bondi Junction for some high end shopping then catch a train back to the city.The Watsons Bay Ferry half an hour before sunset will give you the killer views of Sydney backlit.

Great place to visit. While staying in the city we travelled by bus to Watsons Bay, through the eastern suburbs. After a walk around the waterfront and lunch at Doyles Seafood Restaurant, we caught a ferry back to the city. A most enjoyable day.

Highly recommended. Giving great views over the harbor entrance and the cliffs are amazing. Try not to get lost though if you walk along the top of the cliffs. Better to go down in to Watsons Bay and follow the beach along as the top of the ridge is restricted access due to defence activities. A hiddenSAydney gem i think.
Great place for picnic. Nice place for family.. great place for picnic. nice place for family. we went there with friends and we had a gewat time with their fish'n chips.

Great Picnic Spot. Watson's Bay is a great picnic spot. An amazing view of downtown Sydney coupled with the bay and lovely lawns and pathways. There is also a kiddie's park which is a boon if you want to keep the kids out of your hair. Beware of the seagulls!

A must see for tourists.. This small beachside and cliff side area is a good place to visit. See the Gap and have lunch at Doyle's seafood restaurant. The one located on the beach is probably the nicest choice. A really quaint and lovely day out can be had here.

Best Fish and Chips in Sydney. Great views back to the City and great restaurants and cafes. Probably the best fish and chips in Sydney at either the Cafe on the pier or the more expensive restaurants

Beautiful beach and views. For a clean beach and lively environment, Watsons Bay is a brilliant way to enjoy the view across the water to Sydney Bridge whilst enjoying the calm of the sea or dining at a great restaurant like Doyles. Nice way to spend a few hours in Sydney.

Great place for picnic. the ferry trip to watson's bay is awesome. Walk past the trendy restaurants to the main road and turn left . Go past the small bay and up the steps for a mystical walk. The walk is suitable for pushchairs with a few steps that need to be negotiated. Avert your children's eyes from the nudist beach which is nearly hidden below the cliff walk. After about 20 mins you will be rewarded with great views across the ocean. Go at the weekends and you should see an armada of sailing boats. A great place for a picnic
Posh Sydney. Easy to reach via ferry (bus too!), this offers an excellent beach plus some very fine homes to gawp at and envy. Not that much shopping. But well worth 3 or 4 hour visit.

Great harbour views . Superb setting right on the water with stunning views to the city, lovely walks around and of course seafood, fish and chips are a must, buy some and take to the park. Highly recommend a visit here.

Nice coastal/cliff walk. Start at the top of the hill and follow the path along the cliffs down to the bottom of the bay. Stop in the Watson's Bay Boutique Hotel for a drink to cool down or relax on one of the small beaches.

Gives a close view of Opera House from new angle. Take the ferry from Circular Quay and have a great ride and then enjoy wandering around the beach and seaside here. Places to swim and eat for a few hours then the enjoyable ride back to Sydney.
Great Fish n Chips. Shared a fish n chips meal on the Wharf - best value 2 pieces of the best Baraamunndi and wine to wash it down. Then a beautiful ferry ride home.

Just walk around the beach to the Gap. Just spend time walking around the beach, can cross over the park to the Gap and take pictures of stunning rocks. No need to go further, the view is not that good if you walk further down signal hill anyway.

Ferry to Watsons Bay. We went over to Watsons Bay on the ferry which was excellent but we didn't check return times beforehand and had to go back to the City on the bus which was a bit long and tedious. Watsons Bay is a lovely area with a great view back towards the City.
A skip across the harbour. We took a ferry across the harbour to Doyles for lunch. A quick scenic trip. Beats fighting traffic.

Beautiful beach with wonderful views of Sydney. Loved this place, our son took us for the first time, found a hidden secluded beach which was very special. Lunch at Doyles for fab fish and chips, only managed the takeaway as all restaurants booked, would recommend booking in advance!, good tourist place to visit.

Such a pretty spot. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay. Enjoy a pleasant walk to the lighthouse to work up an appetite for lunch at Doyle's where you can sit and watch the water. A lovely way to spend the day.
Beautiful. Beautiful beach but not a lot here. If you queue for the legendary fish a chips, make sure you are very hungry as the portions are huge! Easily accessible by ferry.
The best of everything.... Watson's Bay has everything. Great restaurants; great beaches and one of the best views of Sydney. It idyllic, peaceful and a must see destination in Sydney's inner harbour

Some charm, but over-rated. Don't go out of your way to get here.. If you go, do so by ferry. That will be the best part of the trip. Some charm, but after a bit of a walk there's nothing to do, unless you go & eat the most dissatisfying expensive fish & chips on the planet.

What's on in Watson's Bay?. A great place to see when visiting the eastern suburbs of Sydney! A short 10 minute drive from Bondi Beach or the 380 Bus from the city. An older established area of Sydney, quiet, leafy and coastal. There are many pockets of water to enjoy and explore. Good for swimming and sunning. There is a magical coastal walk where you can see Manly and the heads that enter Sydney Harbour. Watson's Bay is the place to be for the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race on Boxing Day, a clear expansive view of the water ways that lead the yachts to sea! The famous Doyle’s on the Beach will give you a fish & chips experience to remember and The Watson's Bay Hotel is just fabulous to sit and sip on a glass of wine as the day unfolds with everyone enjoying the sun!

Watson Bay - A place to see Natural beauty. From the time that you take the a ferry in circular quay until you get to Watson bay wharf, you can see lots of amazing things. Once you get to Watson bay, you will be surprised by the natural beauty of this little bay. you can see the fight of water and rock which has been going for millions of years and still continues. the big ships are floating on the ocean and ....

Average for Sydney is still pretty good.. The best part of Watsons Bay is the ferry ride. Great views all around. The parks at WB are nice but not spectacular. The restaurants are average ( we ate in only one), the cliffs overlooking the surf offer outstanding views. The area is extremely popular with rude, pushy tourists carrying cellphones and selfie sticks.

Doyles and Camp Cove a must. One of three places in Sydney I would recommend for Fish-n-Chips is Doyles (Boatshed at Glebe, and Balmoral Beach being the other two), but you need to book, particularly on weekends and in Summer. Worth the walk to Camp Cove, and to the Green Point Reserve lookout on the hill (between Watson's Bay and Camp Cove) which provides a spectacular view back towards the city, and is a great place for an impromptu picnic for those who would prefer to "do it themselves"). There is a small carpark at Green Point Reserve for those travelling by car.The Gap (a lookout towards the sea) is a short walk up the hill from Doyles and Watson's Bay, and worth a look (a nice view, but 30 seconds later you will tick that one off the list and move on).Including lunch, allow a good 3 hours in the Watson's Bay area. For tourists, this is a nice place than Bondi and will let you mix with more locals and experience the "real" Sydney.

Everyone loves Watson's Bay. Everyone loves visiting Watson's Bay whether as a tourist or local. Getting to Watson's Bay is fun, with either a fabulous trip on a ferry from Circular Quay or via the local council bus. Then there's a choice of places to eat and drink. Of particular note is the famous Watson's Bay hotel where sumptuous, affordable lunches on sun drenched verandas with sweeping beach and water views make the outing an experience to treasure.

Small enough to be quaint, big enough to visit. We had been tipped off that the seafood restaurant (Doyles on the Beach) here was not to be missed, the beaches either side of the jetty were very nice (and quiet), a trip worth taking.

Great place for taking in the Sydney skyline. Wonderful location minutes away from the Rocks. Everyting from the boat ride to the local atmosphere, lovely restaurants, great easy walks contribute to a unique must have experience when visiting Sydney. Next to entrance to the harbour.
A great place. Catch the ferry out here and there are numerous places to have a drink or eat. I love the Watson's Bay Pub. The view is perfect and the food relatively cheap. It can get busy though!

BEST SPOT IN SYDNEY. HIDDEN GEM!. Great place to relax, have a few drinks and fresh fish & chips too. watch the harbour and all its traffic and a great place to few the numerous cruise ships that come and leave out city.

Stunning view!!. The fabulous beach to visit. Great place to rest and made your day. I like this bay because beautiful and quiet. Easy to go by boat and there are many restaurants for you to choose for brunch !!

Best place in Australia. I love Watsons Bay. This place absolutely rocks. The views are stunning, the beaches are beautiful and the Watsons Bay Hotel is a happening place with great food and delicious beer. A must in Sydney.

Take the local 325 bus to Watson's Bay. Take the 324/325 bus from downtown to Watson's Bay. The houses you will see on the way are breathtaking. When you get to the last stop, there is a nice walk to the beach, then a bit of a bush walk past Lady Bay (Lady Jane) beach and to the lighthouse at the South Head. The views from Watson's Bay back to the city are something to behold. You can have a lovely fish dinner at Doyle's seafood restaurant, which is almost famous, or a take-away fish and chips and enjoy that on a bench...watch out for the seagulls though, because you could lose your lunch.
nice. Watson´s Bay is a very beautiful beach at the very east of Sydney with some great scenic viewpoints. Take a walk and enjoy !

Must visit Doyles Restaurant. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay. Hop off at Watsons Bay,enjoy fish and chips or a meal at Doyles Restaurant, walk through the park to the scenic view points over looking the sea. Watch the resident pelican.
Best place on Sydney Harbour. Go there by ferry, then climb up the head and enjoy the splendid view of the South Head and the Tasman Sea. Then have lunch at one of the several nice places there.

little gem. great location within 10 mins by cat to sydney. nice rooms on beach side location in an old select part of the city. lively beach bar and nice walks nearby.Ideal for a three/four night stay, loved it. Doyles fish restaurant next door. Hotel food was just ok.
Gorgeous. The suicide cliffs are heartbreakingly beautiful. Take the bus up. Gorgeous city and water views. Must do for unique views.
A fast ferry ride away from the City. Beautiful little village with lovely houses, great fish and chips and high dining if you have booked a table at Doyles.

Another must see!. Watsons Bay is a place I always recommend visitors to Sydney must see. A ferry ride from Circular Quay is reasonably priced and let's a traveller see a lot of Sydney on the way. On arriving at Watsons Bay there a great places to purchase great seafood, and visit walkways with great views of the harbour and Pacific Ocean.

Relaxing, with spectacular Harbour and beachside views !. Loved the relaxed lifestyle, and you could easily while away many hours in the relaxed Beach Hotel. Had lunch at the original Doyle's - fantastic food and amazing service makes it well worth the trip. Have been back many times and will definitely be again ! Take the ferry there and the bus back if you've got the time.

Well worth a trip. My wife and I took our 3 year old son and 4 year old daughter. The ferry ride alone is worth the trip. Make sure to get to the beach around the corner, Camps Grove. Doyles is a must to eat lunch. Try to book ahead. It can get busy.

Nice visit in great weather. Great ferry ride from Sydney. Only 20 minutes! Excellent Seafood restaurant from the pier (Doyles on the Beach) but takes cash only. The pub next door was really noisy, but looked better. Great walk to the Philip Arthur monument and South Heads lighthouse. Great trip for the afternoon. Don't take the kinds.

The Beach Club Bistro. Not enough in the Kitty for Doyle's, no problem , the Beach Club at the Watson's Bay Hotel is excellent value and full for lunch on a Wednesday following Easter.Great quality fresh prawns oysters and bugs.

Beautiful Bay. Stopped off here on our Island hopping tour. A very popular and pretty bay. Has plenty of facilities, shops, cafes restaurants. Although it was extremely busy we managed to find a table for six people and ordered fish and chips from a Doyle's cafe. They also have a restaurant if you wanted something more upmarket. We had to catch our ferry so did not have time to sample the beach, would certainly return here again to spend a day here.

brilliant views - well worth a visit. I caught the ferry from Manley and had a brilliant afternoon exploring. Saw pelicans on the beach, brilliant views, enjoyed the Gap and found a great place to eat.

Beautiful Scenery. We took the ferry to Watsons Bay en route to Manly. We had lunch at Doyles and then took a walk around the bay for approximately 2 hours which was about enough to see what we wanted to see. Worth visiting and you can re-board the ferry to travel to Manly doing both in one day.
A MUST SEE. When you pass the restaurant and go up the hill, there is a little trail that borders the coast... there was some spectacular views.

Stunning!. Ferry to Watson's Bay from Circular Quay is around a 30 min trip. Walk to the top of The Heads for fabulous views and sea air! The reward can be fish and chips on the beach or an ice-cream!!

My happy place in Sydney!. For many years, this has been my Sydney happy place. Sunsets over the water, boats in the bay, stunning waterside venues, and views of the city curtained by the cliffs... it is surely one of the most beautiful little seaside spots in the world. I highly recommend spending a long afternoon in the Watsons Bay Hotel beer garden, or - if you'd like to enjoy some very nice seafood as the waves lap at the shore just metres from your table - Doyles at the Beach.
Have a walk round the headland!. The fish and chips, the hidden bays, the colourful houses, the distant views of the city and the Gap.

take the water taxi there. Its a beautiful beach inlet on Sydney Harbour the taxi takes you right up the beach and you jump out. Doyle's seafood restaurant is at your doorstep great seafood though not cheap, yes a lovely day

A must!. This is a magical place...not to be missed. As much as we love Doyle's at 75 dollars for fish and chips it is overpriced. However, the hotel right next door is terrific. Has the same wonderful setting, great food at great prices.
