doyles Restaurant. take another fast ferry ride to Watson's bay. but if you want famous Doyles fish and chips do it in the day for the take away on the jetty. The Restaurant F&C were $47.00!!! and nothing flash. the service was pleasant but very slow. waited for ages for our first wine. and it was not that busy. So if its in the evening make sure you are cashed up and not in a hurry

Wonderful Wild Seas and Great Views. The title says it all. Well worth the very (fifteen) short water trip with some nice hilltop walks and parkland.Worth considering taking the bus back to Sydney for some differing scenery.

Wonderful half day trip. Once the home of sailors, fisherman and harbour pilots Watsons Bay is a great half day trip from the city. Go by ferry, have lunch and a walk around South Head to see the lighthouse and amazing harbour views. At "The Gap" you have the harbour on one side and the ocean on the other side.

Close to the South Head. What a lovely place across the harbour from Sydney. Lovely views, walks, dining and just relaxing. Downside is that the ferry finishes earlier than you would expect and if you don't have a car, the buss takes forever to get back to the CBD.

Great place for fish and chips. Along with friends we walked from Rose Bay to Watson's Bay, some of it was by the road but a good part of it was on the coastal path, with great views as we approached the Bay.Once there we felt that we had earned the fish and chips that we got from Doyle's Fish Restaurant and ate these on one of the many picnic benches that were placed in the shade of the trees on the adjacent grassed area.The beached looked very clean and there were plenty of people swimming as well. In all a very good place to visit and spend time relaxing ,( and eating the fish was delicious )

One of the best places for Tekkers, photographers, party goers. I have travelled to Watson's bay few times, because everytime I felt I missed something. Sea food at the Watson's bay wharf or a trek along the hills or stopping for photographying, the entire experience is good. I think this is a good place to take someone on a date. Far away from city noise. This place is in number 1 position for me for relaxing on a weekend. Good transport form Sydney harbour.

One of the most beautiful spots on Sydney Harbour. You have a choice of Doyles beautiful seafood restaurant, Doyles Pub with outdoor seating as well. Also Doyles take away fish and chips. Glorious curving sandy beach with backdrop of the city skyscrapers in the distance. Travel here by car, ferry or water taxi. Not to be missed.
Beautiful and Peaceful. Watson's Bay is beautiful with a pathway for coastal walk. It has many beaches including a Nude beach-Lady Bay. It is connected by ferry or Bus network from Circular Quay.
Quick Trip. Watson Bay is a quick trip from the Circular Quay by ferry. You can also hit Doyle's for some fish and chips. I didn't have time to check the shops but it seemed very peaceful there.

Fantastic Fish and Chips!. If you are a lover of fish and chips, then make the trip to Watson's Bay. We ferried over, at lunch and ferried back. Watson's is a beautiful spot. There is not much to do, but definitely worth the trip. The ferry ride was beautiful and relaxing and the food at Doyle's made it worth the trip!

Surprising views. We took the Hop-on-Hop-off boat tour and Watson's Bay was one of the several locations we took advantage of. As soon as we got off the boat we saw Doyles! We were told that if you go to Watson's Bay this was one of the places to go to for good seafood! Well, we ate at the Harbor just before we got on the boat, unfortunately and couldn't take advantage of this opportunity, so for us, please give it a go! We've heard it is well worth it! Moving on to the island.....the guide on the boat mentioned to be sure to go to the far side of the island, but didn't really tell us what to expect! Well you are in for a treat! Follow the sidewalk up to The Gap fore some absolutely gorgeous views! Completely different landscape from the side you come in on. Over thousands of years the limestone has been eroded by the waters coming in from the Tasmanian Sea and has created some breathtaking views. Looking back the other way you see Sydney in the distance. Well worth spending a few hours here walking around and perhaps having a frozen yogurt in the park. A beautiful place to enjoy!

Could be a brilliant cliff walk. Sadly, the cliff side walk is scruffy and unfinished, with bits closed off, and rubbish lying about. A sign says that it should have been completed in Sept 2013 but far from completed in march 2015 when we visited. Pity as this is a lovely place with a great history and fabulous views. Would not go again until this walkway sorted out

Like a little village. Watsons Bay is great to just walk around for a few hours. Great places to eat. So don't have breakfast before you go. There is a lot to see. We only gave ourself 3 hours to eat and walk around. Could have spend longer there.
Go by boat. Get a ferry from circular quay and have a fish and chip meal on the waterfront at "Doyle's". Not cheap but well worth it!

Gorgeous bay with view to the city. There is so much to do here! Enjoy a walk up to the Gap and surrounding walkways for great views. Picnic with your own food or taken away from Doyle's. Eat by the water at a selection of 3 of Doyle's eating locations, with varied price points. Walk around to cam cove to enjoy a picnic, relax by the water or enjoy a swim at this gorgeous bay. There are a couple of pubs here too.

Watson's Bay. I loved the short ferry ride out to Watson's Bay from Circular Quay. Then there were plenty of cafes and eating places at the ferry area. I walked across the park and came across the wonderful cliff side views over the Sydney harbour and Heads. It was a good walk and then I came back to the ferry and it was easy to catch the 20 min ferry back. Very regular services. On Sunday it only cost me max of $2.50 on the ferries. Worth the trip

Perfect Spot. Such a great little bay with views back to the city. Bay is quiet, with only the ferries going back and forth every half hour or so. There are many eateries which I thought were over priced but had great food. Take the walk thru the park up to the Gap and South Head

Beautiful views of city skyline. A friend suggested I go to Watersons Bay at around sunset as they views back on the harbour and bridge were spectaculor. I wasn't disappointed - it was beautiful. I also walked behind watsons bay to Gap - which is a pretty coastal walk.

Doyles on the Beach. March/April 2013. Doyles is expensive ( let me cover that one straightaway) I went for a treat. Bucketlist stuff. The beach is lovely though I had a paddle and really enjoyed that.
Beautiful tranquil spot. Don't be spending a fortune in Doyles, bring your own picnic on the beach in this fantastic location. A lovely tranquil area to while away the hours.

COLOURFUL STOP ON A FERRY RIDE. To kill a bit of time we took the Ferry for a few stops before alighting at Watson's Bay.
Like a lot of the little bays dotted around Sydney Harbour it is colourful, has a number of restaurants the best know of which is Doyle's.

Great Harbour Trip. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay - There is a famous place called Doyles where you will see celebrities and a fab pub called the Watsons Bay hotel- you can not go to Sydney and say you have seen it all until you go to Watsons bay- A short walk from the pub takes you to the ocean cliffs on South Head
Watson's Bay. It's a very relaxed place to stay, with beautiful houses and yachts at the bay. The best resto is said to be the Doyle's. the park is very quaint and clean. The gap is so so nice too.

Great place for lunch after a beautiful ferry ride!. Went to Watson's Bay on the advice of a local It's a beautiful and serene suburb. Had a wonderful lunch at Doyle's, and still had time to take another ferry to Manly Beach. You can't go wrong here!
Take the Ferry. Lovely Ferry trip followed by a lovely walk around the last bay before the mouth of Sydney Harbour. Great little cafe's and beach.
Lovely. What a perfect spot, so beautiful, the views through to the harbour are wonderful, full of boats and yachts, lovely places to eat. The perfect place to sit and take in the surroundings.

Watson's Bay. Watson's Bay is a quaint little fishing village. I expected to see many little tourists shopping stores, but there were none. They have nice paths that go around the Bay. There is a lot of history when you walk the paths and nice beaches.

THE GAP!. Caught the ferry to Watson's Bay and walked the short distance to The Gap and further south to the ship wreck site. Amazing coastline and could just imagine being there when the Sydney to Hobart yacht race begins!

Check Ferry times!. We cycled out from Sydney via Bondi to catcha ferry back from Watsons Bay. We got there at 5pm and last ferry had gone so we had to cycle back before it got dark and so missed our fish and chips at Watsons Bay famed chippy!

Day Trip. Ferry ride to Watson's Bay, walk to The Gap, took a few photos would have loved to walk more but a bit warm. Lunch was at 'Doyles on the Wharf' (the takeaway, not the restaurant) - excellent food, a beautiful day spent with family and friends :)

Pretty. Watsons bay is a small bay but very pretty.
It has a lovely view of Sydney's skyline.
It has a famous fish and chip shop and you can sit and while away the hours with no problem at all.
It has a play park for the children and a cordoned off outside pool.

Nice views. We arrived at Watson's Bay via the Ferry in the morning around 10am. Had a quick drink and bite to eat at Doyles and then to the beach for some sun. This beach is very tourist bound as it's the first beach you see when you arrive by Ferry, so there are lots of folks not dressed for the beach wondering around. The next couple of days we moved up to Camp Cove beach for more folks interested in sunning themselves. In any case it’s still a nice beach.

Beautiful views and a Little History, too!. My son and are are in Sydney for 9 days visiting some college friends and during the day we go on our own adventures. Today we had some time so we thought we would take the ferry to Watsons Bay. We enjoyed the walk out to the lighthouse (as long as you don't look toward the nude beach - there were two men posing for the tourists - just saying it seemed ....) We enjoyed reading the signs that described the history. Beautiful views!

Doyles fish & chips, Yummy!. Not a lot of shopping but it's a great little port for lunch. The much larger Doyles (with white linen tablecloths) is on the beach but the smaller little café on the docks has the same fish & chips in a more casual setting. Difference? On the docks $14 on the beach $40. Adjacent to a cute little park, tea house, ice cream shop and marina area. Just a great little lunch stop.

our favourite beach. This is delightful. We came here for safe swimming, peace & great fish & chips.There is a really good cafe, which serves brekkie, child friendly & brilliant for a veggie.Opposite is a safe swimming pool, fenced off by netting, and if you keep walking along the path to the left, you'll find a secluded beach.Heaven.
Beautiful. Buzzing food, bar area when you get off ferry but once you move away from this to the head land absolutely amazing views and good signed walks. Nice beach too for a paddle or swim.
Bay visit. Lovely place for a day out. Either get the ferry from circular quay or the bus from Bondi junction. Great scenic views and small beach area.

great food with a view. this is a place you have to visit at watsons bay. awesome food and an amazing view of sydney harbour. has a great atmosphere and great for families, couples and groups of friends to enjoy

Very good place for healing my body and spirit. It was a great time to stay in the bay area and walk through the load on the Gap park.I could see beautiful landscapes on the way of going up to the Gap park (placed a bit higher than the Watson's bay ferry station). A cliff which you can see at the Gap park is great. Don't forget to enjoy the "fish and chips" in the Doyles restaurant nearby the ferry station.

Beautiful bay in Sydney Harbour. Take a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. Before eating at either the wharf or the Watson's Bay hotel (which is very popular and therefore busy) take a walk around to Lady Bay Beach.

Beautiful place to visit with family & friends. We visited this place last Sunday with friends. Nice place with to be visit, beautiful ferry wharf & big park with plenty of garden benches & play equipment for kids. Awesome view of bay from such a height scenic view.

great destination for seafood. If you only have a few hours and want a ferry ride and a seafood meal then this is the place to visit. Quite a few restaurants to choose from and the best views of the harbour and you are on the ferry for about 15 mins.After your meal it is a 5 min walk up the path to view the gap which is quite spectacular to see esp on a rough day, there is also a nice cliff walk you can do. If you have more time catch the bus to Bondi and then you can get a train back to the city.
Lovely little half day trip. A great place for having a picnic or takeaway fish and chips. Take your swimmers for a quick dip. Highly recommend going on the ferry as traffic and parking is terrible!
WHAT'S ON AT WATSONS BAY. The quiet relaxed park area and the view from the Gap, the walkways that you can go exploring further along the sea wall.

Beautiful Watsons Bay. We always visit this area and spend a few hours walking the area.We walked The North part last year and this year we discovered Sth of the Gap, very beautiful indeed.There is a cliff walk which goes for quite a few ks, we only did some of it but next year will do a lot more.

Pretty and relaxing with great views. Sydney harbour beach and eateries with a lovely park. Just magnificent views and nice walks. Sit in the park, take a picnic and enjoy. Or try one the cafes-Doyles pricey and overrated. Walk to the South Head of the harbour just a few 100 metres.

A pretty place to wander. Take the ferry over and make sure that you are hungry. There are several choices to eat - includingtwo Doyle's (bring a large wallet for excellent food) and an even more historic restaurant that served good fish and chips. Wander the back streets and round to Obelisk Beach - always interesting to people watch.
Nice beach. Loved this beach. Very clean. Had lunch at Doyle's restaurant. Very very expensive. Should have eatten at the Doyle's carry out on the wharf. Good there on a ferry.
Peace and Beauty. The beauty of the suburb. Sunset at Watsons Bay. Having Fish and Chips at the Doyle's is what you need to do. A place you sit and enjoy. Have food and forget the world. Beautiful

Worth a look.. We caught the train to Bondi then caught the bus to the beach, after lunch we caught the bus to Watson's Bay, there's a scenic path which goes along the cliff tops with great views of the ocean. We caught a ferry back to Circular Quay.

What a wonderful day trip. I took a taxi to Watson's Bay (via Uber) from Woollahra, and he was marvelous, dropping me at the top of the cliff-side area. I walked down the hill into town, and then to Doyle's. Took the ferry back to Sydney. Lovely lovely day.
Great Fish and Chips on the beachfront. Nice to catch a ferry to Doyles at Watsons Bay and have a leisurely lunch by the beach. A nice simple day out on a gorgeous Sydney Harbour

Great views. We liked the ferry ride to Watson's Bay. It is a quiet little bay and the famous Doyle's Seafood Restaurant is there. We walked along the top of the cliffs and the views were stunning. There is no shopping there. You can catch the bus back to the CBD to take in the other surrounding suburbs.

Well worth a trip.. Great little bay ... Doyles Restaurant truly great place to eat.
Beware ... the ferries back to Circular Quay finish before 5pm ... if you don't have a car then it is either taxis o a 40min bus ride back to CBD

Breathtaking Harbor. Amazing views and water colors. We went on a fairly overcast day and still had gorgeous views of the north and south harbor heads. Also looking back at the city was breathtaking. This has to be one of the most beautiful harbors in the world. So worth the trip, we went by ferry from Circular Quay then returned by bus (our choice) but the ferry was for sure the nicest trip. This is a must see when you are in Australia!
Nice Views. Nice ferry ride with beautiful views. Enjoyed a nice lunch but the shopping area was minimal from what I saw.
Nice walk. Good views bit more peacefull bit lacking on shelter on a hot day but worth for the views over city and coast
has to be done!. cliff top walks, and Watsons Bay's famous fish and chips. hop on the ferry for a lovely visit to a scenic lunch spot

Magic pure Magic. A ferry ride from Circular quay gets you to this Magical place a top feed of Fish & Chips A Beer to wash it down a walk up the hill offering the most stunning view of Sydney harbour, further on even better views outlooking the heads and the open sea. Returning on a longish but interesting bus trip via Bondi ( next time we will try a sun set run) to Circular Quay our most enjoyable journey is complete till next time in Sydney

Beautiful!. Take the ferry to this haven, have a snack and a drink and enjoy. A beautiful small island within easy reach of Circular Quay. We travelled with Captain Cook' s ferries and had a wonderful day.

Always on the'to do list'. I never go to Sydney with out visiting WATSONS BAY, it is a very pleasant ferry ride from the Quay, on arrival you have a choice of restaurants from the Doyes on the wharf, the Hotel which serves really good food, and the up market Doyles On The Beach Restaurant. Or you can sit and eat some take-away fish and chips whilst over looking one of the prettiest beaches,
Fabulous - well worth a trip.... Beautiful ... well worth a trip out... the ferry service is really easy to use and quite inexpensive...Loved it :-)

Happy visit to Watson's Bay. My husband and I together with our daughter-in-law and two young grandchildren enjoyed a lovely trip to Watson's Bay very recently.The westher was gorgeous,which helps to paint a rosy picture!,and we took the ferry from Circular Harbour and went straight to Dunbar House for a nice cup of coffee and a Devonshire Cream Tea!! Very nice too! Then we had a lovely time in the children's playground and walked around the lovely greensward.As earlier comments say--there are a number of very good restaurants here,well worth a visit!
Wow!. What a lovely place. Fish and Chips to die for and scenery to match. Big green adjacent to the sea front. Tiny wavelets breaking on a sandy shore
Beautiful. Another ferry trip out to this lovely bay, some great restaurants , so ideal if thinking of having lunch out. some lovely beaches and nice coastal walk!

Serene view busy surrounds.... Whether it be for a walk to camp Cove or to the Gap any visitor to Sydney should not miss this beautiful area of the east in Sydney. Great views and have to ensure a visit to the pub and consume a famous prawn roll ! Parking never easy on a sunny day so a bus trip from the city will give you a trip through some of the most expensive real estate in the country.

You just gotta!. I love this place. It used to be a sleepy fishing village but no longer. You can get ferries there from Manly or Circular Quay or get the local 324 & 325 buses from Circular Quay and the City.Yes there's Doyle's restaurant for pricey seafood but also the Watson's Bay Hotel (aka Watsons Beach Club or some such). Get there early as this place gets 'rammed'. Its a great place for lunch where you can drink and dine al fresco. It ain't cheep though!A must is to walk to Camp Cove Take your swimmers if you want to spend some time on the beach - safe swimming - or if you've left them at the hotel go onto Lady Jane Beach where clothing is optional), take the steps at the northern end and walk to South Head (a Mission:Impossible film had its baddie's lair here btw) and watch the boats on the harbour from the cliff edge. Wave to the seaplane as he flies over you to Rose Bay. See if you can see the white obelisks on the far side of the harbour and work out what use they have.Have fun. A great place to visit.

Stunning. If I ever left UK it would only be to live here!. We were taken to Watsons Bay by a local friend who lives in Bondi Beach. He suggested we eat lunch at the famous Doyles Restaurant. We did this and the fish was to die for. All seafood in Oz is absolutely fantastic and cannot be beaten. Don't miss it. We sat and looked across at the Sydney skyline (there is a ferry that will take you across to circular Quays). Then we went for a walk along the beach and were facinated to see trees at the top of the path that were so stunning we had to go and look. Some were 3 metres in diameter and the roots appear to come from about two thirds down the tree and grow above ground. Quite spectacular, my camera never stopped clicking. We then had tea and scones in a beautiful old property whilst we decided how to make our way back. We decided to go local and take the bus. Lovely trip, past a lighthouse. It took about half an hour and dropped us right at Bondi Beach where we headed for The Bucket List. One of our favourite haunts. (A bar and restaurant right on the beach. Serves everything from iced water - free - to jugs of sangria and everything inbetween. The food is also terrific) Check it out. All in all the perfect end to a truly perfect day.
crowded & pricey. We ate lunch there....all the food places were crowded and pricey, they even charged for ketchup. Not much to see also.

Respite & Relax with fish and chips at the beach. Watson's Bay is great for a quick getaway from the hussle and bustle of Sydney CBD. Take the quick Sydney ferry for a casual fish and chips lunch at Doyles take away and eat it sat on the front or in Robertsons Park overlooking the bay and with the city in the distance. There's some nice walks close by to take in the open ocean and cliffs of the headland if you need to work up an appetite or work off your dinner. Best arrive before the rush of lunchtime to get your place if you are sitting down at the Doyles restaurant, but why bother when it's a fraction of the price on a bench with a better view? Enjoy the simple pleasures.

Watsons Bay. We caught a Hop on Hop off boat to Watson Bay. A pleasant way to get there.
Walked to the Gap from the bay - well worth seeing. Had lunch a Doyles Seafood Restaurant. Very nice.

Pretty Harbourside bay. Best reached by ferry. a small harbourside bay where you can eat fish and chips on the beach or at Doyles Restaurant, or sit in the Watson's Bay pub for the whole day or evening. Very pretty and quite, although the weekends can be busy.

a great view but.... The Watson's Bay area has great views but amenities don't match it.
Having said that, if you want to enjoy a ferry ride out from Circular Quay and then lunch at Doyle's, its a nice touristy thing to do.

Sea, sun and fun. Catch the ferry there and return to the city by bus via Bondi. Spectacular trip both ways. The harbour views are iconic. The hotel is excellent for a meal or fish and chips in the park is as good. Walk around to Camp Cove via million dollar fisherman houses to its harbour beach or risk getting the gear off at Lady Jane beach which is an official no clothes beach. Walk further to do the fabulous North Heads loop with amazing views to the city, Manly and out to sea. The Gap near the wharf is a major tourist site.

Ferry to Watsons Bay and fish and chips at Doyles. A great little trip from Circular Quay, Sydney. Take local ferry to Watsons Bay. Get fish and chips at Doyles take away. Great feast. Take the walk up to the headland and then return to circular quay in the afternoon. A greatt rip for not much money. Good for singles couples, families etc.

Watson Bay - Fish & Chips @ Doyles (takeaway) and lovely walk!. Travel by Ferry to Watson's Bay on Sydney Harbour . Beautiful bay and a lovely small beach.Cheap options for food and YES it is a Doyles Takeway ...... so much cheaper than at Doyles Circ. Quays. Also a pub if that is your thing.Lovely walk to the Infamous Gap Cliffs overlooking the deep ocean. Also worth visiting Rose Bay which is the stop before Watson's Bay.When you travel back towards Circ Quays make sure you enjoy the view approaching the Opera House and CBD city lansdcape.

A great tourist spot. This is definitely a great place to visit. I've been there twice. When you get off the bus, you can start walk along the coastal line. Different scenery compared to other coastal line.
Lovely area and superb cove for a rest.. We arrived by boat and had a lovely walk to look at the ocean We then dropped down to a sandy cove with facilities. we enjoyed a peaceful few hours here.

Relaxing and Refreshing. The nicest way to Watson's Bay is by Ferry on Sydney Harbour . It is a quaint picturesque bay and small beach . For economy level there is a Pub near by for refreshments / food and a Take Away Sea food bistro on the wharf . One can walk to the Infamous Gap Cliffs overlooking the deep seas below . There are stairs involved . Eating fish and chips on a bench underneath a tree and listening to the sea lap across the shore whilst sea gulls keep an eye out for a feed is simple living . There are also a couple of convenience stores high up the park near the road and bus stops . Relaxing and refreshing .
How to view Sydney. The scenery is great - of the ocean from The Gap and of the harbour and the city from the park. Doyles Restaurant is the place to eat.

Best place to watch the sunset over Sydney. Best place to watch the sunset over Sydney. Take a table at the harbour club, order a nice cold beer, and watch the sunset.....
Travel there by bus from Bondi Beach or take a ferry ride. After sunset, take the bus back to downtown Sydney.

lovely spot. went to doyles for fish and chips, not cheap but worth every penny. Had john dory in light batter, best fish and chips every had. Lovely walk through the park to the headland. A definite must do when in Sydney along with the zoo

Loved it!. My wife and I spent a week in Sydney following a cruise around New Zealand and had been advised beforehand by our chiropractor - an Aussie - that we just had to visit Watson's Bay during our stay. Well, we did and we loved it. There is not much to it - some stunning views, a small beach, restaurant, fish & chip shop and cafe, and some coastal walks - but that is part of its charm. I did hear that there is now a nearby nudist beach but by the time we arrived I was too hungry to care!You can get there by car, bus or ferry (from circular quay) , a journey that takes approx. 30 minutes but we had spent the morning at Bondi beach, which is only a short bus journey away, and headed off to Watson's Bay to sightsee and enjoy lunch at Doyles, a famous seafood restaurant on the beach. The restaurant attracts a lot of hype but it certainly lives up to it as the atmosphere is delightful, the food (and choice) is fantastic and the service is all you would expect from a place with such a great reputation. It is pricey but, in my view, you get what you pay for here and we enjoyed a delicious lunch washed down with a bottle of wine for $127AU. A bit out of the way but well worth the effort.

Lovely part of Sydney Harbour waterways. Watson's Bay is very nice. The Bay is smallish and can be reached by road or by private boat or by commercial ferry (departing from Circular Quay - and other Sydney Harbour ferry stopping points). There are some good restaurants there, a hotel and some cafes and takeaway places along the foreshore. Views across the harbour are great from this area.The park is expansive and lovely to walk around and/or have a picnic. There are a few (marked) historic points relating to Sydney's early days of discovery and beginnings of European settlement.
Good.. A great view of the city and some nice walks in the area. There is one that will take you all the way round to Rose Bay you even cross over a rope bridge on the way. Great fish and chips.
Beautiful part of Sydney. Big shady trees, beach, picnic tables and Doyles for lunch. What more could you ask for? Great place to swim or sun bake and go for a walk.

The Gap at Watsons Bay. Take a nice ferry trip from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. Stroll through the park, past the shopping centre, to the gap Lookout for some great costal views of the Pacific Ocean.

too popular for my tastes. Great Location, picnic or take away in the park or beer garden in the pub. Only issue is the total lack of parking and the grid lock in trying to get around. Recent visit saw us parking 2kms away With all up hill on the return trip. Not great after a lazy afternoon drinking and eating

Gorgeous fish and chips!. Just love this trip on the ferry along to Watsons Bay - amazinglittle bay with the long established fish and chip restaurant at the ferry port - established from a little shed years ago and now a world famous eating place - walk around the area or just sit eating fish and chips overlooking the beautiful views.
wow. a must for any traveller to sydney as well as localssuperb viewsgreat pub or a visit to doyles on the beachwonderful walks & the ferry trip from circular key not to be missed
eat fish. beautiful fish & chips, tho dont be in a hurry to eat, they get very busy on the weekends, just relax & enjoy the view while you wait.

Must see for travellers. Take the ferry from Circular Quay out to Watson's Bay for a great experience. Just the ferry ride itself is spectacular and a cheap way to see other parts of the Harbour. Head to Doyles for some fish and chips overlooking Watsons Bay or dress up and head to Doyles seafood for a great meal.

A Ferry Ride, A Cool Drink & wonderful fish. There are few places in the world where you can take a beautiful ferry ride, enjoy a cool Chardonnay or a boutique Shiraz followed by some wonderful fish or lobster. For those not money conscious or wanting an experience, lunch or dinner at Doyles On The Beach is a real treat. Otherwise enjoy fish & chips from the kiosk and relax on the small beach or park bench at Watsons Bay

Worth a trip.. The trip to Watson's Bay is worthwhile for the experience on the ferry and the scenery in the harbour. Doyle's famous restaurant is grossly over rated and over priced. The hot chips are over cooked and the fish average. Very disappointing at extortionate rates with poor service. Bring a picnic! There are plenty of lovely spots to sit and eat and enjoy the view.

great food. caught the ferry there from circular quay, very crowded and returning had to wait for a ferry but it was a weekend and very busy during the week might be quieter. Quite a few places to eat fish and chips were yummy. we tried to get into the hotel but far too busy. Kids played in the park had a great time.

lunch and The Gap. a short ferry ride from circular quay to Watsons bay, leisurely lunch at the Pub or in the Park and a wonderful scenic walk near the cliffs overlooking Pacific ocean to the east adn back to the city to the west

Great family day. Watsons bay is well known for Doyle's restaurant and their fish and chips, we go there a few times a years as it is a lovely spot with playground for the kids, nice walks and very relaxed

Lunch at Watsons Bay. Drove from Eastwood to the Eastern Suburbs - through the CBD to Paddington (lovely lace work on the houses) on to Double Bay, Vaucluse (fantastic view of the Harbour) then Watsons Bay for fish and chips at the take away. You can sit in the park with your lunch a bottle of wine and watch the boats on the water - lovely.

Watsonville Bay. I have lived in Sydney all my life, and only now when I am moving interstate did I take the ferry to Watsons Bay, how beautiful is it, great food facilities, just depending what you want to spend. Just walk around at your leisure go up to the top to the famous Gap. quite an expenience
The Europeans would like this one. The fish restaurant on the beach - where you can have a swim while you wait for your order to arrive.....

Don't fall over the edge!. Watson's Bay is an interesting place to visit as there are some historical things located there. The Dunbar was wrecked off the Gap, the gap is a notorious place for people hurling themselves off the edge in an effort to defeat their problems (?), the Watsons Bay Hotel is a great place to eat, especially the seafood. The Royal Australian Navy have their facility, HMAS Watson up on South Head and there is the South Head Light House. It is the start of the coastal walk to Maroubra Beach.

So much to see and do. Such a beautiful spot. Don't miss the fish restaurant on the sand. It has an atmosphere all of its own - or jus a drink in the garden at the pub and watch the passing parade - bliss

The Fish and Chips are Amazing. The restaurant located on the ferry pier serves delicious and abundant fix and chip meals. Nice place to have a beer and some good food while watching the activities on the harbor. Always meeting very friendly Australians.

lovely walk. it was too beautiful foe words and the sad part was that we did not have time to visit the famous place there that serves excellent tea .maybe on the next visit.felt tired and thought it would never end as i had not realised we were going up and down hill .lovely place,lots of pics.
must see and eat at doyles. This is a highlight when in sydney. love the ferry trip out here from sydney harbour. and doyles onthe beach is very good. great spot for fish and chips.

Outstanding experience for visitors...... ....but not most jaded Sydney siders.Having lived in Sydney's eastern suburbs for a very long time, I can confirm Watsons Bay is universally loved by visitors to Sydney. Like a little enclave protected from the hustle and bustle that seems to impact most of Sydney.On a sunny day, there are no better experiences. The large park that adjoins the hotel and wharf is outstanding and always filled with kids, families and picnickers eating some fish and chips from the hotel. We generally take our kids early on a nice day considering parking is atrocious.The beach, being a harbour beach, is well protected and where we taught our children to swim and catch the small waves. Never crowded and always a joy.Heading east, the beach adjoining the RAN base is spectacular but better suited to adults. Being a little more exposed to the heads, the water can be choppy and rougher.The walk along the refurbished gap is absolutely spectacular. For the uninitiated, the posters advertising 'Lifeline' can be confronting and a constant reminder that this beautiful site is where some poor souls choose to end their visit permanently. However, if you can see past that, you will enjoy some of the closest and most spectacular views of the heads and the waves far below.We always finish a visit with a lunch at Watsons Bay Hotel, either in the fairly recently refurbished beer garden, which is convivial and usually packed on a sunny day, or at the adjoining Doyle's seafood restaurant. The pub is relaxed with greatly upgraded food quality yet family friendly and not overly pricey. Doyle's is pricey and despite it not being the best example of seafood in Sydney, I am yet to bring a visitor to Sydney here that did not fall in love with the location, literally steps from the sand.We sometimes use Watsons Bay as a launch point for exploring other parts of the harbour with the great ferry access it provides. 10 minutes on a ferry gets you to the CBD or to Manly so it's a wonderfully well positioned location.The only downside is the poorly available parking, which has been the case for the last 20 years. You'll also find some jaded Sydneysiders reflecting poorly on it - we have so many options to enjoy the water in Sydney it's not everyone's cup of tea. However, if the reaction from ever visitor I've taken is any gauge, it's a special location with something for everyone.
I just don't get it. everybody is talking about this place and i don't get it great view but the service is crap and the food is ok. i won't be taking guest here again

Lovely walk. Watsons bay is always a great place to have a walk and then a bit to eat. You can go upmarket but Doyles takaway is as good as you can get. Take the ferry over and catch the bus back to central quay

Very nice outing. We took the ferry from Circular Quay and got off at Watson's Bay, did the walk up to the lighthouse (easy, good footing, with a few stairs) and came back for a fish and chips lunch at Doyles.

Worth a visit. Went at the weekend and whilst bust around the harbour the walk around the lighthouse, accessed at the far end of the beach was quiet with a fantastic view. Some houses with a wow factor.
...a little gem, and great place to see Sydney Heads and enjoy fish & chips..... Views and vistas across the Harbour are good, behind are the views to Sydney heads....... entry to the Harbour

Lovely View. We used the Hop on Hop off ferry. Once on the island, we headed to The Gap. What a view of the cliff. We followed a path through some woods and again, we saw a lot of insects we never seen before. A nice little walk.

Great ferry ride for lunch. We caught a ferry to here and it was a great trip. We had a lunch at Doyles restaurant . Overlooking the water with a view of the Sydney skyline . You can eat in watsons bay at many cafe / takeaways . Nice walks too
ideal location. great place to kick back and have fun at the Pub or rest in the park. The parking on a sunny day is always very short so maybe catch the ferry or bus.

Like a charming fishing village of old.. I did not realized I was still on the mainland because it felt like we landed on an island since we came by ferry. A good place to walk, jog, explore. There were sailboats and yachts moored near the beach. Seafood restaurants were crowded with day trippers. I love the experience. The water must still be too cold, because nobody was swimming.

More Yacht than car. Visited watson Bay in noon and still it was plesant to be ther. Beutiful beach and lots of yacht park in bay than car near by. Beutiful houses surrounded with some has facility to go park yacht directly from their house.

Beautiful Bay with Great Restaurants. Watson's Bay is a great location for a short walk and good dining. Doyle's restaurant has excellent food and the harbor is very pretty. If you go, also take a short walk to the Gap Headlands for a view of the Pacific Ocean. It is reminiscent of the Cliffs of Moher.
Great view on the city. Took the ferry from Central Quay to Watson's Bay and enjoyed the ride as well as the view from the bay towards the city. It was not overrun as Bondi Beach.

Stunning. Doyle's Restaurant was the reason we went and thankfully we booked a beach front table as the line up for casual dining was large.The view back to Sydney is beautiful as was the various places to eat or drink at the Hotel. cant wait to go back have always wanted to go there.

Beautiful. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay and had a great day here- walked up to the Gap and the scenic cliff walk then spent the afternoon on Camp Cove- a lovely beach with great views over to Sydney- it was so good we didn't want to go anywhere else.

Lovely little bay. We caught the (fast!) ferry to Watson's Bay prior to catching the bus down to Bondi Beach and then undertaking the boardwalk down to Coogee. There's not a huge amount to do there, but you can walk up to clifftop for some terrific panoramic views of the ocean. It's a really idyllic location and the locals can count themselves very lucky (and presumably very wealthy) to live there!
Breathtaking views. We took a taxi up to Watson's bay and loved the views. It's a beautiful part of Sydney and we will go back but this time will try and get accommodation there.

Must visit for lunch. Take a ferry to Watson's bay and enjoy either a take away fish and chips looking at the stunning view of Sydney across the water. Or get a seat at Doyles and have a lovely seafood lunch with stunning views and great service. It is a must do trip when in Sydney.

Gorgeous spot to drink and watch the sun go down. Watsons Bay is very popular. It has lovely sunset views and we often go there in our boat and dine at Doyles for lunch. There is a lovely golden beach and calm water that is often clear and not too deep to wade in and have a swim or SUP board. An iconic Sydney spot and must visit. The lighthouse and ocean views up on the cliffs around the corner are not to be missed!

A lovely place to get away from the hustle and bustle!. This is a great place to go and enjoy some fish and chips and get away from the hustle and bustle from the tourist spots. It's a great place for family and friends and to hang out, and enjoy some sydney peace.

Lovely Beach. The ferry ride to Watson's Bay was hot and very crowded, don't expect to just hop on board, many people were left behind this weekend. But the Beach and bay is lovely worth taking the trip to visit

a quiet place. When you leaved bus the paths are just there. It's a very nice walk with great view points. The beach is small but quiet . If you want to have lunch there are only two restaurants which are very busy during week end. sea foods is good

Worth the ride. With a few hours to spare we found the trip over to Watson's Bay a perfect activity. We walked around the point to the light house past the nudist beach without being shocked and enjoyed the breath-taking views (not of the Nudists!) across to North Head. On return we lunched of fish and chips from the pub in the park. Important to note that Doyle's own the pub and the take-away but there seemed to be quicker service at the pub ...maybe because not too many people knew it does take-away. Overall it was a lovely day and we would do it again....
Fish and Chips. Watsons Bay is a great day excursion, ferry from the quay, walk the south heads, enjoy the great fish and chips on offer and relax as you return ti the heart of Sydney.

Hasn't lost its appeal. Watason's Bay remains a lovely spot to visit. New lookouts near the bus stop provide a wonderful view of North Head. The easy access by public transport (bus and ferry) is another plus and should be taken advantage of by tourists and others. There are a variety of small shops and cafes within walking distance which gives the area some sort of a village character.
Smashing to visit. Take the Ferry to here and enjoy a super seafood meal in Doyles Restaurant. Fab walk along the beach and all around.

Good to spot City form a distance. Good spot if you are looking for Sydney's scenery from a distance. You can see Opera House and Sydney 's bridge form a distance. Also they have a nice fish and chip shop, you must try.
worth a visit. Watsons Bay is very picturesque. A look at how the other half lives, very exclusive and great fish and chips when you get hungry

Take the ferry...have a meal at Doyles !. This is worth the trip to see the sights of Sydney harbour but stay long enough to have a wonderful meal of seafood at Doyles.
One of life's pleasures....

A quiet corner of Sydney Harbour. First off it is important to note that the trip to Watson's Bay by ferry is not for wheelchair users. We purchased our tickets and boarded the ferry and were not warned by the transport personnel of the problems we would encounter. When getting of at the Watson's Bay wharf we encountered several steps which were not wide enough to turn or wheel my sons wheelchair. Luckily there were a few of us and we managed to bounce the chair on and off these steps.Watson's Bay is a picturesque bay with a few specialty fish and chips shops and local stores. From the bay you can walk up to see the ocean and Sydney heads. The view is magnificent, but again not really suited for non electric wheelchairs. The ramps are quite steep and there are stairs throughout all the walkways.Take your time and ensure you stop at the anchor of the shipwreck, the Dunbar.The ferry leaves and returns to Circular Quay and will cost around $24 a person or less if you can get hold of an Opal Card.
Watson's Bay. Wow ! we were recommended by a friend to visit and so glad we did, a beautiful bay and within walking distance other bays to be found.

It has to be Doyle's fish restaurant. Alighting from our hop-on ferry, we decided to do the walk to the lighthouse at the extreme end of the peninsula, but found the directions impossible to follow. Not surprising, as this viewpoint had effectively been cordoned-off through seemingly abandoned footway repairs.Returning to Watson's Bay itself, we joined the queues for the obligatory fish and chips at Doyle's Restaurant - an experience well worth the wait.

Cute little spot and worth walk along cliffs. Watson Bay has a fish and chips shop that is magic. Get the fish and chips and walk up the road towards the ocean and walk up to the lighthouse. It takes about 2 hours round trip but the views are worth it.

A pretty ride on the ferry and a pretty bay,. We enjoyed our trip to Watson's Bay. There are nice walks when you get there and a small beach. The Doyles restaurants dominate the pier area. We ate at the restaurant overlooking the beach and thought it highly over rated and expensive. Suggest you have fish and chips at their pier location and don't be lured into the restaurant.
Lovely walk and tranquil too.. Loved the sea food in Watson`s bay, the town the beach, the cliffs and the kids loved the playground too. Shame I cannot live here.
Great place for lunch. Get a day ticket on the ferries and visit this for lunch at Doyles fish restaurant - and all the other trips from Circular Quay!

Beautiful picnic spot. Watson's Bay is one of the most beautiful spots in Sydney. When the weather is good, it's the perfect place to sit in the park with fish and chips. Expect huge queues at Doyles Bistro ( I think that's the name of the first restaurant you see when you get off the ferry) on the weekend, but it's worth the wait. Not the best or cheapest fish and chips in Sydney, but it's pretty good. Walk off your meal at The Gap - scenic cliff viewing area - across the road from the park.

Great beaches great fish and chips. Another Sydney must do, a fast ferry ride to Watsons Bay then fish and chips on the beach in the sunshine....great day out, then you can catch the bus to Bondi Beach...

a beautiful location to enjoy the harbour. Watsons bay is a great place to go for a walk along the harbour with the view from the top of the hill making the climb especially worthwhile. there are a number of good places to eat there especially Dawsons if you are a fan of fish and chips. THis is a great place to get to by ferry which gives you an interesting view of the harbour and as a trip from Circular Quey is definately something you should do when visiting Sydney.

Nice Beach. This was part of a Sydney city tour. The weather was overcast and cool (December) and not beach weather so not too much going on at the beach. However, it was a pretty area. There is a nice overlook to the ocean with beautiful views (take your camera). We were only there about 30 minutes as part of the tour so there may have been more to it than we had a chance to experience.

Watchout for the Nude Beach!. Driving all the way from the Northern side of Sydney Harbour to Watson's Bay wasn't as difficult as the general consensus would have you believe. Take the scenic route through Rose Bay and wind up the back roads to Watson's Bay and you'll see the streets lined with old limestone buildings built back in the 1800s. There is some magnificent history in Sydney, you just have to look for it.Get to Watson's Bay and good luck with finding a car park. There's not a lot of shops or the typical 'touristy' bars and things there, that's not to say there isn't a pizza shop and Doyle's Fish and Chips by the water is a popular spot, but people come here for the beach and the walk through Watson's Point.Walk through the park and then turn left past Doyle's. Keep heading in the same direction through some side streets and you'll find yourself at the little beach at the end of the road. It's a highly popular spot with the typical Sydney beach posers, but irrespective, it's nothing like Bondi. The water is clean and there's very little waves, so you can swim out into the depths without any major concerns. A really refreshing spot to cool down and absorb some sunshine.After cooling down at the beach, we decided to take the walk to the lighthouse. On the way I noticed another little beach, down what seemed a very steep cliff face. Upon looking further I started to notice the people down there…NAKED! Yep, all naked! A nudist beach! HAHA! I found one. Now as much as I'm all for the freedom to show your naked body, I wasn't quite prepared for all the bums and doodles and big bellies that beamed up at me in their naked glory, so I stepped up my pace and found myself looking across at Manly from the cliff face of Watson's Point. This whole area is really well maintained with lots of historical spots to read about on the way. The lighthouse is magnificent with it's red and white nautical stripes, and there are a heap of concrete trenches and gorges where old canons used during the war still lay. Quite a frightening reality to realise that Sydney had been invaded and it all got that close to our shores.Watson's Bay is a lovely day out, I recommend bringing a nice packed lunch and making a whole day of it. Taking your time to relax by the beach, have a light lunch in the park, then making your way along the path the winds you around the scenic view of the Point. A lovely place to visit.

Another gem. Watsons bay , is a really lovely area, with beautiful views , we were there on a really nice day so it was quiet busy , but very relaxed , great to see so many families enjoying their picnics in the little park , the jewel in the crown is the outstanding Doyles restaurant , yes it was a wonderful day at Watsons bay , well worth the visit , I would love to go there again ,
Family visit. Excellent trip to beach on ferry starts a remarkable day out with walks to the headland and a nice park overlooking the sea for picnics

enjoy the coastal view. this is one of the nicest neighborhoods I have seen. enjoy walking on the coast and see the oldest lighthouse from Australia. or enjoy a walk in the bay and have some lunch with a nice sea view.

Fish Fare Fit for a King!. Doyles Restaurant in Watsons Bay is a fish gourmet 's delight. If you arrive by ferry on a fine day you will have the most wonderful experience enjoying fine wines and delicious food served by pleasant and attentive staff. We were seated overlooking the harbour with spectacular views across the water to the city and beyond. Although there was a big crowd everyone was attended to in a timely fashion with smiles all round! A must do when in Sydney!
Worth a visit. Can get very overcrowded on a warm summer weekend but still worth a visit. On these days take a picnic rather than relying on any eatery
Lovely day out. Beautiful beach, great ferry trip and lovely lunch a Doyles, great family day. A must do when in Sydney.
Great Views. Really enjoyed Watson's Bay. Great views across to Sydney and on the other side to the ocean. Lunch at Doyles restaurant is a must. A highlight of Sydney.

Wonderful Views and great for a Picnic. We caught the ferry across to Watson's Bay which was a great start as long as you don't go on a public holiday! Very crowded! You have a choice of restaurant, pub or takeaway for food. The park is perfect for a picnic. Pick up a seafood boxed lunch from the shop at the wharf and relax with views across the harbour to the city. The park is great for kids too with plenty of space to run around and a great playground. Then walk off your lunch by heading up to The Gap and following the path up the hill to North Head for views across the entrance to the harbour. We have seen whales frolicking just off shore here! Lovely day out!

Just beautiful.... This is my favourite spot in the east... Worth a visit if your in Sydney! Relax on the grass or the sand with veiws of the beautiful blue waters and the city skyline the back ground, or get active & do the coastal walk, stunning views! Finish off at Watsons Bay hotel for a cold beer & food, my perfect Sunday afternoon!

Lovely place, with a nice walk to the lighthouse. This is a short ferry ride from circular quay and is a lovely trip. The bay itself is very cute with some very good restaurants nearby. The walk to the lighthouse is nice and easy, although if you have young children, it's not really suitable for pushchairs unless you're happy to carry it over lots of stairs and steps....

a great place to spend half a day. Watson Bay is definetly a place to go while in Sydney for scenic view over the ocean but also to the bay. The oldest light house in Australia is also close by so definetly a great place to go.

Pretty place to visit. We took the ferry from circular quay and it only took 20 minutes. Lots of young families appear to enjoy the beach location to take their children for a swim. Lovely park to sit under a shady tree with a picnic or to eat your fish and chips from Doyle's take away. There is a rather lovely looking tea house at the end of the bay and we tried to get a table there but it was busy. We took the bus home to our hotel near Hyde Park. That was an interesting ride as you got to see lots of harbour side houses and suburbs. It takes about 40 minutes but the bus is air conditioned and comfortable.

Great for the start of the boat race. The Sydney to Hobart boat race starts on Boxing Day just near Watson's Bay so we took the ferry over there and walked out towards the headland. Watson's Bay itself is a nice little place with a couple of restaurants - apparently Doyles is the best fish and chip place but we didn't try it out ourselves. We found a great place to view the race and would come back the next time we are in Sydney to walk on out to the headland and the lighthouse. We used the normal ferry which gave us wonderful views of Sydney Harbour, the Bridge and the Opera House. The ferry crossing was about 30 minutes. A lovely place for a day trip.

The best view I found in Sydney!. I visited here on advice from trip advisor reviews. The view is just delightful, really really amazing. The tip is to go in the late afternoon before the sun sets and you will get the most wonderful sunset photos of Sydney as the sun actually sets behind the skyscrapers and bridge in the distance from where you stand. Another tip, the fish and chips here on the wharf (I believe they are famous doyles brand) are wonderful and not too expensive either! Grab yourself some fish and chips, have a picnic in the park here, then walk up to the lookout for those incredible sunset views. Whatever you do do NOT forget your camera!

Hobbart to Sydney - 26th December 2015, the view from Watson Bay. A good warm day with clear blue skies. Doyles fish n chips so good. The viewing points above the Watson Bay village was also good , although crowded , as the "maxi-yatchs" headed out to sea and southwards to Hobart. This is an annual event which "Wild Oats" won for the 8th time.Took the bus to the venue and the ferry back to the ferry terminal. Daughter who is currently in Sydney organised it so my wife and I had local knowledge. A wonderful day. Ikipa Tongatule

Cute bay/beach. It's a pretty beach and very near south head and The Gap. Very expensive area to live but with amazing city and water views. It also has one of the best seafood restaurants in town on the beach = Doyles.
Loved the view!. We loved visiting Watson's Bay, it has a few good restaurants and a nice walk along the beach! The Ferry ride is lovely and short.
Watsons Bay. Ferry from Circular Quay,Lovely beaches,Good walk to Lighthouse at entrance to Sydney Harbour. Superb restaurant/bar beside ferry terminal in Watsons. Its a must on Sydney visit.

Little known vista of sydney. A ferry trip to Watson's Bay and South head lighthouse is well worthy of doing. You take the ferry to Watson's bay and then walk out to the lighthouse which gives you a lovely vista out to Se through the headlands.

Top fish and chips at doyles on the bay. Go either by bus or ferry if by buss you get to see how the other half live via the streets of their waterfront mansions. We did both bus drops you right at the gap the you walk down through the park to doyles and the ferry back to the quay

TAKE A FERRY RIDE TO WATSON'S BAY. We took a ferry to Watson's Bay and then walked to the South Head. It is an easy walk and the views are amazing. There is a feeling of being well outside a big city at Watson's Bay which creates a peaceful environment. I can recommend the fish and chips at Doyle's to top off a great day.

Great location, but beware holiday crowds. Watched Syndey to Hobart race begin from Watson's Bay. Missed the last ferry from Circular Quay due to crowds so took the public bus which took about 30 minutes. Would recommend Watsons as a good half day trip for lunch or dinner from downtown Sydney.

Doyles didn't live up to the hype. Went to Doyles with huge expectations and to be honest we were all disappointed with the quality of the fish. Brilliant setting and a great day but very poor fish and chips

Ferry Ride to Watsons Bay. Its worth going just for the ferry ride over but once your there it's a great spot for a stroll, a beer or two and some food. Lots of good pubs and restaurants - well worth the trip.

Lovely cruise to Watsons bay for fish and chips. Great spot, lovely walks. We arrived by ferry from Circular Quay, they seem to run about every 30 minutes.
Had fish and chips at the famous Doyles, which were fantastic well worth the trip
Beautiful view and clear water beach. Very crowded beach, but its very beautiful. Hard to find carpark, and also during lunch time was long queue to order for food.

Perfect Day Trip From the City. We had such a gorgeous day here - walking along the cliff tops, looking at the many historic buildings & enjoying the cafes. The Beach Club right by the jetty is great fun, but Doyle's chippy is the real gem - less than $20 for a avoid fisherman's basket with chips, which is plenty for two to share :-)

Small little town. It’s a quite little town a bit far from Sydney and you could take a ferry ride to the place. This in itself is an amazing experience as there are so many beautiful sights all along and once you reach at the place there are so many restaurants and cafes that serves you the famous fish and chip which is also one of the must dos. The place had a different charm and gives you a quiet little vacation experience.

Beautiful town, excellent fish & chips!. The beach is not as picturesque as Bondi's but there's two things here worth visiting... First of all, make it to the view point to the Tasman Sea and the dramatic cliffs where so many shipwrecks took place. Secondly, Doyle's, the Fish & Chip shop. We tried the take away (but they have a place to sit with tables that is sheltered from the rain) and had to repeat, it's that good.

A beautiful spot to visit. If you are sailing around Sydney Harbour a must is Watsons Bay a beautiful resort feel about it with a lovely beach and good choice of bars and restaraunts along with the famous fish and chip shop right on the pier, have some then sit under a shady tree in the park across the street. LOVELY

I wish I'd lived here. This place is so amazing..calm, peaceful, quiet...you can go by ferry in 20-25 minutes. Have some drinks at the bars or cafes or have a picnic. Such a beatiful place to visit. We went to Watson's Bay on Boxing day and watched the start of the yatch race. It was perfect day to visit
Quiet little town a short ferry ride from Sydney. There are great look out points over the sea and a nice stroll around. Only a few shops but believe visitors mainly visit to go to Doyles Restaurant!

Fantastic view of the City. I caught the ferry here with my family in December 2014 after reading about it on Trip Advisor. It is about a 20 minute ferry ride with a scenic view all along the harbour which I guess is an added bonus. The Watsons Bay faces towards the city with the sky scrapers in the distance and offers a truly amazing view perfect for photography. We timed our visit to coincide with sunset (I recommend you do the same) and we got to see the sun set behind the city with glorious oranges and reds filling the sky. Very relaxing place with a nice little beach there also (although I didn't see anybody swimming it looked very clean). I can recommend this place to anybody visiting Sydney and looking for a nice day/afternoon out. There is also a park here and you can buy fish and chips near the ferry terminal and have a nice picnic in the park.
A Good Place To Visit. Watsons Bat provide an interesting part of the harbour and with only a short walk you can see the Pacific Ocean and The Gap. Also there is a walkway to the South Head
where the harbour begins. What a beautiful location for lunch or picnic. You can use hop on hop off ferry to visit this place and walk to the top for the views.

Beautiful place. I got on the ferry to watsons bay, on recommendation In my travel book, and I was not disappointed at all. There is a lovely feel to the place and a short walk from the ferry is a lovely beach called camp cove which had amazing views of the Sydney skyline. I would recommend a trip there to anyone travelling to Sydney... It's not bondi or Manley but I loved it.

Entrance to Sydney Harbour. Lovely place for a stroll around looking at some of the best views in Sydney. There are a couple of small beaches (one of which, Lady Jane Bay, is a nudist beach). A few steps to negotiate up to South Head but the views are just stunning.Watson's Bay is still the home of the naval base HMAS Watson.Walk around to the infamous "GAP" and think about all those poor souls who have ended their lives there.There are plenty of information plaques and also the actual anchor from the wreck of the Dunbar" whose captain mistook the Gap for the entrance to Sydney Harbour.Lots of nice restaurants including the famous Doyles but a good pub and take-away food as well.The pleasant ferry ride to and from Circular Quay just tops off the experience.
Famous Fish&Chips. We love Watsons bay,very well known for its famous Fish&Chips been there about 8 times now would recommend this place so relaxing

Watson's Bay for an afternoon. We caught the ferry there and back, always a wonderful way to travel. The place is so pretty and a good way to get away from the business of the central Sydney area - even on holidays one needs a break from hustle and bustle. The fish and chips were heavenly and we walked around the South Head and then up to the Gap. Our teenagers enjoyed it too. Bring your bathers for a swim at the pretty nearby Camp Cove.

Perfect Summer destination. Watsons Bay is perfect for those who would like to experience Sydney Harbour and take the ferry from Circular Quay. You can stop and have a pub lunch or an more upmarket lunch at Doyles (reservations required). There is a little beach for young children to paddle in and you can walk from her to see the surrounding suburb which has great views back to the city and out to the ocean.

See the "GAP". Travel by Sydney Ferry to Watsons Bay and take the scenic walk up to the Gap and surrounds. Return to the Hotel or Restaurants for a seafood meal whilst looking out at waterviews. Return to the City by Bus where you travel through many suburbs.

A stunning place to visit!. Board the ferry from Circular Quay and head towards Watson's Bay. If the sun is shining and sky is blue, this is a fantastic place to visit. As you walk along the small jetty from the ferry, you are greeted by golden beaches and gentle waves lapping against the shore.Take a walk around the area. Turn left along the beach from the ferry and meander up the back lanes following your way around to the other coves located further around from Watson's Bay. Be sure however to book yourself a table at Doyle's Restaurant for the 12.00 noon lunch time and head back that way for a delicious meal. The food is pricey but worth every cent. If you are lucky enough to get a table overlooking the water you are in for a real treat.
Good Place to Visit. Really liked this area in Sydney - get away from the mad rush in the city. Top views and laid back atmosphere. Nice cafes and restaurants around.

LOvely place to stop over for lunch and an afternoon stroll. Watsons Bay is a decent spot to stop over for fish and chips (apparently very famous and long standing). So we decided to stopped over for a short stroll and lunch from our Hop-On-Hop_off cruise tour.It has a nice little playground between the jetty and Gap Park, where our daughter had a lot of fun on the slides and swings.Gap Park (furtrher up the path) also offers very scenic views, both of th ocean as well as the city at a distance.

Another very good attraction. For me, the top walk in Sydney is Coogee to Bondi Beach. Ball's Head is another personal favorite of mine. But Watson's Bay is great, too. It's accessible by ferry (as well as by bus), there are wonderful views and great walks (I really like South Head).

Nice Views. We came to Watson's Bay on a rainy day so we didn't stay for a long time. Parking was a bit hard to find too despite the weather. The park and the beach are nice for picnic and a day out in the sun. Remember to walk across the street to see the beautiful view of the cliffs!

The best one!. I love the view of the cliff and also the view from harbor park. The place is easily accessible, get on the ferry to watson's bay and you'll be there! It keeps making me miss Sydney because of the absolute beauty of the view and the beach. Must-visit place.

A bit hot and dusty. The fish and chips was delicious but there isn't anything very comfortable to sit on when its hot. The ground under a tree was dry and dusty, would have been great have more seating.
Watson's bay. A beautiful beach only 15 mn away from the Circular quay by boat. I recommend the walk to the lighthouse and a lunch at Doyle's (you must reserve a table beforehand)

Book Doyle's at Sunset. It is a bit far from city, approx. 40mins by taxi which costs $50. Doyle's is facing to the beach and you can overview the city across the beach, which is fantastic! To be very honest, you may not be excited with the food, but it is still worthwhile to spend an evening there!You don't have to worry about your return trip. Doyle's can organise your return taxi.
Great views of coast and city. Fast cat ferry from Circular Quay, then you are close to walks and cafés, famous Doyle's and views galore. Good day or half day trip.
Great little drop zone. This is a very quaint place and has fantastic fish and chips.. Nice place to wonder and hang. Watching the boats and the scenary with all the boats is wonderful.

What's at Watson's. Christmas lunch and what a spot. My friend arranged get to gether here. Brilliant location can swim paddle board eat drink and be merry in the sunshine. Food's good and it feels normal here to drink champagne pre 12noon.. My kind if spot ;) good atmosphere casual and energetic vibe.
Love this place. Been there 3 years ago and went there again in our last visit. Do walk the Heritage Trail and the Cliff top Trail when you're there.

It keeps calling us back. A good destination with food, views, beaches and swimming but also a good stepping off point for a long cliffe walk to Bondi, South head for the view, or a walk along the harbour coast line (partly residential but good to see houses that are in our dreams.

Go at Sunset for the most amazing views!. Went here after reading about it on Trip Advisor and wow what a great place. You just catch the ferry here from Circular Quay (they run quite regularly but not super regularly). There is a lovely peaceful beach here also a park where you can eat fish and chips from the nearby fish and chips shop (I got the grilled fish highly recommended) but the best thing about this place is the VIEW. Lovely view looking to the City with the harbour bridge there in background. Tip - make sure you go in the late afternoon and you may well get the most incredible sunset setting over the city. Lovely for photos!!! Definitely recommend this place!
Stop Over. You can take a Sydney Ferry to Watson's Bay from Circular Key. There you can swim, shop and walk getting a birds eye view of Sydney Harbour. Nice place to have breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Great scenic view of the head. This is well worth the trip , can catch a ferry or a bus , as you see a lot of sights , the view is amazing , and there is the what sons bay hotel , Doyle's for seafood and if feel like a swim Camp cove or for the nudist Lady Janes beach, can spend a whole day there very easily

Best place in Sydney. If you are coming to Sydney get to Watson's Bay any way you can by bus, ferry, seaplane or car. This is just the best part of Sydney Watson's Bay Hotel for accommodation and great fish and chips for lunch, a huge Robertson Park with play area and of course great ocean swimming pool.We regularly visit Watson's Bay you can take a picnic or plenty of places to grab something to eat. Ferries come in regularly so there are surges at food outlets, so timing is everything. Car parking is limited and fills early in the day in Summer. Short walk up to the Gap with great views of the Ocean and back over toward Sydney Harbour Bridge. Don't forget to duck into Watson's Bay Anglican Church for the lovely stained glass windows.Just the best place sit relax and enjoy the best of Sydney.
Worth the ferry ride. Wanted a few hours out of Sydney one Sunday so hopped on the ferry and had traditional fish and chips at Doyles. Very pleasant. Walked to the Gap and then back to the ferry.

Short trip from Sydney. I popped over to Watson's Bay for breakfast before departing Sydney. Getting there is an easy c.15 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay (ferry route 7) and one can use a pre-pay Opal card (just don't forget to tap out....I learned this the hard way!)Once in Watson's Bay, you'd find a small, quaint neighbourhood with a beach and a few restaurants. There appear to be a couple of options to eat ranging from nicer (Doyles) to the Beach Club.Overall, if you have a couple hours to kill and you want to "get out" of Sydney, it's worth a look.
Beautiful. A lovely place with a nice beach and a 10 minute walk takes you to Camp Cove which is great for swimming. Really nice houses in this area.

Always a place to visit. If you live in Sydney or just visiting, you should spend a few minutes travelling to this part of Sydney, it has almost everything, that a tourist would want, sand, water, wonderful views , friendly places to eat, large free parks, places to swim, large ocean vista's to admire, public transport, history, and the list goes on and on, I have lived in Sydney all my life and never get tied of visiting this beautiful part of Sydney Australia, I do warn you that my admiration for this place is not mine alone, and weekends are very busy, but Public transport makes it easy to get to.There are two famous places to eat Doyles and The Watsons bay hotel, both a little expensive but both worth a visit, this place is perfect, to take visitors too.

A must do day trip - suits all budgets. I always take any interstate and overseas guests on a day trip to Watson's Bay. Get the ferry over from the city which is a lovely experience in itself, walk out to South Head or at least up to The Gap, depending on the budget grab takeaway fish n chips to enjoy in the park, or join in the atmosphere at the Watsons Bay Hotel. My US guests were shocked when a 'pitcher' of beer and 4 x fish n chips came to $125... but it's good food, fast and fun. Next step up is Doyles on the beach which we recently enjoyed very much for a milestone birthday. So probably the great thing about Watson's Bay is that there is an option to suit all budgets (bring a picnic and enjoy the park and a walk!). Safe swimming options and lovely to see the boats and beautiful homes too. I love this day trip, over and over again.

Great spot for lunch and walk. Caught ferry from Circular Quay late Sunday morning, enjoyed beautiful views of the harbour, bridge, opera house on the way out to Watson's Bay. Took around 30 minutes with one stop on the way. Thankfully, had booked well ahead for lunch at Doyles on the beach, so were seated immediately and enjoyed wonderful seafood lunch overlooking the beach with Sydney in the backdrop. Interesting and easy 1 hour walk after lunch around the headland, past the lighthouse, then the ferry back to town. Great way to spend a few hours on a sunny Sunday - or any day for that matter!

Pleasant day trip on the water. Take ferry route 7 from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay - you can have lunch or dinner and then a walk along the beach and see the Gap (cliffs overlooking ocean). Get an Opal card for easy ticketing.

Old favourite. Something for everyone, cheaper eats on the pier and takeaway options or medium hotel lunches plus extravagant lunches at Doyles' on the beach. Doyles' has been our favourite and special place for decades, not just fish & chips but sensational really fresh seafood and great service. Jeff has been there looking after us for over 25 years! If you sit near the beach you can opo in for a dip between courses.Wonderful.
Cute. little town.. not much there except couple eats & the chipper. Worth visiting and walking up the park to other side to see the ocean.

Lazy lunch. Great place for a lazy lunch. Choose between fish and chips at Doyle's or hang out at the Watsons Bay Pub. Good food and any place on the beach has to be a good choice right? Good spot for meeting up with friends and you never know who you might see there.

A must do, especially if you love seafood. Love the boat ride to Watson's Bay and the real Mccoy Watson's Bay Doyles Seafood restaurant - the food is amazing, try the stuffed king prawns - the scenery is great and the service was lovely. Or if you are on a budget there's always fish & chips at the Doyles Cafe Restaurant on the side of the peer.

Love this place. So pretty and heaps to do and see from restaurants with views, to beach access and cliff walks with fantastic views, shopping a little on the exclusive side but fun to do. Worth the trip over to look around, very scenic and peaceful.
Doyles for Lunch. Go every year and is always a great spot for lunch and a cold beer. Food is second to none I always try something different never diappointed.

Beachside fun!. A great escape to the iconic beach. Take a 30 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay. Enjoy fine dining at Doyle's, fish & chips on the beach or socialise at the Watson's Bay Boutique Hotel's incredible Beach Club. Seafood is a must (platters, buckets of prawns or delicious oysters in the half shell) and cocktails will help pass the time.

A perfect spot to see the start of Sydney Hobart. Watson's Bay celebrate Sydney Harbour Entrance. Its a great spot to come on boxing day to enjoy the start of Australia's most notorious boat race. It may be crowded but you can get there by ferries, boats, cars or public transport. its just a few minutes from South head cliffs,just have a family picnic in the Park or try the pub for a beer and some BBQ food . Perhaps ,you may prefer a fish and Chips on the wharf or a more sofisticated lunch at Doyle restaurant. Dont forget to bring your swimmers and try the local harbour swimming pool ...

Visit this old Sydney icon. When in Sydney, take a round trip on the Cicular Quay to Watsons Bay ferry/ Catamaran - all part of Sydney' s magnificent harbour.You'll get to see the lie-of-the land, from the water's edge, as you traverse a large part of Sydney's Eastern Suburbs. You could even do your own 'Hop-on-Off' ferry-bus trip, and have a typical Australian feshly made 'Fish and Chips' meal while you're there Mind you, you'll have to watch out for the unashamed Seagulls, that are just looking for a quick snap and grab of your chips, when you're about to eat some yourself! You can also walk another 50m. to the relaxed atmosphere of the Watsons Bay Hotel - a real family pub. You can sit there for a while, enjoying a varied menu from Doyle's family fish restaurant and taking in the beautiful surrounds, before heading back to the rest of your vacation.
BIRTHDAY PARTY. My great niece's 2nd birthday at the Watson's Bay Hotel. Had a lovely time. The scenery was wonderful. We have a great time.

Hopped on the ferry from Circular quay / SYDNEY. hopped on to have a great ride over to the beach walked up towards the lookouts ,then to see the light houses, Was a Saturday a several weddings were taking place. good job it was fine weather and you could see for miles /Kms. Interesting watching all the boats in the harbour plus plate planes flying around .Great day out .. Make sure you check timetables for ferry as they can get very busy , and you might have to allow extra time to catch one back to Sydney.

Spectacular views. Just a short ferry trip from circular quay you not only get to see the harbour but once you arrive its a short walk to some of the best cliff top views in the country. Do miss out on getting the fish and Chips at the hotel.

Good sea food. Liked the meal at Doyles on the beach at Watsons Bay. You can just see the Sydney skyline in the distance. Easy ferry ride from CBD and have a relaxing meal at Doyles- the best seafood.
watsons Bay. Doyles is the place to eat and drink and swim. Food great wine lovely if a little expensive A once or twice a year visit for a special occaision.

Worth the trip. Watson's Bay is a fantastic little bay with great views and great food home to the best fish and chips every right on the foreshore close to the ferry wharf.Take a walk past Lady Grey nudist beach and up the lighthouse for even better views then follow the walkway down to the Gap a fenced off cliff with dangerous rocks and surf. Many have jumped to their death from here. Take the fast ferry to the bay not the bus if you can.
lovely place to eat. lovely place for walks then have a seafood lunch lunch at the hotel Watson bay over looking the beautiful sparkling water.sample the aussie beers
Great seafood. A great place to go by ferry, and then have a lovely seafood meal at one of multiple Doyle's Seafood outlets.

Great place for a swim, a beer and something to eat. Its a great place that you can see the city from, but its a million miles away. The pub has been redone and is fantastic for food and a drink or two. The beaches are harbor beaches but they are usually less crowded than there eastern suburbs counterparts. Parking is a pain though so if you can get one, keep it.

Fun. We took the Hop-On Hop-Off ferry and it was a beautiful ride to a beautiful place,even a single seconds was enjoyable. We wandered around the bay - there's a lot of historical places to explore.Definately,nice place to visit

A pleasant day out. Having only arrived in Sydney the previous day, we were keen to do some gentle sight-seeing. Someone from the UK had recommend a fish restaurant in the bay, with meals to die for. The barracuda and chips was supposedly priced at 30 Australian dollars (about £17) which is a lot to pay for any meal, let alone fish and chips. However we set off for the ferry but being typical newbie holiday-makers, fell for the first kiosk advert we saw. It cost 174 AUD for 4 of us to catch the (hop-on-hop-off) ferry to Watsons Bay.
