(We later discovered the "locals'" kiosk where tickets can be purchased for 12 AUD.) So this was already a dear do. When we reached the bay, we found the chippy meal had jumped to 42AUD in the restaurant but to buy from the its sister take-away on the pier was only 18 dollars. Needless to say, we chose the latter. Watsons Bay is wealth worth a visit - just make sure you get the right ferry. It's a lovely place to walk round and have a picnic.

Beautiful, fun place. We took the Hop-On Hop-Off ferry and it was a beautiful ride to a beautiful spot. We wandered around the bay - there's a lot of historical, scenic places to explore - and ate at one of the overpriced restaurants. Certainly is a nice place to visit.

keep yourself hungry !. We took a boat trip to visit manly beach from Sydney and stopped at watsons bay to try the famous fish and chips .It was very busy there and the wait was about 10 minutes but worth it .didn't sit at the tables there but took a short walk away from the bustle sat down on a wall with our feet on the sand and the water about 6 feet away and gorged ourselves on the said fish and chips very crisp and fresh and enjoyable .Weather was great and the boat trip from circular quay was price wise very reasonable

Nice Food and Great View from the Gap. As you arrive on the ferry (best way to get there), there is a cheaper takeout Doyle's restaurant, and also a nice beachside Doyle's with the linen table cloths. We ate at the takeout place, which still had a view and a bar. After lunch, we hiked up to The Gap, a high isthmus overlooking both the ocean and Sydney. What a view of both, with incredible geological formations.

Boat trip to/from Watson's Bay. If the weather is good you should take the ferry from Watson's Bay to Circular Quay. This is a nice scenic boat trip with great views of the city, the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge.
A bit dirty beach. Go just further to Camp Cove beach it worth the 10 minute walk. Watson's bay is busy, water dirty with boats.

Great views of Sydney and harbour area. Got a bus from Bondi to Watsons bay and returned to circular quay by ferry - was a nice day trip taking in Bondi beach and then here. Walked round the headlands at South head - great views of the ocean and sydney harbour. Nice place to get away from the bustle of the city centre. Go to Doyles for fish and chips. There is a good safe swimming area near the ferry stop. Really lovely place to spend an afternoon in Sydney

Tremendous view of Ocean. One of the most breathtaking views of Sydney. Here you can see the beauty of ocean standing on the top of edge cliff. Just get a bus (324) from EdgeCliff station and it will take 30 mins to reach Watson's Bay. We took photos standing on the top of the rock of the edge cliff. But please take care of your children. 2-3 hours can easily be passed here. Request your bus driver to get you off at Gap Park. From the Gap you can have the tremendous view of ocean. If you wanna have some food then you have to go to Watson's bay wharf. It's just 15 mins walking distance down to the road from Gap park. Enjoy!!!

A must do for Sydney visitors.. Absolute must o savour true Aussie Harbour side culture- must have fish and chips at Doyles- eat in or take away and sit on the beach. Catch the ferry and visit this iconic seaside location.
South Head. Loved the ferry trip and the fantastic walk around the headland the views are great , a photographers dream
Views, seafood and beer. Took some tourists here recently, they were well impressed, had a swim in Camp Cove, walked to South Head, food and beers at Watsons Bay pub, all in all a great day
Just beautiful. A lovely bay with the famous Doyle's Fish Restaurant where we enjoyed an excellent lunch - not to be missed.
Good place to relax.. Like an old fishing village with a super nice restaurant and hotel on the beach for lunch. The ferry ide out there is half the fun.

Spectacular Sydney views!. A cheap and very affordable trip on the Sydney Ferries to Watsons Bay. On route you get great views of the CBD, Sydney Harbour Bridge and the famous Sydney Opera House.Explore the nearby beaches and spend the money you saved on a official harbour tour on Doyle's Restaurant and take in the spectacular view!

Just a 10 minute ferry ride away. We went to Watson's Bay specifically to visit a restaurant there but fell in love with this secluded little bay that Sidney city dwellers flock to every weekend.
Well worth jumping off the ferry for.

Stunning views. Took the ferry from Circular Quay and got off the boat at Rose Bay then walked to Watson's Bay, lovely walk but a bit tricky to find your way in places. Arrived in Watson's Bay which in itself is lovely but take the time to climb the steps up to the cliffs looking out over the Pacific and the entrance to Sydney Harbour, fantastic.

Nice hike to the lighthouse and back. Watson's Bay provides scenic views and interesting architecture. The beaches are beautiful. The ferry ride was quick (maybe 15 minutes) and the walk around the area can be done in 2 hours. Doyle's is the place to eat.

Haven by the sea. Lovely beach ,very small compact little place ,had a lovely walk around ,sat and watched the world go by in the lovely sunshine ! Had a beautiful lunch in Doyles restaurant ( famous. For it's fish and chips)

Just had to visit Doyles. Even the pouring rain couldn't spoil our trip across the harbour for our fish and chip lunch at the famous Doyles . Must be wonderful in the sunshine with a walk in the park afterwards .

A Gem!. A definite must if you're visiting Sydney. We had fish & chips at the Beach Club, situated just as you come off the ferry wharf. It was delightful and a lovely walk afterwards around the back of the bay onto beautiful coastal scenery!

Cute little Sydney Enclave. You'll know when to get off the bus - it's the end of the line. You could also do the 5min or so walk further up to Camp Cove Beach - a local's destination or stay in Watson's Bay for a quick walk on the beach and then enjoy fish and chips on the jetty - if you have kids on board, there's quite a good little playground there too. If it's adults only, there's a lovely little outside bar at the top of the Watson's Bay Hotel. I, personally, would totally avoid Doyles, the food is inferior and the prices are superior, it's for ill-informed tourists only. Sunset at the Watson's Bay Hotel Beer Garden is a beauty .... glass of sauv, calamari, the sweet view .... what are you waiting for?
Worth a couple of hours. Easy to get there by the cheap ferries and worth a nice stroll around town. Maybe just go for a coffee or lunch.

my favorite spot is Sydney!. Everytime i visit sydney, i go to watsons bay! wonderful views & very good food ! worth a visit! Catch a ferry from circular quay skip taking a car or a taxi so that u enjoy the opera house & the bridge from the sea

Watson's Bay. A friend gave us a clue about eating on Watson's Bay - the Doyle's Restaurant further up the beach was a good destination for lunch. Expensive, but we split the fish and chips - more than enough!

Lovely fish and chips. This was a return visit a trip down memory lane. Many thanks to my sister who took me as a teenager all those years ago to the original Doyles it was just as fantastic. Very easy walk to view the Gap pity it was under repair when we were there.
Awesome Day Out. So much to see and do, lie on the beach eating fish and chips take out, or go fancy to the restaurant, or even grab some friends and meet at the pub either way you cannot lose
the gap. took the ferry there ,had lunch at Doyles.Went to the Gap and then walked to south head to the old lighthouse and historic house...worth it!!!!!
View is the best! See Sydney harbor. A great place to view the harbor. We did not do anything special here other than view the harbor. Nice small park at end of peninsular.

MY BIRTHDAY. Haven't been to the Watsons Bay since they did up the interior a few years ago. Had a lovely surprise , the grass area is all gone, lovely 2 level eating areas, food was lovely, relaxed, and staff were very obliging and friendly, couldn't fault it, I had a wonderful long lunch with family and friends.
Yummy fish and chips. Went to Doyles for lunch - fish and chips and a gorgeous glass of chilled Australian sauvingnon blanc. Go you won't be disappointed!

Well worth a visit. This is a lovely place to visit and get away from the bustle of Sydney. The ferry trip is fantastic before you even arrive. Piece of advice is don't eat in the cafe right at the dock. Their chips are expensive, tasteless and the vinegar watered down 😡

Gorgeous!. This is another "can't not" while visiting Sydney. Be sure to stop at the Dunbar House for scones - probably the best we've ever tasted. Lots of folks were enjoying Doyle's. Watson's Bay is simply gorgeous, and it's refreshing to escape the city life to relax a bit!
Re-visiting a place I lived near. I caught the bus to Watsons Bay and just walked around. I looked over The Gap and generally walked around the foreshore. It was all good.

Lunch, a beer a chat with friends...life is good. After walking from Coogee to Watson's Bay we decided to have lunch in the Watson's Bay pub, beer garden. It was a Monday and the place was pumping. I wondered if everyone in Sydney was having a sickie.Service was good, although we had to line up, there were plenty of tables. Food was ok for pub food.The pub is right by the wharf and you get to look across to Sydney CBD and the Bridge. You can wander up to the Gap and look out over the ocean and see the waves crashing against the rocks.You can sit in the park and read a book. Great way to relax on a week day.This place gets very busy on the weekends. But if you love a crowd, then go for it.

Impressive beach. Get the early ferry and have a walk along the bay before the tourists arrive to taste Doyle's fish and chips when it just gets far to crowded and busy. Then walk up and then over the other side of the bay to Jacobs Ladder for some impressive sea views. Well worth it.

Lovely place to go for lunch. We travel by ferry to Dunbar a House for our Christmas get together tennis friends. Food is fantastic. View is beautiful looking back across the best harbour in the world. You can get cheaper food at the wharf which is delicious F

Doyles sells our Watson Bay. This is a credit to a wonderful family. Watson Bay is one of my favourite places to chill out and be on my own wondering how lucky I am - I live in Sydney, and can see out to our wonderful harbour and see beautiful people....The Pub and all of Doyles's restaurant are a must while in Sydney, its not cheap, but its good!
Interesting. We have been here numerous times, you can drive yourself there get a bus or the most interesting is getting a ferry over. Great food outlets, great pub and lovely walks

A lovely little fishing village...once. So it has been built up a bit since it was a quiet little village at the very end of Sydney, but nowadays it has a wonderful set of baths for harbour swimming, and some great restaurants and pubs to look back at the city and enjoy the view. Take the ferry for the ultimate fun afternoon.

Between the Harbour and the Ocean. Watson's Bay is a great spot! On the South Head peninsular of the magnificent Sydney Harbour you can see both the Ocean to the east and the Harbour to the west. There are great restaurants, parks and beaches, as well as the famous "Gap" - great for locals and tourists alike, with a great suburban feel within the hustle and bustle of a big vibrant city!
Good food & view.. Doyle's at Watsons Bay is a fine dining restaurant in Watsons Bay. A nice water taxi ride from Circular Quay. Reasonably priced food with an amazing view.

Great place for fish and chips. Get the ferry from the city or bus or drive and have fish and chips at the outdoor Dennys , the clam chowder soup on a cold day is great , you can walk to The Gap lookout or have a cool beer in the beer garden of the pub , swim in the netted pool along the water front or have a coffee and cake in the cafe near the pool theres also toilets there or in the park.In the park there plenty for younger children to keep them busy. Great place to visit , and watch the world go by.

Extremely busy on weekends. we stopped here for 45 minutes as part of hop on hop off tour. Being an absolutely perfect day in spring and a Sunday, it was packed with families enjoying themselves. Thanks to advice from announcer on Captain Cook boat, we knew to take 5 minute walk up to the cliffs overlooking sea on other side of beach. Views were outstanding. If you are just a tourist stopping by to get a feel for the place, the 45 minutes was sufficient. Just enough time for a walk to the hills and to eat an ice cream while waiting for the next boat to arrove

Perfect Sydney Day. Watson's Bay is one of my favourite places in Sydney. It's beautiful to get to, especially by ferry. You can relax and have a few drinks in a great pub, walk the park or grab some great fish and chips at really decent prices and sit on the beach with a superb view of the harbour. Just lovely.
Gorgeous place!. Gorgeous place to walk around and stroll and stop by for a cup of coffee. The beaches are gorgeous and the views are beautiful. It's a wonderful spot to spend an afternoon.

Great view and Fish and Chips. Great view from the Cliffs, a must see.Lovely sitting with the sea as a background eating some of the best fish and chips. Gorgeous place to nip over and have lunch. Beautiful Ferry trip.

Beautiful Bay. On our recent trip to Sydney our son took us to this bay. It is beautiful. So peaceful and very scenic. It was a Friday-so it wasn't too busy with tourists and locals enjoying the beach, bay & restaurants. We were able to walk along the promenade admiring the views, reading about it's history, and enjoying a snack, while watching a yacht race in the harbour. Doyle's is a must-do!. Delicious seafood for all tastes and prices.

A great escape. 20 mins from the CBD by ferry but a million miles away. Top tip, get there early for lunch or make reservations. Alternatively, take a picnic and watch the world go by. Lovely walks to the cliffs with spectacular views to the ocean and back to the city
Beautiful. Watsons bay is a lovely place to visit, I recommend by ferry. We didn't sample the famous fish & chips as it was closed.

FAVOURITE PLACE. watson's bay is the most lovely place you can visit, from the ferry ride from circular quay to walking around the bay, taking in all the history , relaxing and enjoying fish & chips on the grass.
or enjoying a lovely meal at doyles( specail occassion for us )
what a fantastic day out .........

Absolutely Gorgeous!!!. This is a must see on your list of things to see before you die! The cliffs along the ocean are absolutely breath taking! I spent so much time starring off over the edge, taking it all in! I wish I would have had more time at this spot! Take your time, relax, and enjoy God's beautiful creation!

Go have fish and chips and take the ferry. My sister used to live around this area and we would go for walks, check out the expensive homes and go and eat fish and chips at doyles. It's hard to be critical of a place that boasts a beautiful cliff structure (the gap) that has an amazing view of Sydney and harbour surrounds. If you take the drive from vaucluse village past the white lighthouse on your right towards watsons bay, you'll see the beginning of the gap walk and be bedazzled by the view of harbour. The fish and chips at doyles is pretty good. I forgot to mention in my Sydney ferry review that you can get a ferry there.
My favorite place. This is a rare spot to see the waters coming into Jackson Bay. When you turn around to the opposit side, you can enjoy the magnificent view of the city.
Beautiful day. This was a special day for my family and we loved the laid back but attentive ambiance . Really beautiful, great service, quick and efficient

19 th century charm mixed with bling. Approaching the cove by Ferry you still get glimpses of what was a fishing village. There are some original cottages intermingling some serious mansions. A nice public park a good fish and chip perry on the wharf and the overrated Doyles..

Picturesque stop on HOHO boat. Founded in 1788, Watsons Bay is Australia's oldest fishing village. This is a stop on the Hop On Hop Off Tour Boat from Sydney, and I took some of the best pictures here that are now in my vacation photo book.

Highly recommended to add to your visit to Sydney to do list. I went here on the recommendation of other trip advisor customers and I'm glad I did it. To get here you need to catch a very from circular quay to watsons bay (the ferry wharf is right on the beach where you get off) so the added bonus is you get a wonderful scenic ferry right past the opera house and fort denison and a lot of the other sights on the way to watsons bay.At watsons bay there is AMAZING fish and chips right next to the ferry terminal where you get off on the wharf there. The fish and chips is a tiny bit expensive but it was beautiful some of the best I have had anywhere before. There is a huge park here where you can lie in the sun and relax and eat your yummy fish and chips! Also a hotel here where they have a restaurant with lots of seafood choices and of course cold beer!Best thing is the VIEW oh my goodness make sure you go in the afternoon/evening because you will get to see sunset over the city and harbour bridge. Amazing for photos!!! This was honestly one of the best things I did in Sydney make sure you go for the sunset but of course also the fish and chips and the relaxing park. Oh and there is a beach here where you can swim! Another added bonus.
Lovely place to spend an afternoon. Gorgeous area just to take time for a stroll and stop for a coffee. The beaches are gorgeous and the views are beautiful.

Lovely trip and walk. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay and enjoy the lovely view. Take a walk to the left to the beach and then off to the heads along the National Park. It is lovely to sit up at the heads and watch the boats come in. There are plenty of places to eat and have coffee and a quick walk to the Gap is also worthwhile.

Get ready for a long lunch. Having fun on the harbour? Now time to relax. Watsons Bay has 3 restuarants. Doyles, wonderful but very expensive, the Hotel beer garden just lovely but this visit we bought take away from Doyles on the Wharf and then sat in the resturarant seating on the wharf watching swimmers, boaters, beach goers and catamarans coming in and out. Quite a wait for the food and a little pricey but HUGE portions and very yummy.

Private beach. Very nice beach, quiet and preserved. Ideal either for a romantic date or for one of those days you need to be connected to the nature and able to relax at the beach with no noises or crowd around.
what a place !!. far from the maddening crowd, gorgeous shady trees, tranquil waters, Doyle's Fish/chips and the delightfully renovated waterfront hotel for another lunch choice. great day out !!!
WATSONS BAY. Worth a look. Go over on the ferry , Pleasant trip and a small but relaxing area once you get there. A few things around the bay

Must visit. Plan half a day for this in your itinerary and you will not regret it. Just a short ferry ride from Circular Quay and you will disembark into a beautiful peaceful town. After immersing in the great view at Gap park, head down and enjoy a short walk along the south head heritage trail. The walk consist of beautiful clean beaches, lighthouse and the nice Sydney skyline in the far background.End it off with a fabulous meal at the Doyles restaurant with their famous fish & chips. One of my most memorable place in my stay at Sydney.

Beautiful Place Highly Recommended. I visited here on my recent trip to Sydney. This is a MUST DO. To get here you just catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay the ferry wharf is right next to the beach.The beach is quiet and peaceful and there was nobody swimming there much better than the crowded Bondi Beach. There is also a bar here and restaurant that did nice food (a little expensive but wow the view). Speaking of the view it faces the city and you can literally watch the sunset over the skyscrapers and harbour bridge.I really recommend this place it was one of the best places I visited whilst in Sydney, also great for families as the kids can relax on the beach maybe take a swim while you relax with a nice cold beer :)

Nice to walk around on a sunny day. Had lunch at boyles then lay in the park for an hour relaxing. After that headed up the hill to do the walk along the coast. Watson's bay is nice but there are no shops, coffee shops or sights to see apart from the small beach. Just a warning to those who might be expecting more. On a beautiful day it is very relaxing.
Great views. Went for lunch, was lovely to sit looking out at the harbour and get the ferry back to circular key.

Beautiful. Wow, we spent a good couple of hours here just relaxing and enjoying the views. Beautiful little park for picnic lunches, perfect little water area. Just gorgeous. Loved the ferry ride over too.

Filthy and unsafe . 1st time here in years and was disappointed how filthy the beach and park was . My wife and I picked up so much broken glass on the beach we ended our day early as we didn't want our son cutting his feet or worste maybe the council should have someone cleaning throughout the day and more bins. Also there needs to be a better organization of the ferry having 2 arrive at the same time is very unsafe due to the amount of people getting on and off

Great view. Take the bus out to Watson's Bay for a bit of fresh air from the city. Climb up the hill and enjoy the view of the Harbour, I know there's a lot of harbour to be seen in Sydney, but this is worth it too.

Oasis . Great place to visit for a half or full day. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay, only $6. Great walk around the lighthouse, just thirty minutes, then a drink at the bar. Great day. We could have caught the ferry back but instead we walked down the ocean coast to Bondi, roughly 2 hours then caught a bus back to downtown. Great day!

Great way to spend a sunny day. Ok so we only had two days in Sydney. Day one we took the ferry to the main tourist attractions and day two we were told by our hotel to hit up watsons bay so we did and it was great. Great food. Lots of okaves to sit and enjoy the sun. Clean water to swim In for kids and a great family fun. Lots of birds though.

Amazing worth the drive or Fairy Ride. Amazing spot with so many great eating houses its hard to choose. The drive their is amazing there are so many stunning views you will want to stop and take photos every two minutes. you can also catch the fairy which is a great trip too. Doyle fish & chips on the beach and Watson bay hotel are great for a casual catch up or with kids. Doyle's is amazing for a special occasion.

Great day trip or an overnighter.. Beautiful spot with a lot to see and do. Easy to catch the ferry from the CBD, you can drive but parking is a nightmare. Once you're there there a lot of good restaurants and cheap cafes you can go too. The bay itself is great and sights such as South Head, Camp Cove and the Gap and a few minutes walk.
Gorgeous. We took a ferry out there just to spend an afternoon. The views are gorgeous. We had takeaway fish and chips from Doyles - amazing and affordable!
Doyles Rocks. The location was fantastic overlooking the Sydney Harbour. The atmosphere was great -0 very ecclectic
Beautiful Beach. Beautiful Beach. Upon arrival we went to the restaurant just off the pier it was beautiful and even though it's touristy, the food was delish. The nature walk was okay.

Good alternative to Doyle's taking over the whole of Watson's Bay. Watson's Bay Tea Gardens - Really enjoyed this cafe. Outdoors. Just past the Doyle's take away Fish and Chips, continue walking past the beautiful Moreton Bay Fig Trees, then near the VYC you will find the delightful Tea Gardens. Better value than Doyle's. Would like to have lingered to enjoy the ambieance of a beach holiday, but we had a goal to walk up to the South Head Lighthouse. Perfect day for it! The harbour was at its sparkling best. Kiddies were enjoying splashing around at Camp Cove, and a few nudists were still sunning themselves as we passed Lady Jane Beach. My Godson enjoyed exploring the headland battlements dating from 1856 (against the French). The lighthouse could do with a coat of paint, but still a picturesque perched on South Head. Unfortunately we couldn't find a way around to The Gap from there as HMAS Watson (Naval training base) limits access. You can access The Gap directly by heading straight up the street from the ferry wharf. Both the beaches/lighthouse walk & The Gap involve some steps. Wheelchair access only within Watson's Bay immediate prescint from what I could see.

A mediterranean vibe in Sydney's east. Afternoons at Watsons Bay are the best. It has a chilled out vibe. Unless its v windy, the afternoon sun bathes all of Watsons Bay with its gentle glow. There is the great fish and chippery (complete with seagulls) or the pub or restaurant on the beach inviting all with a laid back, glad you came here to relax emphasis.The lovely park alos perfect for kids makes Watsons bay a perfect family locale. Why not enjoy your food, walk along the strip of sand that is the beach, paddle in the harbour by the boats and congratulate yourself on your smart decision to spend time at one of Sydney's best spots. Then enjoy the sunset over the harbour to top it all off.

Definite must do!. One of the highlights of our recent visit to Sydney. We took the first ferry (08:30) from Circular Quay and arrived in Watsons Bay just before 9am, which was a good thing as the area was still uncrowded. The Gap and the cliff side walk is absolutely stunning. It takes about an hour (strolling with photos) to do the walk from the Gap to Christison Park. If you need refuelling after the walk, there is a little eatery called The Grumpy Baker just off Christison Park. They serve wonderful breads and breakfasts.

Definite must do!. One of the highlights of our recent visit to Sydney. We took the first ferry (08:30) from Circular Quay and arrived in Watsons Bay just before 9am, which was a good thing as the area was still uncrowded. The Gap and the cliff side walk is absolutely stunning. It takes about an hour (strolling with photos) to do the walk from the Gap to Christison Park. If you need refuelling after the walk, there is a little eatery called The Grumpy Baker just off Christison Park. They serve wonderful breads and breakfasts.
Doyles. Very expensive eatery, eat next door for the same views. Great sun set location, great walks and bird life...
Beautiful. Watsons Bay is a beautiful part of the harbour and has great food and entertainment at all times. Restaurants with a water view are very special

Great retreat from the city. It's just a short ferry ride from Circular Quay through some of the nicest parts of Sydney Harbour to Watsons Bay, but it feels like another country. None of the hustle and bustle of Sydney, and the view of the Harbour Bridge and city skyline is certainly worth a few photos.Have fish & chips at Doyles on the wharf; far cheaper than their sit down silver service place on the beachfront. Take the time to walk to South Head and the lighthouse, taking in the views on the way. Then a refreshing amber at the local before catching the ferry back. A lovely little quiet spot with the city on the doorstep.

If you are a tourist, you must lunch here once. Just eat at Doyles Watsons Bay. If you are staying in the city you can get a ferry from Circular Quay right there and back. Great food and lovely ocean setting. A must if you are visiting Sydney.

Surprising walk. We got the ferry to Watson's Bay and walked right round to the light house past the ? American army base. The views are spectacular and reading the history at the light house was so interesting. the beach in the bay is so pretty and inviting ( take you swimmers) We rounded it off with a meal at the small beachside bar at the jetty. Delicious.Well worth a detour and the views of the city are great.

Hidden gem. While Gap park is the key attraction here.. Take the time and walk to the heads and take the heritage park around this lovely placeThe place is beautiful.. Not too many tourists... Simple beautiful and you can see the city, harbour, sea and yachts !Take the time out and definitely go to this place for enjoying some quiet time...

Good midday walk!. Really enjoyable, not too long, not too short. We've done the walk on the left side, to camp cove beach and after. Beautiful views over the city and the bay. Don't miss the fish&chips at the wharf, they're really fresh and a perfect reward after the walk!
Definitely visit if time permits. This place is so close by the city but yet feels worlds apart. We enjoyed the walk, relaxing by the beach, visiting the lighthouse etc. Lovely day trip indeed!

Sydney.....Right?. Because if not for the magnificent views of that fabulous harbour you would swear you were down on the south coast in some sleepy little fishing village. Don't just go the excellent pub or the iconic Doyles - just go!!

View as the sun sets. Watsons Bay offers a view of the CBD that leaves little to wish for - especially as the sun is setting and you can watch the sun set as the lights of the city spread out before you. There are a number of restaurants along the bay, Doyles Seafood among the best known. the food is good but it's better value to buy your fish and chips from the kiosk and eat it on the beach or in the park. The hotel does a roaring trade on weekends in the summer, and is a fine place to eat as well. Watsons bay is only a short ferry ride to the city, or if you have the money, $50 will buy you a water taxi whenever you want it.

So much to do and see. Sydney is so fortunate with its harbour and beach sites and this is one of the better ones.Parks to relax in, several restaurants to enjoy fish n chips, easy to get to whether by taxi ferry or driving

nice quiet beach area - food for "tourists" only... liked that the (small ) beach was on the quiet side but the seafood at doyles restaurant is for the 'birds'...way overpriced and nothing special at all..."welcome tourists"..
Great little village.. Good place to go for lunch , take the city ferry ride. Nice pub on the beach there and grab some seafood from the cafe. Just like an olden fishing village.
Doyles. If you want some excellent fish and chips try the famous Doyles. Make sure you guard from the seagulls if you are having them in the fresh air!!

Mustn't miss Doyles. Catch the ferry out from circular key, walk from the ferry up to the ferry terminal at Watsons Bay to the Gap (the entrance to Sydney Harbour) a beer at the pub and fish & chips from Doyles. Or maybe dinner at the restaurant

Watson's Bay N.S.W. Take the ferry across to Watson's Bay the very renowned Doyle's Fish Restaurant and to top that off you can go for a short walk to the other side for a scenic walk along the coast just beautiful. Certainly worth the ferry trip across to Watson's Bay

Beautiful Place to Visit. We arrived here by ferry from Circular Quay in the afternoon. Watson's Bay is a beautiful, tranquil and delightful place towards the mouth of Sydney Harbour on the Southern side. There are great restaurants, beautiful scenery and a very pretty beach front. It's on a narrow stretch of land with the Harbour on one side and the Pacific on the other. There is a nice walk from the beach up through a park to the high side of the area which offers great views over the Pacific.Take care with the ferry times, we didn't and had to take a bus to Rose Bay to get a return ferry. The bus service also serves central Sydney. A little gem of a place.
Lovely at the weekend. What a beautiful place! Has a bit of everything to please everyone, from restaurants to cores to scenic walks. A definite must see when in sydney

Fish & chips. Fabulous fish & chips at Doyle's. Well worth the ferry journey. Was also a lovely beach/bay. Wish we'd gone earlier though as had to wait some time for restaurant to open and not much else to do there - perhaps if we'd taken an earlier ferry we could have gone straight to eat and then taken ferry back to circular quay. As it was we had to wait for it to open then take bus back to city. That was an experience in itself!

Anothe great bay. Brilliant take the bus and train from Sydney to Bondi for the morning. Then take a bus down to Watsons bay just beautiful with grand old pub to boot. You won't want to leave though if you do take the ferry back to Sydney.

Nice little Bay Area. Really nice ferry trip to get there, going past lots of interesting properties. Did a number of ferry trips in Sydney and this was our favourite. Nice lave to go for lunch with good food options there.

Watson's Bay and South Head walk.. A beautiful hidden gem. Don't forget to grab some seafood and go for a walk along the foreshore towards South Head. It's a great historic place but also a fantastic vantage point to watch the ferries and the Cruise Ships sailing in and out of Sydney and into the Pacific. Great place to spot the odd migrant whales too.

Catch the ferry see the heads. Fun way to go , catch the ferry and go to watsons bay , have a walk around down lady bay , check out the heads , have fish and chips at Doyle's then catch the ferry back to circular quay ,views are magnificent

ENTRENCE TO SYDNEY. Situated at the Watson Bay and famous Doyles Fish and Chips Shop and Restaurant a culinary experience reasonably priced. Views to Harbour Bridge one side and the Ocean to the other from the Gap..Adjoing HMAS Watson Naval Base and famous Chapel. Well worth a visit by Ferry and scenic walk to the Gap

Doyles Restaurant Watson's BAy. Watson's Bay is a great palce to visit in your Sydney Journey. When you get off the ferry walk up the hill and you get a fabulous view of the sea pounding on the southern section of the South Sydney Harbour heads. The views are wonderful and occasionally you may see some dolphins and whales during the migration season. After you go back down the hill get your lunch from Doyles ( recommend the John Dory anything ! ) and then go for a walk around the bay and have a look at the beautiful old houses that are on the foreshore.

Beautiful coast walk. Watsons Bay is more than just the restaurants and pub at the ferry wharf, and the stunning view from the Gap. Take the time to walk down to Camp Cove, a beautiful little harbour beach. Walk around the Heritage Track around South Head, past Lady Bay (nude) beach for a fabulous view out to sea, across to North and Middle Heads and look back to iconic views of the city. There is a lovely little red and white striped light house and historic light house keeper's cottage on the way.You can walk along the cliffs to Bondi (takes about an hour from here), or walk back towards the city through the streets of Vaucluse via gorgeous Parsley Bay.Try to avoid Sundays (lots of people around the wharf and the Gap) and sunny winter days are even better!
Great viewing spot. A great viewing location whether you are at the lighthouse or on the harbour looking towards the bridge and eating your flush and chips from Doyles at the Bay

Excellent. We were there at the time when there were 1 million extra people as there was an Navy weekend. Excellent time to be there but hard to see and do what we wanted to do. Throughly enjoyed the trip though and coming back later this year to do it again without all the people

Lovely place to visit, have a meal and a walk. This place is a gem. When you get off the ferry walk up the hill and you get a fabulous view of the sea pounding on the southern section of the South Sydney Harbour heads. The views are wonderful and occasionally you may see some dolphins. After you go back down the hill get your lunch from Doyles and then go for a walk around the bay and have a look at the beautiful old houses that are on the foreshore.

fishing village. watson bay is sydneys old fishing village. a popular destination if you love eating seafoods. restaurants and others is just around. many choices of foods available. and you can dine and relax and drinks. the place is wonderful.
Got to go to Doyle's Chippy. Of course we went to the wrong one. However, nice little strip of beach and a lovely view of the harbour and the bridge, especially at sunset.
Lovely spot on the Harbour. We explored the overlook paths and hiked the shoreline. Afterwards we grabbed drinks at the Beach Blub. It was the hot spot to be on a Sunday afternoon.

Very beautiful. Sighs and wistful staring at the beautiful homes that are situated in Watson's Bay. We took the ferry from circular quays and enjoyed the journey stopping at Rose Bay before Watson's Bay.What a delightful trip we had. Fish and chips at Doyles then a leisurely walk around the bay with some stunning views across Sydney. This was one of my favourite places in Sydney. Delightful and a must although the last ferry leaves early 16:45

catch a ferry. Even locals like us enjoy getting to Watson's Bay by ferry. From Circular Quay, Double Bay or Rose Bay. Worth it just to view the harbour, then great food and wine and plenty to walk and see.
Lunch at Doyle's.. Lovely ferry ride to watsons bay to enjoy lunch at Doyle's on the beach and wonderful city views. Walk to look out to see sydney heads.
Great setting. Took the ferry to Watson's Bay. There was a concert in the park on the Sunday afternoon, with wine tasting. Totally chilled. And great food at the restaurants along the beach.

Lovely on a sunny day. Get the ferry from circular key. Be sure to check on return ferry times as they finish quite early in the afternoon. Walk off the jetty, up the hill, across the park and road to the coastal walk. It is an easy walk but quite hilly. There are several look out points for great photos. On a beautiful clear sunny day you can't beat it!
Sit, relax & Chill out. the view is fantastic, lots of food and drink places, can get a bit busy but best way to spend a cheap lazy arvo in sydney
Just delightful. Wow what a best kept secret this is! So so beautiful, nice hotel on beach, just nice to sit and watch the waves and city!
Great Sea Food. Great Seafood and good service. We had difficulty parking but found the walk for ten minutes enjoyable and the food was well worth it.

Best view in Sydney. Watsons Bay is the one you must go when you come to Sydney. As the entrance of Sydney bay, you can see the view of the ocean when you go to the cliff. Famous seafood restaurant by Doyles family. You can watch the sunset while you are having the dinner.

Friday Lunch at Doyles. We were not that impressed - very overpriced average seafood - would have done better to have gone to the beer garden at the pub next door and had the same food for about 50% less.
Great spot to visit. Right on the water with city views. Easy access by Ferry from the city. Usually a great eating experience but last visit not good. Great pub on the beach, must visit...

Very beautiful. Watson's Bay is very very scenic. Very beautiful garden and amazing view from the hill top. Did not feel like going back home from this beautiful place. A must visit place if you are in Sydney
Beautiful Watsons Bay. Another lovely area in Sydney, went to hotel for lunch but they are doing renovations so bit of limited space & not quite the. Had nice lunch & still amazing views.

Beautiful!. Such a beautiful area with lovely walks, beach, brilliant park for the children, yummy fish and chips in Doyles, a walk up to the Gap and not forgetting the stunning view of Sydney. Definitely worth a trip!

To The Bay. Catch the ferry to Watson's Bay, just walk along the beach or have fish sat on the sea wall. Better still grab a drink at the hotel and some fine food. Feeling generous dine at Doyle's. what a way to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon, catch the last ferry back to the city.

Lovely. Watson's bay is very cute but the main attraction for me was getting up to the gap to see where the sea meets the harbour. It's a shame you can't actually see the opening of the harbour here but it was still good to see the rugged coastline and listen to the crash of the waves. I had the salt and pepper squid at Doyle's which wasn't great; wish I'd had the fish. Easy bus ride to Bondi and then walked to Bronte. It was lovely.

Fish & Chip aholics!. Best place on earth to visit for fish and chips. We went there by the Sydney ferry which was enjoyable on it's own passing all the gorgeous homes of the rich and famous. Watson Bay is such a lovely place to visit and Doyle's Fish Restaurant gives a choice of menu's depending on your finances!!
A definite must on your list when you visit Sydney. Such a pretty suburb and beautiful walk along the foreshore. And up to The Gap. Don't forget your camera!!

A world away. Any trip to Sydney is not complete without a trip to Watsons Bay. Eat at the Pub or at Doyles - wander to Camp Cove and up to the Met office - sit on the beach at Camp Cove licking an Icecream watching the boats pass through the Sydney heads. Stroll to the Gap and along the stunning coastal walkway to the lighthouse and on the the historic cemetery So much to do you could easily fill a day..

Idyllic Life. Kept returning to Watson's bay to enjoy the view and the excellent food on offer. There are a number of eating places clustered together, although some looked better than others. We had three enjoyable meals at Dunbar house on different days, but other establishments could be just as good. Easy to get to either by bus or ferry.

Best spot in Sydney. Easy access by bus from Circular Quay or Bondi Junction. Good for sunbathing on the harbour beaches or rocks at South Head. Watsons Bay pub a great place to sit in the beer garden and watch the sunset!
Amazing. The restaurant I went to was just amazing.....Food excellent. Service no.1Went by ferry and that was the start of a perfect lunch
Incredible!. We hiked along the cliffs bordering the ocean - incredible views! One of the highlights of our trip and a place to which we would return!
Magnificent setting . What a beautiful bay and little harbour. Worth visiting and strolling around. Some very expensive little restaurants but the setting is awesome.

A must do on a sunny day. Watson's bay is a great little place and definitely worth getting the ferry over. There's a few nice walks around, you can walk for 15 ,minutes up to the gap which is nice. Doyle's fish and chip is brilliant, did this before we got back on the ferry back to circular quay.

Dream Houses all the way to Watson Bay. The ferry departs from Circular Quay and passes by the magnificent Opera House so you get a very close look at the Harbor side of the building which is just spectacular. The next picturesque view are all the marina's on the way with the amazing different style of houses , the multi levels ones , the single houses and the some very interesting contemporary designs with the most stunning views ...you cant help but daydream of owning one of them and having your sail boat waiting for you in the marina for a day cruise with some bubbles before sunset.

A great trip on the ferry!. We took a ride on the ferry out of Circular Quay just to do something different and we were richly rewarded with views of the city and harbour foreshores. You must check out the restaurants at Watsons Bay. Excellent food and views!!

Stunning views of harbour and ocean. Easy ferry ride from Sydney, great fish and chips or classic seafood dining right at the dock. But walk a short distance to the ocean side and view a spectacular coast-line. Super half-day excursion from Sydney (or part of a longer ocean walk route).

Has not lost its charm. As a repeat visitor I generally look forward to visiting Watson's Bay.A sunny winter Sunday brings out the crowds (though not as many as in summer) but the charms of Watson's Bay are to walk its streets as I did far from the madding crowd.Access is easy with a ferry every half an hour.A great destination to bring overseas visitors.

Not just for tourists!. We took friends visiting from overseas to Watson's Bay recently, taking the ferry from Circular Quay for the first time in many years.The Harbour and Watson's Bay were at their very best; we walked through the park up to The Gap, back through the village to Camp Cove for ice-cream on the beach before fish and chips in the beer garden at the Hotel which has been totally revamped and now offers luxury accommodation. Our friends loved everything - the stunning scenery, the history of the village, the relaxed lunch, and they could not believe we had not visited for so long. In their company we saw everything through fresh eyes and realize that we travel the world but neglect the treasures on our own doorstep.
Fish and chips for lunch. Watson bay is a lovely small village a 45 min ferry ride from circular quay Really enjoyed the trip there was a beautiful day in ferryWalked up to lookout steep as

A short and sweet time at Watson's Bay. If you only have 3 to 4 hrs and havent had enough travelling, the city of Sydney is never going to stop your thirst. I got onto ferry to watson's bay at 1pm and got the last boat back at 4.40pm. It was a good 3 hours spent there. Not so much on food, we travelled north immediately when reaching the wharf. On the north theres Gap Bluff Cliff which is an amazing sight. Walk to the left fir pictures and then travel a 1 or 2 km to the lighthouse on the right (it was a 1hour walk/climb in total). We prepared food for picnic at the lighthouse and had a great time there. Didnt have time to enjoy coffee at the cafe next to the beach as they close ard 3.30pm before reopening ard 5pm. It was the only pity!
Watsons - Doyles. What's a visit to Sydney without a visit to Doyles seafood restaurant, catch the ferry from Circular quay and back it's a great day
Nice walk. Great views of the ocean. We took an easy ferry ride from Circular Quay and returned to Bondi Junction by bus. Both areas offer lots of places to eat.

nice place. we did the walk from Watson bay to bondi beach. It does take a long time but the views from the board walk at Watson bay are fantastic. this would be a great spot for the start of the Sydney to Hobart Race
Mr Watson's Bay. This place is pretty a small. It was a short bus ride from Bondi and a short ferry ride back to the City. Lovely place to sit and watch the day go by with Fish and Chips and a cider.

Fantastic. What a very pretty part of Aussie and superb views in the distance of the Harbour Bridge
A visit to the fish restaurant is a must

Seagulls, and Fish and chips.. Watson's Bay is worth the ferry ride, not just because the ferry ride is a treat in itself, but because there is a lot to see. Plan your trip to leave Circular Quay at around 10am. Once you arrive at Watson's Bay jetty, hop off and head up the hill to the Gap. It's a decent incline, but it's doable for anyone..fit or not. The Gap is amazing and the views are stunning..if it's the right season you may even spot a whale or two...however, whatever the season the views are worth it. By now you'll have worked up an appetite so head on back down the hill to Peter Doyle's takeaway fish and chips or eat in the restaurant. I enjoy the fish and chips wrapped in paper, sitting on a bench on the beach. But, beware of the seagulls, as they will swoop and pinch your food if you're not careful. It's well worth the trip across the harbour.
Relaxing. Visited Watson's Bay hotel last week. Spent the afternoon watching the ferries, chatting and drinking wine. Perfect place for a sunny winter's day.

Fish and chips on the beach overlooking the harbour. I am from Sydney originally and I love going to Watsons Bay on the ferry, it's a very picturesque trip over. Watsons Bay is an exclusive neighbourhood in Sydney with multi million dollar homes overlooking the gorgeous harbour. Get takeaway fish and chips and then sit in the park above the ferry terminal or along the walkway overlooking the beach. The fish and chips are a bit pricey and you will wait in line on a Saturday or Sunday, but the portions and quality have always been good in my experience. My husband and I were in Sydney recently and we took our two children up to the playground area after lunch which they enjoyed. When we do not have our children we head up to the Watsons Bay hotel for a beer or wine and ask to sit somewhere overlooking the water. There is also very good takeaway coffee below the hotel. For a full day, I recommend heading to Watsons Bay by ferry but then walk up to Military Road and catch the bus down to Bondi Beach. Alternatively, walk up Cliff Street and around from Watsons Bay to Camp Cove which is another beautiful yet much quieter and more secluded little Sydney Harbour beach. Be aware of the ferry timetables as ferries do not run late in the afternoons and evenings. If you miss the ferry back to Circular Quay from Watsons Bay you will need to get a bus from Military Road into the city and that takes approximately 50 minutes or so depending on the time of day, though the upside is that it too takes you through some lovely parts of the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney.

Lovely Scenic Walk and Rare Whale Sightings (If Really Lucky). Watson's Bay is an easy day trip from about anywhere in Sydney. Take a train to Circular Quay and board the F7 ferry at Wharf 4. The ferry ride is quite scenic with the Sydney skyline behind you, and is quite comfortable. We reached the bay early in the morning, which we definitely recommend, since it may get quite crowded and hot (even in winter) towards lunchtime. There are a map at the wharf, showing the directions to the looping trail, either towards the Gap first or the Hornby Lighthouse. We went towards the lighthouse first on an extremely scenic route. There is some amazing flora along the route, and some nice beaches in strips. The beaches here are quite small compared to the Manlys and Bondis of the world, but they are definitely a lot quieter and the white sand and crystal clear water certainly can match the big beaches. The route also have some 'interesting' attractions along the way. Nudist beach and plastic cannon anyone?The Hornby Lighthouse, itself, isn't that amazing, and it's a shame that you can't go into the lighthouse. But the views from the lighthouse is utterly breathtaking, in my opinion better than the ones at the Gap. Both places shows stretches of the Pacific Ocean, but the lighthouse have the Sydney skyline in the background. One of our friends have some incredible luck in seeing some whales from the lighthouse. Apparently, during their migration season (especially this year), you have a slim chance (as our friend demonstrated) in seeing those amazing creatures in the distance.And finally how can a trip to Watson's end without lunch at Doyles on the Beach. We suggest reservations if you want any of the outside seats, as we found out later. The food is not the best value for money, but you pay for the iconic status, fresh seafood and the lovely view.Overall, brilliant, somewhat quiet day trip from Sydney.

Lovely view of Sydney skyline at sunset. We always head over here for oysters at Doyles but this trip we came over on the last ferry but we did not even know it was the last ferry! It was only 4:10! So we had to get the bus back to Circular Quay. Very annoying! The ferry announcements should tell you this information. And on a related note, why do people in Sydney eat and restaraunts close so early!

Pretty Village atmosphere. Gorgeous walk available around the coast from this point' a quick ferry ride to Circular Quay and a glimpse of harbour living! Iconic fish n chips from Doyle's and a very pretty village atmosphere and properties to dream of!

Great Scenery. Caught the train to Circular Quay from Bondi Junction the hopped on a ferry to Watsons Bay, terrific trip down the Harbour , wonderful views from the notorious Gap and quite historical.

Doyles at the wharf Watsons bay.. A bright Autumn day with a wonderful Sydney Harbour in sparkling splendor.The ferry trip to Watsons Bay was perfect. Lunch at Doyles take - away was a surprise indeed, really good blackhead fillets,fresh garden salad,nicely cooked potato fries & the young staff a credit to the Doyles management. Us Seniours sat at table on the north side of the wharf overlooking the bay at no cost .Recommend to every Pensioner as a special treat & enjoy.

Nice weekend getaway. Watsons Bay is a perfect place for a Sydneysider's weekend getaway. It's so close to the city yet would feel so far once you're there. It's a nice place to relax and to just have a quiet time with your loved ones.
Different. Worth the ferry ride here but it is like a small village when you get there. An interesting place to walk around. There is a large fish and chip restaurant but I didn't like the fish.

Favourite place in Sydney. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and have lunch at Doyle's, get there early as it gets busy (or book ahead). The food is great and the view is stunning. Then take a walk up to The Gap, another beauitful view.

A quaint little pocket.. We visited on a Sunday afternoon and this place was crawling with people. There looked to be 3 main places to eat all were really busy. We got a bus to Watsons Bay then caught a Ferry to circular Quay. Watsons Bay is surrounded by lovely parkland which had a playground,toilets and lovely picnic spots. The little sandy beach in front of the restaurants was a fantastic photo opportunity

Barramundi and Chips. Visited via ferry from Sydney and had a great meal at Doyle's on the Beach. Pricey compared to Fish and Chips in UK but then I was sitting overlooking Watsons Bay and the Sydmey skyline and being well fed and watered with good service. In the UK I would have been eating Fish and Chips out of newspaper on a rainy night in Colchester....no contest mate!!!
Best sea food - EVER!. Take the ferry from Sydney - it's worth the trip! Excellent place for a romantic meal, the food & general atmosphere are fabulous. The platter is recommended.

Went for dinner but...... We went there for dinner because it was recommended so many times. However, we went on a week day at 4 pm and got there and found out the last ferry back was in 1 hour. Weekends they run at night. So we walked up to the cliff that overlooked the Pacific Ocean and walked on that path. I also was excited because that was where I saw a flock of cockateels just flying free and making a noisy racket. And there was a huge black and white pelican in the harbor swimming around looking for food.

Pleasant way to pass an afternoon. A popular destination for coach trips (and Sydney's suicide destination of choice), Watson's bay can take a bit of patience to find the best bit. The lighthouse is pretty, but if you persevere and head into the heart of the town, you'll find good fish and chips and a nice spot for sun down - those with really good eyesight will be able to see the harbour bridge as the sun sets. For more tips on where to go in Sydney here: http://lostthemap.wordpress.com/2013/12/08/gday-sydney/.

Gorgeous. Watsons Bay is a gorgeous 20 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay traveling through scenic Sydney Harbour, past Cockatoo Island and the Sea Planes off Rose Bay. The Bay is great for dipping your feet in and a chance for the kids to build castles. No waves as it's on the bay. For those with very little ones there is a lovely big grassy area which is great for kicking a ball or there is an even better fully fenced large playground area complete with swings, slides and climbing frames. For those wanting more scenery, you can venture up to the gap for a fantastic view of the open sea. If you visit on a weekend you might be lucky enough to watch a wedding ceremony at Dunbar House. We normally eat the pricey but delicious fish and chips right near the wharf, but Watsons Bay Hotel is right next door if you want a more sit down meal. A lovely day out.

stunning harbour views and gorgeous beaches. Watsons Bay is the perfect destination for anyone seeking the authentic Sydney experience. Visit Watsons Bay and take a stroll along the picturesque coastline, or eat fish at seafood restaurants, or soak up the sun at Lady Bay.

Lovely trip out of the city. I was planning on doing a harbour cruise but as we had all area transport passes we decided to take the ferry across to Watsons Bay and didn't really have any expectations of what we would find there. The views of the city and harbour are fantastic from the ferry so the journey itself fulfilled my requirements. But Watsons Bay is a lovely little place, feels a bit like going back in time. We had a walk around the village, which didn't take long, finishing with the climb up to the cliffs to see the wild ocean on the other side. The views are breathtaking and it's well worth a visit. You get the views back towards Sydney as well and can just about see the city.We ended up getting fish and chips from the takeaway and eating them in the park area as the weather was lovely. But there is a covered area for eating as well, with a bar and toilet facilities.Highly recommended for a few hours away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
Beautiful views and marine life. The landscape is very cool, but diving/snorkeling here is even better! Saw a huge bull ray, cuttlefishes, octopuses, eels, many different fishes...

A nice little village.. Catch the ferry from the city to this village where there is a nice beach and a great seafood restaurant right on the beach. Nice walk up to the clifftop and just take in the view looking back to the city.

Do the pub and the Gap. Lunch in the beer garden of the Watsons Bay Hotel.nice food,good beer and views to the city across the harbour.
A short walk to the cliff tops at the harbour heads.bit scary since it's a place where people jump and commit suicide.still,worth a look.good paths,parklands,and views of the ocean.
Bring a camera

An attractive trip and destination. We had been tempted to stop off at Rose Bay but the man on the ferry suggested Watson's Bay had more to see - and he was right. We got to see a lot of the harbour on the ferry - lovely to see all the sailing boats on the way enjoying the nice weather - before we arrived. Obvious attractions were the fish and chip takeaways/restaurants, the well manicured park that led up to the famous Gap with it's sheer cliffs and rock platforms and the beaches. The only negative we found was the indifferent customer service at two of the places we had food and then a drink - it didn't encourage us to stay for more. But it was an inexpensive trip and well wroth the visit
Tranquil spot. A short ferry ride from Sydney harbour Were recommended to dine at Doyles restaurant on the beach & this was the reason for the trip.Enjoyed the picturesque scenery on the way

north head and then fish & chips on the beach, nothing better.. Spectacular North Head, the quarantine Station, the views the history. The ghost tour at night is also great but during the day the visit and then back to Manly for fish and chips. Make sure you sneak in and take a look at the spectacular International training college, it used to be a catholic college, what a building and view.

Fish and chips in the park, the bar or the beach and a great walk. Travel by ferry here (best way) and get a great view back to the city or get the bus (324 or 325). The main tourist reason to come here is to get fish and chips from one of the Doyles properties from the take-away (eat in the park) option, the sit in the popular hotel/bar and order food for your table option to the sit-down, waiter service and best views of the city skyline option - each depending on how much you want to spend.Another option is the Dunbar house option across the park which looks like an English country house which is not that expensive as you might think.Another option is to walk around to the great harbourside beach Camp Cove and hopefully the beach kiosk will have what you want. Take a swim here on a warm sunny day and relax.For the more energetic, take a walk to the Gap (steep cliffs to beware) or go the lighthouse and get a great view of the harbour and stand on South Head to see North Head the entrance to what is one of the most beautiful harbours in the world.

Beautiful walk. We caught a ferry to Watsons Bay and went on a walk up the Gap and around to Jacobs Ladder. we took a picnic with us and sat and wathced the world go buy over South Head. Beautifu;l. Not a hard walk. It is up hill. But i went wiht my 14 yr old daughter and a back pack and we where fine.
Beautiful spot to visit. Great place to take in the views of ocean and cliff faces. beautiful walk up the viewing points. Great place to enjoy lunch or a ferry trip back into city.
So pretty. So incredibly prettyThe best seafood restaurant - but I can't remember the name -- it's on the waterfront. To die for!

Lovely ferry stop for scenic walk. Stopped here on one of the hop on/off ferries and got fish and chips (just ok) and sat by the ocean to enjoy lunch. It is very scenic and they have a nice walking path along the cliffs. Other than a nice walk there isn't that much to do, but for an afternoon stroll it's very pleasant. Disappointed you couldn't go in the lighthouse.

Fishing village with amazing view. This used to be where the fisherman in Sydney were based. So enjoy some fish and chips at the Watson's bay Hotel - cheaper and just as good as Doyle's restaurant next door. As the sun sets over the million dollar view of the city you can have one of the best and lowest cost meals in the city! Get the bus from the city and then you can have as many beers as you like. And if you feel like exercise take a stroll along the cliff top or down to Camp Cove for a dip in the harbor.

A Nice Trip On the Ferry for Fish & Chips. Take the Ferry from Circular Quay to Watson Bay and enjoy some Fish and Chips on a pleasant day. You get to see some of the harbor and there more expensive homes of Sydney

Overrated. Its just a bay for the rich to park their boats, parking is a nightmare and eating at say the local pub or the famous Doyle's restaurant comes at a price. Good for a walk or a picnic in the park.

A great day out. Take a ferry to Watson's Bay for a great day out. Once there you can walk to see the views from The Gap then along to the lighthouse. You can enjoy a picnic lunch or fish 'n chips by the water and then walk the other way for views of the heads.

One of Sydney's hidden gems. The very best way to get to Watson's Bay is by ferry, a 15 minute journey from Circular Quay. This way you get to enjoy the beauty of Sydney Harbour from the water, and step ashore at Watson's Bay Wharf. At the wharf you will find the famous Doyle's Seafood Restaurant, which also has a take-away counter so you can enjoy your fish and chips under a shady tree in the adjacent park, or watch the children play on the small sheltered harbour beach beside the ferry wharf. The park also has a large fenced children's playground area. A short walk through the park brings you to the cliffs overlooking The Gap, and the rugged coastline of the Pacific Ocean. There is a walking track up on to the top of the headland reserve from which you can see the Entrance to Sydney Harbour, and watch ships coming into port, or look across to Manly in the north, and watch the Manly Ferries ply the Sydney-Manly route.

Watson's Bay. This is well worth a visit. We took a bus from Paddington to Bondi Beach and then on to Watson's Bay. It was a good way to see the sights. The walks around the Gap are very scenic and the waterfront area is lovely with fabulous views across Sydney Harbour. We enjoyed hot chips on the wharf before catching the ferry back at sunset.

..a gem hiding in a small bay... ..a ferry trip from Sydney's main terminal, Watson's Bay is a lovely spot..you can choose to walk around the Head with fantastic views or just eat the jetty restaurant's superb fish and chips..watch as the locals clean the catch of the day..observe the fish in the clear waters or just people watch..a popular destination for Sydneysiders but no so popular that overcrowding ever becomes an issue..enjoy!..

A Hike Trip to Hornby Lighthouse from Watsons Bay. A trip to Watson's Bay can be done by a few ways. As a tourist, my means would be public transport. Public transport in Sydney isn't cheap hence, I would recommend purchasing of My Multi 2 or My Multi 3 (if going Manly beach) card. It give you unlimited train, bus and ferry rides within the city. Price is $54 and $63 respectively. Can be found in the NSW transport website. For me i took the ferry from central wharf 4. Departure timing can be found on the screen before the wharf entrance. By taking the ferry, you'll be brought through the view of the harbour bridge and Sydney Opera House as a whole, as well as Double bay and Rose bay. If you wanna catch and full view of the city from far, ferry would be the way cheaper way.In order to reach Hornby Lighthouse, from Watson Bay, you would need to walk towards cliff street and up the trekking pathway at camp cove beach. The hike would consist of some steep slope and stairs. Generally it is a very easy trek that takes about 15-20mins slow walk to reach the lighthouse. Additionally, along the trek, there is a nude beach call lady bay beach. It is a very small beach, if you are interested in getting nude, that is one of them in Sydney. I would suggest to stay till sunset, the view would be magnificent and majestic. Great view of Sydney central as well as the Tasman Sea. Do bring along some food for picnic. Its worthy!!P.S. Do remember to check for returning ferry timing, as the return ferry might cease earlier on certain days. But fear not, there is always bus 324 325 and 380 to nearby train station or to central.As for dinner, there are a few restaurants near the wharf area. I had my dinner at Eastern Bay Thai. You can try that for authentic thai food. I have written a review for it as well. Do read up! Hope this is useful! Cheers!

Big Blue Beauty. One of the best ways of catching the amazing sights Sydney's shore is to hop onto one of those ferry tours which take off near the rocks. Depending on where you want to travel too, they cost around AUD$40.00 plus. April is a great time to catch the great Sydney weather. The sun is still bright and not too hot. The journey from the Rocks to Watson bay will allow you to catch all the key landmarks- Opera House, the business centre, the zoo, grand homes along the shore area, and also a bit of the green lung that is still left in Sydney. Watson's Bay is the spot that meets the ocean. Homes here are pretty and its famous for its fish and chips. You can disembark at the end of the ferry trip, stroll around and have your meal, mix with the locals and hop back at the ferry a couple of hours later. A great way to catch the magic of Australia at your own pace. Highly recommended to those who enjoys the sun, and to capture scenes of local life.

short ferry ride to a beautiful part of Sydney. Only 15 minutes ferry ride from Circular Quay- beautiful beach, a great pub and good seafood. What more could you want? Great place to bring the tourists!

Very peaceful, beautiful and wonderful view of Sydney. We caught the ferry over to Watsons Bay, it is a quick journey looking at some wonderful coastline. We had a short stroll to the southern heads view, that was lovely and well worth the walk. It is an easy walk with easy paths and a short climb low fitness levels required. We had a very lazy lunch at Watson's bar. Looking at the boats coming into the bay was amazing and just looking over to the skyline of Sydney was perfect. Well worth a visit.

Bondi to Watsons Bay walk, and fish and chips. We walked with our two children from Bondi beach to Watsons Bay along the cliffs. A fantastic walk with some stunning views out to sea. Was a bit steep walking up out of Bondi, but once we were along the cliffs the steps and board walks were easy to moderate.Once at Watsons Bay there is some construction going on at the walkway we had to work our way around.We then had fish and chips at Doyles on the wharf, a well earned beer and wine, looking out at the peaceful bay.We then caught the ferry back to Circular Quay.

My favourite place. This was my first date with my partner and the ferry trip over is wonderful.The little beaches are great and and the walk around the headland is a must.After we walked to the gap and then ate in the local; pub.There is a lovely restaurant on the beach and another on the wharf.So much to see on this trip and also a few stops on the way.

Gorgeous. This is well worth a trip on the ferry from Sydney. It is a beautiful quiet harbour with a very well kept park leading down to it. The whole area is very pretty, clean and tidy. There are a few fish and chip restaurants on the harbour front and a couple of cafés in the village street.The walks along the cliff tops have beautiful views over the ocean and also back down the harbour.Don't miss it.
Photo Opportunities. We drove to Watson's Bay and walked around on a very pleasant day. The views of the harbour with the city background are lovely and a great place for holiday snaps.

A memorable walk around the peninsula. A ferry boat trip to Watson's Bay captures everything that is special about Sydney Harbour. The Ferry itself is reasonably priced and provides wonderful views of Circular Quay, the Opera House, Bridge and the general Bay area. It is also spectacular if your return is timed at dusk, when the city neon takes over. Our ferry was met by a real live pelican on the beach and, after landing, my wife and I set off on a walk adapted from one in an old Dorling Kindersley guide to Sydney, which showcases the differences in the two sides of the peninsula. Firstly we walked to Vaucluse House via Gibson's Beach and the supension bridge across Parsley Bay. This route takes you past impressive residential properties ( particularly The Crescent). Vaucluse House and gardens looked impressive, but we didn't have time to go in. Next was a bit of a hike along Cambridge Avenue (not much shade on a hot day) to reach the ocean side of the peninsula and a walk towards the South Head taking in the Signal Station, Jacobs Ladder, Dunbar's anchor and the Naval Memorial Chapel. The attractions here revolve around the sheer cliffs above the crashing waves. Sadly, there are several reminders that this spot has attracted several suicides. The paths around the northern part of the peninsula were being redeveloped and are not well signed, but will eventually bring you back to near Camp Cove Beach where you can follow the coast back to to the ferry terminal, where there is a pub/hotel and Doyles fish restaurant and cafe. This walk took around 3 hours and offers spectacular and varied scenery and restaurants at the start/finish with a great view of the Bay.

A lovely evening with an amazing sunset. What a lovely part of Sydney. We spent our first evening here with family and had dinner at the Beach Club which had such a relaxed and pleasant atmosphere. The food was lovely, most of us had the fish & chips which were superb and I know that the lobster linguini was also very good. The food and drinks were reasonably priced and good quality. The sunset we had that evening made it quite magical. We had planned to visit again during our stay but sadly ran out of time. Next door to the Beach Club was Doyles fish restaurant. I'd love to have tried it but again the time just flew by - will just have to go back one day....

Great Atmosphere. We had a rainy trip around Bondi Beach and other local areas but ended up at Watson's Bay for lunch. It was a real good experience although a little pricey. Food was great and only wish we would have been able to visit here on a nice sunny day. It's a busy place and popular.
Love this little beach. Visited Watsons Bay on the ferry. Love it. I always like to visit every time I visit Sydney, the walk along the cliffs is magnificent.
Cute little bay. Wedding reception. Great in summer. Amazing views just a short boat trip/road drive from Sydney. Would have loved to have tried the fish and chip stalls.

Don't jump off the Gap!. The view of the Gap was another great sight to see. It was ANZAC day when I went, so I was greeted with the sounds of bag pipes and merry music. The walk along Watsons Bay to see the Gap was really cool, but I was disappointed that going north you get stopped by personal property. Heading south was still a great view. Instead of heading back the way we came, we took the nature walk way which showed us one of the largest trees that looked like a series of roots! It was very cool and a great photo opportunity.
Love it. I love every single peace of Watson's bay. Really relax and great spots as a nice Club with beautiful ppl on Sundays.

Watson's Bay and Doyles .... To us Watson's Bay is synonymous with Doyles, a classic Sydney seafood restaurant.You can sit down with distant views of the city skyline for a luxurious seafood meal (try the cold seafood platter for two!) or hit their takeaway shop at the pier and have a picnic lunch in the park under the trees.You can walk off your meal with a walk to South Head, the nearby southern tip of the opening of Sydney Harbour.
So picturesque. What a beautiful place. Loved it here. Great to walk along the Gap and coastline. Very busy and touristy but just so gorgeous. Well worth the visit. Good history here too

Top Spot. A great location for a stroll or a picnic with dramatic cliffs of 'The Gap' on one side and views of the harbour on the other. Treat yourself to superb takeaway fish and chips at Doyles or sit in at the restaurant. There are easy ferry and bus connections. Altogether a top spot! One of Sydney's finest.

Beautiful location. Hop off the ferry (which is a fun trip) and Doyle's seafood café is at the end of the Warf. Its very convenient and a beautiful outlook. Reasonably priced but be prepared to line up for your meal. Worth the wait.

Ferry ride and Gap walk. We loved the ferry ride to Watson's Bay. On the way you could see the harbor bridge really well and also see some lovely houses built along the coast line. However, the main part we liked was the walk along the gap. It has been renovated since we last went several years ago and new walkways have been put in. The cliff views of the crashing ocean below are majestic. You can walk both sides of the gap. If you are hungry there are some good fish restaurants on the harbour

Stunning place. Take your visitors on the ferry from circular quay to Watson's Bay. Treat yourselves to some great grilled fish and chips at Doyles on the wharf. Not cheap but generous serves. Wander up and check out the infamous gap or take as troll to the beach.

Nice trip from Sydney Harbour. Love taking the fast ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. The biggest attraction there is Doyle's Restaurant, right next to the beach and with great views back to the sky scrapers of Sydney.

beautifully majestic. I went by car from coogee beach to Watson bay. It's an amawing cliff with crashing waves. No way to go and swim there, it was too windy.
What I can't forget is the walk way there, with all the majesty of nature

Take the time to visit this great picnic and foodie spot. Allow time to enjoy fish and chips here or dine in a restaurant. Take a short walk to see the Gap and its numerous signs to try and help those feeling despondent. Great views of city from the Watsons Bay foreshore and Ocean views from the Gap. Enjoy the ride to Watsons bay on one of the ferries from Circular Quay, you will get to see many of Sydney Harbours attractions during the ride.

Lovely 'local' experience. If you are visiting Sydney and want an extremely easy 'local' experience then catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay for lunch. Fabulous water views and peaceful surroundings. Pub food is fabulous but there are other choices too. Small children's playground and grassed lawn for picnic and also take away fish and chips. Not much ease to do but very relaxing. Tip: check ferry timetable so you don't miss the last one.
Awesome. The food there is great for younger and older and on top of that there's a playground for younger children.Definitely recommend for all

Beautiful views of the beach and great food by the water. My friend and I went to Doyles and had fish and chips for lunch and then for a walk. There is a little beach underneath where you can walk on and take in the beautiful views of Watson's Bay. On New Year's Eve it is a great spot to see the fireworks display.
A must if you happen to be in Sydney. Everything good. The ambience is familiar and service is quick and friendly...and the views from the wharf are marvelous.
Another top spot after a ferry ride. A nice spot to have fish and chips by the water and a great playground for the kids.Go on a nice day otherwise the wind can be cold there
Nice & Scenic. A great view of the sydney bridge from the other side, nice seafood fresh and delicious! Ferry ride was nice as well
Watsons Bay. Catching a ferry from Circular Quay is the best way to see the Bay, walk thru the large park to "the Gap" it is just majestic, later take in a sea food lunch near the Wharf.

Another great ferry trip. From Circular Quay to Watson's Bay is a good alternative to the Manly Ferry. However, there's not as much to do once you arrive. Everyone goes there just to have Doyle's famous fish and chips.So plan to just enjoy the journey and when you are finished head back to the city with greasy fingers and salt on your lips.

A "must visit" part of Sydney. Just a short ferry ride to Watson's Bay gives the traveler a taste of small town Australia within the precincts of Sydney Harbour. Add to that, the iconic Doyles Restaurant with excellent seafood and service - who could resist
Beautiful. Absolutely gorgeous scenery, very nice atmosphere and very good place to just relax. Just let everything flow around you

Great view. Recently went to Watsons Bay for a day trip. We ate at the seafood restaurant, the platters were incredible and had drinks on the outside terrace. The weather was perfect which made for a spectacular view of the harbour.
Best view in the area. We visited this little place as part of the hop on/hop off boat tour. It's a must see! The view from Gap Bluff is breathtaking.

A ferry trip which feels like a mini cruise.. Good way to pass some time at the site of Captain Philips first settlement folowing landing. Ferry from Circular Quay is reasonably priced, locals friendly and very pleasant walking.

Cute, but small. Cute little village from which you can take a ferry across to visit Manly, but not a whole lot to see here. There are two restaurants on shore, with one specializing in seafood, but we had to leave after sitting down and looking at the prices; just a bit to dear for a lunch meal. However, the same restaurant has a take out counter on the pier and then a small enclosed sitting area with a bar also on the pier. That's a much more economical way to grab a bite and a glass of wine before catching the ferry, especially if you looking for something like fish and chips or basic grilled seafood.
