Love the new renovations. Such a wonderful spot with friends and the view from the cliff is beautiful, beach and ferry are romantic, restaurant is amazing, food is wonderful. Lovely suprise!!! Large variety to chose from the only thing is the lines/waits were fairly long.

The fish & chips are a bonus. Ferry calls in at Watson's Bay, so very easy to get there. The added extra here is the renowned fish & chip café on the harbour. When a ferry comes in there's always a queue but we were soon served. Lunch cost $15 each so quite reasonable price, it was tasty as well as enormous! One serving would have been enough for 2 of us.From the landing stage walk straight ahead up the hill to the view point at the top. From there you can walk along the cliff top either way (turning right takes you up to the lighthouse) on a very safe path.

Worth the visit for Lunch. The ferry from Circular quay is a great way to get here, and its a great spot for a picnic on the beach or grab some fish and chips. We were here on a sunny Sunday afternoon and the place was alive.

Difficult but nice!. It's very difficult to get there but it worth it. View from the cliff is beautiful, beach and ferry are romantic, restaurant is amazing but i couldnt find a way to the lighthouse-which was the main reason why i went there.

beautiful views, slightly expensive. We went to Watson's Bay via the hop on/off ferry. There is a walking trail along the cliff area that offers some amazing views. We ended up walking to a beach area (? Cave Cove) that was small but clean. Dining in this area was a little expensive and the lines/waits were fairly long.

Great way to spend a few hours and see Sydney Harbor. Just take the Sydney Ferry to Watson's Bay...the ferry ride is an attraction in itself, with great views of the Opera House and harbor. You can turn around and go back, stop for an hour for a meal, or even spend a few hours walking up to see the ocean views.I had a decent lunch at the Beach Club. The fish & chips were pretty good, nothing was cuisine but it was wholesome enough for fried food. I had no idea what beer to get, so followed the advice of a patron and got something called "ExtraDry" which was pretty good.The famous Doyle's is next door but had a line and looked more expensive--I was not in the mood to wait so the Beach Club suited me well.Next time I will do the walk before lunch.

Great little day trip away from the Sydney hustle & bustle. Watson's Bay is a hidden gem at the end of the harbor, opposite Manly Heads. A short ferry ride from Circular Quay will take you along past Rose Bay and the millionaire Eastern suburbs en route to this quaint little spot. Having fish and chips on a summer's day at the original fish and chippery is a great way to pass an afternoon, and you can finish up with a drink in the beautiful waterside beer garden at Watson's Bay Hotel.Really recommend it for a half-day out of the madness of Sydney.
Exceptional. Nice secluded beach, great for families to get away from crowds and city hustle. Easy. To get to and good in that it is away from the commercial sector.
Spend some time here. The beach area is nice, the harbor is pretty with plenty of restaurants. A short walk away is a park with great views of the ocean.
lovely bay. We walked from Bondi,, clifftop wlak then had lunch at the beach bar . Lovely bay, so pretty.. well worth a visit
beautiful. Lovely part of the world. We took the train to Bondi and then the bus to Watsons Bay. ferry then back to circular quay for a great day out

Nice ferry ride with great views.. This is more about the ferry ride from Circular Quay than what you find at the other end. There are several restaurants at the water's edge, but most seemed to be owned by Doyle's, and most seemed to offer mainly fried food. Fish and chips A$24, bucket of 18 prawns A$32, beer A$7/glass, NZ wine A$8/glass.Service OK. Nice views from the restaurants.
A great way to while away a few hours. Ferry to Watsons's Bay and drinks at the beach club. Excellent way to kill some hours in Sydney. Possibly the best Margarita I've had.
Beautiful scenery .... My cousin took me on a trip to Watsons Bay, a beautiful harbour, and we had lunch at a lovely fish restaurant. There is a ferry to and from Sydney so it is easy to get to.

Fish & Chips. Grab a ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay, after alighting relax and take a recharge break of fish and chips, you can go all out and go to the restaurant if you like, then climb the slight rise and cross the street to take the steps to the magnificent view of The Gap, on the street there is a bus that will take you on a lovely tour of Bondi
a must see in sydney. get the bus to Watsons Bay and then go back on the ferry it is a wonderful trip eat at the Pub and walk up to the gap
Loved it. Had a brilliant day in Watson's bay...gelato, fish & chips, walk along the clifftops, met friendly strangers along the way, and photo ops at the light house.

Doyle's Fish Restaurant. We took a fast ferry from Central Quay. It was a perfect day and Watson's Bay is the perfect location with lovely walks along the coast followed by not so cheap but so tasty fish and chips at Doyle's whist watching children play in the sea and admiring the views of Sydney and the Harbour.

Worth a visit. We are a group of 8 that travel to Sydney from Melbourne for a 3 day weekend getaway and are always looking for something different to see besides the inner city. A short ferry ride to Watson Bay from circular quay gets you there. The Gap Park is definitely worth a visit, great ocean cliff views , just a short walk gets you to the top which gives you great views of the city. There are longer walks for the keen enthusiast ( all the way to Bondi).There's also Doyles - Fish n Chips. Sitting on the Jetty.A must visit for lunch. An affordable choice compared to the fine dining Doyles that's also available on the foreshore .A great park for families to enjoy aw well as the small beach .

Busy but nice to walk around .. Went there on a Saturday so it was rather busy ,loads of people but a good buzz,everyone enjoying themselves.hard to find a parking spot though ! bit of a nice beach ,boats ,etc. and fish and chips !

Lovely town. We took the ferry over to Watson's Bay to spend a few hours. When you get off the ferry, walk straight ahead up the paved path going uphill, cross the street, and take the stairway up the hill to the overlook. It is not a hard climb and is definitely worth your time. The views are wonderful when you reach the top and see the jagged cliffs with the water crashing around at the bottom. It reminded me very much of California.Back down at the beach area, there are nice restaurants with outdoor dining overlooking the beach. Watch the seagulls as they watch you eat! A very relaxing way to spend some time away from bustling Sydney.

Amazing escape from busy city. If you are tired of crowds and exploring city, hop onto a ferry and come here....small beach, lovely for walking around and reading a book....Nice fish and chips and maybe a glass of wine....

Amazing views, swimming and fish n chips!. Watsons bay is a must to visit when you are in Sydney. Beautiful views and great places to eat and drink and a park where you can hang out all day and enjoy the day!

atmosphere is great. everyone is down there either getting fish and chips or picnicing or going to watson's bay boutique hotel! so many options and its just a really nice view. you can also now get a ferry from manly which makes it really easy for us!!
What a place!. Took the hopper boat to Watsons Bay, ate and drank in the Beach Club and enjoyed some stunning views. Truly special place and some of the houses are breathtaking.

A Very Pleasant Suprise. We went (via ferry) expecting a tourist trap but found a very nice small village. Had lunch at Doyles on the beach; it was expensive (every thing seemes to be in Sydney) but delicious seafood. Sat outside with great views of both the Sydney skyline and the small beach in front (30 feet away). Walked up the hill through the park and saw the raging sea from the National Park overlook. Caught the city bus a block away (in front of the pharmacy where we bought bus tickets) and rode back to Circular Quay - a very pleasant afternoon.

Wonderful spot for lunch. Our daughters arranged for us to have our Christmas treat (we have too much stuff, in their view) which was lunch at Doyle's. We had a table right next to the beach, so front row seats to watch the boats in the harbour and the children playing on the beach. The food was wonderful, too!
The bay and more. Whilst Watson's bay is beautiful to walk East of it takes you to stunning views and lovely beaches.Don't leave without your fish and chips!

Charming. We took a harbor tour boat to Watson's Bay. We were charmed by the beach and the cafes. We ate at the Beach Café, then walked up to the Gap. We were surprised by the spectacular view of the ocean. Definitely worth the short walk.
Watson's bay. A stop at Watson's bay is a must! The views are amazing and there is a walk path. Doyles is also there but I didn't try it.

unexpected treasure. Our first activity off the plane from LAX was stunning. We had purchased a transit pass which included the ferries. (I highly recommend as the public transportation is extremely user friendly.) The ferry attendant suggested the destination, with "take away" for lunch. There was a slight hill to climb, but totally worth every step. At the top of the hill was a magnificent view of the ocean, jagged clifts, walkways to scenic lookouts and Cockatoos. The Cockatoos were flying around the way Robins fly around in our home town. We were fascinated! Lunch Fish & Chips at a picinic table enjoying the living art all around us, AMAZING DAY!

Watson's bay. Arriving at the bay and having late lunch then walking around the Watson's Bay with a great weather was relaxing.. going to the up hill, been told it was the famous suicide area, and they had a board sign about that..
Just Beautiful. What a day, so much to see and do,we did a walk around,had lovely lunch on the beach and then had a swimGreat for everone

watson's bay. It's relaxing. many come here to picnic. more tourist it seems. we had fish and chips here. people watching is good, especially those playing with the little kids. they just love the sand, the sea and the sun.

You can walk to the lighthouse and then swim back near the ferry. We chose this place because it had a swimming area and a nice hike to the lighthouse. After leaving the ferry, we dodged the crowds and walked across the park to a local milk bar (Con's) on Military Rd and had wonderful coffees. Then we found the walk to the lighthouse and enjoyed a picnic. On the way we passed a beach that looked very family friendly, but alas the bathrooms were not good for changing into suits. Also, warning, you do pass a "clothing optional" beach, but the bodies are pretty far away. Back down near the ferry there is a bathing area and public bathrooms where you can change. You need your own towel and the water in the showers is icy cold, but we made it work. After a refreshing swim in the shark-netted harbour, we took the bus back, snaking through many posh neighborhoods.

Great fish and chips. We took the ferry to Watsons Bay on a rainy Saturday morning. Due to the weather we didn't do the walk to the head of the harbour although we did enjoy the ferry ride there and back. We had lunch at Doyles on the beach which is a take away ( aka cheaper ) alternative to the famous Doyles restaurant. There is a nice area to sit undercover next to the warf, adjacent to the takeaway area with tables and chairs like a cafeteria. So it is pleasant. No card payment at the takeaway though so have some cash handy this could be an issue if you need to go to an ATM to pay. There is a bar and coffee available so you don't feel like you are missing out on much, the food quality is all you would expect from Doyles.

Best fish in Sydney at Doyles. It's a short, easy ferry ride to Watsons Bay from the Circular Quay ferry terminal, and Doyles is right at the beach at Watsons Bay. Our table had a great view across the harbour back to the city. Prompt & attentive service. Our lobster and barramundi were both excellent, the hoki fish and chips less so. Great atmosphere.
Nice side trip to Watson's Bay. Camp Cove - this is a secluded bay which is just stunning. Nice little walk around the cove. Must eat at the Doyles... recommend reservation.

Great Views of CBD. The location shows the reason why you would visit Sydney with the natural beauty of Sydney showcased and only half an hour by car or ferry. The ferry ride is great but the frequency is always the best. You can eat at 5 or different locations with varying costs for any budget.

Lovely bay with great views back to the city. Pleasant ferry ride out to bay. public bus back to city hotel--via bondi--good way to see another part of city.seafood restaurants pricey but worth it for outlookGreat walks up to cliffs and ocean sea views

Wonderful Way To Spend The Day!. The ferry ride was a delight, fish and chips at Doyles right on the dock was magical, the Gap was worth seeing, and the walk to the lighthouse was a great way to stretch your legs. If you have more than one day in Sydney and want to get out of the city without working too hard at it, this is the perfect place to go!
Nice alternative way to see the habour. Nice piece of harbour with a beach to boot. You can see the city in the distance.A quiet, peaceful way to take in the harbour.
Doyles on the Beach. We had lunch at Doyles on the Beach in Watson's Bay. Great view back to the Opera House. Really enjoyable.

Outstanding place to visit. We returned to Watsons Bay several times as we were so impressed with it. There is a lovely beach and great walk round the headland and up to the lighthouse. The only disappointment was Doyles take away closing early in the afternoon

Wonderful View. Sydney turned on a beautiful day after days of no sun at all. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. We made a reservation at Doyles and were seated right at the waters edge. Staff were very friendly and knew the menu well. Food was just above average, but you really don't mind as the visual experience surpasses anything else. A must do. Take a walk after lunch up to the gap and look out over the Pacific Ocean.
Very scenic area, great seafood.. A ferry trip to a beautiful area, great seafood at the hotel, good swimming area & just a nice place to relax & soak in the great atmosphere.

Super day trip. This is a must and a great way to see the Sydney harbour on the ferry away from the crowd. Just jump on the ferry and go! No need to book any tours, the trek can be easily done on your own and save that A$75,
Have to eat at Doyles. After a very relaxing ferry ride, a few steps to a really good fish restaurant. Nice walk up to the monument and walk on to the beach at Camp cove.
Great little village on the edge of Sydney Harbour. We came in here to catch a bus to Bondi Beach. We stayed awhile and had a look around. Would have loved to stay longer, perhaps next time.

Spectacular. We caught the Ferrie to Watsons Bay to go to the pub there and it is a gorgeous little bay, with cute little restaurants. The best part of it is the view you get looking back to Sydney Harbour especially at night which is breath taking. It's a must visit for all tourists.

Watsons Bay. Great place, easily accessible by Ferry from Circle Quay. Try Doyles for lunch. Great views of the harbour and Sydney from the veranda. Food excellent and lots of it. Short walk to the cliffs of Sydney harbour entrance. Go during the week, very busy on Weekends. Taken to Doyles by friends whbo live in Sydney..

Short very ride from Circular Quay. Went over for lunch at the original Doyles. Definitely worth the trip. Take the short hike up the hill to see the ocean waves crashing into the cliffs. A little bit of a queue waiting for the return ferry but no big deal.

One of the less crowded places with great views. The introduction to this attraction on top of this page pretty much sums up what I was going to write: go to the Gap, walk to the South Head and the lighthouse and enjoy the great views of the Sydney skyline and northern coastline, with boats scattered picturesquely in between. We enjoyed the atmosphere before sunset very much, the sea looked like liquid silver... It gets chilly pretty quickly after sunset, at least it did in November, so don't plan to linger by the sea for too long.

One of those places that no one will tell you about. but you have to visit and discover why Australians are so easy going people. Can get there by car, bus or ferry. Not expensive to travel from City, yet I would always recommend ferry as it gives you 30 minutes trip to enjoy. Of course, if it is raining, ferry will not make it better, but once you are there, there are plenty of places to look and fall in love. Good food, nice beaches, beautiful parks and Iconic walk with famous Gap to take a photo that will look as if you been to the end of the world and back. Go and see lighthouse, have a lunch at "Doyle's on the Beach" fish and chips... will not be disappointed.

A pretty bay, with a lovely walk to the lighthouse and great fish and chips. Get a boat from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay. Its a beautiful little bay with an idyllic family beach. We strolled from here to the lighthouse passing the exhibitionists on Lady Bay nudist beach! We then ate delicious fish and chips from Doyles kiosk right next to the ferry stop -dont be put off by the queues!

great views. This is a lovely place with great views of Sydney.If you walk up to the top of the hill there is a lovely view if the ocean.The famous Doyle's restaurant is there but beware it is really dear for fish and chips
Beautiful scenery. Nice place for couples to hang out, there are a few cafes and bars near the beach. The walk up the hill which showcases the waters is very nice

Good Choice!. We took the ferry out from Circular Quay. Very reasonable priced, especially since the second child was free! Beautiful ferry ride to a great destination. I only wish we had allowed more time to hike around. We went for the afternoon and started with leisurely lunch on the patio at Doyle's. It wasn't until we finished lunch that we realized the last ferry back was at 4:45pm! We scrambled to quickly take a cliff walk and see the harbor heads, but really needed more time to walk farther and fully appreciate it all. It just never occurred to us that the ferry's would stop so early.

Beautiful bay and home to the famous Doyles. Bay was beautiful but unfortunately got caught out like many, and thought the famous Doyles Restaurant was the one on the wharf and ate there. Not good at all. Pretty bad and left most of our meals. The famous one is back further on the street facing the sea but you don't see it at first. Shame.

great place to explore. 2nd time back to watsons bay. just as good as i remembered it. went with 2 friends, caught the ferry from circular quay. had doyles famous fish and chips! fantastic feed! and went for a walk along the coast. awesome place to take friends and just chill.well worth a visit.

Great place to explore. Went over via hop on/off ferry, and went for lunch at Doyle's immediately. After a great seafood meal with wine, we set off to work off the calories by walking around the point. This is easy to walk with a few interesting sites in the lighthouse and the defense works; and the not-so-interesting nudist beach.

A Treasure of a Bay and a little Red Lighthouse. Watson's Bay is a 30 minute and a cheap ferry ride from Circular Quay in Sydney. It boasts of wonderful beaches, beach cafes and a little known trail called the South Head trail that allows a traveler to view the magnificent entrance from the Tasman Sea to Port Jackson (which includes Sydney Harbour). It is astonishing to view the amazing North Head and the wide yawning gap of water seperating the two heads. At South Head which the trail ends, there is a little red lighthouse and some old abandoned military pillboxes and fortifications where you can see the circular well where canons used to be placed.Tip: Please please take the South Head Trail to view the magnificent Tasman Sea and North Head. It takes about 45 minutes to an hour to walk along the trail (Bring water!) but the views are simply stunning!
Nice beach and lovely views across the water. Intersting ferry ride to Watsons Bay from Circular Quay. Takes about half an hour and quite leisurely.
Watsons a must. Watsons Bay offers casual dining on the pier or in the hotel; or fine dining at Doyles; the beaches re beautiful as well.
Boring. Ferry ride out is interesting, but the place itself doesn't seem to have much. There is a park, a bit of a beach and a viewpoint. There is Doyles chippy, which is very expensive.

Nice summer breeze during a hot day. Find a shade, bring some snacks while sitting on a blanket and enjoy the nice summer breeze during a hot day. Whether you're just taking in the sights or people watching, it's a nice area to sit back and relax. There's a popular place that sells fish and chips if you're hungry and willing to wait in line (the place gets crazy busy). There's also restaurants nearby if you prefer a dine-in meal. Then, you can take a stroll to the nearby park or the ocean cliff, "The Gap." Lastly, if you have more time, you can take the ferry to Circular Quay that docks next to the Fish & Chips place.
Nice spot!. One of the stops on the Manly fast ferry from Darling Harbour,always seemed to be very busy whilst we were there but well worth a visit just for the ferry ride alone!

Beautiful. Attended my Nephews wedding under the fig tree at Dunbar House. This was a beautiful setting with the City in the background. It was so nice there we went back the next time to spend more time.
Doyles fish stop. If you travel to Watson's Bay as a tourist, your prime stop must be to Doyle's Seafood Restaurant. Best place, perfect and elegant dining. A walk up the cliffs - great views.

Nice place but busy. Caught the ferry from Central Quay. A nice trip across the harbour with lovely views of the bridge and opera house. Arrived at Watson Bay and queued for fish and chips on the jetty which were ok but not as spectacular as we had been led to believe. Then walked to the beach which was so crowded there was nowhere to sit, so did the coastal walk instead which was less crowded. We went on a Monday I would imagine the weekend would be even worse. Not recommended if you don't like crowds.

Watson's Bay to watch the sunset. We did this late afternoon on a cloudless spring Sydney day. Caught the ferry at the Quay. Took about 30 minutes. We then walked on the South Head Heritage Trail around out toward the tip of the peninsula. Walk took us about an hour, taking our time and reading the fascinating history of this strategic point. Head back just in time for the sunset and a beer at the Beach Club Bar and Restaurant. Definitely a highlight of our stay in Sydney, enjoying the view of the harbour, bridge, opera house from Watson's Bay.

Wonderful Bay/Beach. Friends took us on the ferry from Sydney to Watson's Bay to have lunch at Doyle's. It was an absolutely fantastic ferry ride and a great way to see the entire harbour. Watson's Bay is a great place to chill out and just walk around or enjoy the beach or grassy areas.

The Best Village in Sydney. Sitting in the beer garden of the Wato Bay Hotel, eating some of the freshest sea food available with a coldy in hand, grooving to the sound coming over the speakers and watching tourists traipsing around to all the "must sees", Sydney summer time.We used to run down the hill from the Naval Base as part of our fitness training, we were meant to run either to Bondi or Double Bay and back but a lot of us in the back of the pack stopped at the door of the pub, especially when the weather was good.When my children were small my wife and I used to take them to the park (opposite the pub) and when they got hot it was only a short walk to some very good sheltered beaches such as Camp Cove, one of the best free days out for families in Sydney, with the prospect of a cold bevvy at the pub on the way home or for lunch.

great ferry ride across the harbour. it has got to be one of the most scenic harbours in the world, without the clutter of other city harbours. The ferry service is efficient, the ferry crew are always friendly and helpful. The destination, ie Watsons Bay, was great

Walk South Head for exhilarating breeze and crashing surf. The ferry only departs from Circular Quay but is pretty frequent with one stop at Rose Bay. Lots of popular restaurant/bars rocking on weekends at the end of the ferry pier. Make reservations if you want to eat a nice meal. Walk north a few streets and you will find a second beach and the entrance to the south head park with lighthouse. Be mindful of the nudey beach on the way if you are offended by this sort of thing. Exhilarating wind and crashing surf on the rocks is beautiful at your walk's end/turnaround point. If you walk straight east from the ferry drop off in Watson Bay you can find some more incredible cliffs and crashing surf (with suicide help info signs about). Mother nature reminds you just how small you are!
Beautiful spot. Stopped off here on a tour of Sydney Harbour. Nice parkland in which to while away some time. Queues for Doyle's were horrendous, so didn't bother to try that.

you must visit Doyles in Watson Bay. You can book a table almost on the waters edge and the seafood is excellent,as is the service from friendly staff.You can get there by water taxi,ferry or by road and its a must to visit!
sun, swim and seafood - awesome!. Love this area - have a swim at the beach then have some lunch and a beer at the Watto hotel. No better way to spend a sunny day !

Lovely Watson's Bay. The ferry ride from Sydney Harbor to Watson's Bay was great. We ate fish and chips at a charming restaurant right at the dock where the ferry landed. From there, we walked uphill along the cliffs on the coast - dramatic, sweeping views - and caught a bus to Bondi Beach.
Peaceful little beach. Watson Bay is a cute little place with a small, romantic beach. From there you can easily walk to the South Head which offers breathtaking views of the northern shore.

A bit too crowded. I may be being a little unfair because it was very busy the day we went...... Really enjoyed the ferry ride but we had to queue for quite a while at Doyle's and it kinda felt a bit like a conveyor belt with no deviations allowed which I suppose I can understand with the numbers......we had a BBQ seafood plate which was tasty and a prawn bread roll which was ok...... bit disappointed with the Marie Rose sauce..... Not enough and not available in tubs....... Just tarter and red...... good ferry ride back though.

Great Stop on Ferry Ride. Watson's Bay is located at the end (or beginning depending on how you look at it) of Sydney Harbor (Port Jackson). Great restaurants where you can eat a relaxing lunch. A short hike up a hill will provide you with a multitude of picturesque views of Watson Bay and the ocean where it enters the bay.

Take the Ferry, get some take away. Take the ferry from Circular Quey. Get off and get some take away from Doyles, sit in the park and enjoy the view. Then take a walk along the coast, and grab the bus to Bondi Beach. A great day.

A must do if in Sydney. We spent the day on the beach here before eating at Doyles Restaurant in the evening. The place is very chilled out and free from the hustle and bustle of beaches like Bondi. Doyle's is a superb fish restaurant which must be visited. Be aware that the ferries finish at 4.45 so you will have to get a taxi or water taxi back to the CBD if eating later.

Watsons Bay. A great ferry ride from Sydney to Watsons Bay. Plenty of places to choose to eat at and the park is great to sit in and enjoy the view. The walk to the gap is breathtaking and a must. A great day out, it feels like an overseas trip.

A great place to visit with overseas guests. took our overseas guests there on a Sunday evening to watch the sunset over the bay
Ate dinner at the watson's bay beach club and it was a great evening
Don't you just wanna live here ever time u visit. Sublime cute beautiful great beaches subset drinks what does this place NOT have ........ Nothing I can thing if ....... Tis perfect
Peaceful and scenic. Great view in relaxed hamlet a short ferry ride from Circular Quay. Eat at the Watson's Bay hotel, or one of the 2 famous Doyle's restaurants.

Love Doyle's fish & chips!. No trip to Sydney is complete without a ferry trip to Watsons Bay for some fantastic Fish & Chips at Doyle's. Grab some take-away, and sit by the beach soaking up the view. You can see the Harbour Bridge in the distance.
Lovely!. A lovely ferry ride from Circular Quay, get off at Watsons Bay, dine at one of the restaurants there, take a walk around the Bay to Camp Cove and back on the ferry.

Lovely. A lovely place for relaxing. You can easily take a bus to Watsons Bay, and later passing ferry on back. Amazing various places satisfy you with great foods and ice cream in summer !!
a lovely tea garden nearby also a great & ideal place for drinking a cup of leisure tea

Fantastic view of the start of the Sydney to Hobart boat race. I went to Watson's Bay on Boxing Day for the start of the annual Sydney to Hobart sailing race. It was a lovely day, obviously busy but I got there about an hour before the start and still got a good view. Was easy to get there on the bus. Had great views of the start, and then walked to the lighthouse right at the end of the peninsula to see the boats go through 'the gap' in the harbour. Be careful of the nudist beach if you're sensitive though!

Fantastic Family Location. Watson's Bay has one side to the Quay- in which the ferries run. The other side is the wide open sea connecting to the Pacific.If u wish to relax and lay down you can do so on the small cute beach just beside the ferry station, or in the park, just 2 mins from the ferry station. There are some shops and eateries where you can hang around with friends and families watching the quay.You can also walk up the pavements up to the top of the Watson's Bay to admire the views of the wide open water. There are also some scenic spots to snap photos. If you are there in the late afternoon, don't miss out the sunset over the Sydney city and Harbor bridge. You can also relax and laid back with your loved ones on the top admiring the sunset and the ocean.

A great place for an outing. So easy to get to, with lovely walks and plenty of places to get great food and ice cream in summer.The hop on, hop off ferry comes straight into the take away fish and chips pier and is a great way to start your stay.

Lovely Spot. We went on the bus to Watsons Bay and got the ferry back so had different views which was excellent. While there we had a short walk and then fish and chips takeaway which was excellent. We had an ice cream also which I would thoroughly recommend. A great variety of flavours. Later we wandered along and had a nice cup of tea at a lovely Tea Gardens.

Lovely Area. Watson Bay would be a lovely area to live. We stated a walk along the headland but unfortunately the weather wasn't kind to us it rained again so didn't see it the area in the best light.

A nice little walk. Its worth catching the bus to visit Watson's Bay. You can make an afternoon of it; a long walk, take plenty of photos, grab a bite to eat.At certain points you can also get a great distant view of the Sydney centre and the harbour. It is also quite awe-inspiring looking out to sea from 'the gap' knowing that you are staring at thousands of miles of ocean, and little else. 'The gap' is probably very good for sunrises too as it faces directly east.

Pleasantly surprised with the beach. This place seem like a place where the locals would go on a weekend. It is not crowded with tourist like how Bondi beach is. It has some restaurant selling seafood freshly caught. Beyond the ferry terminals, there are many more nice beaches with crystal clear water as you walk further away, including a nudist beach of Lady Jane Beach. There are some interesting life forms living on the rocks formation by the beach too

Don't forget to get beyond beach. We arrived via Sydney Harbour Cruises and walked up to the Gap which was a good hike yet worth the time. Great views. Looked like some nice shops and park. Good eateriies nearby as well as an outdoor bar where we were abe to sit and talk withut being blasted by music. Made for a nice stop and worth coming back.
ferry and beach walk- day plan. we took the ferry to Watsons bay- great vies, then had fish and chips and caught the bus from there to Bondai beach and did the coast walk

Great restaurants, but no beach destination. There are some good restaurants, know by their amazing fish dishes. You can go for a bit cheeaper ones, that will serve you your meal in a cartboard box ( but just as good) or you can go for a fancier version, but also quite pricy. You have to try the famous australian king prawns!

A great day trip. It's a little like Manly - a great place for a day trip. Good to walk around, relax in the parks, go for a walk and then an afternoon at Doyle's with fish n chips and a bottle of wine. You can drive but it is so easy to get to from Circular Quay.
Beautiful for lunch. just 15 minute ferry ride from Sydney, there is a wonderful restaurant on the beach - Doyles must book

Delightful visit to Watson's Bay. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay and arrived in Watson's Bay mid morning. It was a beautiful sunny day and a good time to arrive before the crowds. The sea breeze kept the temperature pleasant. We wandered around the foreshore watching families playing in the water. We bought some delicious takeway fish and chips from the pier, sat under and the Moreton Bay Figtrees beside the water and enjoyed the view of the harbour. It was a delightful morning and a great harbour trip for visitors and locals. Don't forget your hat, sunscreen and camera. There's also a wonderful harbour pool for those who want to swim.

Tranquility in frenetic Sydney. Very laid back, beautiful safe beach with hardly any waves, good eateries. Amazing playgrounds for kids. Easy access to and from Sydney CBD (Circular Quay), can also take a ferry direct from Manly to Watson's Bay. Top tip: $2.50 all day family public transport ticket on Sundays, but beware, if it's a nice day, the ferries and Watson's Bay will be packed.
Sights around Watsons Bay.. Loved this place especially the Tearoom.The service was excellent and food great too.waiters and waitresses were very pleasant and helpful.will definitely be back again.
Lunch at Watson's Bay. Took the ferry to Watson's Bay for lunch. Food was great! Ferry ride is only 15 minutes from Sydney Harbour, so very convenient.

Relaxed place. Go to Watsons bay with the ferry, you will have a great sight of the opera from the sea. After half an hour, you will land in the bay, small beaches, not too crowded, nice restaurants, and an amazing point of view of the city, and a great coastal walk. A nice afternoon!
Wonderful Scenery, Awful Parking.. The cliffs and the bay views are breathtaking, but finding a parking space on a weekend is a nightmare. It's better to go by public transport.

Wonderful views. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay and you won't be disappointed. Lovely walk through the park to Watson's Gap and a walk to the top of the cliff for fantastic views. Eat at Doyle's Fish Café rather than on the beach as the seagulls tend to swoop down! We caught the bus from Watsons Bay to Bondi Beach to enjoy another Sydney delight.
Surprising view. Called here via our City tour. What a sight looking straight across the opening of Sydney Harbour, absolutely beautiful
Ferry in. We ferried across to Watson's Bay which was a great trip and it was very quick. Only downer was last ferry back is at 4:45 which is quite early for a summer day
Gorgeous views and sunset. Ferry trip there is full of lovely views. good bars and restaurants on the beach. Pity the return ferry stops so early.

Spectacular views.. A quick ferry ride away from Darling Harbour and Circular Quay is Watson's Bay. We did the walk along The Gap to the Light House and enjoyed the spectacular views of South and North Heads down to the rocks below. A good walk with two children (12&10) able to do it easy. Wonderful view back towards the city. A must do.
Lovely spot - worth the drive. Just be ready to pay plenty to enjoy the food. Even Take away is "exe" but it really is superb. Make reservations at Doyle's and you won't forget it!

a different perspective. Watson's Bay is like a hidden secret of Sydney. Many know it's there and frequent it, but it still gives you the sense of discovery and delight. And it offers an unique perspective on Sydney Harbour while providing many top restaurants and breakfast locations.

Spectacular setting and lunch At Dunbar House. Beautiful spot---make sure you walk around to Camp Cove and around the Hornby lighthouse with views to Manly. Lunch or breakfast at Dunbar House is delicious and good value with a sophisticated ambience. Not to be missed

A little piece of heaven. Just a 20 minute ferry ride from the Circular Quay set some time aside for a few hours in Watsons Bay next time you are in Sydney. A former fishing village now a community of eclectic heritage homes (and some upscale waterfront properties) with glorious beachfront at every turn. A couple of waterfront restaurants in a postcard setting overlooking the harbour. Not to be missed.

Go to Doyle's. Well, I'm a Doyle so how could I pass up the opportunity to visit Doyle's by the sea? If you want a nearly private beach with a great hotel, restaurants, and activities, this is the best place you can visit. I've been going there for the past 20 years and I still love it!

nice cafe and fish & chips, big park. nice place to have cup of drinks and snacks watching the ocean. there is play ground for kids and big grass park.many of residents come to spend their time on weekends with family. if you need to take a break from the routine day life, pls pay a visit here. It is close GAP PARK where you can see some nice cliff

Beautiful place. We decided on a day trip to Watson bay from the main Sydney harbour terminal. Cost is low to travel over by ferry and you get excellent views of the opera house and bridge, almost a mini harbour cruise. Watsons bay is a lovely place, there are excellent beaches and great views. There is a pub and a couple of nice places to eat. Shops are lacking and people feeding the seagulls has attracted problems but that aside watsons bay is well worth a visit.

Beautiful setting. You must definitely walk the Gap it is well worth it , the scenery is stunning and then turn round and take a photo of Sydney in the distance , and the breathe !!!!!!! .have a wander down to beach and then stroll to Doyle's near the ferry terminal for a fish lunch , very busy restaurant but well worth the wait , food Is delish !!!!!!

Lovely Watson's Bay. What a lovely view of Sydney Harbour from Watson's Bay. Enjoyed relaxing at the park and the Gap is such a wonderful creation of God. Will make it again to Watson's Bay if I go to Sydney again.

Take the ferry.. A good ferry ride from the city to this type of fishing village. A hotel is on the beach front where we had a beer then indulged in a big lunch. You can also walk 5 minutes up to the clifftop to see the entrance to the harbor.
not worth it.. Took the ferry to Watsons Bay, the bay itself is very picturesque but after eating lunch at the overpriced and overrated Doyles Fish Restaurant cannot say it is worth going here.

Very picturesque part of Sydney. Every time I come overseas to Sydney, I always feel I need to see Watson's Bay and Gap Bluff on the other side of the park. Watson's Bay itself has a great little beach with soft sand, trees to stay in the shade, restaurants and a nice fish and chips joint. There is also a kids playground in the middle of the park. I am always captivated by the big cliffs and huge waves on Gap Bluff. You can climb the stairs on the left or right as you approach the cliffs. If you have trouble climbing stairs you can still marvel from the bottom. The views are just great and you can see the different colours in the water as it crashes against the rocks. On one occasion I took the ferry to Watson's Bay from Circular Quay and it is a very pleasant ride.

great short excursion from Sydney center. Easy to get to by ferry (but don't go too late: last ferry at 3:45 pm), Watsons Bay is a small suburb town. Originally a fishing village, it's still got some small town feel. Great stroll along the southern headlands, and some seafood and ice cream by the ferry terminal. A nice big lawn leading to the small beach is good for lazing. Wouldn't take a swim, though: the sewage outlet is right there in the sand, making the water murky.

Ferry me over. Take the ferry from circular quay to Watson's bay for an afternnon brunch and great views of the Sydney opera house. You can go swimming at the beach, eat at the rastaurant or take a hike in the area. Quite easy to spend an entire afternoon there whiling away the time of day...
Beautiful views. Worth the visit to see this historic place. The views are amazing, put this on your to do list for sure

Amazing view and gorgeous walk. One of the most beautiful spots in this glorious city. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay and enjoy the harbour. Then there are two walks you can do, one to the left up to the South Head and light house-very easy and one hour return. The second one goes up and across the park up to the Gap for stunning views. Make sure to make reservations ahead of time at Doyle's outside on patio. Opens at 12. Yes it is expensive but just go with it you are paying for the view!

Good feel and place to spend half a day. Lunch at the beach club. Swim in the harbour at the pool to the right of the ferry jetty as you are walking to the shore. Walk up the back to look over the cliffs. SUP in the harbour bays.

Nice place to see the harbor and the ocean. We took the hop on hop off water taxi to Watson's Bay. It's a cute little fishing/vacation village. We had wonderful fish and chips at the restaurant right on the dock. One thing to be aware of, the hop on hop off boat docks at the very end of the dock and doesn't stay very long. Because of that, we missed the next boast and had to wait 40 minutes. That actually turned out OK because it gave us time to walk up the hill and view the ocean.

Fantastic panorama of the city. If you are only in Sydney for a few days and the sun is shining then this is a great visit. By taking the ferry at very modest cost you will have a harbour "tour" as well as a short cruise. Much nicer trip than on the larger ferry and choppier ride to Manly Beach. When you alight at Watson's Bay, and if you don't fancy fish & chips, turn right on the promenade and make the short walk to the cafe opposite the open air swimming pool. Very pleasant place for a coffee and a bite to eat. Afterwards head up across the park and you will have great views of the ocean and an even better one looking back to the city skyline, including the Harbour Bridge. Afternoon return ferries stop early so we took the bus and stopped off at Bondi Beach on the way back, and then at Westfield Shopping Mall a bit closer to the city. A great day out and much better than an expensive organised tour.

Great Place to Go. Get there by a fast ferry from the Circular Quay and do not forget to book for meal at the Doyles, famous fishmongers! There are some nice little beaches and that wonderful walk up to the South Head lighthouse. Fantastic views of the Sydney Harbour.

Beautiful!. Lovely bay within easy ferry ride from circular key or darling Harbour . Doyles seafood restaurants and bars only 1 minute from ferry pier . We visited just for lunch but thought it would be a lovely place to stay longer . The view beyond Sydney Harbour from the look out was fabulous and definitely worth walking 3 minutes across the road to see.
Beautiful spot. Really fantastic place to watch the sun set. Eat in the pub rather than Doyle's though - great food.

Nice trip to Sydney suburb. Interesting to have cliff at one side of the road and beach view at the other side. Quiet and beautiful suburb area. If you are not driving I would suggest to take the train from CBD to bondi junction, change to bus 380/333 to bondi beach for a visit. From bondi beach take bus 380 to Watsons bay. Visit the Gap and then lunch at the beach / pier area (fish and chips) and then take the ferry back to Circular Quay where you can have the view of Opera House and Sydney bridge from the sea.

sunday afternoon delight. my 2nd visit to Sydney and Watson bay draws me back it best to see the place on a sunday afternoon the views and places are great and the trip across by ferry is one of my abiding memories and having lunch looking out to the bay

Include this in your top things to do in Sydney. The harbor view is fantastic.You can catch a nice bite of take out and eat in the adjoining park. Parking is a bit difficult, but access is easy via public transport.We're from the states and enjoyed this perspective lot with some local friends. 30 min or so from Circular Quay

Beautiful Area to take Overseas Guests. A ferry ride to Watsons' Bay, fish and chips at Doyles or a drink at the Hotel. A walk to the Gap and around the point to see where the first 'invaders' landed.......a lovely view from the National Park headland to see North Head and entrance to Sydney Harbour and there's always the chance of a sunbake and swim at the beach........so much to do, definitely worth a visit!

A little piece of heaven and history.. Make a day of it, catch the ferry from the quay to watsons Bay and have lunch at the hotel or splah out at Doyles seafood right on the beach. A fantastic day out and just a short walk to camp Cove beach for that swim afterwards.

Take the ferry from Circular Quay. For those wanting to see the harbour the ferry ride to Watson's Bay is a must.When you get off you can walk to the Gap and view the Pacific or the headland and see the entrance to Sydney harbour.Before you leave enjoy some seafood at Doyles's...

Good place!. Rode the ferry for about 20mins to Watson's Bay. First thing you see is the small beach and Doyle's...we walked further straight and took a stroll at the park. Further to the end is the Coastal cliff, beautiful views from there, you could even climb up the cliff. Spent about 1hr here an had the Fish and Chips by Doyle's, quite pricey but not bad.

Got to visit Doyles. OK, so the quayside restaurant is pricey (40 AUD for fish and chips), but it's probably the best fish and chips you will ever eat, and the views are sublime - oh, and there's a Doyles take away (with tables) where you can have the same food for a fraction of the price. Lovely walk up to South Head and the lighthouse, past Lady Bay nudist beach!

Not for the budget conscious.. Friend and I really struggled to get the barbecued king prawns away from the shells. 5 king prawns on a bed of saffron rice with some rocket on top for about $35. Very disappointed knowing the reputation this restaurant has for it's seafood. Ice cream was good.

Great lunch and views over the bay. We jumped off the city cat and stopped for a few Sunday drinkies and seafood lunch at the Watson's Bay Hotel. It has been fully renovated and the beer garden looks out over the bay. It is a glorious location and we spent a few hours there. Great atmosphere and the place was jam packed. Would highly recommend it.
Do you get here if you're sad or gloomy. Spectacular beach, steep cliffs, One of the most beautiful beaches Sydney has to offer easy to reach by bus or ferry.

Worth a visit. Still quaint in its own way with tranquil small beaches and calm waters. Great for swimming. Doyles on the beach or the wharf serves consistently good food, although pricey. The pub offers good value meals and the atmosphere and views of the harbour are stunning.
Doyles seafood and lovely views.... Just loved the location, but it is a long way out of town. Good food and a relaxing atmosphere at the pub, made it a worthwhile visit.
Fun small place to see. It is a fun small place to go and check out. There are places to get ice cream and they have great Fish and Chips.
Best fish and chips. Good to walk around and look across the harbour.wonderful views on cliff top walk. Very friendly and great places to eat.

Back after 17 years. We stayed at the hotel last time and went back to see what had changed. Much more upmarket and expensive but a nice place to dine and stroll around still. Shame the last ferry is at 4pm.

A lovely place to while away a few hours. We really enjoyed our trip to Watson's bay (we got the bus from Bondi and it only took 15-20 minutes). Sadly we didn't give ourselves enough time to explore, as had not realised that there was so much to see and do, in a relatively small place. It was visually beautiful and there is the added advantage of the Gap to see, complete with cliff top walks. Make sure that you have a few hours to explore and to get some of the famous fish & chips. We got the ferry back to the harbour and it was a really nice journey back, with some lovely views along the way.

Got to visit!. Watson is popular for its fish and chips!! you can either get fish and chips from the take way or the restaurant!
Watson very pretty also with a few small beaches and a cliff walk which iswell know for its suicides so dont be suprised if you see lots of help signs.

Spectacular gem. This a piece of paradise! Simply magical and beautiful.
Take a lunch with you and stay for the day! Swim, snorkel, read, relax.
Place to relax.. Here is place you usually go to relax or picnics or chill out on Weekends. Very accessible by Ferry or Bus. There are nice fish and Chips available anso a Nice Pub food..

Worth a stop, coffee and an ice-cream. Scenic with an atmosphere, away from crowds, a cozy, residential feel, lovely walk to the Gap with another great view, birds and clean water, I just loved the area. A nice drive on the way to Watson's Bay too with wonderful houses around the area. I was there in autumn/early winter. Enjoyed the sun heading towards sunset, the billowy breeze, the opportunities for photo-taking. A nice place to play around with your DSLR. All the harbours in Sydney are a worth a photo-stop but I especially enjoyed walking around Watson's Bay.
beautiful place to spend a sunny day. Water is clear and you have a wonderful view of the harbour and the city. Nearby campcove is a great place for a swim

a quiet harbour side enclave. Watson's Bay is a quiet residential area near Sydney Heads. A trip on the ferry from the city to the bay, then a walk to the famous Gap to work up an appetite for lunch at one of the nearby eating places followed by a stroll along to the couple of harbour beaches close by is a wonderful way to spend a relaxing day that is a uniquely Sydney experience.
Overrated destination. Most ferry stops are just as good, without the huge queues for very average fish and chips.I didn't do the full walk around south head -that may be good??

Cliff walk is a must do. Such amazing views from Watsons bay, grab a coffee and go for a walk along the coast. Can spot whales off the coast from here at certain times of year. Absolutely beautiful spot in Sydney.

wedding celebration. For the first time I stop and don't just pass by Watson's bay I was invited to a wedding at Dunbar house for the diner and the celebration was under the fig tree. With the sundown it was just magical and the food delicious with efficient service.

Fish and chips. Great restaurant and pub at Watsons bay. Either order the fish and chips from the counter or head to one of the fancy restaurants. Bring your wallet. they can be expensive. The fish and chips from the counter are reasonably priced. Its better to get there a little early because as soon as the ferry pulls up the take out and restaurant gets very busy. After eating head up the hill to "the Gap" for a fantastic view.

Sydney harbour - one of the Gorgeous bays. Take a ferry from Circular Quay, and explore this luscious area the beaches, spectacular view both out to the ocean up the hill to the "Gap" then turn and see the city, bridge and Opera House and the harbour foreshore for 'miles'.

Beautiful Little Spot. The ferry ride is a very enjoyable way to reach Watson's Bay. Bring a picnic, there are lots of places to sit down and enjoy the view. Walk up the hill and you will get to Gap Road and the stunning views over the cliffs to the water. Nearby beside the little group of shops, you will also find the bus stop for bus 380 which will take you back to the city via Bondi and then the Bondi Junction transport interchange. The bus ride itself is entertaining. Sit on the higher level at the back behind the driver and you will get great views of the harbour and the city skyline; sit up high on the other side and you will see the views of Bondi further along on your trip.
"Sunny Sunday Special". What a way to spend a sunny Sydney Sunday, fish and chips in Watson's Bay. It was so busy but so worth the wait. Just go and enjoy.

What's happened to Watson's Bay?. Not having been to Watson's Bay for a number of years we thought we would spend a day walking around the place, going for coffee and something to eat. Oh dear! Firstly do yourself a favour and take the ferry as there is NO parking. The walk around the Gap and in the park was wonderful, so on to the pub for coffee and something to eat. Overpriced, had to wait a very long time for service and food. Food very ordinary and the pub was sterile with dreadful furnishings. Unfortunately we could have gone to the tea house where it looked beautiful but full. So next time we will take a picnic. We will still go back but only for the walk around the Gap.

Beautiful Bay - some tips for tourists. Watson's Bay is beautiful and well worth the trip. Take a short walk via the road to Laings Point Reserve, only a 5 minute walk but has a great view back over sydney skyline.Avoid Doyles "World Famous" fish and chips. I can't comment on the fish as I only had chips but they are frozen reconstituted chips! How is it every chippy in the UK can make real chips from potatoes yet Doyles have to serve up the frozen variety?!The last ferry back is at 4:30pm. HOWEVER what they don't advertise is that Sydney public ferries stop at 3pm! We got stung and had to pay $9 each for a private ferry back to Circular Quay despite the fact that we had a 7 day multipass for public transport which we had paid $44 for.

Wonderful day trip. Took the ferry to Watsons Bay and a beaufiul trip it was going past all the the beautiful homes along the way. We took the walk up to the gap which is well and truly worth it and the Teahouse is a beautiful place to stop for a cuppa. We had lunch at the pub, which was lovely. A little overpriced but it was Good Friday so we expected that.
Breathtaking view. This is one of the most beautiful bays I have visited throughout the world. It was absolutely stunning!

a must!. fantastic ferry ride on a handsome cat style boat to the famous Doyles on the beach, plenty of seating and mouthwatering fish and chips lovely picturesque little place with a tiny beach and ice-cream available right on the jetty.
Beautiful. Lovely place, take the 380 bus from the quay, great views of Sydney and the sea the other side , good restaurants and bars, great for picnics or just hanging out.

Go by ferry and back by bus :). Watson's Bay is a beaut place to visit. We usually take the ferry to the Bay as its scenic, inexpensive and fun. If you decide to go by ferry check the timetable for the return trip.Watsons Bay has a beautiful park where you can take in the view or perhaps sit there with a great seafood meal from Doyles takeaway. If you want something a la carte you may prefer the restaurant itself but its quite pricey.The Watsons Bay Hotel is a landmark and also has a great view of the water and a vast menu so as you can see you have lots of choices. The beer garden is really good but often a little too crowded.For something different you may want to take the return trip via bus which is also a nice trip.For visitors to Sydney just in case you don't know, you can purchase all day transport tickets which allows unlimited train, bus and ferry rides. Great value indeed :)

Awesome View. What a view -- and take the Ferry to get there and not the bus. Doyle's is there to grab some food and if up to it you can walk to Bindi Beach (about 1.5 hours). great place to see the history and entrance to the harbor.

Fish n Chips. I generally found fish and chips in Doyles to be good. In some respects location too adds as much to the experience as the quality of the food. "Bottom of the Harbour" on Watson Bay has good fish and chips, and the high turnover ensures they are really fresh. Great to sit by the beach and enjoy the view."Doyles" (the takeaway) in Watson's Bay, is a great location, I really love Doyles restaurants and is good to sit by the beach side and take in the view and I always find the ferry trip to and fro good to watch

Leisurely lunch venue. We took the hop on hop off ferry here and sat and had a very leisurely lunch in the library cafe, overlooking views of sydney harbour harbour. A very peaceful place to eat and watch the world go by.

three hour walk in Watson's Bay and Vaucluse. Start your walk at the majestic Macquarie Lighthouse 1883,it stands on a high bluff overlooking the ocean on one side, and the harbor terrain on the other,with sweeping views from headlands to secluded coves and white sandy beaches. Follow Old South Head Road to the plaque marking Australia's worst maritime disaster where the ship Dunbar,crashed into the rocks. The crashing waves pounding below,re-inforce the mood.The anchor of the ship is set into concrete,a little further on. Take the steps down to the Gap,bear right into the entrance of sydney Harbour national Park. This single-lane roadway leads to HMAS Watson Military Reserve,where a small chapel has windows offering spectacular views of North head and the Pacific ocean. Past a row of weatherboard cottages and you step onto camp cove,a peaceful ribbon of sand popular in summer. Parking is at a premium. Watson's bay has the iconic Doyle's eatery as well as casual eateries nearby. Catch a ferry back to the city or a bus.

Fish by the sea. Used our Multi pass on the ferry to go to Watsons Bay. Had fish & chip under the shade of a tree, overlooking the Bay. We then went for a walk to the Gap. Magnificant rock formation. Very peaceful. Then the ferry back to the hussle & bussle

Lovely spot but dining was outrageously expensive!. We caught the hop on and off ferry from Cirqular quay and got off at Watsons bay. We immediately found the very highly recommended dining venue of Doyle's restaurant. Granted, it is a spectacular venue with an amazing atmosphere but the expense of it is ridiculous....$41 for whiting and chips!! The garlic bread was soggy and felt like it was cooked in a microwave. To top it off, they charge $5 per person weekend surcharge. This astronomical expense had us leaving Watsons Bay quickly....I did not even have chance to visit the nudist beach :(

A not so secret gem with a sweetener at the end - super fish and chips. A tourist must. Lovely for a walk. Stunning scenery and interesting to boot. Great pub for a drink or two of do what the locals do....grab some take away fish and chips from the wharf. Some of the best seafood you can find

Put this on your must see list. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay. The ferry stops at Rosé Bay and Double Bay so you get to see these areas as well. Watsons bay is a great beach for families. Dine at The Doyles which overlooks the water, not the one on the pier. Try to get a table at the water's edge, sit back and enjoy the views. Afterwards it's a fairly comfortable walk around South Head. The path is well laid out. Be sure to take your camera.

A little gem to visit. Watsons bay is an 19 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay. Our day was beautiful so we went out for lunch. Beautiful fast ride right past the opera house. You exit the ferry and are on a little harbour. You walk straight ahead up onto the hill where you have something called the GAP.....a break in rocks looking out onto the pacific ocean on the other side of the bay....10 minute walk. There is a small hotel Watsons bay hotel....With a terrible restaurant in another review....and the always consistent and delicious Doyles. Eat at Doyles and keep in mind that Monday-Thursday or Friday they have a $28 fish an chips special with 1 drink an bowl of soup....excellent. It is a beautiful location....just to sit and relax......

This is a MUST!. The highlight of the place is not only Australia's first lighthouse but also the magnificent panoramic view of Sydney (including the Harbor Bridge) from the cliff lookout. It's the most beautiful cliff lookout I've seen in the city.If you like big rocks, cliffs, sea, sun, sand, cliff, and birds, don't miss this! There're buses if you don't drive.

Wow just great. Food,cleanliness, great day picnic,relax,swim,great hiking around awesome views of Harbour and heads!
Lots of great bird life too

Best little quiet spot with so much potential. Beautiful spot, all year round.Even in winter now, get the bus from Bondi Central or the Ferry from Circular Quay.Walk up to North Head and along the ocean path to Gap Park and Signal Hill lighthouse. Invigorating.Now you are out of puff and still enjoy the view, treat yourself to the downhill walk to Watson's Bay, grab some fish and chips at the wharf whilst waiting for the next Ferry back to Circular Quay.Enjoy the fresh winds up on top deck or the views from down below in the lounge.

lovely day out. Best known for the fish and chips at Doyles fish and chip shop.You could either take out at the restaurant near the pier or eat at the small restaurant. Good fish and chips and great coastal walk. Very pretty harbour!!

watsons Bay. Just perfect here. Had a milk shake the first time around and where we purchased those they also did pizzas which looked fantastic. Made a special trip back to Watsons Bay for lunch just to buy their pizzas. Only downfall you couldn't buy a whole pizza for lunch purchase was by slice only. Still worth the trip. Sat on the grass and ate the pizza and watched the world go by.

Ferry trip makes it worth going. Catch the ferry from circular Quay to Watson Bay. It allows you to see the amazing houses that line the water and Watson's Bay is small but worth the trip. Don't bother trying to eat the expensive fish and chips at the hotel on the wharf. Walk across the road and enjoy the scenery looking out the sea and "GaP'.
Great Seafood at this Beautiful Location. Loved the Seafood and the location at great place to visit any time but gets busy on the weekends, can walk to the famous The Gap

Early naval history.. Parts of Watson's bay are have old and well established homes. Some are small and some luxury mansions. Whatever size they wil be worth a fortune. The bay looks straight up the harbour to the bridge and the city skyline is spectacular at night. Take the road past the pub and it will lead you to Camp cove with it's beach homes. Very unusual for Sydney to have buildings right on the beach. Either side is rock and bush. Back in the pub you can get a seafood meal, steak and slalds as well as sweets. Take a stroll down to the beach and enjoy lobster mournay at Doyles on the beach or the same at Doyles on the wharf. Probably best done late in the afternoon. The bus terminates right there and runs regularly.

Great Views But That's About It. Watson's Bay is miles away from the centre of Sydney and I'm just wondering if I would tell my friends to go there if they were visiting here? Don't get me wrong, the views from here, and the local surrounds are very good, but that's about it. Aside from that you have the original Doyle's fish restaurant which is fabulous (and FAR FAR better than the one in the Rocks) and not much else really. I don't think it's worth the journey unless you want to have amazing food at Doyle's.

Watson 's Bay Attractions. The start of the visit to Watson's Bay was by ferry ride from circular quay to Watson's Bay wharf. Upon arrival you have Doyle's fish restaurants to fill an empty stomach with fish and chips or prawns, salads etc. A walk around the shore where more restaurants and a Hotel exist and a wonderful park where to sit on the grass and look back over Sydney Harbour is extremely relaxing. The directions of a walk around the back streets to the old lighthouse site is clearly displayed and worth the walk. No visit to Watson's Bay is complete without a walk up to the cliffs of South Head and the famous Gap -look for fishermen attempting the impossible at this dangerous spot. Then back to the pier and a restful short ferry ride back to Circular Quay via Rosebay, Double Bay.

Great seaside village. Great view of the harbour, lovely walk and fab location for a beach picnic the pub is great and a visit to Doyle's restaurant is a must. In summer a great palace to take the family for a lovely day at the beach especially if you don't like the strong waves in the surf.

Fish & Chips on the Beach. Taking the ferry from Sydney's Circular Quay to Watsons Bay is a very pleasant outing and once there, you can walk up the hill to The Gap, which looks across the Heads to the opening of the harbour out into the ocean. Back down at the water's edge is the famous Doyles Fish & Chip Restaurant but if your wallet doesn't stretch that far, they have a Beachside Fish & Chip shop with excellent fish & chips at much lower prices but equally as delicious. Go for lunch then walk it off up to The Gap - you can't beat it.

Beautiful scenery. I think watson's Bay is one of the most beautiful place on earth!! You can see the different side of Sydney on top of the hill, the City side of Sydney and the other is the blue ocean side with amazing cliffs.
Easy access by ferry. This attraction is famous for Doyles Restaurant its a bit pricey but the seafood is fantastic and so fresh , if your on a budget then Doyles have a Kiosk for the thrifty

A good tourist spot. Watson's Bay, even the local people love to do coastal walk here. You can either take bus from city or Ferry from city to get here. Sydney is full of sea view places and this is one of the best places to visit. Fish & chips is one of my favorite local food. A very relaxing atmosphere there.

Wonderful Watsons Bay. Take the ferry or bus from the city. Watsons Bay on a nice day is brilliant. Make sure you walk around to Camp Cove walk along the beach and then up the stairs to South Head. It has to be one of the best places in Sydney. You can eat at the pub or Doyle's famous fish place's. They have formal dining at the restaurant or take away and sit in the park from Doyle's on the pier

Waterfront beauty.... A great view of the harbour. Great restaurants and pub overlooking the beach. Watson's Bay Hotel, the famous Doyle's Seafood restaurant - an iconic area with lots of history. Lots of magnificant homes in this area of Sydney...Get there....

Ideal for a short half day break. Love the food options, Doyle's or The Watson Bay Hotel, buy fish and chips and eat at the waterfront or just grab an Ice-cream while watching the bustling harbour life

Private Beachfronts and Doyles, with Something for Everybody.. Watson's Bay is quintessential Sydney. It's where you start getting towards the affluent end of town, with homes that have their own beach frontages and boats to travel across the harbour in. However, packed amongst the seafront homes, albeit modest in comparison to places like Vaucluse, is a Sydney institution. Doyles. Doyles do,or maybe even are Seafood in Sydney. They have been going over three generations and what started out as an upmarket Seafood restaurant, has now expanded to a pub (hotel) and fish and chip shop as well as the original restaurant. I last ate at the pub. The food was variable, depending on what you ordered, but the atmosphere fabulous. The restaurant is still the place to go if you have the cash. They also have an outlet at the Sydney Fish Market.If you really want to splurge catch a water taxi back across the Harbour after indulging in Sydney Rock Oysters and freshly caught fish, even if its from the fish and chip shop!

take the ferry here, explore, and then go to Bondi to Coogee. the ferry from circular Quay 4 hugs the southern part of the harbor so that you can see some of the homes built for harbor views. there is a small park for young children and can walk north a bit. Take the 380 bus to Bondi form Watson's Bay to Bondi, and take the walk to Bronte and Coogee. The ferry at night affords night views of the city skyline, bridge, and opera house.
Beautiful!!. One of the most beautiful places I've been to and for free! You can spend a day out there walking around the nature and just explore

Scenic walk on the edge of Sydney. This is a well maintained walk with great views of the harbour and the open sea. The walk starts from the Watson's bay wharf. If you are hungry you can taste some seafood from one of the famous Doyles restaurants on the wharf or beach before starting the walk. From the wharf walk through the park to reach the walk trail. You can either walk towards the left for a loop to see the Hornsby lighthouse. There are many historic places on this walk and the views of city skyline are stunning. You can take few detours through small unmaintained tracks through bushes if you like little adventures. From some of the viewpoints if you get lucky you can even see the humpback whales in the open sea during the whale migration season. The walk right side of the Watson's bay wharf leads to old south head, the gap and the Macquarie lighthouse which is Australia's first lighthouse and still operational. If you are tired and don't feel like walking back to the Wharf, you can catch a bus to city from the bus stop near the Macquarie lighthouse. The walk requires at least half day and don't forget to carry plenty of water. Plan the walk on a sunny day and I bet you won't forget the experience.

Great renos!. I used to come here a lot when I lived in Sydney, was always a family favorite but found it to be a bit run down and RSL club feeling of recent years. Decided to bring the family by last Sunday. Was blown away! Admittedly the current construction sight was a bit of an eye sore - but the food, service and quality of the place has been improved 10 fold! Cant wait for the full renovations to be finished so we can come see it!

Doyles. The only time I have queued for lunch for over an hour but well worth the wait. Hadn't realised the popularity of this restaurant and so hadn't booked. The food was superb, service excellent and bliss overlooking the bay.

Postcard Pictures. We went to the Cliff and the view was awesome. We took a lot of pictures there and it doesn't need a professional to have a postcard pictures of this awesome awesome views. We also did not miss the fish and chip from Doyle's seafood restaurant there.
Don't miss the walk down. Once at the top of the Gap walk, check the monument to the man who saved many from suicide and take the shady track down to the little feeder road back to the bus park.
Great views. Views are not just of the harbor. Walk from the ferry drop off to The Gap and Southhead. Great views and invigorating walk. Then, enjoy lunch at Doyle's.

Doyle's "Famous" Seafood done in Queues and Aussie $$$. Watson's Bay is NEAR Sydney, Australia, and features a financial an ambience that may invite natives and tourists back again and again.We visited Watson's Bay by bus by Ferry.We immediately determine that Doyle's Seafood "restaurant" was on our radar_Seems famous according to the locals. Hmmmmmmm!Expect a festive atmosphere.More like a seafood McDonalds.Secure a table; NO SERVICE STAFF.GOTO the rear (front) of this shack, and stand in a queue for 20 -40 minutes to order fish and chips, prawns, lobster, ....Doyle's takes only Aussie $$$, and this is a pain.Deposit meal on table; GOTO bar for Doyle's larger.Meal is ok, but there are better restaunts with SERVICE!Nice walks to reaveal ocean cliffs, and a great sunny PMSo, yeah! Watson's bay is worth a visit, but save mealtime for Darling Harbour!
Just lovely. Great ferry ride Very scenic Had lunch at Watsons bay on the beach and a walk around the gapVery nice awesome sights will certainly recommend

Take a ferry from the harbour, then off to Bondi. This is a very nice place that you can visit on your way to Bondi beach. A nice, relatively cheap ferry ride from the harbour, with great views. It is a very small but nice beachfront area, with a few good restaurants. Immediately across, just 5 minutes walking from the ferry arrival, you have another very nice walk along the steep coast which has great views both ways, into the ocean off the cliffs, and to Sydney at a distance. Between the two, you can take a 20 minute bus ride to Bondi beach. Well worthwhile.

Must go, when in Sydney. First of all, it is a nice boat ride over there. And once there, you have a nice view over the skyline of Sydney on one side and on the other side beautiful outlook over the steep coast to the ocean. I really enjoyed it, the weather was awesome also!

The Very Best. We went back three times. Take the ferry. Take the easy hike to the lighthouse (anyone can tell you how). Pack sandwiches, chocs and wine. Or eat at Doyle's. They've been in business since 1800s. For a real splurge have banana pancakes at Dunbar House (they caramelize the bananas like brûlée. Anyway, back to the bay- the view is amazing and you can spot whales.

So close to the city and yet so far from care. spectacular contrast between the ruggedness of "the Gap" (A cliff face/lookout on the ocean side of this narrow suburb on a peninsula between the ocean and the harbour) contrasting with the quieter harbourside with it's gentler slopes and jetty. Enjoy the 1000s of boats bbbing in the harbour while sipping your favorite drnk at Watson's Bay hotel while watching the sunset over Sydney Harbour Bridge! A Special place worth visiting itself.

Cool and relaxed as you can get,what a view!. You can see to the city, sip on your favourite ,eat fish and salads, or chippies .It's an excellent people watching place, set in millionaires row. Travel by ferry back to Double Bay or City,easy and great for anyone new to Sydney

Make sure you visit here!. Watson's Bay is just beautiful! There is a great pub, a really famous restaurant and the most amazing views of the city and rocky shores you can only imagine. Get a ferry out there, grab a kayak, have a walk, but my favourite thing to do is grab some takeaway fish and chips and a six pack of beer and laze in the sun with friends in the beautiful park there.
Watsons bay pub. Great food -fast service -beautiful spot to visit ferry ride over on beautiful Sydney harbour differently worth a visit regards Nicole watts

Summers Days at Watsons Bay a Must. There are some great Pubs and Restaurants at Watsons Bay, and walks around the Sydney Headlands to boot. If on the weekend the Watson's Bay Hotel is an institution overlooking Sydney Harbour on a hot afternoon.
Lovely Views. Was chilly and raining a bit, but, the view was stunning along the walkway. Enjoyed our stroll. and defiantly a must do.

My favourite place in Sydney. After staying 4 times in Sydney I can say: Watson´s bay is my favorite place . You go there by ferry, find beautiful, calm beaches, walks along the coast with views on Port Jackson and the Tasman Sea. Just wonderful. While having a drink or a lovely meal at "Doyles on the beach" you look over the water and see the phantastic skyline of Sydney - something you´ll never forget. I promise .
The Gap. Stunning views of the Gap, but that's about all at Watson's Bay. As far as having Doyles fish and chips (takeaways)...give it a miss!!!

End to a lovely walk along the southern side of harbour. We arrived at Watson's Bay after walking along the southern side of the harbour from Edgecliff. Watson's Bay welcomed us with a lovely park full of people enjoying picnics. We took in the wonderful view back towards the city. We enjoyed a well earned drink at the WB pub. There are many eating options from cafes, takeaway fish and chips, pub grub and the famous Doyles restaurant. Don't forget to take the climb back up to the east and see the eastern coastline from The Gap and walk around to the South Head. Catch the ferry back to the city and you will have had a great day out.

Do not miss this bay and bluffs and Sea. If taking Captain Cook's Hop on Hop off ferry, head right out to the Watson's Bay stop. As you exit the ferry, make a luncheon reservation at Doyle's (or better yet do this ahead of time) hoping for an outside table on the bay then head up,through a delightful park out to the bluffs and headlands as Sydney Harbor enters The Tasman Sea. Take the walks up into and along the sandstone bluffs. Spectacular views with the sea crashing against the bluffs. Then you can look back over to Sydney Harbor. Calm and peaceful! You have now worked up an appetite for a wonderful sea food lunch at Doyle's a family operated business since 1880. We caught the mid afternoon ferry and it took us out into the Tasman Sea. Very rough but great to see the headlands from the sea and experience the difference in the sea, bay and harbor. You can return to Sydney by bus which will take you through some very upscale neighborhoods. We had had this tour by a friend from Sydney so we stayed on the water. The views from Watson's Bay were probably the best we experienced in the 5 days we toured Sydney Harbor.
A good place to know in a ferry through the bay. This is a nice place to visit there is a very good view towards the Pacific Ocean and the cliffs Try the restaurant right next to the dock

Couldn't find breakfast. The ferry ride was not fantastic, the view on the ferry isn't as good as the Manly ferry. Once in Watson's Bay we were unable to find a decent breakfast place (on a Sunday morning). Decent breakfast would have been a coffee with eggs on toast.
It's worth going there.. Watson's Bay is an iconic part of Sydney. Bring your camera. See the notorious Gap. Stroll along the beach. Try some lovely seafood on the wharf.

A ferry to lunch. We took the ferry to Watsons planning to go to the popular Doyle's for lunch. The ride over is very pretty as is this tiny bay with its small beach area and quaint surrounds. The bistro area was very ordinary so we walked up to the pub for a wonderful meal sitting out to look over the water. Very enjoyable and makes for a nice day out, especially nice to get away from the noisy city and feel like you are far away. It is such a quick trip back to town that I am surprised more folks don't try this out.

Fish & Chips. Visited Watsons Bay with a friend whislt staying in Sydney. We both decided on Watsons Bay and had the famous fish and chips at Doyles, absolutely a must if ever visiting Sydney. We went by car but you can get a ferry.
