Have a beer.... Wandering around on a busy Sunday feels like every person in the city is there...crowded and fun to watch.Walk around to Camp Cove...and take the bus: parking is for the residents(which is fair enough!).

Beautiful Surroundings. This area is unpopulated, and has a great park where you can eat your fish and chips by the water, while basking in the sun, and enjoying the beautiful views of our wonderful harbour. There is also a great walking path that takes you down to the swimming beach, which is secluded.

Watson's Bay Baths- Access all areas. We loved the easy access for people of all abilities and ages! Stunning outlook and proximity to the Tea Gardens makes for a great day out. We loved it so much we blogged about it herehttp://swimmingsydneythemrsgspot.wordpress.com/watsons-bay-baths/

Short excursion for a good walk and great seafood. A short ferry ride to Watson's Bay takes you away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Sydney. A good hour of walking up the hiking trail (where the lighthouse is) if you are not that much into the beach. Complete your day with a sumptuous seafood dinner near the ferry pier, watching the sun set. Great day out for families.

Good food and great driving trip. Watson's Bay is about 30 min drive from the city (Sydney). The reason why i keep coming back is to have a nice seafood lunch at Doyle's restaurant .They served the best, freshly catched fish of the day. People are going to Watson's Bay to dine at Doyle's and have an enjoyable walk along the coastline or the best walk uphill and once you reached the peak, the view is just spectacular. This area well known for being an A-list suburb.Its the area of the rich and famous in Sydney.

Nice little getaway. If you want to spend a cool day, take the ferry to Watson Bay! You will arrive around a little beach with a few restaurants, then you can start the coast walk for about 2h and cross a few beaches and scenic spots.

blissful. highly recommend spending a warm sunny afternoon on the verandah at Doyles enjoying fine Australian wines and the best seafood on the planet. I came 5000 km to eat here and it was worth every km.

Great spot for a day trip. Took the ferry to watch the Sydney to Hobart races on Labour Day. Went for a hike along the rocky coast. Bring your camera; took some great photos. Had lunch at Doyle's. Great day!

Excellent Sydney Harbour and Sea Views. The start of the walk and right to the top of the walk is great. The views are excellent every which way you look. There are also some great plants on the way to the top of Watsons Bay walk. There is a water cooler just near the zebra crossing so fill up your water before you go. The kids enjoy the walk too and not hard and you can always turn back or have sit if too tired.Must Visit for any international and local traveler.

Great place to visit on the ferry. Forget the expensive harbour trips , take a ferry ride to Watson's bay for a fraction of the price and have good seafood on the pier . This is take away but you still sit at seats with great views.Visiting Sydney you must do this !

Great views and seafood.. Something for everyone at Watson's bay. A pub with lots of outdoor seating and good food. A walk to the lighthouse if you feel energetic, a nudist beach if you're feeling daring and fish and chips at a famous take away if you're hungry.
Great view!. A scenic view from the Gap or over the harbour. A few different places to eat for a range of budgets.
Great Cafes and Ice Cream Shops. Good place to visit with the family, excellent take away and ice cream shops if you want to eat on the beach.

beautiful vista. Always so lovely to watch the water, esp if you arrive by ferry. You can swim there if you fancy, but everyone is watching form the pub or the restaurant. Easy walk up to the Gap which has spectacular views.

FISH AND CHIPS. Doyles restaurant...there is a poor persons section on the pier, then a posh (or company expense)section other side of the road. The poor section is more interesting, more Les Mis then Swan Lake. This is a take-away fish and chip joint with places to sit down. It is on the pier, jetty for the ferry, all life passes you by. We had fish and chips and a chilled bottle of wine, delicious, A chap with a bucket of hot water and Jeyes fluid ( maybe it was Dettol)washed out the floor as we dined...this is gourmet eating at its best, what we didn't eat friendly little Kittiwakes came and helped....alll very jolly. Don't forget there is no ferry back to Sydney....HA Ha Ha! I'm serious, there isn't

A lovely destination. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay via Double Bay and Rose Bay and it was a great and bracing trip. At Watsons Bay we had drinks in the pub there and enjoyed the surroundings and view of Sydney Harbour. A short walk to the scenic Gap before a bus trip back to Bondi Beach. A very worthwhile excursion.
Absolutely fantastic. It was a unique experience, fabulous views, fantastic food. We visited with a group of friends from Adelaide and would thoroughly recomend the experience asnd the food,

A little bit of paradise. Watson's Bay is a must-visit for all those going to Sydney. It's really easy to get to - just a ferry over from Circular Quay. There are nice eateries on the wharf - with both a pub, more expensive restaurant and a takeout on the wharf (fish and chips). Have visited both during the week and the weekend. Weekend was MUCH busier - you need to book a table at the restaurant then! We went for a walk round to Camp Bay which is a must-do. The little Bay is so picturesque and sheltered from winds etc! Overall, will definitely be going back - as soon as I get a day off!
Excellent. Very nice place. Good beach, super park, Sydney view, the best fish and chips, amazing walk way. Can colourful parrots on the walkway very near. Lovely environments. Like to go again.

Simply Stunning. I love the varied locations at Watson's Bay. You can sit quietly on the cove beach where the sea is so calm and just enjoy the idyillic views. Brilliant coastal walks, Fabulous Fish & Chips at Doyle's. Also the Tearoom near the library serve excellent breakfasts amongst other things. Watson's Bay Hotel is the place to sit and sip cocktails and watch the sun go down and enjoy every last minute of your day. Buses run later than the Ferries so you can still get back to the city fairly easily.

Favourite Harbour place.. It is a great ferry trip from Circular Quay, but also well served by buses. With Doyles and a great Tea Rooms, loads of walking choices, a great view of the Sydney skyline it is just wonderful.

Incredible seascape. It's got very, very posh these days, but I don't care about anything except the Gap anyway. It's a great place to wander around, and stare out to sea. You can get a ferry to Manly these days, too.
Visit the Gap. If you catch the ferry to Watson's bay you can eat fish and chips at a Sydney institution (Doyles), climb up to the Gap and get some of the best views of the harbour available.

Watsons bay ferry ride. Very enjoyable trip. We bought an all day ticket for trains,buses, ferries and light rail. With 2 adults you only have to pay for one child then rest of family travel free. Unlimited travel on ferries was great.

Watson Bay Baths - Fun!. My friends and I used to spend hours at Watson Bay Baths in the summer. Jumping off the docks is amazing, great seafood at restaurant. It's hard to find a parking spot though, and if you do, be prepared to have an anxiety attack backing out of ridiculous slopes. But baths = fun for hours!

Great spot for lunch. Stopped for lunch looked around the area and saw the Original Doyle's it was packed, Lovely sunny day beach nice and clean to sit on with fantastic fish and chips awsome picknick area picture perfect views across the road with walking trails

lovely day trip. come on the earlist ferry you can as gets very crowded especially around lunchtime
a pleasant walk around surroundings and a visit to the gap
Watson's Bay. Ferry to Watson's Bay, Lunch at Doyles on the wharf restaurant. Great views over water and reasonable prices. Walk upto the Gap.. Then down to the Tea Garden for afternoon coffee/Tea.

Fish and Chips on the Beach. On first glance you wonder what there is here but look a little closer and you will find Doyle's Fish and Chips. If you have walked up/around the Gap then you will have earned your chips before a lovely ferry ride back into Sydney. Enjoy!
Classy place. Worth a trip on ferry out here. Restaurants are great and it feels very civilised and posh! Loved every minute of my visit here. Sunday morning is a great time to visit.

A walk with fish and chips to follow!. Take the ferry to Watson's Bay. At the jetty go left and follow the path around the headland to South Head. It really is a spectacular view of the waves crashing in from the Pacific. You can picture the first fleet rounding the Head. Carry on with the walk and enjoy fish and chips at the ferry stop.
nice place. We stopped here for a few hours and enjoyed the beaches and the general area near the front. It was a busy place and one I would like to see more of in the future.

Feels a world away from Sydney CBD. It's so close to the Sydney, but feels like it's a world away from the city. There are loads of tourists here, especially on weekends, and there's a bit of a wait (large queues) at Doyle's for takeaway fish and chips, but Watson's Bay is a lovely place to spend a day, or an evening. The pub with large beer garden is fun, and has great views. And Cove Beach is just beautiful, especially close to sunset, when the tourists have left! Great headland walk as well. Parking can be difficult, especially on weekends, so best to leave the car at home, and take the ferry trip across the beautiful harbour - there and back. Note the bus can take forever, with the Sydney eastern suburbs traffic!

Great lunch and gorgeous walk. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay and had a great lunch on the waterfront. We then walked up the hill to the bluff looking over the ocean and along the walkway. What a magnificent view of Sydney!!!

Great view of central Sydney from Watson's Bay. Best view of the city, Opera House, Harbor bridge while leaving Circular Quay for Watson's Bay. Try sitting in the back of the boat for the best views. Watson's Bay has a great walk to the lighthouse, then looking over the "Gap" into Sydney Harbor entrance. Take the bus from Watson's Bay to Bondi Beach...nice to see the different neighborhoods you transit through to get to Bondi Beach.

Don't miss the cliffs. Try Doyle's fish and chips. Hang around at the park and beach. Walk back to the "suicide cliffs" and check out the view. A cheap relaxing way to spend the afternoon. You can take the ferry from Circulay Quay and enjoy the view going there as well.

Fab. Fab Fab Fab here.Walk up to Watson,s point and enjoy views of the whole bay area.It really is worth the climb.Go up on the ferry but take the bus back for a more varied view of the area.Last ferry back toSydney is 4.45pm.If you are feeling flush eat at Doyles restaurant Wonderful food but expensive.Ifyou are watching the pennies eat at Doyles take away fish and chips.They even provide tables and chaired for you to sit on while you eat them.

Watson's Bay walk. I was lucky to have a friend drive and park at Watson's Bay. We took a great hike up to the South Head, and you could walk for a good hour if you want to. We saw the lighthouses, and lots of people walking beautiful dogs. Great photo opportunity!We then circled round the hill and saw some lovely residences. Ate a relaxed lunch at the Watson's Bay Hotel. Get a table first, then go down to the bar area and get on line to order your food(the line seems long but goes fast). Drinks can be purchased and you can enjoy your wine until the food arrives. The fish and chips were great. It is fun to relax, watch the boats, and people-watch.
watson bay. was a nice few hours with some good walks and climbs.Had nice meals,I'm not a seafood eater but they had some nice cafes around.was nice for a few hours out
Too Touristy. The original doyles was a must on everyone's list of places to visit and checking out Watsons Bay after or before.Its just too busy now .

Lovely Ferry Ride, scenic walk and afternoon drinks. Lovely little afternoon out. Take the ferry from Circular Quay and get off at Watson's Bay. Had a lovely walk around the island including the residential areas. Only (unexpected) downside was the all too very clear view of naked male bathers at Lady Beach. Put me off my scones and jam if truth be told!

beautiful, just beautiful. Gorgeous views, lovely beach, shaded grassy areas, 30 minute ferry ride from circular quay. Food a bit overpriced for what you get and it's mobbed on sunny days but it's a gorgeous spot

Worth a visit when in Sydney- half day or full day. Definitely put this in your to-do-list while in Sydney. Nice boat ride with view of Sydney in background including Opera House. The fish and chips place just where the boat docs is recommended- other people has talked about the Doyles, but I think the one by the dock is better and cheaper! Then you can walk around, up the hill/grass to the cliffs and walk around, hear the sounds of the different birds and admire the views. You can also take a left while exiting the boat and walk that way and view the upmarket houses and pass by a nude beach! You could spend a full day or a half day is possible too.

Watson's Bay is scenic and peaceful. Good views, nice park to just sit and relax or grab a lunch. Feeding the gulls is fun, but they can be overwhelming! Short walk to the Coast Path and the heads - very scenic.

A peaceful corner to the other side of the city.. The Watson's Bay was a pleasant day trip about 2-3 hours, which can be reached easily from Sydney Harbour through the numerous ferry boat along the pier.The trip is short, about 10-15 minutes to do absolutely by boat, the photos are amazing and can be reached easily by bus from Bondi beach or Bondi Junction but the route is much longer. Once landed in the small harbour you realize immediately that you'll get in another world, it seems one of those villages where the inhabitants live peaceful and in turn transmit the tranquillity that characterizes this place.There is a walking path that leaves from the port and reach the lighthouse, through a lovely Park.This route is very scenic landscape level is due to the presence of the many outposts and disused bunker left now after decades as a witness.The route is circular and has a duration of 40 minutes before arriving at the lighthouse, but I have to mention the presence of a nude beach on the left of the path called Lady Bay. After the tour we return to pier, from here you can go back to town through the bus or waiting for the ferry boat lunch in one of the restaurants along the beach.

Outdoor Family Fun. I don't want to give this 5 stars because as we got on our fairly empty ferry out to Watson's Bay, we watched the hugely crowded Manly ferry leaving...I'd hate for this gem to end up like that. We enjoyed a day of walking around the northern part of the peninsula, swimming at Camp Cove, lunching at Doyle's, and having a great time together as a family. Our late afternoon ferry back to Circular Quay did have a much longer queue, so perhaps the secrets out already.

Great Fish and Chips. Take the Ferry for a trip across.Take the walk up to the "GAP" for fantastic views across the Heads entrance to Sydney Harbour.Stop for a takeaway Fish and Chips from the famous Doyles.There is also a walk aound to the old Lighthouse.Watch out for the Nudist beach!
Doyle's on the Beach. Watson's Bay was pretty, and Doyle's was delicious (lunch and dinner menu are the same) but costly. Not a restaurant if you are bargain hunting, if you are not, eat here!

Beautiful!!. We caught the ferry from circular quay to watsons bay. What a lovely day out... Absolutely beautiful place with the harbour on one side and the ocean on the other. Nice short walking trails along The Gap nice fish n chips at doyles....

Watsons Bay. Easily reached by ferry from Circular Quay or regular service buses from Sydney centre. Short uphill walk from Ferry Landing to Gap Point with fantastic views of cliffs and ocean. Walk up to South Heads to see the gap between Pacific Ocean and Sydney Harbour. Choice of various refreshment places down by the ferry landing

Beer on the beach. Watsons Bay is so much more than just Doyles Seafood Restaurant. We enjoyed an ice cold beer on a very hot day, sitting on a patio overlooking the small beach. Families were swimming, people had picnic rugs spread under the trees in a lovely park and joggers sweated their way past us. It is a great place to kick back and relax and watch the yachts and water craft go by.
beautiful part of Sydney. Very nice beach , amazing views and best fish and chips restaurant !Do make an effort while in Sydney and spend at least half a day there!

lunch on the beach. Think Sydney and you think Harbour Bridge, in fact harbour and beach! Well Doyles at Watsons Bay has the view in spades. A quick hop off the pathway and I could paddle in the surf! And be back at my table for our first course. Our food was predictably fish which can often be a letdown if not prepared correctly. No fear of that here our chowder was delicious and my second course of Queensland Mud Crab fantastic if a bit daunting size wise! Our waiter was attentive and friendly and best of all we were given the time to enjoy the food and the view! The ferry ride over and back was part of the highly enjoyable afternoon

Swim, Doyles Fish & Chips, and a little haven of peace.. My favourite spot in Sydney so far. I enjoyed the peace of Watsons Bay. Beautifaul views down the harbour, swim in the netted area next to the Yacht Club (with a couple of Sydney to Hobart veterans at anchor), great fish and chips from the famous Doyles, and space to stroll around over to the Gap and South Head. A relaxing day out. There are changing rooms with showers across from the swimming area. If I lived in Sydney, and had the millions, this is where I would live.

A few extra steps ...... Watsons Bay, especially at the weekend, is popular! However, if you walk a little furher you will discover Camps Bay (cove?) which is a fantastic little beach with safe swimming, clean sand, amenities, entry to a beautiful coastal walk and views to die for. Don't get waylayed by fish and chips at Watsons Bay .... keep walking and get to Camps Bay (mind you get some fish and chips on the way back as they are incredibly good ......)

A must visit for overseas travellers (and Aussies too!). Sensational location with views looking back over the city. Suggest lunch at the Watsons Bay Hotel, but get there early on a weekend, as many others know how good the area is.

Take the Ferry to Watson's Bay!. Sydney's Ferries are the least expensive way to explore this most beautiful harbour in the world! Jump the ferry for a day at Watson's Bay ... you will pass a series of bays that boast some of the most expensive real estate in the world. Watson's Bay is tucked into a cove at South Head with a lovely small beach, several hotels with harbour views, and some of the best fish and chips you'll ever eat. You may wish to pick up a local map and plan a bush walk to the eastern side of the Bay ... glorious ocean views and a beautiful jewel of a naval chapel are worth exploring before returning on the ferry ... a perfect day on The Harbour!

Beautiful Walk to the Lighthouse. This is a beautiful, relaxing place to spend part of your day in Sydney. The walk out to Hornby Lighthouse has stunning views and lots of history stops (for the history buffs). As other reviewers have noted, be sure to also stop by nearby Macquarie Lighthouse which is also a beautiful lighthouse with stunning vistas.

Doyle's at Watsons Bay. Last time we visited was by road at night 12 years ago so this visit during a tour of Sydney harbour was quite different. The location of Doyle's is wonderful with views across the Bay and the skyline of Sydney on the horizon. The food was memorable and the service was as good as I remember it, obviously they specialise in seafood and it is expensive but for a treat it is worth it. It's worth noting that there are cheaper places to eat, Doyle's also have a fish and chips restaurant on the bay where prices are a little cheaper.

Doyles a little bit dated. Heading out to Watsons Bay is always fun - we used to love to go to Doyles but my sense is that it has become a bit more tragically tourist than not. Certainly there are better seafood options, but that view is a good one!

Pretty bay with nice bars. Our second visit to Watsons Bay after nine years. The Watson Bay bar had been updated and offered great beers and food. It was nice to sit in the park area under the shade of the trees and watch the weekend visitors and children. Glad we made a second visit.
seafood lunch. Such a lovely way to travel to lunch by ferry to Watsons Bay. Had a wonderful seaford lunch in a beautiful setting at Doyles. Thanks

day trip. Took the ferry to Watson Bay which allowed me to take quite a few pictures of the Opera House, the Bridge and a number of other stops. Walked from the Watson Bay terminal to the nudist beach where we spend a couple of hours relaxing. Had lunch outside the restaurant just off to the left.
Fish and Chips and Views. What more could you want - great fish and chips and a very pretty walk around the headland in the sunshine.
Loved it!. We made a walk up to the GAP with stunning cliff views and we had lunch at the Doyles restaurant. Great seafood, a nice afternoon spend on a sunny day!
A convenient way to go to The Gap. Nothing much there but it is a convenient way to go to The Gap National Park. The Gap is a must visit place for travelers who enjoy nature.

Awesome and Stunning Experience At Watson's Bay. I visited Watson's Bay in March, 2013. This is an experience that is perhaps overlooked by some travelers, but I had spent about two years researching the places we were going to visit in Australia. I found that Watson's Bay had a lot to offer.It is quite easily reached without a car. I simply took the train on platform 24 at Central Train Station, which was about 200 yards from our hotel (Rendezvous Suites on George Street), and rode the train to Bondi Junction. Bondi Junction is close to Bondi Beach, and has excellent shopping and eating facilities. Like most travelers, I caught a bus to Bondi Beach. Those buses run all day and into the night. They come by often and so it is easy to get to Bondi Beach.After visiting Bondi Beach and having a fine and filling Aussie-style breakfast at a cafe along Bondi Beach, I caught bus 380, which took me to Watson's Bay within about 25-30 minutes. It was easy and simple. At Watson's Bay I took advantage of the walkway next to the road, which overlooked the ocean. The churning ocean lay below the cliff, just like a scene out of "The Count of Monte Cristo." Wow!The walkway was paved and had different levels. It is an easy visit if you have no limitations. With physical limitations, you have to exercise some restraint, but it is still well worth the visit. I was inspired.There is a park there and the world-famous Doyle's. Get great fish 'n chips from the takeaway along the harbor, then catch a fast ferry to Circular Quay in downtown Sydney. The fast ferry reaches Sydney in just a few quick minutes. From Circular Quay, you can do so much. From there, you can catch a ferry to many locations within the harbor or catch a but or train out of downtown. Nearby is downtown itself and also Darling Harbour.Go to Watson's Bay if you have the time.
Views at Watson. Get off the ferry and go for a short walk up to the top of the point, the view is really quite nice.

cliff walk watson bay. went on ferry ride from circular quay to watsons bay and had fish and chips at doyles on the pier and then went on an amazing cliff walk up to light house and back seeing opening to harbour and also old military bunkers with remains of cannons! amazing day some of the best senery i have ever seen before. cheers dan.
Nice suburb and nice beach. Watsons Bay beach is a nice little beach and relaxing little beach water so clean but so cold. Sydney has many beautiful beaches and this is one of them

Visit to the lighthouse at Watson bay. Arriving by ferry there is an excellent fish and chip restaurant on the quay and the it is week sign posted to the 2 beaches in the area and also to the lighthouse past a small nudist beach mainly inhabited by men. At the lighthouse there is a restored keepers cottage.wonderfull views over the harbour
Beautiful. No trip to Watsons bay would be complete without trying the Fish & Chips at Doyle's. And try the Calamari some of the best i have ever had

A nice walk around the headland but the beachfront has been taken over by Doyles. A great fast ferry ride from circular quay. A great walk from the beachfront up and around the headland with plenty to see on the way. However the beach front seems to have been taken over by Doyles restaurant, hotel, cafe, fish and chips......

Ferry wharf, restaurants and hotel. The Watson's Bay Baths, the famous Gap, Doyle's Restaurant and the hotel. It can get pretty busy in the summer over the weekend. Camp Cove is approximately a 10 minute walk away. An interesting place. Very good park and play area for children. Ideal for a picnic.
Quiet bay. great for chilling out and having a relaxing time away from crowds! Super swimming and not feeling overcrowded!

Limited facilities. Fast ferry but limited restaurants and most over hyped. Beware the last ferry back to Circular Quays goes at about 3.45 but you can go one stop back to Rose Bay and then get a later ferry from there.
relaxing. your must arrive by ferry from circular quay u must eat fish and chips you must see the gap and if you enjoy a walk south head and the nude lady jane beach head back to city by bus
Lovely to walk around. Up through the cliffs, there's some lovely walking trails that outlook the ocean and some of the Bay. Definately worth taking a trek if you have the right footware :)
Great place to visit. Very quaint little area on the outskirts of Sydney. Nice beach area and very relaxed. Great fish and chips.

worth the ferry ride. Take the Sydney ferry to see Watson's Bay, a nice trip there and back. You just need to be aware that during high season the ferry fills up quickly and you might have to wait for the next one back to the city, and that the last ferry departs Watson's Bay about 4pm. I went to Watson's Bay to take in the views at the Gap and to take the walk around the lighthouse. Awesome views over the Heads and then turn around and awesome views over the Harbour back to the city. I had takeaway from the restaurant on the ferry dock, decent chicken and yummy ice cream. Since i don't eat seafood, can't really comment on that.

Gorgeous little bay. What a cute little suburb for some down time. Very cute little spot to walk around and enjoy the harbour scenery. There are two parts to this suburb, one where the beach is and the other on bay - a couple of cafe's and a great little pub - but it's mainly about the walking and the views.
Scenic place to have lunch. Great location to look back at the harbor, see the many boats and have lunch or dinner. Great for a couple.

Fancy Fish & Chips and a glass of wine?!!. Lovely area to explore. We took a ferry but there are buses from the city centre. Nice sand beach and gardens and then there is the cliff walk to the lighthouse to burn off lunch at Doyles.

Doyles-where else?. You cannot do Sydney if you dont do Doyles at Watsons BayIts a mecca for all lovers of seafood & our first visit was by no means a let down.We had to abandon our outside table as the heavens opened but were very easily accomadated inside the Restaurant.Great choice of food-ranging from the passionate to the plentiful platter.Watsons Bay ferry finishes at 19.10 so be mindful of the need for a taxi on the way home-but is that such a bad idea?House Ale & Wine were both excellent as was the evening as a whole.

Great Location. Watsons Bay is a must for any visitor to Sydney. We arrived on the bus from Bondi Beach after walking the coastal path from Coogee Beach and were pleased we made the effort. The sea and harbour views are breathtaking and it is possible to walk along the headland towards Sydney Heads.Fish and Chips at Doyles on the ferry jetty are an institution.We took the ferry back to Circular Quay and all in all this was a great day out.

One of our favorites. When holidaying in Sydney a ferry trip to Watson's Bay is a must. The ferry trip itself is always enjoyable with plenty of things to see. We then have lunch at Doyle's (book to ensure an outdoor table) - great seafood and something of a Sydney institution. Alternatively you can have fish and chips from the cafe on the wharf or bring a picnic lunch and sit in the park. Great views back to the city while you eat. Our routine then involves a walk up the hill to The Gap and a wander around there admiring the views and taking photos. Following this we catch the bus to Bondi Beach and then either the bus or train back to the city.

Take a ferry to Watson's Bay. We took a ferry to Watson's Bay. Once you get there, be sure to walk through the park and up the hill. The views on the other side of the hill are spectacular. Doyle's Restaurant is a favorite of locals and tourists.
Don't miss Doyle's. Best fish and chips in Sydney! You can either eat at the restaurant, or order on the wharf and eat in the park. Either way was great!
Great ferry trip. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay just for the ride and whilst there had a great lunch and then ferried back. A great way to spend time doing very little in the sun.
Great, little Bay. I like to visit Watsons Bay each time we are on holiday over here. Fish and chip lunch is a must and the beach is nice to spend some peaceful time.

Ferry trip to Watson's Bay, The Gap, South Head.. If you want a simple and low cost tourist trip on the harbour, this is a good option.Catch ferry from Circular Quay. Ferry goes past opera house, then follows southern coast of harbour , with quick stops at Double Bay and Rose Bay, then Watsons Bay (lots of houses/mansions to look at along the way).Doyle's on wharf for fish and Chips, or Doyles Restraunt for the more discerning diner (either way, it is good).The Watson's Bay Pub rocks on the weekend.Short walk up hill to the Gap.Little bit longer walk to South Head, but well worth the time, as Lighthouse and Cottage, and views accross the harbour to North Head, at the end.Nude bathing beach (Lady Bay) along the way.If you have more hours available, there is Vaucluse House, and other attractions.So wasy to do, and so relaxing.
Awesome for afternoon sundowners. Beautiful bay with a view to kill...great to relax with a glass of wine or have a seafood lunch overlooking Sydney harbor.

beautiful !!. If you are visiting Sydney try and get the #325 bus from Elizabeth Street in the city. It gives one a true feel of being a local.. the bus will take about 45 minutes, depending on traffic... to get to Watson's Bay... once there you can walk around this old part of Sydney, have a walk around the shore and the famous Gap... the local pub is a good place to grab a meal, I would avoid the weekend as it is far toooo busy and you might have to wait a while to be seated.. the garden area does have a great vibe to it. Only if you want to impress an overseas friend would one want to go DOYLES ... yes it is on the tiny beach, if you book ahead and are lucky enough to get a table... the meals here are extremely overpriced for 'fish and chips'...so be warned !! If you are adventurous there is a walk/trek down to a very secluded beach...only the locals can direct you... but it is worth finding it. Watson's Bay is Sydney of yesteryear ... lovely!!
Very pretty. We can say that the beaches were very clean,the people were friendly the sky was blue and the view was picturesque.What more can you say!

Love the open air ambience. The place all Sydney residents and tourists to the city should visit. Restaurants are excellent and the view is great. Good place to wander. Take the ferry from Circular Quay.

Relax Along the Beach. Took the ferry early Sunday to Watson's Bay to beat some of the crowds. Enjoyed hiking on the headlands, and hiked to the lighthouse. The ocean views are outstanding. After hiking, the small beach was a nice spot to relax.

Great day trip to Watsons Bay. Take the Ferry from Circular Quay to fabulous Watsons Bay. Have Fish and Chips (great take-away) on the grass under the big trees. Walk up to Gap and have a look at the amazing ocean so close to the Harbour. Have a beer in the pub and return on the Ferry and you will have a REAL Sydney experience without braking the bank. Doyles is a hugely famous restaurant but as an Sydneysider who has eaten there a number of times I would suggest that it is very overpriced for what you get. If its your first time in Sydney then go for it but be warned that it is not cheap, compared to other great seafood restaurants in Sydney. Head to the Fish Markets for lunch there if you really want a super seafood experience. Doyles are down there too.

Great spot to catch our fishing charter boat. Easily reached by car or water taxi from Sydney. We arrived at 6.00 am and were impressed by the beauty and peacefulness. Of course, the famous Doyle's Seafood Restaurant was closed at that hour, but a meal there would be heavenly, I'm sure.

A family place. It's more a family place. Not too many restaurants, but there's a great fish and chips outdoor joint which is popular. The park is nice on a summery day. Hard to find if you are a tourist without a car.

Don't miss Doyles. We had lunch there twice during our stay - once in the restaurant and once from the takeaway cafe. Both were excellent. Also spent some time on the beach which although quite narrow does have some nice trees and grass at the back for shade.
Lovely to visit. Very picturesque and near the Gap. Great to get to by ferry. Many go to visit Doyle's, which I think is over-rated. Have the takeaway fish and chips and a drink in garden of hotel.

Breathtaking views from atop. Magnificent views of the harbor (vantage point to view the Sydney Harbor bridge)... The steep cliffs with the blue blue ocean below, the quaint walkway leading you atop (watch out for the anchor - must see) was truly a memorable experience. Nice line of fish n chip eateries on your way to the bay too.

A cool place to hang out. We arrived at Watson's Bay via the Hop-on-hop-off ferry from Circular Quay. There are three or four restaurants close to the jetty and many visitors don't seem to get any further.There is a green park leading down to the small beach, ideal for picnics and games - with picnic benches beneath shady trees.However, it's worth taking the walk up to 'The Gap' where you can take the coastal cliff walk with the Pacific on one side and Sydney Harbour on the other. Fabulous views - but be sure to take a hat and plenty of sunscreen as there is no shade (as I found to my cost!)
A Truly Exhilarating Place. It was my first trip to see and feel what this place is like after hearing so much about it. I was not disappointed. The view was great and the Food was good

Get A Ferry. A wonderful trip from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay by ferry. Lots to see and so invigorating - try fish and chips at Doyles, go for a walk up the hill to the Gap or have a cold drink at the pub whilst looking down the harbour. A wonderful day trip - do prebook if you intend dining at the restaurant and try to get seats overlooking the water. Ferry, buses or a seaplane back??

Dont miss it!. Its a beatiful place. You cant miss it visiting Sydney especially in a sunny day. You can go here by bus from the center or by ferry from Cirqular Quay - by ferry is more picturesque for sure. There are several things to do here - you can go to the nice Camp Cove beach. From the beach you can take a walk by South Head Heritage trail to the Lighthouse with wonderful ocean view. Or you can walk up from the Watson bay to the Gap park. Whatever you chose - you won't be disappointed - the views are amazing.

Amazing views. After a short and scenic ferry ride from the CBD, we arrived at Watson's Bay. There is a sign as soon as you get off the ferry indicated the two recommended walking paths, to get the full experience. One path goes via a couple beaches (including a nude beach), to end up at the lighthouse at the tip of the peninsula, overlooking a rocky cliff and amazing sea views. The other path goes straight through a park, to another lookout over the sea. We only had time for one path (they take about an hour each), so we opted for the lighthouse. The views and the scenery made the trip and the hike well worth it, the relatively isolated beaches were very picturesque, as were the lighthouse and the cliff. You could almost make a day of Watson's Bay, between the trails, the beaches, and the waterfront dining. But even a few hours will make the trip worthwhile.

Watson's Bay. We took an on/off ferry and got off at Watson's Bay, which was a lovely little place. We stopped for afternoon tea (tea and scones with jam and cream) at the Dunbar House Tearoom, sitting outside overlooking the water - delightful. Took a walk along the trail to see the rugged coastline which was also very pleasant.
a bay to relax. if you are looking to have some quality time by the water with barely people around, it's a good place. just get fish and chips and enjoy thr Aussie laid back life.

food. great place to chew lovely fresh seafood and take in some of the most amazing views of the Pacific Ocean battering the stunning sandstone cliffs that predominate the landscape. Nice relaxing trip from circular quay by ferry.
Well worth a visit. Easy to get here and worth the trip. We did the coastal walk which was better than just having a look at the Gap. Doyles was fun!
Watson's Bay. A great day out Ferry from the Quay lunch at Watson's Bay watching the boats on the harbour great fish and chips a nice walk around then Ferry back

Beautiful views. This place offers spectacular views across the harbour, some lovely walks and of course the chance to visit the famous Gap! Have lunch here as the fish is often great and you can either eat it in the park, pub or fancy restaurant! Whatever takes your fancy!

Worth the drive!. When my husband and I traveled to Sydney, we stayed with relatives. They took us for a drive to Watson's Bay, on the edge of the city through a very rich neighborhood. From the cliffside, you can see the city line and some rough waters. It's a beautiful look-off. If you're in the area, definitely take the short walk to the cliff and relax. On the way, there are some nice beaches and restaurants. Nothing to do on the edge but sit on the rocks and chill, but worth the visit if you're nearby.

Amazing. So far, my favourite walk in Sydney!! Just catch a ferry from Circular Quay and you'll be taken to another world : wonderful bay, cliffs and views on the heads. You can walk to Camp Cove with its pristine water and then to Horsnby Lighthouse. It was a a great walk, with amazing views. Alternatively, you can cross the park across the wharf and head to the Gap and learn about wreckages and have great views of the ocean!! A must-do while in Sydney!!

A must to. Recommend catching the ferry from Circular Quay for a day trip. Great views over the harbour and the heads and super beaches, Two restaurants owned by Doyles and Watson Bay Hotel where we had normal fare, but the atmosphere and vista made it a great afternoon / day out. A must do when in Sydney.

One efficient operation. As we departed the ferry we were handed a paper menu for Doyles, we had no queue to order at the front counter and less than a 10 minute wait. Sit inside or outside and choose beverages from the bar. Well priced, fresh seafood. Walk up through the park to the bus or go for a longer hike along the clifftops.

Day trip to Watsons Bay. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay for a day trip. Once there we followed Cliff Road and walked around the Head. There's a great pathway with lots of great views over the harbour and the heads. We didn't have lunch there but there was a lot of people in Doyles and the pub on the corner at the wharf. We did go into the pub for a few drinks after our walk.A really nice day out, easy to get to on the ferry.

Great Walks & Fish & Chips !. Ferry to Watsons Bay then walk out to Hornby Lighthouse & back. Stop off for Fish & Chips at Doyles ( expensive but good) and then walk to the main lighthouse above the town with great views over Sydney Heads.
lunch. A must for the best fish & chips at Doyle's - either for a posh lunch or for a lighter and cheaper lunch on the pier
I love it here!. i love it here! Great views of the city!Nice places to eat and drink!Nice to go for a swim on a hot evening!Lovely view!Not too busy!

Watsons Bay. always feels good going here..love the vies, the small beach, the yatchs, the seagulls, the the Robertsons park, the Gelato ice cream shop and esp the Balken Kebab shop which makes delicious kebabs and pizza, both shop is adjacent to Robertsons Park, then you will get to go to The Gap, all the photos I have taken everytime I go there looks like postcards and always bring guest of ours there and eveyone of them will say they are happy we brought them there, you get to ride also a ferry boat going back to Sydney central and Manly, buses also very convenient, the Doyles fish and chips..

Doyles Fish & Chips. We love going to Watsons Bay. We took our friends who came over from the UK last May and had our usual fish & chips at Doyles then walked along the beach and up the headland to the lighthouse and had a wonderful day. The setting is absolutely beautiful.

Fish n chips, great beach and ferry ride!. There is a self-service Doyle's with seating, which was very good food. There is a very expensive ($45 for fish and chips) nicer Doyle's restaurant a little further up. We did not go to that one.Beach-- the onse right by Doyles are tiny and good for kids. The regular beach is further up, and there is also a nude beach.

Old South Head walk and ocean vista. The ferry ride is fantastic, the walk to the South Head of the entrance to Sydney Harbour is a must, and there is one of the best located eateries in the world. (Stick to the fish and chips as basically the cooking is terrible - or better still walk along to the Tea Garden in front of the Yatch club and eat with the locals).

Fish'n'Chips at Watson's Bay. One of Sydney's best spots: gorgeous views, and an array of eating options from take-away fish'n'chips (best enjoyed on the beach, with toes buried in the sand), pub-style food, and a restaurant. Also a charming tea rooms at the other [western] end of the beach. Lovely place to take in the sunset before getting the ferry back to Circular Quay. Bus ride to Watson's Bay is worthwhile, too, as winds through some interesting streets and buildings.

Gorgeous beach, good food & natural beauty!. When in Sydney you must take a ferry ride on the harbour and one of the best is a trip to Watson's Bay for lunch. Hop on a ferry at Circular Quay or Manly and soak up gorgeous harbour and city views from this picturesque beach, from Doyle's seafood restaurant or the pub on the beach. If you're on a very tight budget, grab take away seafood or fish and chips from Doyle's and picnic on the beach or under a shady tree in the park and soak up the unique views. Don't forget your swimwear for a dip in the harbour and there are also a few walking trails starting from here and take in the clifftop ocean views. You can also hop on a bus from here to Bondi beach - about 15 minutes away - and do the famous Bondi to Bronte beach walk.
One of the most amzing vies of Sydney!. Don't miss a visit here as the views are amazing and it doesn't get any better. Walk around, look at the ocean and enjoy every minute of it.
Great Ferry Ride. We enjoy our trip to Watson's Bay on the ferry. We took the advice of fellow TA reviewers & skipped Doyle's & were glad we did. The walk to South Head was great.

Beautiful harbour side location. Watson's Bay is a gorgeous location for visitors to Sydney. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay and make a day of it. Put on your walking shoes and set out on the ocean walk along the cliff side, then relax with fish & chips & a beer at the Watson's Bay Hotel or just laze around in the park opposite. Magical way to spend a day out on the harbour. Take your camera for views of the harbour on one side and views of the ocean on the other. If you're feeling energetic there are even more spectacular elevated views of the harbour from further up the hill towards Vaucluse. One of the loveliest spots in Sydney

Nice Spot........ Really a lovely place to visit, hard to believe Sydney City, with all the noise pollution and all things associated with a major city is really only almost over the hill away. The sea-air really was refreshing; sad to know then of some of the suicide history of The Gap.

Doyles Fish and Chip. We went to Watsons Bay as were recommended the famous fish and chips. Great visit, got the ferry across and walked around to the beach which was great to sit and relax on. Fish and chips were great - just watch out for the seagulls.
Delightful. Our trip to Doyle's at Watson's Bay by ferry from Circular Quay was magic and to cap it off we had a 'to die for' seafood luncheon.

Great grub!. Eating at Doyles is a wonderful experience ... the food is great but very expensive. We ate at the 'smart' restaurant, but the regular fish and chip place looks good, as does the take-away, but long queues. Lovely views sitting outside at the front and very good service.

Our favourite little bay. With a beachside bar and 2 Doyles retsaurants and a large childrens play area, this bay is perfect to while away the evening, just make sure you do not miss the last ferry back to town!

A 'Must Do' in Sydney. I love a day out on the Harbour, ferrying over to beautiful Watson's Bay for a seafood lunch at the Watson's Bay Hotel or Doyle's if the budget permits. Then a walk around to South Head, wandering through little streets full of quaint houses, passing lovely Camp Cove beach, a quick look at Lady Jane (nudist) beach and on to the lighthouse for spectacular views of the coastline. Then a walk along The Gap path before heading back to the wharf for the 3.50pm (weekdays) last ferry back to the city. A perfect day out! Remember the sunscreen though!
Chill out and enjoy. What a place to chill out and take in the views. Must go and check it out. Nice bar and park to enjoy.

Worth leaving a day for this.. Take the boat from Circular Quay for the 20 or so min ride to Watsons bay, on the way are some great views of the harbour and surrounding sights. Worth stopping a while for fins n chips in Doyals chipper, but it can be very busy. Directly opposite the ferry wharf is the gap with spectacular views over the suburb. It is worth spending some time exploring the cliff top paths just beyond the gap. Remember to take your swimming costume as there is also the beach of camp cove to enjoy or if you are more adventurous you can use Lady beach just a short walk further on. It is a nudist beach open to all. Further on is the south head walk that takes about 30 mins to go round, worth leaving some time to explore the old WW2 gun emplacements and the lighthouse. There are other walks available such as the one out to Bondi but it is worth just hanging around Watson Bay! Another I deals is to purchase a multi trip day ticket for the ferries and go exploring on the various other ferry routes to really see the whole harbour. The ticket costs $21 and allows unlimited trips that day.

It is beautiful.. We were on a hop on hop off cruise of the bay with Captain Cook. At first we weren't going to get off but the guide said really good things about it so we did. We walked up to see the views up behind the town. Great views of, I guess it is the Tasman Sea. It is not a tourist trap at all. We could only find one shop that sold hats. Not what you would expect in a tourist town but it was alright with me.

The Stunning Scenery of Sydney Harbour!. Watsons Bay is part of an old fishing village that has now become part of Sydneys' most expensive prime real estate..Arriving off the bus from Bondi Junction you can see why as the walk through Robertson Park down to the main foreshore reveals picture postcard views of Sydney Harbour in all its crowning glory.A fantastic way of exploring the scenic surroundings of Watsons' Bay is to 'do the walk ' around to South Head..this isn't that hard by any stretch and with the sweeping panoramic views everywhere you look you actually don't even realise you are walking!You can either alight the bus on Military Rd(the last stop) cross over to view the other scenic attraction there 'The Gap' then walk around to Cliff St turning left onto the corner of Victoria and Pacific St..From there follow the steps down to Camp Cove Beach,(take your beach towel as this place is certainly worth a stop on your way there and back for a swim)..then just walk along to the end of the beach and that then brings you onto the National Parks trail...takes about 20 minutes to walk to Sydney Head from here and I promise you it is worth it for the stunning views you can see of all of Sydney Harbour!When you walk back your reward is either fish n chips from the Doyles take away located on the jetty (which has a great value 'seafood basket' by the way) or you can order a meal in the Watsons' Bay Hotel beer garden,just have a chardonay or cold beer and watch the sunset over Sydney Harbour like we did!A perfect way to end a perfect day...just make sure you take some good sun lotion with you and a hat isn't a bad idea during this time of year..and of course your camera!To access Watsons Bay you can either take the ferry from Circular Quay or take the bus from the city via Bondi Junction interchange..380..324..325http://www.sydneybuses.info/network-interchange-maps/east_map.pdf

Incredible scenery and views. We watched the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race from the bluff. Since our last visit four years ago there have been lots of improvements to this area. The viewing platforms and steps have all improved out of sight. And the views are quite breath taking. Having fish and chops at the iconic Doyles made the day complete.

wonderful place. I went with my girlfriend and my friend to watsons bay. Went took the ferry from the city centre for I think $5.60 one way. Went went straight for tea in the local tea rooms (food looked pricey but teavand scone was reasonable). Went then walked all over the bay. A wonderful place and went were lucky the weather was lovely. Fish and chips in doyles with a beer. V nice. Then back to the city on the bus. A wonderful way to spend a spare day :-)

Did the walk from bondi to watsons bay. Good walk beautiful neighborhood walked past two outdoor gyms on the way in case you want to stop for some exercise. Had a drink at the pub in watsons bay - good scenery its worth the walk from bondi

End of Year Celebration. 23 booked in to enjoy the delicious Doyle's Fish and Chips. An excellent venue with a supurb ocean view. The staff very obliging and the service very good. A very cool venue on a hot, hot day. Will be back minus the crowd to savour the flavours real soon

Must see in Sydney - if you walk across on the "The Gap park" trails. A must-see for all visiting Sydney - Walk across to "The Gap Park" which is a bit of a steepish climb.It's the perfect peaceful spot to view the sunset with views of the city skyline to your left, as well as the vast ocean to the right and an awesome view of the "Gap" between north and south heads too.Take the ferry from Circular Quay to just complete the experience. :)

Fish and chips here are a must!. Catching the ferry to Watson's for fish and chips at Doyles is a must do for every Sydney trip! The views from both sides are spectacular and the atmosphere is sublime. We watched a wedding at Dunbar House and finished off with an ice cream and sunbake in the park. Perfect day.
Great viewing all the yachts. Great place to sit and relax, looking at all the yachts in the bay. Great walk along the shoreline. Great homes in the area as well.

Good lunch stop. If you are craving fried fish, the fish and chips at Doyle's is great. Little hard to get a seat and peak times, but just grab as takeaway and head to the adjacent park which always has a lot going on. A good agenda is to take the ferry out from Sydney, have lunch at Doyle's (or one of the other places, I have always been happy with Doyle's takeaway), then hike up the hill to take in the amazing view off the cliffs of the Tasman Sea. There are some short hikes along the cliffs to help burn off the fried food. Come back down to the center of the town and there are two gelato shops next to the bus terminal. Get some dessert and either return the ferry or opt for the bus back. If you take the 380 bus, it returns to Circular Quay the long route, via Bondi Beach where you can stop or just keep riding. Good views of the town of Bondi which seems to go on forever as you head back to Sydney proper. Watson's Bay is nice and easy day trip. The perfect lunch stop if you are doing hop on-hop off on the ferry. Oh -- and Doyle's has a lot of other non-fried seafood including some intriging looking salads and sandwiches, but I have never been able to resist the fish and chips! Reasonably priced, fish and chips around $13, more if you add things on.

Quite simply stunning views.. When you board the ferry for watson's bay at circular key's for the first time it is something akin to a young child going into a sweetshop for the very first time with his mother and being told to pick a sweet, except one sweet is never enough, and this is what it is like when you visit watson's bay. When the ferry pulls in at the landing stage you are greeted with a view of a small beach to your left as you dock, with a beach which has golden sand and quite simply clear water which on a nice day just lap's up the shoreline, plenty of small and medium sized boats abound the shoreline and cove. On the shore you have both Doyle's eating establishments, one alongside the wharf as you step off the ferry and the other one just a little bit further on to your left, you can cross the road and then enter a park which has a drinking fountain sited as you enter the park, this has a facility that allow's you to refill your water bottle, which is a very good thing to do on a hot day, you can now proceed through the park which has quite a steep climb to the top of the park, and if you cross the road and climb up the concrete steps(20 to25) you will then be greeted with a quite magnificent view of the Gap, where the cruise ships as well as other ships come through on their way to Sydney harbour) the ocean views are quite stunning. When you are next in Sydney if you have not already visited Watson's Bay then please take the trouble to visit, you will not be dissapointed I can promise you that much.
Nice walk to the light house. Take the ferry and walk to the light house. Great views of the entrance to Sydney Harbour. Then take the bus to Bondi beach and enjoy the surfers.

Walk around the point. We had a map from our hotel of a walk around the point, starting at the Watsons Bay ferry terminal and continuing around to The Bluffs on the other side of the point. It took five times as long as it should have because we kept having to stop to photograph the fantastic views! Mind the nudist beach on the way out!

A perfect place to go on a sunny afternoon.. Hubby and I together with our boys (age 5 and 7) drove to the bay on a lovely Saturday afternoon around 4pm and had tea of a seafood platter at Doyles on the Wharf. Hubby also enjoyed the local brew, Doyles Fisherman's Lager. After enjoying the beautiful view we strolled towards the playground which occupied the boys a good while. We also drove towards Camp Cove and took a relaxing walk towards Hornby Lighthouse and back. Breathtaking views of the cliffs and sea. A definite good day out with the kids. Will remember to bring their swimmers next time because the waters looked inviting.

Fish and chips on the wharf. Took a lovely ferry ride with a friend from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay to enjoy fish and chips on the wharf at Doyle's takeaway. $17.90 for the whiting fillets with salad and chips with a beautiful dressing. Delicious and an affordable way to enjoy a little taste of Doyle's. Bought a generous glass of SSB to accompany my fish. Would definitely do this again.

Cafe on the side. Watson Bay is a perfect destination for lunch. With a pensioner discount travel one-day card ($2.90) you can use buses, trains and ferries. We chose a fast ferry to Watson's Bay. We avoided the fish and chip take-away cafe on the wharf and the more expensive Doyles options and instead took a short walk along the bay to the Tea Rooms/garden. Brilliant outdoor setting (same views) with fresh lunch options including seafood. Served efficiently with time to catch the 1.45 ferry back to Circular Quay.

Go by ferry and have a double experience.. I would suggest that if you are going to this great location in Sydney go by ferry and get to see the most beautiful harbour in the world on the way. Watson's Bay is a must do location. The Hotel and restaurant as set right on the water and you are only a 'stone' throw' for the viewing platform for the south heads of the Harbour. Make sure you walk up the hill and see the entrance of the Harbour. Truly great.

Nice walks. We walkes to the point and to the army base and then to the beach because the weather was nice. By ferry it is a nice trip which you will enjoy. When you walk from the crowd it will be pleasant.

Ferry ride Circular Quay to Watson Bay with a short walk and fish and chips. The ferry from Circular Quay to Watson Bay is a fast ride and provides a really good view of Sydney Bridge, The Opera House and many bays; take a camera. There is a pleasant short walk along the Heritage Trail (be aware there is a nudist beach) and many restaurants to dine in or out (busy at week-ends). We had excellent take-away fish and chips from Doyles on the Wharf and ate them in the park overlooking the bay. Watch out for the over-friendly seagulls though.
Fish and chips, cruise and a walk. Take the ferry to Watson Bay, enjoy fish and chips, walk to South Head and then the Gap. Alternatively walk down to Bondi and take bus/train home.

A long way from the city. Ferries only travel to and from Watson's Bay during the middle of the day and not first thing in the morning or after about 3:30pm. Catching a bus or a taxi is required outside of these hours. (Nov 2012, the cost of a bus fare one way is $4.50)

Great destination by ferry. The ferry trip from the city to Watson's Bay is fantastic. Goes past the magnificent mansions in the eastern suburbs. Once at Watson's Bay there are great spots to eat or picnic. It's a short walk across to the Gap overlooking the ocean, or a longer walk around to South Head is good.
Very Picturesque. Catch the ferry over but do check the timetable for the last one as they don't run too late.Lovely views and very serene. Well worth the trip over

Bit o' a surprise. Despite innumerable trips to Sydders, I'd not gone to Watson's Bay before, and now would thoroughly recommend it on a nice day. I went by bus, but I'd recommend taking the ferry and coming back to the city by bus. Lunch at the seafood restaurant ended up being a "must do" as did a walk through some of the streets and the visit to The Gap.

Lovely bay just avoid Doyles!. Cute and quaint little bay near the South Head of Sydney Harbour, easily accessible by ferry. Watson's Bay Hotel is a nice enough pub that has great views and lots of outdoor seating. Doyles is also here and is one of the most over-hyped restaurants in Sydney with ridiculous prices and very average food. Eat at the pub instead and then go for a walk up to the Heads for incredible scenery and spectacular views of the entrance to Sydney Harbour.

Lovely, as the Aussies Say!. We took the ferry to Watson's Bay, itself a delightful and inexpensive tour of the Sydney Harbor. We had dinner at Doyles, great seafood, and then walked along the coast through the attractive Watson's Bay neighborhoods to the Macquarie Lighthouse. Wonderful walk! We saw a lot of locals out with theri children all dressed up for Halloween! Fun!!!

scenic. very tranquil place great seafood restaurant as soon as u get off the ferry. If u decide to walk around highly recommend walking to the edge of the harbour as if very lucky will get to see the whales !

A really lovely day.. Staying in Paddington I had noticed the 380 bus was to Watson's bay so I grabbed a friend and we set out to explore. What a lovely day. Watsons Bay has gorgeous views of the Sydney skyline, parks and walks. We chose to treat ourselves to an afternoon at the famous Doyles restaurant where we had a table by the beach and a fantastic view. We took the fast ferry back to Circular Quay and back on the 380 bus to Paddington. If you are on a transport ticket do be careful to get the ferry home by 3:50pm on weekdays as that's the last government ferry of the day, and if you miss it you will pay the private ferry as we did. The harbour is so lovely that we enjoyed the ferry, but we could have saved $9 each.
Great view of the Sydney skyline. As well as having a small and beautiful beach that is never crowded, Watson's bay also has a terrific view of the Sydney skyline
Great Views. Taking the Ferry to Watson's Bay is an amazing trip. Great views all the way there. Stopped and had lunch overlooking the bay and worth the experience.

A great afternoon out. Go by ferry from circular Quay, and about 30 minutes pleasant sail later arrive in Watson Bay. Be sure to call and have Fish & Chips at Doyle's famous restaurant, or for the budget option visit their takeaway branch. Travel back to Circular Quay by bus or ferry.

Has everything for a day trip. Great for fish 'n chips by the beach - best to come here by water taxi and see everything the Sydney Harbour has to offer.Easy to walk and see wonderful beach and rock views, the Heads is nearby and it is a stunning view of the open seas and the opening to Sydney Harbour.

GOOD PLACE FOR FISH AND SHIPS. took the ferry from sydney harbor. nice ride to watson's bay. went their mainly for fish and chips at doyles. from what i was told there are 3 doyles at this location. the least expensive one is right where you get off the ferry. walked around a little and saw park and small beach but not much else.

Most beautiful place in Sydney. Went to watsons bay on advice of a specsavers employee, it was breathtaking with a beautiful beach and amazing views of the rocks and sea and a very easy but scenic walk. There is also a very picturesque park and seafood restaurants. It is only 15 minutes on ferry from circular quay.

Fish and Chips. This is a place known for fish and chips and eating seafood. There is a park and places to eat. You can also walk to The Gap, a cliff top look-out spot over the ocean and notorious spot where people have jumped/fallen to their deaths.
Great location. Fantastic location for romance or just a weekend getaway. The rooms are 5 star along with the food. New management have taken over now, so not sure it will be upto my standards.

A spectacular view of Sydney. Walk up the hill to the top of the cliffs and see for yourself the spread of Sydney Harbour Bay, look at the skyline of Sydney in the distance, eat fish and chips at Doyles on the beach and just watch the worlds go by in the spectacular natural surroundings. We have done thsi three times in 10 years,

A Hidden Gem. All the guide books recommend getting the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Well get in line with all the others who've read the same. Instead get the ferry to Watson's Bay, then walk 5 mins to camp cove for one of the most beautiful beaches in Syndey. On the way back eat at Doyles whilst you wait for the Ferry, gorgeous seafood.

Take a ferry or dive.... Watson's Bay is a great destination whilst in Sydney... Doyles is the main eatery place.. but its a bit of a tourist rip off now..... but the views from the beach back down the harbour are worthwhile.... if no.. then go up to The Gap... that is where people tend to throw themselves off...:)
Doyles. Well worth the ferry ride to Watsons Bay and Fish and Chips at the famous long established at Doyles Restaurant.

Stunning little village. Arrived late afternoon on Halloween. Such a cute little village pretty little beach houses, Doyles restaurant and fish and chip takeaway, very iconic for the area. Could have sat their and watched the view for hours. took a walk along the national Sydney park area great views out to the Ocean and all the history regards the military there. Spend some time there and you will never want to leave.

Another gem. Yet another perspective on beautiful Sydney Harbour and its environs. Watson's Bay is well known for a number of things, most notably The Gap I would think. The Gap is quite spectacular with crashing waves against the rugged shore and views way out to sea. Watsons Bay forms South Head and Manly North Head both locations are part of the entrance from the ocean to Sydney Harbour. Camp Cove is a pretty harbour beach which is quiet and protected. Well worth taking the ferry from Circular Quay past Garden Island, Darling Point, Double Bay and Rose Bay. Enjoy fish and chips on the grass and sand or lunch at one of the cheap cafes and restaurants. The Watsons Bay Hotel also has a thriving beer garden and offers a counter lunch.
Best fish'n'chips. Catch the new ferry from manly to watsons bay and enjoy fish n chips at the watsons bay hotel. A favourite to do on a sunny summers day.

Day on the bay. Walking out to the lighthouse for a view of the harbor opening was fantastic! The neighborhood is wonderful and the views are stunning. Make sure to add it to your list of things to visit in Sydney. The only negative is the limited restaurants that are over priced.

Accessible and great views from the Gap!. Accessible by ferry from Circular Quay in only 25 minutes, Watson's Bay makes a fun day out. Have lunch at the famous Doyles (Fish n Chips) and then take a walk through the small park to the "Gap" - where you can walk along the coast. You can explore as far as you like, you can walk to Bondi if you really want!There is a NAB ATM and free public toilets near the ferry wharf. Bring Sunscreen, as most of the immediate Watson's Bay area is without shade. The seagulls are an absolute nightmare too - not for the ornophobic.

Wonderful scenic coastal walk. As you come off the ferry, walk almost straight ahead, across a park, up the fill until you come to the coast footpath - the views of the cliffs are just stunning. turn right and walk along to the first lighthouse - really enjoyed that coastal walk on a bright, sunny day with blue sky. Saw lots of wild flowers and wild birds along the way. Walked back and had fish and chips lunch at Doyles restaurant before catching the ferry back to Sydney.

Pleasant Place accessible by ferry. The bay is a pleasant place to take a ferry ride to. You can walk from there to a very calm, safe beach called Camp Cove and also to a nudist beach which seemed to me to be a gay paradise so I avoided it as I didn't want to be in a minority. Don't be lured into Doyle's. The food is not nearly as good as it's cracked up to be and is over priced.

Stunning. Went here on recommendation of a Sydney ex-pat and it was completely worth the visit. Quiet, beautiful. Went for a stroll, saw The Gap and had Doyles Fish & Chips whils dangling our feet in the water watching a wedding in the gardens. Just idyllic.

Favourite Place in Sydney. Sydney visitors, one&all - the ferry ride never disappoints, just be careful not to miss the last one returning to Circular Quay. When you arrive on the wharf, walk straight up the steep-ish hill in front of you and you will see the glorious cliffs at "the Gap." It's stunning. Often windy - hang onto your hats! But your photos will be special.Watson's bay is an easily accessible, rewarding, free (well, not including the Sydney ferries ticket, but even that is reasonable) half-day trip for all newcomers to Sydney, whose real asset is it's abundant rivers&bays. Great views in all directions. Just don't get the fish&chips at Doyles on the wharf - rubbish food/bad service.

Peace and Quality. Take the standard ferry, it is a lovely journey via Rose Bay, with tremendous views along the route. Watson bay is a quiet spot, with beautiful parkland and excellent scenic views Sydney Bridge and some of the towers can be seen in the distance. There are a couple of places to eat and an hotel close to the quay. There is a small beach and pleasant walks on the promenade. Watson Baty is particularly beautiful in the late afternoon as it faces almost due west.

Panoramic Harbour vistas and great restaurants. Watson's Bay houses the Sydney Pilot Station: it's at - or very close to - the Heads, the majestic sandstone cliffs that stand sentinel as the entrance to Sydney Harbour. You can visit by government bus or by ferry: either way you'll be rewarded with spectacular harbour vistas. Once there you have a choice of restaurants specialising, not unnaturally, in seafood. There are plenty of grounds in which to picnic and another attraction - the Gap - notorious as a favourite suicide spot - adjoins.

Lunch at Watson's Bay. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and enjoyed lunch at Doyle's Takeaway, which has chairs and tables outside overlooking the bay. Walked out of Doyle's, across Robertson Park and up the hill to the lookout at The Gap. It was spectacular.

Elementary, my dear.... Watson's bay is one of the great Sydney days out. Whoosh there on the catarmaran and then stroll nice and easily round the headland to the lighthouse for some great views and photo-ops. Wind your way back to Doyles for a monster portion of calamari and chips, then burn it off by climbing to the top of the Gap. This trip also offers one of the more unusual views of the city. I'm not telling you - you'll have to go and find out!
Excellent lunch and views. Take the ferry for a total experience and have a tasty lunch overlooking Watsons Bay, beautiful area.

Lovely view. We took the ferry out to Watson Bay and had fish and chips at the Waterfront as has been suggested on Trip Advisor before. It is a scenic ferry ride and enjoyable spot for lunch. We did the walk up to the gap which was stunning. We caught the bus from near the gap all the way back to Circular Quay - it went via Bondi Beach and you can get a scenic view from the bus (make sure you are on the left handside)
Amazing outlook. We took the bus from Bondi to experience the back streets, the bus drop you off with the perfect view. a choice of fish and chips from Doyles or fine english tea from drumbar house
Take a ferry to fish and chips. Take a Sydney Harbour ferry to Watsons Bay. Doyles do great fish and chips by the harbour. Or there is a good pub food with pan aromatic views of the harbour.

Lovely area in Sydney Harbour. This is a lovely spot to go for a relaxing day out. The ferry runs frequently from Circular Quay. There is a very well known seafood restraunt here as well as the hotel plus another fish cafe that serves fish and chips+ salads etc

Take the extended walk to the light house. If your up for it, the walk to the lighthouse is worth it. The views are lovely...watch out for the two men who love to show you ALL of themselves along the way when you pass the nude beach (they seem to always be there and always be standing up with full view toward the walking path). Fish and Chips and Doyle's is a must or pack a picnic and enjoy the great big green space.
Great place to visit. Watsons Bay is a great place to visit. Has great views of Sydney and lovely places to eat and drink.
Gorgeous. Lovely walk, great area to look over at Sydney bridge - brilliant view. And we saw dolphins to top it off :-) at the bottom here is a good spot to get fish and Chips - yum!!!

Nice Place. Great place just a short trip on the ferry from Sydney Harbour. As always in Australia, getting any decent customer service was difficult in the seafront bars/restaurants. Despite this it's still worth the trip.

A little piece of paradise. I actually think the sand in the bay at the end is literally made of crushed gold it is soooo beautiful! We took the ferry over, and where you get off there is a Doyle's cafe / take away right at the end of the wharf. We had lunch there before we left; just did take away and sat in the gorgeous park looking at the view. If you go into the cafe I believe it is licenced if you fancy a beverage. As you come off the wharf just walk in a straight line up a gentle hill and that puts you onto a walking track; we turned left on this one. You walk along a ridge with breathtaking views of the ocean as this is where the harbour meets the sea. Stunning and an easy walk for children too. At the end of that we dropped down, walked along a road with the most charming houses on it, and onto the bay with the golden sand. Great place for a swim depending on water temperature. Then you follow your nose back along there to get back to the wharf. Highly recommend taking an afternoon out here!

Fun Ferry Ride. This trip was suggested by the I'm Free tour guide. Got us out of the city center, and we enjoyed seeing the small town of Watson's Bay. Climb the hill to The Gap to see the great views! We caught the bus to Bondi Beach from here.

More than just Doyles..... Go early or go late. Catch the ferry, or even better get a water taxi if you can afford it. Go to the pub, because in all honesty Doyles is far too expensive for what it is. Take a stroll to the South Head, spot the naturists along the way. Walk up the hill to the life invigorating bluster of the Gap. Laze in the park. But do it all on a weekday and avoid Sundays, don't go on a Sunday because everyone else will be there.

Awesome place to watch sunset. First time at Watson's Bay and the view is definitely worth visiting the area for! We parked a little further away up the hill and walked down the trail overlooking the magnificent ocean views on the right and of Watson's bay on the left. It was amazing! By the time we've reached the bottom the sun was almost ready to set on a beautiful Saturday. However don't waste your time buying take out at Doyle's on the weekend unless you are super hungry. I went to enjoy fish and chips while watching the sunset over the bay and a view of the harbour bridge. All I have to say is....I missed the sun going down while waiting for my food at the Doyles counter. Literally stood there for over 30min and once I returned to my friends with food the ball of fire over the bay was GONE.Once it was dark we walked back up the same trail we came down the hill on. The view of Sydney completely changes at night. I'm glad I got to see both day time and night time views of the bay and Sydney CBD skyline. Truly magnificent. Hint: climb some rocks to get a better view if you are short like me!Take out at Doyles was the only negative of my Watson's Bay visit.

Beautiful wee place. Only stopped for a couple of hours. Lots of lovely we cafes and restaurants. We especially liked the look of the swimming area with pontoons at the beach but it was too cold for us to swim. Would love to come back one day.

A little gem.. Watson's Bay is a little gem tucked inside the Sydney Harbour Heads. It is easily reached by ferry and is a great start point for many different walks. If that sounds too strenuous try lunch at any of the three Doyle's seafood eateries.
Wonderful. BEAUTIFUL place to take a rug and have a picnic on the grass area and also a great place to go and have fish and chips.

Loved it!. We loved our trip out to Watson's Bay. We took the ferry so we had a nice ride in the harbor. We then did the hiking around on the trails to the end of the peninsula and it was beautiful. Even saw whales from the lighthouse!

WATSON'S BAY. terrific views across the water to boats, yachts, residential areas and of course the bridge. Many places to eat or just bring a picnic and sit on the lovely grassed and treed areas. Beware though, on a sunny weekend, unless you get there early, parking is IMPOSSIBLE.
Lovely spot & great ferry ride. Lovely spot & a great ferry ride from Circular Quay. Doyles on the Wharf [takeaway] is very disappointing compared to the restaurant but the park is beautiful.

Vacation in a vacation. Took the Captin Cook Hop on and Off Ferry here. Stayed on until we arrived. No hopping off before. Had breakfast at Glimpse. Not bad. I would suggest just coffee to go then start waking. Lunch at Dontes ? The big seafood place. Touristy but really good and unique. Had the paella and it was exceptional. Seefoid was cooked well and tomato broth was yummy. More of a chopino than paella. Order it! Cute little beach town
Great views!. Trail walk worth the trip! Spectacular views at lighthouse entrance of Harbnor to Ocean! Some u and downs on walk!

Lovely spot. A favourite spot but Doyles was a bit disappointing this visit - quality of fish was below their usual standard. Also parking is very difficult around here as it is such a popular destination.
A pleasant spot. This place has amazing but scary views from The Gap. There is a nice family park, and two great fish restaurants, Doyles and the pub. It can be reached by ferry and bus.

See the waves beating against the cliffs. We took a ferry from circular quay to watsons bay. As we had enough fish n chips since we arrived at sydney, we did not dine at Doyle's. contrary to stories of it being very crowded, there was only one table filled when we arrived at 2pm. We walked to the gap, and the view was truly amazing. Great photo-taking opportunities there.After that, we walked towards the Christiston Park where the Macquarie Lighthouse was located.We cut across the Gap park on our way from Gap Bluff to the light station. Theres nothing much to see, and the park is located on higher ground, away from the road. As such, its better to avoid the park for personal safety reasons.After the light station, we took bus 324 back to the CBD but along the way, we saw plenty of shops and settlements, which sadly, we did not visit as it was raining outside.

Great alternative to busy Manly. Love the ferry ride across - it's in the "inner harbour" so can be reached with a ferry-ten ticket. The walk around the South Head headland is really worthwhile, with a great lighthouse, and a clear view over to Manly and back to the city. You can see The Gap which is spectacular (the drop into the sea). The harbour water and sea are just minutes' walk from one another. Less populated than Manly and way, way less commercial. Great swimming.

Leisurely lunch at the beach.. Travelled to Watson's Bay on the Sydney Ferry run and had a very nice fish and chips sitting under a tree beside the bay. The food was good and at a reasonable price, the service was quick considering the number of people and I would do it again.
Beautiful. A beautiful ferry ride to Watson's Bay then enjoy fish and chips at the Wharf at the famous Doyle's restaurant.
