Cliffs, sea and sand. This is a nice place to go if you want to see spectacular cliffs over the ocean as well as having a relaxing swim at a calm beach. Within a 30 minute walk you can take in the view from the spectacular cliffs and take that calming dip at the nice beaches.

Ok.... Overrated. Doyle's was pah. Come only if ou really got sick of the other prettier bays. It was quite fake for my liking, as if we were trying to appear to be at a place that was less than what it appeared to be.

Sydney Must See. Great for the Seafood lunch as their are many restaurants here and and also a Pub, also a short walk to The Gap, they have a netted swimming are on the harbour for safe swimming Excellent Place

Interesting but poorly signed.. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay, then walk out to South Head via Camp Cove for views of North Head etc. Allow 45 min for this walk. Unfortunately, when you get of the ferry there is no directional signage or information about the South Head walk or direction to "The Gap" Park. Most people just seem get off the ferry and stay in the area near Doyles, the Hotel and the park, eat their fish and chips and go back on the next ferry. The walk via Camp Cove is interesting and has the historical marker as the place where Lieut Phillip came ashore in 1788. The loop walk at South Head has interp signs about the light house keepers cottage, the light house and the gun and miliarty periods. After completing the South Head walk, proceed up to "The Gap" park near the bus stop for views of the Gap and paths that climb up to look out points. After this your options are to catch the bus to Bondi Beach, walk further along the top of the cliffs towards Bondi or return on the ferry from Watsons Bay Wharf.

Also a must. A great ferry ride to see Sydney harbour from a completely different angle.It used to be a small fishing village quiet remote and it still is. Take a walk up the back to the Sydney heads then come down for a drink or lunch at the Doyles restaurant. sit there till late afternoon and watch the light show

A great day out.. We indulged in the iconic Sydney experience of a ferry ride to Watson's Bay and lunch at Doyle's. The restaurant was very good, but some of the staff are a little precious - they fawn over the locals, and put up with the tourists. But the fish was excellent. A real highlight was the walk around the Gap area, for fantastic views, and to reflect on the tragedy which has befallen many people on those cliffs.

Watsons and Fish & Chips. We went to Watsons Bay twice on our trip to Sydney, caught the cheap ferry from circular quay. On both visits we sat and ate fish and chips in Doyles and watched the sun set behind the harbour bridge, that was very special. The fish and chips are very special too!!
Ride and Dine. A lovely ferry ride from Circular Quay, get off at Watsons Bay, dine at one of the restaurants there, take a walk around the Bay to Camp Cove and back on the ferry. Lovely!

Great Spot for a picnic. a lovely ferry ride and wonderful views. Not to mention Doyles famous seafood restaurant! It is also a short walk to The Gap which has lovely views overlooking the bay and Sydney in the distance.

Crowded but a lovely family day out venue and good for picnics. The fish and chips takeaway is good, albeit crowded with a long queue on sunny days. The large park is a nice place to relax. Remember to take a picnic blanket or something to sit on if you can!
The Gap. The area of the Gap is of interest mainly for infamous acts by desperate people, the area though has good dinning.

Stunning little place. Hop off the ferry and spend a hour here just walking around - take a trip over the hill to see the stunning views of the ocean - return to the quay and try the best fish and chips ever - suggest the Seafood Basket as best choice - be prepared to queue but once you placed your order - you will be amazed how quick it turns up - very tasty.

Doyles Fish and Chips!. We went to Watsons Bay twice on our trip to Sydney, catching the inexpensive ferry from circular quay. On our second visit we sat and ate fish and chips in Doyles and watched the sun set behind the harbour bridge, that was very special. The fish and chips are very special too!!

Lovely views (if you can avoid the hordes for Chinese tourist). Not too difficult pathways to fantastic view of both the water and the city. As the title says, you may want to walk faster, slower or the opposite direction when confronted by the hordes of Chinese tourist. Nothing against Chinese, I'm of Chinese descent myself but talking loudly, climbing over rails and hawking & spitting their phlegm in public isn't cool.

So lovely. Have always loved 'Wato' was a favorite haunt of my childhood living in anearby suburb. Swimming, sailing, playing in the park, having fish and chips at 'Doyles'. Coming back was good to see it adn't change too much and the view of the wonderful harbour is amazing, from the Gap out to the ocean spectacular and nearby Camp Cove Beach a great place for a swim or to sunbake. Memories......

Stunning. Watson's Bay is the entrance to Sydney Harbour and if you position yourself correctly along the cliff top walk you can see the ocean on one side of you and the Harbour and City on the other. Make sure you do the walk along the cliff top. It is a bit strenuous but worth while undertaking. Take the ferry from Circular Quay, do the walk, then go to one of the many restaurants or the Watsons Bay Pub and have some lunch. This is one of my favourite places in Sydney and one where I always take international or interstate visitors.

Lovely half day out.. Have done this trip many times. A beautifully picturesque ferry ride - always a treat- followed by a delicious lunch at either Doyles Seafood or the cafe in the Park (less busy & more personable).
Fantastic place with good views!. Watsons Bay has the best Fish n Chips at Dolyes. Good place to relax for fresh air and good views! Simply love this place!

Just plain awesome!. Well worth the drive when you are in Sydney. Amazing views back to the city over the harbour. There are a couple of good bars/cafes out there and I would recommend going during the day on a sunny day or later in the afternoon to watch the sun set.

A famous place. Looking over the gap and watching the waves splash and crash against the rocks is very relaxing. There is a lot of history here, not all pleasant. There are a few places to eat especially if you like seafood.

Great hike and Awesome views of Sydney. This was an all day trip out from the city. You need to take a ferry out and then follow one of the many trails, to either the lighthouses or parks. There's a dozen views of Sydney and the harbor that are simply amazing. There's a little park in the center of town that will give the kids a break. Jacob's Ladder, the Rescue site of a sunken ship is pretty eerie. Cliff views are extraordinary.

There and back why not?. From Circular Quay to Watsons passing buy the most stunning residential properties in the world visit all the little stop overs in the 4 bays on the way. Sundowners in Watsons at Doyles an absolute must do......I believe this IS the best sundowner place in the world.Book at the restaurant Doyles well in advance for the most special front row seat in town at the same time.If you want to get lucky book this place!!!The Gap and entrance into Sydney HArbour the huge vertical cliffs at the enhance with the Vaucluse Walk along the the cliff walk highly recommended. Plan 2 - 4 hours for the excision. Wear trainers and enjoy the freshest air the the breeze on our face. Coffee at the traffic circle at the upper end of the walk with the sea on your left with the city far in the distance on your right with brochette in Vaucluse before you return.
Great views of the harbour!. Really nice views of the harbour bridge and srrounds. Nice cliff walks too. lovely beach in a sheltered bay too!

A must visit when in the eastern suburbs.. This is a must visit when in Sydney's eastern suburbs. You can get a ferry or bus there and the pub there is great but get there early on a Sunday if you are driving. Plenty of great walks nearby as well.

Great Views. We took the hop on hop off boat to Watsons Bay. Great view of the city and out to the Pacific. Good chip shop and Ice Cream as well. Could imagine great place to spend a day if sun shining
Watson's Bay Hotel on ANZAC Day...aah the (dim) memories. Great pub! Fantastic atmosphere. Enjoy a "Snake Bite" (but don't drive!!! Good selection of food, too.
Expensive Fish 'n'Chips. A must do place for some but you'll do a better value elsewhere. Water views are good if you get 'em.

Good scenery. This is at the south head of the Sydney harbour. There is a walking path along the coast. Catch a ferry here or take the 324 bus. Good views of cliffs, harbour and ocean. Can have a picnic here.

The vie as Nice but you have to walk a lot. I must say that Watson Bay is a very nice place but you have walk a lot to cover it. The vie of the sea from top is awesome and beautiful. U will never forget that Blue water when you ill see it from the top. But if will cover the entire watson bay range in a day .... i am sure thatyou feel that in your legs the next morning....:-)

Well worth the trip!. My personal favorite! I quickly walked passed the famous sea food restaurant and discovered the area where the locals have their BBQ. The beach is small yet charming. My nicest walk, with stunning views from the "roughest" side of the bay! An exquisite yet not very much talked about beauty...
Catch the boat from Circular Quay. Perfect trip to get out the city, walk across the park from the ferry stop and walk up the steps for amazing views along the cliff
Cold and wet. But the cafe at Dunbar House was an excellant place for coffee.Offered an outdoor heater and blankets to keepp warm, and we only had a 15 minute coffee!

Such a pretty spot. This is my childhood playground and mostly it remains unspoilt. It is near the Gap and Camp Cove. Doyles Restaurant is here and you can catcht a ferry here from Circular Quay in the CBD near the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

Great location for the traveller or just a day out!. We love going there and making it a great day out. We mostly drive there or you can ferry it from circular quay. There is good seafood there with Doyles eat in or take away food always fresh but can be pricey. There is always the hotel across the road which also offers great food. It's a great venue to sit by the water or go for a walk or swim. There is a lot of boats moored there so I'm not sure if the swimming is good.
Doyle restaurant. The ferry from Circular Quay to Watson Bay is really nice. I went to Doyle Restaurant and has an awesome seafood lunch. Loved the Paella, was really nice.

amazing views..:). don't miss it.. i love this place.. beautiful cliffs and beautiful views. great fish and chips.. take a ferry from sydney harbour.. you get to see the opera house from a different angle from the ferry..which is cool.. and when you arrive there dont forget check ferry timing for your return trip as the last ferry leaves probably at around 4 or 5 pm.. if you miss it, you'll have to catch a bus and it takes literally forever to get to the city by bus!
Lovely ferry trip!. Lovely area, ferry costs $11per person for round trip. You can walk around and then lunch or dinner at Doyle's! Wonderful seafood, only one meat offering.

A breathtaking view of the sea and sydney. The place has historical value for the Australians. From the upper portion it is nice to see the Pacific ocean to the left and to the right the skycrapers of Sydney are also an amazing sight. I truly enjoyed the place.

Fish and chips by the Sea. After walking from Bronte to Bondi we jumped on a bus to Watson's Bay- great views of the Harbour all the way! A short stroll to Doyle's for lunch and a trip across the harbour completed a very relaxing day!
Good 1/2 day trip. Took the ferry out early and walked to the lighthouse. A really nice area. finished with fish n chips from Doyles...which was a disappointment (oily and soggy batter).
Lovely views. Had a meal at Doyle's on watsons bay one night with a big group, the location was just lovely and the views spectacular.
Take the ferry, sit on the beach , eat fish and chips. Great way to see the harbour, grab some yummy seafood and enjoy the views over the GAP

Very scenic. Watson's Bay is a good alternative if Manly gets too crowded and noisy. Also, Doyle's by the wharf is an absolute must-have! Go to the one at the wharf, where it is cheaper than the restaurant.

Great place to visit. A fun ferry trip from Sydney Harbour, about a 1/2 hour & stops about 3 places before landing at Watson's Bay. Headed to well know Pub for Fish & Chips & a bottle of wine. Then a walk around the area before heading back to Sydney on the ferry

Pristine beach and headland walkway. Manly is a great place to visit even in winter. The walk is easy going and there is plenty of room to allow for lots of walkers and joggers, prams, dogs etc. Very enjoyable!

Heavenly Habour. For those trying to having the ideal Sydney Harbour experience a trip to Watson's Bay by Ferry is the perfect way to go. Try arrive in time for with a hour or so to spare before you are ready for lunch or dinner. There are lovely walks and a nature reserve to look out over North and South Head. The walks are reasonably easy though perhaps a little hilly for some. In the heart of Watson's Bay are a number of really lovely seafood restaurants. Pick between the more extreme al la carte, the traditional seafood and the pub lunch with the seafood twist. All needless to say feature lovely views, fresh seafood and friendly efficient Sydney style service. Afterward you can reboard the ferry and head on to Manly for a beach moment or the Zoo for an animal afternoon or back to the City. Alternatively get the bus and travel by road through lovely Rose Bay and Double Bay and on down through Kings Cross to the City.

The Full Package. Watson's Bay is inside South Head of Sydney Harbour. The suburb itself boasts some of Sydney's best harbour views, looking back down the harbour to the Harbour Bridge. On the Bay you can have a picnic in the park, have a pub lunch and a beer, have fish and chips from Doyle's take away, or sit down on the edge of the sand at the Doyle's restaurant. Many private fishing boats including those after big game dock at Watson's Bay wharf after a day at sea. To get to the Bay, you can catch a ferry from Circular Quay, catch a bus, or drive. In the Park is a restaurant and what remains of the old Council Chambers. The Park is a favourite wedding and photo spot, so you may happen upon one on a weekend. It is worth taking a walk along the water's edge to the nearby coves and harbour beaches, or up the hill for a spectacular view of the Harbour from South Head itself. Just a short amble away on the other side of the Park is The Gap, a dangerous high cliff which falls away to the sea. It is infamous for providing a final solution to many a jilted lover. The Innkeeper at the Pub there has many a story to tell of those he has coaxed back from the edge on a dark night. So Watson's Bay can match your every mood and dining requirement and all in the ambiance of the stunning body of water that is Sydney Harbour.
Relaxing holiday spot. Away from the hustle and bustle of Sydney centre and Bondi is the very relaxing and family friendly spot of Watsons bay. Beautiful beach and pier, family catered restaurants.

Picturesque. Stayed there for two days and had a chance to do the cliff top walk. It was so beautiful. Wuould loved to have seen it when a storm was there the waves and ocean would have been a amazingWe saw the Lighthouse and great view of Sydney as well as teh old Guns that used to be Sydneys defence against invadors..
doyles at Watsons Bay. expensive but worth the experience, food very good

Beautiful. we went to Watson's Bay with the ferry from Sydney. We have only heard about the place, but didn't know anything about it. We were so surprised. It was very beautyful, the beaches was nice (even in june), the lighthouse and the old houses.
Great walk. Lovely walk and the watson bay hotel great place to have lunch afterwards. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay and enjoy the harbour
Stunning. A regular walk for me and my partner. Beautiful.There are great cafes near by, and in summer be sure to pack your swimmers!
beautiful part of Syd a must see. you could be any where in the world a step back in timegreat markets

A great way to see a different side of Sydney.. From the hustle and bustle near the ferry jetty to the tourists at The Gap it is still possible to find a quiet spot to sit in the sun and gaze at the harbour. Walk to the lighthouse and enjoy the blue wrens and swallows swooping around the vegetation.Only downside......the Council were very efficient emptying the overflowing rubbish bins near the eating areas but also needed to clean the public toilets. Rubbish everywhere and very dirty.
Beautiful Bay/great restaurant. Captain Cook Cruise to Watson's Bay is a must. Having fish and chips at Doyle's on the water was excellent.

Qunintessential Australia. We love Watsons bay. You sit in your chosen restaurant and watch life. Kids playing in the beach, luxury boats anchoring, people popping in in their tinnie for fish and chips, tourists, local residents, sydney siders. It's all here. The rich and the not so rich enjoying the Australian way life. Doyle's is great but so is the pub next door. Great food and a world class outlook.
lovely walk. a great way to spend an afternoon. Lovely harbor town.

Great way to get to Bondi Beach. A great day out is to take the ferry to Watson's Bay which is really pretty with magnificent cliffs. Try not to jump off! Then take the bus to Bondi Beach and walk the coastal path, getting the bus back into town.
Lovely Bay for day trip !. Had some lovely food in Doyles seafood restaurant in Watsons bay. Lovely day trip from the city, getting a boat there from sydney circular quay......
DOYLES FISH. Enjoyed fish and chips at Doyles while at Watson bay.Friendly service and nice place to sit and watch the harbour sunset.

very nice place to eat and view the surroundings. it is a good place to get a sense of the first settlers whom landed there many moons ago , go up to the gap , walk around the view is amazing , a ferry ride away and worth the visit ,
A little fishing village.. Its a good ferry journey there from the city and the pub has good view and superb views back up the harbour.
The Gap. The Gap is great and the ferry service is so easy.
Gorgeous and private. I love Watson's bay. How wouldn't? The sea breeze and Doyle's for lunch? Pure Sydney..
Watsons Bay a must do. Good ferry ride from city, lunch at Doyles and walk up to the cliffs are great.

Ferry trip. Interesting experiance but would not hurry back.
We found food expensive when we got over there and would have eaten first had we known.

Gorgeous place. We took the ferry to this lovely bay. There was a nice walk around the bay/coast and you get great views out to sea. Unfortunately we didnt spot any whales. After stretching your legs and taking in the lovely scenery there is a lovely hotel/restaurant and also a coffee shop back at the beach / ferry point. Nice relaxing day out!

Wow, what a place.. Took the advise of a dear friend and went here for a walk along the cliffs and lunch. I never thought I would ever spend that much on fsh and chips, but like all things touristy ya just gotta do it. Stop throwing your rubbish into the harbour though Aussie - really sad walking along the beach
Take the ferry here.. Like a little fishing village with a nice pub and great views looking back up Sydney harbour. Two hours well spent here.
a Must visit place. I highly recomended travellers visitting Sydney to go Watson's Bay . Must go !! the place is so awesomely beautiful ! The Gap - the view is "OMG " .
Don't waste your time. We took the ferry here, thought there would be more to see and do. Very disappointed with the whole trip. Would I advise anyone to go here again. No Sir!!

Beautiful Location. Take the ferry, it's only 15 mins, there is a lovely park where you could picnic and a good playground for children, good toilet facilities. There are three cafes to eat at (not cheap but good food), lots of good walking tracks and great views of The Entrance.We ate at Doyles and sat at the window looking back at Sydney City and the Bridge, lovely setting.
Wato Bay Hotel. What's not to love..pub is great ,view is insane, park is beautiful to walk through and the people are lovely..

A bit overrated fish-and-chips beach. It seems that the fish-and-chips is one of the main attractions of this beach. The trip on the ferry is great, on a weekend-day, you sail between the sailing yachts before you reach the beach. If you do make it, do not miss the walk to the coast across the hill.

Pleasant haven. There's a couple of nice small beaches, some very nice houses. park and a few shops but the main hub seems to be the ferry and Doyle's two fish outlets - restaurant and fish and chip takeaway.There's an interesting walk out to the lighthouse at the heads which takes you past possibly the nicest beach in the Sydney area which is frequented by nudists. Most seem to oblige by strutting their stuff whenever they see anyone on the path - so be prepared - they seem to take great pleasure in posing !Go up through the park and you will find another cliff top path which is really dramatic and well worth the visit. It's quite a climb and you begin to wonder about the merits of going further but keep going. Not only do you get away from the lazy ones thronging around the initial viewpoint but the path runs parallel to the main road which conveniently has bus stops to take you back to the western suburbs and Sydney rather than going all the way back again to get the ferry.
Stunning sunset. Our friends took us to see the view of Sydney on the first day and it was magnificent. We even watched the sunset from Watson's Bay and it totally blew us away.
Nice place to visit. Watson's Bay is one of the nicest places to visit, found just half an hour to the east of the Sydney CBD. Very nice walk with nice views of the ocean and of the CBD.

My favourite. Love everything about it: from the ferry trip, the lighthouse, the Gap, the view, the food...
Perfect for any type of day!

Great view of the city from this bay. Watson's Bay is a great place for travellers to visit. It is a ferry ride from Circular Quay and during the trip you get to see the well heeled foreshore of Sydney Harbour. I recommend taking the ferry to Watson's Bay and the Bus back to the city.Allow yourself time to walk around a bit - visit the Gap and stroll up along the ocean side of the headland as well as the harbour. There are pretty little cottages along the Camp Cove Beach - so worth a wander down those little by ways.As you get off the ferry you will see the Doyle's Fish and Chip shop. You can buy some takeaway food and eat it in the Doyles area where they supply restaurant type facilities. (Dont confuse with the more elegant Doyle's restaurant a few buildings along the bay. My experience of Doyle's restaurant is that it is expensive, poor service and unexciting food although it does have a great view)

What a way to spend a day!. This was one of our highlights in Sydney. We took the ferry over to Watson's bay in the morning and spent the day hiking, eating and just enjoying a most beautiful place. Be aware though the last ferry leaves before 5PM, which we found out since we missed it :) Cab ride back to Potts Point was about $25:) Well worth it since we got to watch the sunset in Watson Bay.

One of our favourite places on the Harbour. One can get there by bus or by ferry and by car although parking can be a bit tight even on weekdays. There is the very well known Doyles for some of their magical seafood or the pub just next door. Even in the pub the food is very good but it can be a fight for a table and they can be a bit slow to clean up after the diners have moved on. If take away is your scene or a picnic there is a huge park to let the kids go wild in. Here you have the fabulous Gap but also a lovely walk around South Head. Views straight up the Harbour and across to Manly. There are the old Fisherman's cottages, worth a fortune these days and the enclosed swimming beach as added attractions. a very, very good day out.
Beautiful playground. Love to take the grandies to Watson's Bay for a play in the kids area. However have to say that the iconic fish & chips are now highly over-rated

Wow. Beautiful, unforgettable. In Robertson park there is a lovely playground (slide, swings, climbing nets etc.) from there it is only a few minutes to reach the cliff walk, that is really worth experiencing.

Watson's Bay is delightful!. A charming, unique place with excellent views of Sydney.We walked up to Dover Cliffs for wonderful viewing and caught a bus to Bondi Beach. Then returned to Watson's Bay for a delightful meal at Doyle's which we highly recomend. A lovely day!

Stroll to Camp Cove and South head. I am always amazed by how frost people get off the ferry, walk up to the gap, have a beer and a bite at the Doyles but never do the most beautiful walk to camp cove and South Head via Pacific Street. In winter it is quiet and beautiful. Stretch your legs and enjoy the views.

Swin, Sun Sand and a Great View. Take the ferry, pick a beach, catch some rays, cool off in the water and then walk to South Head for a spectacular view out to sea and finish up with fish chips before returning via the ferry. A great way to spend an afternoon.

Great Walks!. The ferry ride to Watson's Bay is enjoyable.From the pier there are two walks that both deliver spectacular views at their acme.If you do not have a brochure or walks guide there is a sign at the pier, near the Doyle's on the Wharf take away and bistro. After you exit the ferry, walking towards the beach, the sign will be on your right.Pressed for time and need to catch the next ferry back to Sydney? The walk to The Gap is the quicker of the two. Walk up thru Robertson Park up to the Sydney Harbour National Park at Gap Bluff. You'll be rewarded with a great view from the Coastal Clifftop Walkway.Military Rd. is on the left side of Robertson Park, Clovelly St is on the right side of the park. At the top of Clovelly, make a right and there is a small market if you need a water or soda.The other walk is out to South Head and the Hornby Lighthouse.Cliff St. will get you to the start of that walk. You can walk up the left side of Robertson Park to Cliff St. Or, walk along the Marine Promenade (the beach walkway that passes the main Doyle's Restaurant), then Short St. up to Cliff St. Turn left on Cliff St.From the Hornby Lighthouse at South Head you have a view of the entrance to Sydney Harbour and North Head. On the walk up to the lighthouse there is a nice view of Sydney, looking back into the Harbour.Bring your swim gear and towels. Several nice beaches and changing rooms in the Watson's Bay area. You'll see Camp Cove on your way down from South Head. Lady Bay nude beach is on the way up to South Head if one is so inclined. :-)Doyle's Restaurant? Nice for lunch at one of the beach side tables. A little pricey, and I'd have to say the fish and chips weren't the best I've had while in Sydney. A good venue/ambiance. This past trip we skipped a sit down meal and bought ice cream and snacks at the market after a hike up to The Gap.

A quintessentially Sydney experience. It's noi wonder visitors put this high in their list. Watsons bay has a park, a huge pub , a seafood restaurant and fish n chips take away and a nice stretch of sand to walk down. Plus of course lovely harbour views - It captures the lovely afternoon sun and great sunsets on a good day.Most of all it has a lovely vibe that makes me feel on holiday every time I go there. The garden at the pub? Fish n chips on the beach or a glam seafood lunch? Which will it be next? Who cares - it really is all good.TIP - Once we went there when it did have quite a wind coming in from the west, so best time is on a mild/warm/hot sunny afternoon.
A slice of Sydney Paradise. There's not much better than a beautiful day down at Watsons Bay.Enjoy a sumptuous seafood platter at Doyles Restaurant and then get the ferry over to Manly Wharf.
A nice fishing village.. Got the fery from the city to here and enjoyed a seafood lunch at the Doyles restaurant on the beach.A great day.

Worth a visit. Had a relaxing day at Watson's Bay. It's a great place to unwind away from the crowds at Sydney. We did the cliff walk and returned to the waterfront for a relaxing light lunch. Nice trip on the ferry both ways

Stunning views. We enjoyed our visit to this area. We enjoyed the weather and the views of Sydney Harbour. It was so nice to see and enjoy the small shops, the gentle beach, and going around to the see the South Pacific/Tasman side of the area. It was worth coming to this area and the ferry ride was so memorable. We'd love to come back again.
NIce spot. Worth a visit as a lovely dirve or ferry trip to get there and nice place to chill for an hour or two.
Where else can you walk from the bay to the ocean in less than 10 minutes?. Put this place on your bucket list, and wear good shoes when visiting!

Lazy Sunday. A trip to Watson's Bay is best enjoyed by ferry. Part of the experience is the boat ride and taking in Sydney Harbour from the water. And on a weekend lots of tourists and locals must agree! After arriving, avoid the long queues to the infamous fish&chips and instead walk around the park, visit the gap or even the coastal walk to the head of the harbour. Our tip is to queue up for the fish & chips just before the next ferry arrives.Good spot for kids too ... they have a children's playground, lots of green space and a small swimming beach.
Doyles fish and chips. Walk to the Sydney heads and on the way back to the ferry call in at Doyles for good fish and chips. Restaurant expensive - buy from the take away by the quay.
Beautiful Views. We got the hop-on, hop off ferry and got off here. The pub was great and the views were stunning!Definitely worth the walk up the cliff.

Fun ferry ride and beautiful scenary. The ferry was great fun as it was a fast ferry, and only about $4 each way. The park had a playground and a few options for coffee and food. The view back towards the harbour was stunning, as was the walk along the coast at the Gap.

Quick zip to Circular Quay. After visiting Bondi Beach we caught the bus to Watson's Bay and hopped onto the ferry back to Circular Quay. This is a quick and easy way to get back to town, see more of the harbour and utilize the week transit pass we purchased.
A must destination by ferry. This is a must do destination by ferry (or winding Eastern Suburbs roads) to great fish'n'chips, an excellent harbour swimming pool and park.
a good view. We went on a ferry which was interesting then just followed the crowd.We had a lovely walk with some great views
Beautiful. We walked through the park to Hornby Lighthouse, beautiful walk and stunning views, we also caught the bus to MacQuirie head lighthouse which was worth the visit
Great views. Not far away from the city centre but so different. Fantastic views looking back to the city. Also some great walks around the coast on the Pacific side. Great restaurant - Doyles.
Relax!. It was an enjoyable Sunday walk along the ocean cliffs. It is safe since there are all barriers along the beautiful scenery walk.

Beautiful Watsons Bay. This is one of my favourite places to visit in Sydney. I last visited it in May 2011.Watsons Bay is very accessible by various forms of public transport. One can take a ferry to Watsons Bay from Circular Quay. Watsons Bay is also very accessible by bus. I took bus service number 325 from Rose Bay to Watsons Bay.I like the crashing waves against the rocks of the Gap Park. Somehow, looking at the works of Nature while I was at Watsons Bay made me feel humbled. The air at Watsons Bay is very fresh too. This is quite an inspiring place for any one who would like a sketch.Nearby, the beach is welcoming. For a treat to good food, consider the seafood from Doyles on the Beach at 11 Marine Parade, Watsons Bay. It is said to be the site of Australia's first seafood restaurant. I was rushing for the last ferry to Circular Quay and did not have the time to have dinner at Doyles on the Beach.If you are interested to have activities at the beach, please bring beach-wear.The good news is that there is no admission fee to Watsons Bay. Perhaps the only cost is the transport expenses to reach there?
Watson's Bay Pub. Great fish-and-chips lunch with reasonably priced drinks. Quick service, delicious food.

Feed me now!. Nice little coastal village, reached after a 20 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay. We walked from WB to Rose Bay - a lovely 5 mile route (walk available from the internet). Spectacular coastal views from Gap Bluff and leaving the best till last - Doyles - the best fish and chips in Australia!!!
Fish and chips. We went to Doyles at Watsons Bay and thoroughly enjoyed the food plus the ferry ride, it is a very pretty place.
Well worth a visit.. Take the walk across the little garden and up to the headland. Great views. Lunch at Doyle's is an essential and delicious!
visit the cliffs at the gap. be sure to grab a meal at doyls and walk across the street to the GAP and enjoy the high cliffs overlooking the ocean....

Pretty Bay. Watson's Bay is a pretty place. Lovely beachfront homes, people watching and great places to grab some seafood. We had locals take us to Doyle's on the Wharf - really good fish n' chips - they ordered for us so I don't remember what kind of fish we had, but it was delicious. Wonderful view and ambience.

beautiful watsons bay. We went to a wedding in Watsons bay during our stay in Sydney, it is well worth the tripover, my favourite bay in the harbour, very quaint with great views back to sydney harbour, an amazing restaurant down on the waterfront by the ferry pier.

If you like Fish & Chips overlooking the harbour. Taking the ferry to Watsons Bay is an ideal way to build up an appetite for lunch or dinner. Once their you can take a walk along the beach and if more energetic walk around the point to where Captain Cook landed. Then the Hotel or Restaurant can serve a beautiful meal of sea food with a wine if you prefer. Sit back and relax and when ready head back via the ferry or bus to Sydney if you need public transport

Rip Off. Ferry ride was great, scenery fantastic but Doyles is just an overpriced excuse to serve up batter and breadcrumbs ( with a bit of fish inside ) Tip - take a packed lunch and soak up the atmosphere

good day out. Have been to Watsons bay on a number of occations and went last friday, always enjoyed it.There is a number of restaurants(doyles seafood has a couple )from fish and chips take awayto the park etc to lunch on the whalf or the main restauranton the beach.Also a great walk around the heads,with the light house old army dugouts etc.

Dearest fish n chips in the world. Excellent fish and chips at Doyles, but buy them from the chippy next to the ferry landing NOT the beachside restaurant where it cost in the region of £35 for fish, chips and a beer. Friends insisted you 'have the view' but lets face it, you can't eat the view can you?

Fish & Chips and more. Like Manly which is on the other side of the Harbour, Watsons Bay has it share of queues for food at the weekend in summer. There are some nice walks. You can return to the City by bus via Bondi.

Doyle's is good but.... We took the ferry out to Watsons bay just to eat fish and chips at Doyle's. They were very tasty but times must be hard though when on top of the $13.80 for the meal they also charge $1.20 for tomato sauce and $1.20 for vinegar..really!!!

Favorite Beach in All of Sydney!. Although Watson's Bay may be out of the way from Sydney proper, it is still easily accessible via car or by bus. It may take about 30-45 mins to get there from the CBD, but it is well worth it. The first area of WB is mostly family oriented. If you keep on the footpath, you will come across a cove where nudists enjoy sunbathing (this is either a warning or a tip for fellow travelers and what they are comfortable). Even further, and next to a military base, is somewhat of a bluff that has tons of coves, is great for light rock climbing, enjoying seclusion and spectacular views of Sydney proper. Most people tend to head to Bondi or Manly, but WB is definitely a hidden gem.

worth a visit. After a fast ferry trip from Circular Quay, disembark to see the delights of Doyle's fish & chips - choose either budget takeaway at the pier, or expensive high quality food and service at seafront restaurant - recommond 40 minute walk via seafront, and through the township to Camp Cove beach, and on to South Head lighthouse - all good for a picnic away from crowds
ideal relaxation. great little tea rooms and easy little beach with nice park for spacious relaxation

beautiful spot to relax for an hour or two. great little spot to see via boat. beautiful scenery and views of harbour and waterways, a must see in sydney. Lunch on or by the beach is highly recommended.
A little beauty!. Pretty, nice beach, great view of Sydney & fantastic fish restaurant on the beach
Love this place. One of the beautiful areas in Sydney. Catch the Watson bay ferry from Circular quay. The ferry is really fast and it is fantastic.

Pub and Gap. The hotel facing the water is one of the best spots for a lazy, long lunch in Sydney - especially if you manage a warm, bright day. The hotel has an abundance of umbrellas to protect from the sun and amazing outdoor tables on several levels overlooking the small beach, ferry landing and the bay.Good prices but you may have to join a queue to order lunch if you go on a holiday or weekend. Do as we did, order a drink and do some people watching of the passing parade below. The queue soon drops and a quick, delicious lunch happens.Afterwards, take a walk up the hill to The Gap. A comfortable walk along dramatic and memorable rock cliffs. Compelling views! A fabulous day - return on the ferry sitting outside at the back of the boat. Enjoy!

Pretty beach side community. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay. From here on one side, there is a lovely walk along the cliff tops to the lighthouse with splendid views out across the harbour to the "heads". On the other side ofthe little town, there is another lovely walk along the clifftops looking out over the "Gap". Watsons Bay is a very nice area, nice little coves and lots of walks. There is a good seafood restauarant here "Doyles at Watsons Bay" but it is on the expensiveside. There is also a takeway "Doyles" on the ferry landing - more reasonable prices. When you are ready to return to Circular Quay, there is the option of the ferry but be careful as they don't run very often, or you can catch a bus, which is a nice ride through areas such as Double Bay and Rose Bay and back to Circular Quay.

A Worthwhile Trek. Great to go by ferry but if you want to eat at Doyle's in the evening then be prepared for a bus journey. During the week the ferries stop early & so you have to get a bus. This took a while fromthe centre of Sydney but well worth it, a beaut spot with great views of city lights at night.
Lovely harbour suburb with village like atmosphere. The views of the harbour are lovely.We stayed in the refurbished Watson's bay pub which also has very good cafe style meals in the open.

A great ferry ride. spend a few hours walking around this area and having a nice lunch. The return trip is another way to see the wonderful harbour area whilst sitting back and relaxing with no traffic to contend with.....

Nice cliff top walk. Similar in environment to Manly but without the surfing, this is a great day out with both the cross harbour sea trip calling at various stops, making it an interesting experience.
Recommend the scenic walk. Recommend walking from the pier, around the beach, to the lighthouse and back. About 2.5km, doable by anyone.

Go hungry, eat lunch there, then hike.. Ok, be forewarned, Doyle's restaurants in Watsons Bay are expensive and very popular. My fish & Chips cost A$42. I was charged for each refill of Iced Tea. It was so incredibly expensive it become one of our trip highlights, anecdotally. Fortunately we could afford it. If you're on a budget, be forewarned, and prepare accordingly. After pushing back from the table we walked thru the park to the cliffs overlooking the ocean. What a difference between the harbor at our back and the wild pacific in our faces. Do it.

it is really beautiful. Take the ferry over and walk around, especially out to the lighthouse. It is really beautiful. One of Sydney's secrets. Tourists generally go for Doyle's but really, just walk around and it's fantastic.
Doyles. Always have to visit this bay for the seafood restaurants, especially Doyles & the hotel there
Great views, great walk. Walk around Watsons Bay for great views of the city, nice little beaches, charming homes, national park, cliffs facing the Tasman Sea.

Take a ferry to Watson's Bay!. Taking a ferry to Watson's Bay is a great day out in Sydney. If I were you, I'd have fish and chips at the Beer Garden at The Watson's Bay Hotel. You'll find an amazing view of the Harbour!
Shannon
www.urbanchicguides.com

The best view of Sydney Harbour. Sit in the park and eat takeaway fish and chips or sample the food at the pub or Doyles Restaraunt.
Best value is the takeaway in the park.

Ferry ride, view of the harbor entrance, but not much else. We have taken the ferry to Watson's Bay, which is quite relaxing, particularly if it stops at some of the 'ports' along the way, Double Bay, Rose Bay etc.There is actually not much to do once you are there other than walk over to the cliffs at the harbor entrance and watch the surf or have a drink at the pub or a meal at the restaurant/s. Doyles is a well-known seafood restaurant, but is expensive. There is a casual/takeaway branch of Doyles if all you want is fish and chips.For the energetic, the walk along the eastern coastal cliffs to the Lighthouse is pleasant on a nice calm day.An alternative for the return trip back to Sydney CBD is to take the bus, via Bondi Beach.

Wonderful Day at Watson's Bay. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay, meeting family there. It was the perfect place to have a visit and spend the day. There are great play areas for children, climbing structures, beach etc. We had take out fish and chips from Doyle's and ate at a picnic table under the trees.
lovely to revist. Fish 'n Chips @ Doyles......What could be better than sitting looking at that amazing view and eating the Pacific's staple diet.....Did it in 2007 and enjoyed it then, too.
Watson's Bay is Charming. Watson's Bay is a charming waterfront community. It is small, but a fun place to ride the ferry to for lunch and then return.

Great beaches, Pub, cafe and restaurants. Worth the bus or car trip to eat at Doyles on the Beach, have a coffee in the coffee shop on the beach or stroll along one of the two beaches. A special part of Sydney where you pass the famous 'gap' and see some beautiful houses along the way.Well worth the trip.

Get the FERRY HERE !! Best views back to Sydney. A lovely ferry journey to Watsons Bay, very worth while as you get to see all the lovely houses on the inlets. When you are there you have to order Fish and Chips as it would be a crime not to. The main draw for me is the walk from watsons bay to the lighthouse and the views of Sydney you get from a different perspective. Plus you pass a couple of nudists beaches on the walk if you are a pervert.

The place for Fish and Chips. What better way to spend a few hours than to catch the ferry at Circular Quay enjoy a cruise up the harbour to Watson Bay then to indulge in Fish and Chips. You can choose from queuing up at the takeaway/ eat in at Fisherman's Wharf, go a bit more up market at the Watson bay Hotel or go the whole hog at Doyles.If fish and chips aren't your thing there is a charming tea house.
Excellent food and views. Great view and fantastic fish and chips. A must visit whilst in Sydney
Beautiful City Beach. Get the ferry here from Circular Quay and have lunch there. Fish and chips! Was recommended to us by our Hunter Valley guide...was a great suggestion.

Best Fish and Chips. We took a locals advice and took the ferry to Watson's Bay. We were confused as to which place to buy our lunch. Finally remembered we were told to go into the restaurant area and order at the outdoor grill. They give you a vibrating gizmo to tell you when your order is ready. You sit on the patio overlooking the Bay. It was a wonderful experience and well worth the effort of getting there.
Worth visiting. Beautiful walks and has the oldest seafood restaurant Doyles.
The Gap. Ever since I was young I have loved this part of Sydney. Views are amazing and you can see North Head if you take the walk from Camp Cove.

Alot of Sydney history. If you get off the ferry and turn left walking along the beach then detour right up onto the roadway keeping the water on your left you can follow the coastline around passing the old fishing cottages, down onto the rocks to see where they strung the cables across the harbour to stop the Japanese submarines coming in in WWII, then past the memorial where the first ships anchored to stock up on water and repair their ships, across another beach past some of the most expensive real estate, up onto another point passing a huge cannon and some of the oldest sandstone steps in the colony. From there continue on out past the nudie/rudie beach and to the Sth Head lighthouse which has lots of interesting historical stories. If you're lucky walking on the boardwalk you will spot native birds and reptiles. Finally back to the pub for a drink!

Easy to get to, beautiful and relaxed. I live nearby. It is a short fast ferry trip (with great views en route) from Circular Quay and has great views back to Sydney from the point or on the spectacular and easy walk to South Head.There is a nice calm swimming beach at Camp Cove, a few minutes from the wharf, on the way to South Head. There is a nice little kiosk at the beach during the warmer months.The Doyles Watsons Bay Hotel is also a reasonable place to stay if you need a bed. Always good for a drink in the beer garden or above on the balconies.I find the food at the Pub and other Doyles restaurants to be average and over-priced - tourist traps - so better to go to Eastern Bay Thai just up on the main road along from the bus stop for dinner or walk along the beach south to the swimming baths with the Tea Gardens behind it for cafe food & drinks during the day. Or bring a picnic and eat on the beach in front or park beside the wharf.There is branch of the Woollahra library on the side of the Tea Gardens Cafe that has free internet, daily papers, etc etc, so a nice place to chill out only a 17 minute ferry ride from the city.If you have children there is a really cool, new-ish, playground in the park (Robertson Park) and a Gelatisimo ice cream shop at the top corner of the park.There is also a chemist and corner store on the main road on the top of the park, in case you need medicine or coffee and basic food etc.There is also the Gap across the road at the top of the park which is nice to look out to sea or down at the rock platforms.You can also walk up along the cliffs in either direction for a nice walk with great views back to Sydney and across to North Head, Middle Head and Manly.If you miss the last ferry back to the city (at only 350pm during the week!) or want to see another nice park / beach, then it is easy to catch the 324 or 325 bus all the way back to the city if you want - the 325 goes past Nielson Park which is also a nice beach in a park with great views from the headlands. There is also a good kiosk and restaurant.You could get off the bus at the Rose Bay wharf and catch a ferry back from there as well (last ferry 7.46pm) to catch the sunset behind the Harbour Bridge and the city lit up for you.Nice way to spend a day in the beautiful outdoors in Sydney.I love it, hope you do too...

Spend sometime to visit this area. Beautiful place which can be reached by ferry or bus. Easily spend a day - lounge on the beach, see the 'gap', walk towards the lighthouse. One of the best places outside the usual tourist traps

Watsons Bay walk. Get a ferry to Watsons Bay. Walk north to Camp Cove and Lady Bay (if it's hot strip off to your birthday suit and have a swim) walk up to South Head then back via 'The Gap'. Then walk south to Gibsons Beach, then there is a short road walk going past and Parsley Bay and Vaucluse Bay to Nielsen Park (have another swim, but keep your swimmers on here...it's NOT a nudie beach and it is netted in case you are worried about sharks. Check out the 1920 changerooms). Good coffee at the Kiosk. Keep walking south along the pathway past several other small beaches (OK, swim some more) and end up at Rose Bay and catch a bus or ferry back. One of Sydney's best walks. Pick up a map of the walk to get more details. It is really great and not to be missed.

Doyle's - spectacular!. Okay, I have never really had much of a look around at anything other than Doyle's Seafood Restaurant. Residents, visitors, tourists, anyone! everyone! needs to go to Doyle's Watson's Bay at least once a visit to Sydney. The view is spectacular, the food is spectacular, the trip by water taxi from the Quay is spectacular the drive to there is spectacular, the sights around the suburb are spectacular. Just a 'cannot miss' of Sydney.
Lovely spot. Suprosingly easy to park and always a pleasure to eat at Doyles.

A world apart. A genuine local small suburb which has managed to avoid becoming too touristy, except for Doyles famous restaurant. The people who live at Watsons are very lucky to reside in such a peaceful waterside setting yet so near to Sydney

Great fish and chips. This is my number 1 world's greatest fish and chips. You can eat in or find a park bench. There is a beautiful beach/harbor. A short walk up the hill is The Gap where there is a spectacular view of cliffs and crazy waves from the Pacific.

A True Gem on Sydney Harbour. I love this spot and always take visitors here. Watson's Bay has a relaxed, village feel, a great seafood restaurant and wonderful views of Sydney Harbour. It also has the 'not to be missed' spectacular sandstone cliffs of The Gap and the beautiful walk out to the lighthouse at South Head. There is a small, nudist beach along the walk to the lighthouse but you are warned well in advance and it is not overly obvious unless you are keen to have at look. Watson's Bay is at the end of a beautiful car or bus ride that can take in Bondi Beach and will take you through some of Sydney's most expensive suburbs e.g Rose Bay, Vaucluse and Bellevue Hill. Watson's Bay can also be reached by ferry. Taking the ferry to Watson's Bay is the most relaxing way to get there and it enables you to see some truly amazing and otherwise hidden Sydney Harbour mansions.

Worth a visit. We walked up The Gap. This is quite amazing. The cliffs and views. We went to the cafe at the top of the hill. Well worth it if you dont like crowds. By the wharf there was just so many people. The cafe was busy but not cramped with people
Doyles. Lunch at Doyles is a must , the Platter is to die for!!!!

Beautiful and so peaceful. The quiet residential feel of the area was lovely, the bay was pretty, the ferry journey had stunning views, there were some lovely walks, particularly to the 'gap' - well worth a visit.
Iconic Fish Restaurant. Great location, good fish and chips, variety of restaurants to suit all pockets from takeaway to posh.

great location. Easily visited by ferry. Two short but very worthwhile walks from ferry wharf. Doyles fish and chips are a must but make sure you have the money if you wish to eat in the original restaurant - its not cheap!
Nice. good day to catch the ferry across and enjoy some fish and chips at the bay.
Nice!. The ferry ride is lovely, the place is calm and tranquil, and there's a great restaurant here. Well worth visiting on your trip to Sydney.

Walk from Bondi Beach. There is a wonderful walk from Bondi Beach to Watson's Bay. It hugs the coast, and the views are magnificent. It's about 8km and you can research it on the web. When you get there enjoy something to eat and drink at 'The Tea House', to the right of the ferry terminal as you face the water, right across from the netted swimming area.

Great place to kick back and enjoy the view. After looking for a spot to 'kill some time' whilst in Sydney, made the mistake of attempting to visit Bondi.Whilst iconic, you'll need a line of credit to meet the parking costs (assuming you will find one).Instead, head north a few more klms' and enjoy the laid back surrounds of Watson Bay. You can tak a picnic blanket and relax in the park, under a tree. Take a stroll along the harbour beach, then venture east to take in the stunning views of the Pacific Ocean at 'The Gap'. Whilst it may have infamous overtones (sadly a location of choice, for suicides), the beauty of it cannot be denied. The views sweeping back up the harbour are are spectacular on a fine clear day. Do yourself a favour.
Great little spot to visit. Worth the ferry trip, enjoy a meal on the beaches edge at Doyles

Super. we travelled here for a quick day trip on the ferry...Lovely spot with a park as you get off the ferry with a Hotel and cafe for snacks,meals and drinks..Lovely relaxing spot with toilet facility and playground for the kiddies.

Don't miss the Bluff overlook. Only a 12-minute ferry ride from Circular Quay. From the Watson's Bay wharf, follow the other walkers uphill through the park and across the road to the cliff walk. Amazing views, sights and sounds of the ocean, and a good form of enjoyable outdoor exercise. Of course, lunch at Doyle's is a must. I ate twice at the location on the wharf (cheaper than the location on the beach) which is just take-out with plenty of seating with nice views of the harbour.
A Favourite Spot. Fantastic Spot. Very picturesque. Make sure you do the walk to the lighthouse. Somewhere I wouls dream of one day living.

The Best Darn Fish n Chips in the World. Waton's Bay is unique, the revamped swimming pool a real treat, and the opportunity to have a drink and fish n chips in the beer garden a real winner. When you are cashed up, treat yourself to Doyles. It is worth it.
Excellent views of the Harbour. Great spot to people watch. Good food at Doyles. Also recommend the fish & chips at the pub. Walk to the top of the hill to the Gap outlook

Nice walk from Rose Bay to Watsons Bay past the heads.. You can easily take a bus back - Doyles Restaurant is at Watsons Bay so you can have a lovely lunch if you start early enough. Approx 1 -1/2hr walk depending on ability

Great views and a bit of history. Watson's Bay allows great view of the harbor, city and waterside suburbs where some of the most expensive real estate in the world is located. There have been a number of shipwrecks on the ocean side of the bluff and the anchor of one remains. The infamous Gap, where many have chosen to end it all, is also there. There are a number of coffee and dining options, including Doyle's, famous for very expensive fish and chips.
Lovely Spot on the Harbour, getting there is 1/2 the fun. Catch the ferry across, walk around to the South Head, have some fish and chips. Hard to beat.
Breathtaking Views. This places as one of the most breath taking views in Sydney. Also its within the top 2 or 3 of Sydney most expensive suburbs.
Idyllic. Ate at Doyle's (a bit pricey). Great view of bay in an idyllic setting.
A romantic ferry ride to a beach and a food haven with a great view of Sydney in the distance. beautiful views, walk to the head, great sea food, enjoyable ferry ride
Go for fish and chips!. Not a long ferry ride away from Circular Quay, nice little beach with a nice park at the shore. Get some fish and chips!!
quite relaxing. Seaside town feeling, relaxed park and pub and fish and chips... enjoy a quaint part of this mega city

Best ferry ride in the world?. Loved this trip on the ferry, and Watsons Bay is a great place to hang out. Doyle's is a good spot for take away fish and chips. Only note of caution is make sure you travel early in the day as ferries stop around 3.30pm, and the bus ride back to circular quay is painful, especially in heavy traffic.

Just beautiful!. You should definitely take the ferry (about 15 minutes) from Circular Quays to Watson's Bay. This place is beautiful, with nice white beaches, clear water and fantastic views of Sydney. It's a short walk away from Gap Rd, with great views of the ocean.

A wonderful trip. Took a ferry from Darling Harbour and had a fabulous view of the harbour, the bridge and the Opera House. Just a short walk to great views of the open sea. Very good cafes and bars to spend time before the trip back.

A feast of food! after a ferry trip. Fish & Chips at the wharf the ferry ride over and the view from the "Gap" also a visit to the hotel nearby if you don't like fish and chips
is an enjoyable time

It's ok if you haven't anything else to do. Its a nice boat ride over but the restaurants aren't really great.
If you have done everything else then it is ok.

Great View of Sydney Harbour. Watson's Bay is very accessible from Sydney by ferry. You can enjoy the ferry ride, viewing Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and a lot of sailing boats in the harbour. Watson's Bay itself is beautiful enough, but only five minutes' walk lead you to The Gap Park with superb views of Sydney Harbour on one side and precipitous cliff on the opposite side. When I visit there, a part of the park was off-limits and it was disappointing, but still Watson's Bay is highly recommended.
Ferry Ride and Fish & Chips. Take the ferry from the Circular Quay if you are in Sydney and see the city from te opposite views while eating Fish & Chips at Doyle's. It is a must at sunset!

Beautiful Spot. On the recommendation of my aunt, we arrived at Watson's Bay via ferry ride via Sydney Harbour. We were awestruck by the beauty of the area. The waterfront there is so scenic, with boats tied up in the bay. We stood on the dock and watched the fish swimming around. We were surprised to see a stingray as well. We stopped for lunch at Doyle's for some of their delicious fish and chips before heading back. This is a great little side trip from Sydney. Just make sure to check the ferry schedules for return times back to Sydney.
is there a better spot in the world. foremost there is doyles great seafood get there about one hour before sunset and see sydney harbours lights come on
take the ferry for a perfect day trip. boat ride, beautiful sights, pub and restaurants on the waterfront, stunning nature walk around the south heads of the harbour entrance - what's not to like

Swim in the shade!. I used to take my toddler here in the afternoon when the shade from the massive Moreton Bay Fig trees extends into the shallows. Not a surf beach but great for kids to splash around.
Well known for Fish and Chips. Taking the ferry to Watsons Bay is a must for Doyles Fish and Chips (restaurant and take away) as well as a great walk to the Lighthouse at the Heads

Another fave Sydney waterfront precinct. I first went to Watsons Bay many, many years ago for a birthday lunch at Doyles. Since then we have returned regularly to sightsee at the Gap or for a swim in the flat waters of Camp Cove at the mouth of the Sydney Harbour with views out to the Heads. On the late January day that we last visited we had to make a number of circuit laps looking for what turned out to be very limited parking for cars unless you are lucky enough to find a spot as someone left (and on what was to be our third and last lap, we did). A small kiosk is available at the Camp Cove and we purchased ice cream as we relaxed after our swim. Because of the number of vessels in the water, there was often a very strong smell of fumes and an oilness appeared at times in the water. Serviced by Sydney Buses, the beach maybe a bit out of the way unless you have your own transport but it is in close proximity to a Naval base.

The ONLY place to have "Fish & Chips". A buzzing little place, with yummy Fish & Chips [ restuarant a bit TOO expensive for us, but the "takeaways were lovely] Also enjoyed the walk up the hill to se the "gap", an amazing sight
En-route to Bondi. Got the ferry to Watson's Bay then bus to Bondi Beach. Very pretty and nice looking park. Buses came on time and driver very helpful. Wonderful views from bus.
Nice but too popular.. Nice place just too many tourists. Great if you want to eat fish and chips and like lots of folk around.
Worth a visit. Visited here to have lunch at Doyle's. Lovely walk along beach and in park prior to returning to the Harbour area
Lovely, scenic walk.. We had a family outing to Watson's Bay. We caught the ferry and enjoyed a relaxing day exploring various places around watson's Bay-would like to do this again.

Synonimous with Doyles. Watsons Bay is a beautiful suburb. The layout and architecture tends to be quite 'English'. There are some beautiful homes and quaint streets, but of course, no visit to Watson's Bay is complete without a visit to Doyles.....

Pick a nice day and go early. Get the ferry out there, walk up to the Gap, go for a swim, head to the pub or restaurants for lunch/dinner. Must eat seafood!
Pays to avoid weekends if possible as its insanely busy and service/food can be poor. I went on a Monday and it was fantastic!
great fish and chips. we ran here from sydney for the fish and chips. After we arrived we were very hungry and they tasted great
Nice part of Sydney harbour. Best thing about Watsons Bay is Doyles seafood restaurant, enjoy a first class meal overlooking Sydney Harbour
Sunday afternoons. Great fish and chips, stroll around the Gap or South Head
Nice beach, good vieuw, good restaurant. Apart from Doyle's restaurant and the hotel next door, its a good spot for a nice walk along some of the beaches, always good views over Sydney
Fabulous views. One of best views of Sydney across from Watson's Bay. Lovely at sunset. Doyle's have fab restaurant and also lower priced cafe for seafood etc. Go by ferry or get bus.

One of the very best spots. Taking a ferry to Watson`s Bay is one of Sydney`s highlights, with wonderful views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and cityskape as you make your way on the ferry. Once at Watson`s Bay. it is such a great place for walks up to the cliffface, with views of the Heads (there are of course some very sad tales here as well as this is the area known as the Gap, where too many an unhappy person has ended his/her life)...but back to the positives, in the other direction there is Camp Cove. All this area is a real walker`s delight!Then there is the no better place to enjoy fish and chips...either tak away and sit on the grass, or the pub or of course, if you feel like a spluge, the restaurants with Doyles the best known.Just a wnderful way to spend a sunny afternoon in Sydney ( I have yet to have any visitor I have taken be disappointed!)
Worth a visit. Fish and chips at Watson's Bay is a must. Great view back in the harbour.

The Gap at Watsons Bay is the most dramatic view in Sydney. I was amazed at the beauty of the coastline as it comes together to form the Gap at Watsons Bay. Definitely a don't-miss in Sydney. We also had lunch at a wonderful oceanfront restaurant in Watsons Bay.
Fish & Chips. Where better than Doyle's for the greatest fish and chips in Sydney and the view isn't bad either!

Pull up a park bench and have some fish and chips. We have either caught a ferry or a bus to Watsons Bay. Had a walk and then bought some fish and chips, sat on a park bench under the big trees and watched the world walk by. Then a leisurely trip back on the ferry to Circular Quay. Of course if you wish to you can always have a swim. There is also Doyles for lunch or dinner with a wonderful view.

Idyllic. Absolutely recommend this quiet bay. Gotta admit I was there during the week but it was absolutely wonderful, unfortunately we took the bus so I can't say anything about the ferry ride, but I'm pretty sure it would have been the better choice as Sydney Ferry rides always are beautiful! Wouldn't go for the fine dining place, just grab some fish&chips at the Doyles takeaway and sit down just next to the water. Also, don't miss out the "Gap" at the other side with magnificent ocean views and the possibility to do some walks in both directions!
Sydney's first fishing Village.. Fine seafood dining cab be experienced at Doyles famous resturant on the beach or the on wharf as takeaway or casual dining.
Absolutely gorgeous. Superb views. Easy access by bus.One of the most spectacular sights I've seen.

A Pretty Bay. Watson's Bay is an easy ferry ride from Circular Quay and is worth a visit. It's a pretty bay, but food and beverage choices are limited because they all come under the control of one entity(Doyles). So food choices are restricted. However Doyles is renowned for high quality fish and chips, and their restaurant on the beach front is worth a visit - bookings are essential.

Great place to relax. It's an easy ferry ride (recommended) or bus ride from the city. Once you're there you can have fish and chips at Doyles -either at the more expensive restaurant or at the cheaper stall on the pier). Enjoy a beer in the courtyard at Watson's Bay hotel or go for a walk along the cliffs up to the lighthouse.
Very pretty. We had an enjoyable time, be sure to go to Doyles - cafeteria cheaper than restaurant!

Great place to enjoy a beer. We spent a lazy couple of hours in the beer garden of the Watson's Bay hotel last Sunday.
With the sun shining and Sydney Harbour a buzz with yachts, flying boats and Cruise ships leaving port, it was a very enjoyable visit.
The food looked great and was served and prepared in the beer garden.
Breathtaking natural beauty. Watson's Bay and the Gap are gorgeous spots.The view of the Pacific and the cliffs are breathtaking. No matter how many times you visit, you will find it awesome.

The Grand Entrance missed by Captain Cook. When Captain Cook undertook his epic voyage in 1770 he sailed the whole of the east coast -but made his landing in Botany Bay.He missed the entry to Sydney harbour as it is now known.There is a small memorial at Captain Cooks Landing Place at Kurnell on Botany Bay. In 1778 the first convicts/settlers arrived and found Botany Bay unsuitable for farming and moved up to Farm Cove in the newly discovered and named-Port Jackson. This is Sydney Harbour and you can get a ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay to see what Captain Cook missed-the magnificent entry to Port Jackson through " The Heads". Walk up to "The Gap' for views of the sea across to Manly and the have a quiet "sundowner" at the "Watto Bay" pub......

Watson's Bay Hotel Accomodation & Doyles Seafood restaurant. Excellent Hotel service, wonderful location and superb food made for a wonderful experience. We keep going back again and again to experience the most beautiful part of Sydney.
Watson's Bay. Wastson's Bay is very beautiful, there is a small take away fish and chip shop as well as a resturant. very pretty views of the city.
Nice walks. A good walk to the point and either before or after a good meal or just fish and chips with Doyles.

A most relaxing day. On a sunny Sydney day it is a top spot. Relax at Doyles seafood resaurant or the beergarden in the pub next door and just take in the wonder of the harbour. Arrive by ferry for a special treat.
Stunning Vista back along Port Jackson all the way to Sydney City. Wow, what a view. Visit Doyles for a beer in the beer garden on a sunny day or sit outside in the park and have fish and chips.

I do like to be by the seaside. Watsons Bay is ok but if you walk around to Camp Cove you'll find one of the nicest little beaches in Sydney. Lots of families but still ok for non kiddy people like us. It's just a really nice place to hang out on a hot day. There's a little kiosk that sells food, icecream, food etc.
What a pklace!. Love it here, awesome view! Go to Doyles, mmmmmmmm!!! Or sit out and have a picnic! Lovely, what Sydney is all about!
Great day trip. A lovely little bay away from the city, a beautiful ferry ride and then if you've got the strength for a walk to Rose Bay, you won't be disappointed.

A perfect day trip. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay for a great day out. Watson's Bay is the 4th stop. When you arrive you can walk a round trip to the lighthouse and when you get back to the harbour, try out the fish and chips beside the wharf - fanatstic view and absolutely delicious!

Super harbour pool. The Watsons Bay harbour pool has been recently renovated. It's enclosed and in the sea with pontoons for kids to jump off, and it's great fun. Across the road are toilets and showers, and a super cafe which is open for breakfast and lunch from 8.30am.
Lots of parking nearby.

not impressed. Watson´s Bay does not have much to offer save two restaurants and a ferry wharf. It is however a good place to start a walk into the Sydney harbous National Park, i.e. to South head and back, to Gap Bluff with great views and south along the seashore to Macquary Lighthouse and beyond (with convenient bus stops if you had enough)

Take time to enjoy the view. There are 3 places you can enjoy your fish & chips at Watson's Bay:1) Take away style by the wharf - it's like a diner and does not make your dining experience something to write about2) Doyle's - fine dining style, stylish and pricier3) Watsons Bay Hotel - good value, good atmosphere.During the holiday period, we were lucky enough to get a seat on the verandah facing the harbour, we enjoyed a house white, salad, and fish & chips while basking in the sun. It was such a good day that we wished we had our parents with us to also enjoy the view ... yes it was worth writing home about.

A nice small town. This is a quite town which is a 40minute Bus ride from Sydney.When you get off the bus in the town directly across the road you will find a great park which you must go for a walk in.
If you have an afternoon this is a must.. Get the ferry from circular quay. Get fish and chips. Walk up to the Gap. Ferry home. Perfection.

Great Veiw and Fish n Chips. Nice ferry ride to get there and some great veiws of the city once you are there. Make sure you grab some fish and chips at O'Doyles and eat the looking at the great veiws of the city.

History of Olde Sydney, yet upmarket too.. We take the ferry to Watson's Bay---pick a sunny day for best effect. You can yummy seafood at Doyle's or pay less and get takeaway and eat in the park or on the beach. We walked via the Lighthouse to the Gap, then back to the ferry. Lots of the original cottages are still standing. Great views!
We took the Ferry. A quite seaside location with a few eateries. We purchased fish and chips and watched the sun go down lying in the nearby park. Not much to do but a nice place to visit.
Nice fish restaurants!. Lovely bay location and a nice place to explore and then relax with a fish n' chip lunch.

Outstanding place for Lunch. What could be better than taking a ferry to lunch and sit with your toes in the sand looking across the bay at Sydney, the Harbor Bridge, and the Opera House? It is all here, the food is great, and the atmosphere is laid back
Stay for lunch. There are lots of options and every single place is recommended

A beautiful and must-see Sydney landmark.. There are a few things you should see if you come to Sydney for the first time; the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge, the Rocks, and Watson's Bay. A beautiful beach, a gorgeous view back to the city, and some fabulous seafood restaurants by the shore. Uniquely Australian, uniquely Sydney!
Doyle's seafood. When you go to Watsons bay you have to go to Doyle's Seafood reastaurants, the views across the harbour towards the city are outstanding, the food excellent

Ferry hop to Watson's Bay for a good day out. As a local I love hopping on ferries for a trip around Sydney Harbour. Jump on a ferry at Circular Quay Sydney for a lovely trip across the Sydney Harbour to Watson's Bay. There is a good beer garden at the pub for a casual drink or bistro meal. Or buy some fish and chips at Doyles Takeaway, sit in the park and watch the world go by as you eat them. The trip to Watson's Bay takes about 20 minutes by Jet Cat Ferry. You can either get a ferry back to Sydney or take a bus. This is another must do in Sydney for tourists and locals. Beautiful views of the harbour and you can also visit The Gap Lookout.
Wonderful views. Great place to spend an afternoon.The pub has a great beer garden overlooking the harbour.

Great Place to Visit ~ Enjoy Fish & Chips. Take a bus (324, 325, 380) or ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay.Bus 380 via Bondi Beach and Dover Heights orBus 324 or 325 via Double Bay, Rose Bay and Vaucluse.Bus and ferry rides provide different views of the city and suburbs.Walk around the water front at Watsons Bay and check out the restored fishermen's cottages.Various boats at anchor in the bay.Walk up through the park to the Gap and admire the ocean views and cliffs. The cliff top walk involves some climbing of stairs.Enjoy take away or sit-down fish & chips on the ferry wharf.A good choice hotel bistro is only meters away or the expensive Doyles restaurant.Excellent place to visit and spend half a day or more walking around and enjoying fish & chips
Wow!. Fantastic part of Sydney. Scenic ferry ride to get there, with a pretty harbour. Walk across to the ocean side for fantastic views and cliff top walks!

Doyles. Such a stunning place, so quiet and away from the hustle and bustle but with amazing views of the city and harbour. My husband thought he'd died and gone to heaven dining at Doyles, where we were treated like royality. Had the most amazing lunch there and getting there was half the fun.... would go back in a heartbeat......

Nice view, food was disappointing. Like the rest of Sydney, Watson's Bay is beautiful. However, Doyle's Restaurant is perhaps over-rated. The food is very expensive and not that good. A better restaurant at a beautiful location is the Bather's Pavilion - the food is not only superb, moreover the service was excellent. The owner/chef comes to customers to ask for their feedback.

A nice place to visit. We took the ferry over to Watson's Bay and had lunch there. It was a very quiet place with sail boats out on the water. We had a table on the water, the food was good, but was on the expensive side for what we got. It was just a nice, relaxing place to go for lunch or dinner.

A wonderful place. We love going to Watson's Bay for lunch, either at Doyle's or just the Bistro at the Pub. Food is really nice there and the beach atmosphere is great but very family oriented. Views of Sydney are so nice that really deserve a trip from every tourist in town and the beaches around are really nice, particularly Nielsen's Park and Parsley Bay.

O'Dowds Fish n Chips in the Sun. Liked sitting in the sun enjoying fish n chips. Disliked waiting for order number to be called after ordering, but food tasted good when it was ready. Be warned last ferry back to Sydney is early approx 4.30pm from memory - but suggest check to avoid missing the last one. If you do - don't panic there are regular buses just up the road back to Sydney that will give you alternative orientation of Coves back to Sydney Harbour.

Lovely day trip. This is one of the reasons that Sydney siders are so lucky. Take a ferry to Watson's bay and do the walk around the headland via the beaches of Watson's bay. Make sure you go up to the gap lookout and view the beathtaking cliffs and ocean...all in suburban sydney...how lucky are they who live here!
watson's bay. $11.20 return ferry ticket. Walked the path through the park and saw the gap. Great walks either to the left or right to get great views.

Great for a day's outing. The best way to get here to add to a great experience is by ferry from Circular Quay, the boat takes you for a great ride through the harbour and other great bays before you're dropped off at the Jetty at Watson's bay. On the beach there is a great restaurant called Doyles where you can get some fantastic seafood. You can choose to sit outside or inside, but if you get there just before 12 and beat the line up try get the seats outside along the walk way. A more casual option, Doyles has a small take out shop at the start of the pier where you can order your meal and sit in the park or on the beach. You can then head up the hill over to the Gap and enjoy a lovely walk along the cliff tops that drop down to the ocean and some spectacular views.
Best fish & chips. Eat at Doyles on the pier- same great fish & chips - but much cheaper than the restaurant
The Gap. Went to Watson bay by Ferry which was great. It was a nice walk to the Gap and great views
Home of Doyles Restaurant. Nice spot for a picnic. Visit Doyles Restaurant. The food is tasty but very expensive,

Unspoilt bay, beautiful cliffs of Gap Bluff and a pleasant ferry ride. On landing from the ferry, you are confronted with Doyle's excellent fish and chip premises, a park and water front. An attractive place to walk around. Regular buses go to the other bays, such as Rose and Bondi. Near the bus terminal is the beautiful Gap Bluff, with stunning views over the cliffs and ocean and various cliff top walks.
Fantastic. Fantastic sights on the way to Watsons Bay ...then fish & chips on the pier.

Eat at Doyles and laze in the park.. Another ferry will get you to Watson's Bay where the famed Doyle's Seafood Restaurant has been sitting for what seems like a lifetime. It's located right on the beach, adjacent to the sand, with wonderful seafood, ambiance, local chatter, and views back to the city skyline. Next door on the other side of the pier is a huge park where picnicking is popular, or just sunbathing. There's a little hotel at Watson's Bay too, for anybody looking for clean budget accommodation and a place where there's quite a bit going on.

Take the ferry to Watson's Bay. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Watson's Bay and stop and Doyles and have fish and chips. There are two Doyles, one is a proper restaurant with wonderful views and quite expensive but an certainly an icon. You can however just get takeaway fish and chips which are just as delicious and much more reasonable. They have tables where you can also sit down, or if you prefer you can sit on the grass or benches and still have the magnificent view.

A classic sydney day out. our favorite place to go on the first day i nsydney - ferry from circular quay - awesome views of the harbour and city. form watsons bay it is an easy walk up to the Gap - amazing cliffs (thankfully well fenced in for those with small kids) with awesome views, we then walked along the heads and through the bush down to camp cove - site of the first camp of the first fleet. A nice little bay for a swim, then round to watson bay for lunch at doyles - classic sydney - amazing fish and chips - mum and dad can chill in the restaurant and the kids played on the beach. A great day out.
