Panoramic views. We spent New Year's Eve here to see the fireworks. Oh man, it was amazing, you could see right across Sydney and the sunset was a sight to behold. Well worth the trip. And Doyle's fish and chips is a big bonus too.
Beautiful view of Sydney. Great views, nice people, great walks. Ferry ride out was great too, even free wi-fi.

Great spot - take the ferry to visit mid week.. Take the ferry from Circular Quay and grab some fish and chips from the wharf when arriving at Watson's Bay. Finish off with a walk through the village to Camp Cove and visit the Gap, before returning via the Ferry. Skip lunch at Doyles - which is overpriced; instead enjoy some fish and chips in the park.
Superb - one of the best places to visit in Sydney. Great place to visit. Make sure to reach top of mountain and have great view of the ocean.
Quiet. If You got enough of the Hustle and crowds of Bondi or Manly, this is the place to relax.
Great view with fish and chips. Watson's Bay has a fantastic view of both Sydney and the Gap. We also enjoyed Michael Doyle's Fish and Chips on the Watson's Bay jetty.

great place to spend a day. Took in Watson's Bay on a sunny Sunday afternoon, just wandered around the area and had fish and chips at Doyles. It was a fantastic way to spend the day and look back at downtown Sydney and fish and chips at Doyles is excellent!!

Get there early. Parking is limited so if it's a sunny day get there early or be prepared to have major difficulty parking. Cliff walk is good way to get great views of the heads and coastline. Then head to Doyle's grab fish and chips and eat them on the beach or in the park.

If you are in Sydney do it. You never think it is worth it but it is.. Very underrated. I don't know why but everyone raves about it but I have some many friends who visited Sydney and never have time to visit Watson's Bay and the ones who visited Watson's Bay always thought that it was the best. Have Fish and Chips in the Watson's Bay hotel and cold beer while watching the sunset over the harbour. Amazing

Travel on the hop on hop off boat and head for here first. Make use of the Harbour hop on hop off boat and head for here first, great coastal views and walks well worth an hour or longer should you wish to take lunch. Then head for Darling harbour unless you are destined fro the zoo, get off there and walk back through the city for a great day out.
history of Sydney worth the trip. Take the bus from the city leave at least a day to walk discover the sights to Bondi, enjoy lunch at Doyls on the broad walk
Lovely Place. We travelled here even though it was raining, luckily for us it stopped for about 2 hours. We had a lovely two hours just walking and exploring. What a lovely place.

Lovely spot. I caught the ferry to Watsons Bay, a couple of lovely restaurants in this bay, the trip on the way takes you past a pleasant scene.Take a walk to the top and cross the road to the Gap, magical then catch any one of the buses to get a tiki tour of Bondi, get off at Bondi Beach

best fish and chips. watsons bay is beautifull and the fish and chips at doyles the best ever not to be missed !!!! big portions too so you may need to share as we could not finish them you can get a ferry from sydney harbour

A must if you have the time. AS always a ferry ride from Darling Harbor.
AS for restaurants there are about 4 and mostly very tourist orientated.
See our review of the Tea Gardens - we rate this #1

worlds best view of the worlds best city. A small fishing village that has stood the test of time Watsons Bay is the prettiest place in the world to enjoy fresh fish and chips. The view, particularly at sunset is so special. You are a million miles away from anywhere, but just 40 minutes from a wonderful city. Accessable by boat as well as road, the boat ride is great. Highly recommend Watsons Bay

A village away from the city. A half hour ferry ride from circular quay will take you to the picturesque watsons bay area to sample the famous fish and chips as you sit on the beach snapping a wonderful photo of the city from a far.

Great scenic views and atmosphere. Beautiful walk up the harbour to Watson's Bay with great views of the city and harbour bridge. When in Watson's Bay, make sure you try the takeaway fish and chips from the Doyles stand. Delicious, and much cheaper than the sit down restaurant.

The place where it all started. Take the ferry from Circular Quay, stroll the beach, have a beer in the hotel overlooking the bay and with great views down the harbour, picnic under the moreton bay figs or, if you are feeling rich, dine at Doyles on the Beach (OK but too expensive). Then take a walk to Camp Cove, site of the original landing in 1788 and with a great swimming beach. Continue along the cliffs between the army base and the sea to South Head. All of the above are best out of season and absolutely to be avoided on summer weekends but they sum up the best of Sydney.

Beautiful place to be. Watsons Bay is home to the famous seafood restaurant, Doyles. A very beautiful view and beach, the only problem is you are far from Sydney, and the Ferries come less often than a half hour.
A beautiful spot in Sydney. Catch the ferry over to Watsons Bay on a lazy sunny afternoon. Grab some fish and chips and a beer, and enjoy the sunset over the harbour. Just divine!

Watson's Bay does not disappoint!. We took the ferry from Darling Harbour to Watson's Bay (which by the way is probably the most affordable and as an added bonus, the most scenic) to dine at Doyle's. Such an adorable little spot, a great place to enjoy the park, small beach or the many restaurants that Watson's Bay has to offer!
Great place. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Watsons Bay for lunch at Doyles on the Beach. Wonderful trip and lunch.
casual walk. Take a casual walk and you could visit the cliff. Quite beautiful seaview. Good fish and chips on the docks. Many couples choose get married here.

Top 10 must do list. I like Watson's Bay not because of the bay per se, but for proximity to one site of the mutli-location Sydney Harbor NP. The bay is kind of generic, served by the ferry system, being scenic with the usual marina and boats, but has an excellent (albeit expensive) seafood restaurant (Doyle's). But the NP is something else and more. It showcases the coastal cliffs, geological formations and weathering effects. The trail head is easily accessed from the bay (5 min walk). The trail has some moderate climbing on steps or sloped path. There are vista points along the way. View of the ocean is just as spectacular. After visiting here, Sydney can be more than iconic landmarks and fresh seafood.

Loved Watsons. Watsons Bay is lovely, the ferry trip is very scenic. The walks are worth doing, although look out for the Nudist Beach on the way to the lighthouse there was some really strange ideas on how to sunbath down there, personally you would get arrested bathing like that anywhere else. Doyles Take Away is worth a quick fish and chip bite and there is a bar too. Loved Camp Cove what a gorgeous little bay area. A must if you want a ferry trip.

Lovely walking, pretty coves and quiet swimming. If you have more than a couple of days in Sydney, I definitely recommend getting up to Watson's Bay. It's seriously pretty and during the week it's pretty quiet. It will give you a wonderful contrast to the bustle of beaches like Bondi and there is a really lovely walk around the headland. Take water on a hot day! Camp cove is a tiny beach that is lovely for an early-ish morning swim during the week.

Doyles Seafood Restaurant. Doyles in an international Sydney restaurant landmark. If you like fresh fish and chips, or a seafood platter, head to Doyles on the beach at Watson's Bay. Fabulous view back to the city.

great harbour view. I always come here on a visit to Sydney as the view is unbeatable and the ferry ride is entertaining. Lunch at Doyles is a must and you can choose different options to suit your pocket.We ate in the restaurant this time which was pricey but good and the staff were extra friendly.Be sure to catch the last ferry at 3.50pm
nice to eat and watch the sunset. very relaxing, nice food, watched the sunset :) <3 nice place to go with friends, or romantic being right next to the beach

Doyles on the Beach. VERY disappointing food. Had to send the fish and chips back for clearly being "old" fish. Expensive with lack of quality. You are paying to eat on the beach, but choose one of the many other choices!

Doyle's Experience. Loved our visit to Doyle's at Watson's Bay - fantastic position right on the beach, great service from staff who were obviously proud to be part of the famous Doyle Restaurant. We enjoyed a fantastic meal and great cocktails.

Magic - walk around or drive to Camp Cove. Come by car, bus or ferry and take a walk to lovers leap, the expansive park or along the waterfront.Fish and chips fro the jetty or the now living-on -its-laurels DOYLES. They own all the outlets here - pub also.Take the short walk to camp Cove for a protected clean beach looking over the Harbour - very special.Kayte
Doyles on the Beach. For fantastic seafood, and in a truly marvelous setting. You won't do better.

Spectacular beach. Spectacular beach, steep cliffs, One of the most beautiful beaches Sydney has to offer easy to reach by bus or ferry
Do you get here if you're sad or gloomy

Do It -- Great Spot in Sydney. I was really impressed. I took the ferry from Circular Quay; the ride to Watson's Bay is about a half-hour and involves a few stops. The ferry ride is part of the fun -- how can you not love public transportation by boat, sailing in Sydney's beautiful harbour? Once you arrive, walk along Marine Parade and then Cove Street, checking out some of the beautiful Portugeuse balconies and restored fisherman's cottages. Then walk around the park near Camp Cove -- there's a lovely beach, some relics from a WWII boom that protected the harbour from submarines, and a monument marking when explorers first landed at this spot in the 1700s. Keep walking and you come across an old canon; from there, there are incredible views of Sydney's harbour and CBD. It is really a stunning vista! Keep walking -- if you don't mind seeing a few naked guys, there's an interesting little beach at Lady Bay with some pretty dramatic rock formations (worry not, the nude beach is well-signed). Then you can keep walking to South Head, where there is a large expanse of rock and open land that offers a perfect place for a picnic lunch, some reading, and some relaxing. You can stand on the edge and have a view of the bay to your left at Pacific Ocean to your right -- stunning! There's also an interesting old light house. Walk back to the ferry dock, and then go up the hill to explore the vegetation at the top of The Gap and more dramatic views of the ocean. All in all, it's probably a 3km walk (some uphill) at a slow pace; I spent about 3 hours, including time reading and relaxing at South Head. When you're back near the ferry dock, there are places to eat (fish and chips at Doyle's, yum) and a large park with great views and a community feel -- as a visitor, it was nice to get out of the CBD and spend some time that offered touristy-like things (great views, hikes, etc.) but also clearly was a place where Sydney-siders hang out. A unexpectedly wonderful afternoon -- worth a visit!!

A Gem of a Place. Take the ferry as most scenic or there are buses from the city through Vaucluse. A beautiful place for the day, it has plenty! Walk up to Gap park for wonderful views out to sea or back to the city and the harbour. Enjoy lunch on the beach or in the park - beautiful!As well as the beach and Gap, take the walk around to Camp Cove for another lovely beach and then walk past the nude beach to the striped lighthouse. Excellent photo opportunitiesWell worth a visit, it is a well known spot that many try unsuccessfully to keep secret. A gem of a place.

Almost want to keep a 'secret'. We missed the ferry circle tour so the Captain Cook ticket lady suggested we take the the hop on/hop off boat which was leavging a few minutes later --- "Just hop off at Watsons' Bay, you wont be dissapointed" she said and she was right!Just a lovey nook in the far corners of Syndey harbor with some nice lunch spots on the water, a small beach, and great views of the city.Enjoy.

Beautiful views. Take the short ferry ride and then head up the hill to The Gap park for terrific views of the Pacific and the harbor entry (list if ships and sailboat). The views of Sydney going and coming from the ferry are also lovely.

Great walks. A very quaint old fisherman's town that provides for some great walking. You can leave from the ferry dock and head past the beach, up Cove street and find your way to another beautiful beach. Spend some time there, then up into the national park, past the nude beach, up to the lighthouse for some amazing views.The ferry ride from the Quay to Watson's bay is pleasant as well. I just stayed in the front of the ferry and enjoyed the wonderful harbour viewsI'd skip Doyle's restaurant, it was horribly expensive and the service was poor. The waitress didn't even apologize for making a mistake on our bill and charging us for food we never received.

A lovely, peaceful escape from Sydney. Watson's Bay is a beautiful, tranquil place at the far end of Sydney Harbour. It has a lovely park, some nice walks, some great views and some very nice seafood restaurants. Doyle's is the most famous one, although be warned this can be quite expensive. The best thing to do at Watson's Bay is just sit back and relax. the views from the park, or the benches that border it, are VERY good. You can see Sydney in the distance as well as the boats in the bay and in Sydney Harbour.If you want to explore it's only a short walk from Watson's Bay to The Gap Park which has some great views of the entrance to Sydney Harbour. If you're lucky you can also catch some views of passing Humpback Whales during migration season from there.I mentioned how Doyle's restaurant can be quite expensive but it is really nice. They mainly serve fish but also serve steak for people that don't want to eat fish. The views are really nice and the atmosphere is great. Try to eat on the terrace if there is room there as you will get the best views. They have a few establishments in the area - the one next to but not on the pier is the main one.Overall Watson's bay is worth visiting. You can get there by boat from Circular Quay, by harbour cruise from Darling Harbour or using the Explorer buses which stop a short walk from the coast.

Secluded, intimate and beautiful. Watsons Bay is an easy 17 minute trip from Circular Quay on Sydney Ferries' catamarans, normally departing Pier 4.The trip across Sydney Harbour is unforgettable with passing Sydney Opera House unforgettable.On arrival at Watsons Bay, head past Doyles' pierside cheap fish'n'chips eatery and turn left onto the concrete footpath between the beach and the expensive Doyles Restaurant. Then meander through residential streets and a small beach with perfect sand to the South Head, which is part of Sydney Harbour National Park.A round trip of perhaps 1.5km awaits, past a nudist beach and HMAS Watson naval facility. Watch for numerous honeyeaters devouring the nectar contained in banksia and bottlebrush flowers.At the midpoint tourists can view the beautiful 1857 or so red-and-white striped lighhouse along with the lightkeepers' and assistant lightkeepers' most attractive cottages, all erected to protect the thenColony's ships from being dashed onto the South Head entrance to Sydney Harbour.After walking back, choose one of the Doyles' restaurants or cafes or other nearby venues, and then enjoy a quick trip back to Circular Quay.A wonderful walk and midweek, the crowds are absent.
